A `GListModel` containing the shortcut folders that have been added with gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder().
The returned object should not be modified. It may or may not be updated for later changes.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

enum.name: GtkFileChooserAction
enum.description: Describes whether a `GtkFileChooser` is being used to open existing files or to save to a possibly new file.

parameter.name: GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates open mode. The file chooser will only let the user pick an existing file.

parameter.name: GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SAVE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates save mode. The file chooser will let the user pick an existing file, or type in a new filename.

parameter.name: GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SELECT_FOLDER
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates an Open mode for selecting folders. The file chooser will let the user pick an existing folder.

enum.name: GtkFileChooserError
enum.description:
These identify the various errors that can occur while calling `GtkFileChooser` functions.
Deprecated: 4.20: There is no replacement

parameter.name: GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ERROR_NONEXISTENT
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that a file does not exist.

parameter.name: GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ERROR_ALREADY_EXISTS
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates a duplicate path (e.g. when adding a bookmark).

parameter.name: GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ERROR_INCOMPLETE_HOSTNAME
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates an incomplete hostname (e.g. "http://foo" without a slash after that).

property.name: GtkFileChooserNative:accept-label
property.description: The text used for the label on the accept button in the dialog, or %NULL to use the default text.

property.name: GtkFileChooserNative:cancel-label
property.description: The text used for the label on the cancel button in the dialog, or %NULL to use the default text.

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::desktop-folder
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to make the file chooser show the user's Desktop folder in the file list.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>D</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::down-folder
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to make the file chooser go to a child of the current folder in the file hierarchy. The subfolder that will be used is displayed in the path bar widget of the file chooser. For example, if the path bar is showing "/foo/bar/baz", with bar currently displayed, then this will cause the file chooser to switch to the "baz" subfolder.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>Down</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::home-folder
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to make the file chooser show the user's home folder in the file list.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>Home</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::location-popup
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to make the file chooser show a "Location" prompt which the user can use to manually type the name of the file he wishes to select.
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Control</kbd>-<kbd>L</kbd> with a @path string of "" (the empty string). It is also bound to <kbd>/</kbd> with a @path string of "`/`" (a slash): this lets you type `/` and immediately type a path name. On Unix systems, this is bound to <kbd>~</kbd> (tilde) with a @path string of "~" itself for access to home directories.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a string that gets put in the text entry for the file name

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::location-popup-on-paste
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to make the file chooser show a "Location" prompt when the user pastes into a `GtkFileChooserWidget`.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Control</kbd>-<kbd>V</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::location-toggle-popup
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to toggle the visibility of a "Location" prompt which the user can use to manually type the name of the file he wishes to select.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Control</kbd>-<kbd>L</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::places-shortcut
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to move the focus to the places sidebar.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>P</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::quick-bookmark
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to make the file chooser switch to the bookmark specified in the @bookmark_index parameter. For example, if you have three bookmarks, you can pass 0, 1, 2 to this signal to switch to each of them, respectively.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>1</kbd>, <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>2</kbd>, etc. until <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>0</kbd>. Note that in the default binding, that <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>1</kbd> is actually defined to switch to the bookmark at index 0, and so on successively.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: bookmark_index
parameter.parameter_description: the number of the bookmark to switch to

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::recent-shortcut
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to make the file chooser show the Recent location.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>R</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::search-shortcut
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to make the file chooser show the search entry.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>S</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::show-hidden
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to make the file chooser display hidden files.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Control</kbd>-<kbd>H</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkFileChooserWidget::up-folder
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This is used to make the file chooser go to the parent of the current folder in the file hierarchy.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>Up</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

property.name: GtkFileChooserWidget:search-mode
property.description: Whether search mode is enabled.

property.name: GtkFileChooserWidget:show-time
property.description:
Whether to show the time.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileChooserWidget:subtitle
property.description: The subtitle of the file chooser widget.

property.name: GtkFileDialog:accept-label
property.description:
Label for the file chooser's accept button.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileDialog:default-filter
property.description:
The default filter.
This filter is initially active in the file chooser dialog.
If the default filter is `NULL`, the first filter of [property@Gtk.FileDialog:filters] is used as the default filter. If that property contains no filter, the dialog will be unfiltered.
If [property@Gtk.FileDialog:filters] is not `NULL`, the default filter should be part of the list. If it is not, the dialog may choose to not make it available.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileDialog:filters
property.description:
The list of filters.
See [property@Gtk.FileDialog:default-filter] about how these two properties interact.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileDialog:initial-file
property.description:
The initial file.
This file is initially selected in the file chooser dialog
This is a utility property that sets both [property@Gtk.FileDialog:initial-folder] and [property@Gtk.FileDialog:initial-name].
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileDialog:initial-folder
property.description:
The initial folder.
This is the directory that is initially opened in the file chooser dialog.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileDialog:initial-name
property.description:
The initial name.
This is the name of the file that is initially selected in the file chooser dialog.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileDialog:modal
property.description:
Whether the file chooser dialog is modal.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileDialog:title
property.description:
A title that may be shown on the file chooser dialog.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileFilter:mime-types
property.description:
The MIME types that this filter matches.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileFilter:name
property.description:
The human-readable name of the filter.
This is the string that will be displayed in the user interface if there is a selectable list of filters.

property.name: GtkFileFilter:patterns
property.description:
The patterns that this filter matches.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileFilter:suffixes
property.description:
The suffixes that this filter matches.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileLauncher:always-ask
property.description:
Whether to ask the user to choose an app for opening the file. If `FALSE`, the file might be opened with a default app or the previous choice.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkFileLauncher:file
property.description:
The file to launch.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFileLauncher:writable
property.description:
Whether to make the file writable for the handler.
Since: 4.14

signal.name: GtkFilter::changed
signal.description:
Emitted whenever the filter changed.
Users of the filter should then check items again via [method@Gtk.Filter.match].
`GtkFilterListModel` handles this signal automatically.
Depending on the @change parameter, not all items need to be checked, but only some. Refer to the [enum@Gtk.FilterChange] documentation for details.

enum.name: GtkFilterChange
enum.description:
Describes changes in a filter in more detail and allows objects using the filter to optimize refiltering items.
If you are writing an implementation and are not sure which value to pass, `GTK_FILTER_CHANGE_DIFFERENT` is always a correct choice.
New values may be added in the future.

parameter.name: GTK_FILTER_CHANGE_DIFFERENT
parameter.parameter_description: The filter change cannot be described with any of the other enumeration values

parameter.name: GTK_FILTER_CHANGE_LESS_STRICT
parameter.parameter_description: The filter is less strict than it was before: All items that it used to return true still return true, others now may, too.

parameter.name: GTK_FILTER_CHANGE_MORE_STRICT
parameter.parameter_description: The filter is more strict than it was before: All items that it used to return false still return false, others now may, too.

parameter.name: GTK_FILTER_CHANGE_DIFFERENT_REWATCH
parameter.parameter_description:
Similar to [enum@Gtk.FilterChange.DIFFERENT], but signs that item watches should be recreated. This is used by [class@Gtk.FilterListModel] to keep the list up-to-date when items change.
Since: 4.20

parameter.name: GTK_FILTER_CHANGE_LESS_STRICT_REWATCH
parameter.parameter_description:
Similar to [enum@Gtk.FilterChange.LESS_STRICT], but signs that item watches should be recreated. This is used by [class@Gtk.FilterListModel] to keep the list up-to-date when items change.
Since: 4.20

parameter.name: GTK_FILTER_CHANGE_MORE_STRICT_REWATCH
parameter.parameter_description:
Similar to [enum@Gtk.FilterChange.MORE_STRICT], but signs that item watches should be recreated. This is used by [class@Gtk.FilterListModel] to keep the list up-to-date when items change.
Since: 4.20

property.name: GtkFilterListModel:filter
property.description: The filter for this model.

property.name: GtkFilterListModel:incremental
property.description: If the model should filter items incrementally.

property.name: GtkFilterListModel:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkFilterListModel:model
property.description: The model being filtered.

property.name: GtkFilterListModel:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkFilterListModel:pending
property.description: Number of items not yet filtered.

property.name: GtkFilterListModel:watch-items
property.description:
Monitor the list items for changes. It may impact performance.
Since: 4.20

enum.name: GtkFilterMatch
enum.description:
Describes the known strictness of a filter.
Note that for filters where the strictness is not known, `GTK_FILTER_MATCH_SOME` is always an acceptable value, even if a filter does match all or no items.

parameter.name: GTK_FILTER_MATCH_SOME
parameter.parameter_description: The filter matches some items, [method@Gtk.Filter.match] may return true or false

parameter.name: GTK_FILTER_MATCH_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: The filter does not match any item, [method@Gtk.Filter.match] will always return false

parameter.name: GTK_FILTER_MATCH_ALL
parameter.parameter_description: The filter matches all items, [method@Gtk.Filter.match] will alays return true

property.name: GtkFixedLayoutChild:transform
property.description: The transform of the child.

property.name: GtkFlattenListModel:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkFlattenListModel:model
property.description: The model being flattened.

property.name: GtkFlattenListModel:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

signal.name: GtkFlowBox::activate-cursor-child
signal.description:
Emitted when the user activates the @box.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkFlowBox` on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkFlowBox::child-activated
signal.description: Emitted when a child has been activated by the user.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkFlowBox` on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkFlowBox::move-cursor
signal.description:
Emitted when the user initiates a cursor movement.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html). Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control the cursor programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal come in two variants, the variant with the Shift modifier extends the selection, the variant without the Shift modifier does not. There are too many key combinations to list them all here.
- <kbd>←</kbd>, <kbd>→</kbd>, <kbd>↑</kbd>, <kbd>↓</kbd> move by individual children - <kbd>Home</kbd>, <kbd>End</kbd> move to the ends of the box - <kbd>PgUp</kbd>, <kbd>PgDn</kbd> move vertically by pages

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkFlowBox` on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: the granularity of the move, as a `GtkMovementStep`

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of @step units to move

signal.return: %TRUE to stop other handlers from being invoked for the event. %FALSE to propagate the event further.

signal.name: GtkFlowBox::select-all
signal.description:
Emitted to select all children of the box, if the selection mode permits it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>a</kbd>.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkFlowBox` on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkFlowBox::selected-children-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the set of selected children changes.
Use [method@Gtk.FlowBox.selected_foreach] or [method@Gtk.FlowBox.get_selected_children] to obtain the selected children.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkFlowBox` on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkFlowBox::toggle-cursor-child
signal.description:
Emitted to toggle the selection of the child that has the focus.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>Space</kbd>.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkFlowBox` on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkFlowBox::unselect-all
signal.description:
Emitted to unselect all children of the box, if the selection mode permits it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>Shift</kbd>-<kbd>a</kbd>.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkFlowBox` on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GtkFlowBox:accept-unpaired-release
property.description: Whether to accept unpaired release events.

property.name: GtkFlowBox:activate-on-single-click
property.description: Determines whether children can be activated with a single click, or require a double-click.

property.name: GtkFlowBox:column-spacing
property.description: The amount of horizontal space between two children.

property.name: GtkFlowBox:homogeneous
property.description: Determines whether all children should be allocated the same size.

property.name: GtkFlowBox:max-children-per-line
property.description: The maximum amount of children to request space for consecutively in the given orientation.

property.name: GtkFlowBox:min-children-per-line
property.description:
The minimum number of children to allocate consecutively in the given orientation.
Setting the minimum children per line ensures that a reasonably small height will be requested for the overall minimum width of the box.

property.name: GtkFlowBox:row-spacing
property.description: The amount of vertical space between two children.

property.name: GtkFlowBox:selection-mode
property.description: The selection mode used by the flow box.

signal.name: GtkFlowBoxChild::activate
signal.description:
Emitted when the user activates a child widget in a `GtkFlowBox`.
This can happen either by clicking or double-clicking, or via a keybinding.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html), but it can be used by applications for their own purposes.
The default bindings are <kbd>Space</kbd> and <kbd>Enter</kbd>.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: The child on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GtkFlowBoxChild:child
property.description: The child widget.

signal.name: GtkFontButton::activate
signal.description:
Emitted to when the font button is activated.
The `::activate` signal on `GtkFontButton` is an action signal and emitting it causes the button to present its dialog.
Since: 4.4

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkFontButton::font-set
signal.description:
Emitted when the user selects a font.
When handling this signal, use [method@Gtk.FontChooser.get_font] to find out which font was just selected.
Note that this signal is only emitted when the user changes the font. If you need to react to programmatic font changes as well, use the notify::font signal.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

property.name: GtkFontButton:modal
property.description: Whether the font chooser dialog should be modal.

property.name: GtkFontButton:title
property.description: The title of the font chooser dialog.

property.name: GtkFontButton:use-font
property.description: Whether the buttons label will be drawn in the selected font.

property.name: GtkFontButton:use-size
property.description: Whether the buttons label will use the selected font size.

signal.name: GtkFontChooser::font-activated
signal.description:
Emitted when a font is activated.
This usually happens when the user double clicks an item, or an item is selected and the user presses one of the keys Space, Shift+Space, Return or Enter.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FontDialog] and [class@Gtk.FontDialogButton] instead

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

property.name: GtkFontChooser:font
property.description:
The font description as a string, e.g. "Sans Italic 12".
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FontDialog] and [class@Gtk.FontDialogButton] instead

property.name: GtkFontChooser:font-desc
property.description:
The font description as a `PangoFontDescription`.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FontDialog] and [class@Gtk.FontDialogButton] instead

property.name: GtkFontChooser:font-features
property.description:
The selected font features.
The format of the string is compatible with CSS and with Pango attributes.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FontDialog] and [class@Gtk.FontDialogButton] instead

property.name: GtkFontChooser:language
property.description:
The language for which the font features were selected.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FontDialog] and [class@Gtk.FontDialogButton] instead

property.name: GtkFontChooser:level
property.description:
The level of granularity to offer for selecting fonts.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FontDialog] and [class@Gtk.FontDialogButton] instead

property.name: GtkFontChooser:preview-text
property.description:
The string with which to preview the font.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FontDialog] and [class@Gtk.FontDialogButton] instead

property.name: GtkFontChooser:show-preview-entry
property.description:
Whether to show an entry to change the preview text.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FontDialog] and [class@Gtk.FontDialogButton] instead

enum.name: GtkFontChooserLevel
enum.description:
Specifies the granularity of font selection that is desired in a `GtkFontChooser`.
This enumeration may be extended in the future; applications should ignore unknown values.
Deprecated: 4.20: There is no replacement.

parameter.name: GTK_FONT_CHOOSER_LEVEL_STYLE
parameter.parameter_description: Allow selecting a specific font face

parameter.name: GTK_FONT_CHOOSER_LEVEL_SIZE
parameter.parameter_description: Allow selecting a specific font size

parameter.name: GTK_FONT_CHOOSER_LEVEL_VARIATIONS
parameter.parameter_description: Allow changing OpenType font variation axes

parameter.name: GTK_FONT_CHOOSER_LEVEL_FEATURES
parameter.parameter_description: Allow selecting specific OpenType font features

property.name: GtkFontChooserWidget:tweak-action
property.description:
A toggle action that can be used to switch to the tweak page of the font chooser widget, which lets the user tweak the OpenType features and variation axes of the selected font.
The action will be enabled or disabled depending on whether the selected font has any features or axes.

property.name: GtkFontDialog:filter
property.description:
A filter to restrict what fonts are shown in the font chooser dialog.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFontDialog:font-map
property.description:
A custom font map to select fonts from.
A custom font map can be used to present application-specific fonts instead of or in addition to the normal system fonts.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFontDialog:language
property.description:
The language for which the font features are selected.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFontDialog:modal
property.description:
Whether the font chooser dialog is modal.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFontDialog:title
property.description:
A title that may be shown on the font chooser dialog that is presented by [method@Gtk.FontDialog.choose_font].
Since: 4.10

signal.name: GtkFontDialogButton::activate
signal.description:
Emitted when the font dialog button is activated.
The `::activate` signal on `GtkFontDialogButton` is an action signal and emitting it causes the button to pop up its dialog.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: The object which received the signal

property.name: GtkFontDialogButton:dialog
property.description:
The `GtkFontDialog` that contains parameters for the font chooser dialog.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFontDialogButton:font-desc
property.description:
The selected font.
This property can be set to give the button its initial font, and it will be updated to reflect the users choice in the font chooser dialog.
Listen to `notify::font-desc` to get informed about changes to the buttons font.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFontDialogButton:font-features
property.description:
The selected font features.
This property will be updated to reflect the users choice in the font chooser dialog.
Listen to `notify::font-features` to get informed about changes to the buttons font features.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFontDialogButton:language
property.description:
The selected language for font features.
This property will be updated to reflect the users choice in the font chooser dialog.
Listen to `notify::language` to get informed about changes to the buttons language.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkFontDialogButton:level
property.description: The level of detail for the font chooser dialog.

property.name: GtkFontDialogButton:use-font
property.description: Whether the buttons label will be drawn in the selected font.

property.name: GtkFontDialogButton:use-size
property.description: Whether the buttons label will use the selected font size.

enum.name: GtkFontLevel
enum.description:
The level of granularity for the font selection.
Depending on this value, the `PangoFontDescription` that is returned by [method@Gtk.FontDialogButton.get_font_desc] will have more or less fields set.
Since: 4.10

parameter.name: GTK_FONT_LEVEL_FACE
parameter.parameter_description: Select a font face (i.e. a family and a style)

parameter.name: GTK_FONT_LEVEL_FONT
parameter.parameter_description: Select a font (i.e. a face with a size, and possibly font variations)

parameter.name: GTK_FONT_LEVEL_FEATURES
parameter.parameter_description: Select a font and font features

enum.name: GtkFontRendering
enum.description:
Values for the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-font-rendering] setting that influence how GTK renders fonts.
Since: 4.16

parameter.name: GTK_FONT_RENDERING_AUTOMATIC
parameter.parameter_description: Set up font rendering automatically, taking factors like screen resolution and scale into account

parameter.name: GTK_FONT_RENDERING_MANUAL
parameter.parameter_description: Follow low-level font-related settings when configuring font rendering

property.name: GtkFrame:child
property.description: The child widget.

property.name: GtkFrame:label
property.description: Text of the frame's label.

property.name: GtkFrame:label-widget
property.description: Widget to display in place of the usual frame label.

property.name: GtkFrame:label-xalign
property.description: The horizontal alignment of the label.

signal.name: GtkGLArea::create-context
signal.description:
Emitted when the widget is being realized.
This allows you to override how the GL context is created. This is useful when you want to reuse an existing GL context, or if you want to try creating different kinds of GL options.
If context creation fails then the signal handler can use [method@Gtk.GLArea.set_error] to register a more detailed error of how the construction failed.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: location to store error information on failure

signal.return: a newly created `GdkGLContext`; the `GtkGLArea` widget will take ownership of the returned value.

signal.name: GtkGLArea::render
signal.description:
Emitted every time the contents of the `GtkGLArea` should be redrawn.
The @context is bound to the @area prior to emitting this function, and the buffers are painted to the window once the emission terminates.
signal.return: %TRUE to stop other handlers from being invoked for the event. %FALSE to propagate the event further.

signal.name: GtkGLArea::resize
signal.description:
Emitted once when the widget is realized, and then each time the widget is changed while realized.
This is useful in order to keep GL state up to date with the widget size, like for instance camera properties which may depend on the width/height ratio.
The GL context for the area is guaranteed to be current when this signal is emitted.
The default handler sets up the GL viewport.

property.name: GtkGLArea:allowed-apis
property.description:
The allowed APIs.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkGLArea:api
property.description:
The API currently in use.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkGLArea:auto-render
property.description:
If set to %TRUE the ::render signal will be emitted every time the widget draws.
This is the default and is useful if drawing the widget is faster.
If set to %FALSE the data from previous rendering is kept around and will be used for drawing the widget the next time, unless the window is resized. In order to force a rendering [method@Gtk.GLArea.queue_render] must be called. This mode is useful when the scene changes seldom, but takes a long time to redraw.

property.name: GtkGLArea:context
property.description:
The `GdkGLContext` used by the `GtkGLArea` widget.
The `GtkGLArea` widget is responsible for creating the `GdkGLContext` instance. If you need to render with other kinds of buffers (stencil, depth, etc), use render buffers.

property.name: GtkGLArea:has-depth-buffer
property.description:
If set to %TRUE the widget will allocate and enable a depth buffer for the target framebuffer.
Setting this property will enable GL's depth testing as a side effect. If you don't need depth testing, you should call `glDisable(GL_DEPTH_TEST)` in your `GtkGLArea::render` handler.

property.name: GtkGLArea:has-stencil-buffer
property.description: If set to %TRUE the widget will allocate and enable a stencil buffer for the target framebuffer.

property.name: GtkGLArea:use-es
property.description:
If set to %TRUE the widget will try to create a `GdkGLContext` using OpenGL ES instead of OpenGL.
Deprecated: 4.12: Use [property@Gtk.GLArea:allowed-apis]

signal.name: GtkGesture::begin
signal.description:
Emitted when the gesture is recognized.
This means the number of touch sequences matches [property@Gtk.Gesture:n-points].
Note: These conditions may also happen when an extra touch (eg. a third touch on a 2-touches gesture) is lifted, in that situation @sequence won't pertain to the current set of active touches, so don't rely on this being true.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: sequence
parameter.parameter_description: the `GdkEventSequence` that made the gesture to be recognized

signal.name: GtkGesture::cancel

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkGesture::end
signal.description:
Emitted when @gesture either stopped recognizing the event sequences as something to be handled, or the number of touch sequences became higher or lower than [property@Gtk.Gesture:n-points].
Note: @sequence might not pertain to the group of sequences that were previously triggering recognition on @gesture (ie. a just pressed touch sequence that exceeds [property@Gtk.Gesture:n-points]). This situation may be detected by checking through [method@Gtk.Gesture.handles_sequence].

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: sequence
parameter.parameter_description: the `GdkEventSequence` that made gesture recognition to finish

signal.name: GtkGesture::sequence-state-changed
signal.description:
Emitted whenever a sequence state changes.
See [method@Gtk.Gesture.set_sequence_state] to know more about the expectable sequence lifetimes.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkGesture::update
signal.description:
Emitted whenever an event is handled while the gesture is recognized.
@sequence is guaranteed to pertain to the set of active touches.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

property.name: GtkGesture:n-points
property.description: The number of touch points that trigger recognition on this gesture.

signal.name: GtkGestureClick::pressed
signal.description: Emitted whenever a button or touch press happens.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: n_press
parameter.parameter_description: how many touch/button presses happened with this one

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: The X coordinate, in widget allocation coordinates

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: The Y coordinate, in widget allocation coordinates

signal.name: GtkGestureClick::released
signal.description:
Emitted when a button or touch is released.
@n_press will report the number of press that is paired to this event, note that [signal@Gtk.GestureClick::stopped] may have been emitted between the press and its release, @n_press will only start over at the next press.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: n_press
parameter.parameter_description: number of press that is paired with this release

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: The X coordinate, in widget allocation coordinates

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: The Y coordinate, in widget allocation coordinates

signal.name: GtkGestureClick::stopped
signal.description: Emitted whenever any time/distance threshold has been exceeded.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkGestureClick::unpaired-release
signal.description:
Emitted whenever the gesture receives a release event that had no previous corresponding press.
Due to implicit grabs, this can only happen on situations where input is grabbed elsewhere mid-press or the pressed widget voluntarily relinquishes its implicit grab.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkGestureDrag::drag-begin
signal.description: Emitted whenever dragging starts.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: start_x
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate, relative to the widget allocation

parameter.name: start_y
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate, relative to the widget allocation

signal.name: GtkGestureDrag::drag-end
signal.description: Emitted whenever the dragging is finished.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: offset_x
parameter.parameter_description: X offset, relative to the start point

parameter.name: offset_y
parameter.parameter_description: Y offset, relative to the start point

signal.name: GtkGestureDrag::drag-update
signal.description: Emitted whenever the dragging point moves.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: offset_x
parameter.parameter_description: X offset, relative to the start point

parameter.name: offset_y
parameter.parameter_description: Y offset, relative to the start point

signal.name: GtkGestureLongPress::cancelled
signal.description: Emitted whenever a press moved too far, or was released before [signal@Gtk.GestureLongPress::pressed] happened.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkGestureLongPress::pressed
signal.description: Emitted whenever a press goes unmoved/unreleased longer than what the GTK defaults tell.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the X coordinate where the press happened, relative to the widget allocation

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the Y coordinate where the press happened, relative to the widget allocation

property.name: GtkGestureLongPress:delay-factor
property.description: Factor by which to modify the default timeout.

signal.name: GtkGesturePan::pan
signal.description: Emitted once a panning gesture along the expected axis is detected.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: The object which received the signal

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: current direction of the pan gesture

property.name: GtkGesturePan:orientation
property.description: The expected orientation of pan gestures.

signal.name: GtkGestureRotate::angle-changed
signal.description: Emitted when the angle between both tracked points changes.

parameter.name: gesture
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: angle_delta
parameter.parameter_description: Difference with the starting angle, in radians

property.name: GtkGestureSingle:button
property.description: Mouse button number to listen to, or 0 to listen for any button.

property.name: GtkGestureSingle:exclusive
property.description:
Whether the gesture is exclusive.
Exclusive gestures only listen to pointer and pointer emulated events.

property.name: GtkGestureSingle:touch-only
property.description: Whether the gesture handles only touch events.

signal.name: GtkGestureStylus::down
signal.description: Emitted when the stylus touches the device.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the X coordinate of the stylus event

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the Y coordinate of the stylus event

parameter.name: y

parameter.name: x

parameter.name: y

signal.description: Emitted when the stylus no longer touches the device.

parameter.name: x

property.description:
If this gesture should exclusively react to stylus input devices.
Since: 4.10

signal.name: GtkGestureSwipe::swipe
signal.description:
Emitted when the recognized gesture is finished.
Velocity and direction are a product of previously recorded events.

parameter.name: velocity_x

parameter.name: velocity_y
parameter.parameter_description: velocity in the Y axis, in pixels/sec

signal.name: GtkGestureZoom::scale-changed
signal.description: Emitted whenever the distance between both tracked sequences changes.

parameter.name: controller
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: scale
parameter.parameter_description: Scale delta, taking the initial state as 1:1

property.name: GtkGraphicsOffload:black-background
property.description:
Whether to draw a black background.
Since: 4.16

property.name: GtkGraphicsOffload:child
property.description:
The child widget.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkGraphicsOffload:enabled
property.description:
Whether graphics offload is enabled.
Since: 4.14

enum.name: GtkGraphicsOffloadEnabled
enum.description:
Represents the state of graphics offloading.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkGrid:baseline-row
property.description: The row to align to the baseline when valign is using baseline alignment.

property.name: GtkGrid:column-homogeneous
property.description: If %TRUE, the columns are all the same width.

property.name: GtkGrid:column-spacing
property.description: The amount of space between two consecutive columns.

property.name: GtkGrid:row-homogeneous
property.description: If %TRUE, the rows are all the same height.

property.name: GtkGrid:row-spacing
property.description: The amount of space between two consecutive rows.

property.name: GtkGridLayout:baseline-row
property.description: The row to align to the baseline, when `GtkWidget:valign` is set to %GTK_ALIGN_BASELINE.

property.name: GtkGridLayout:column-homogeneous
property.description: Whether all the columns in the grid have the same width.

property.name: GtkGridLayout:column-spacing
property.description: The amount of space between to consecutive columns.

property.name: GtkGridLayout:row-homogeneous
property.description: Whether all the rows in the grid have the same height.

property.name: GtkGridLayout:row-spacing
property.description: The amount of space between to consecutive rows.

property.name: GtkGridLayoutChild:column
property.description: The column to place the child in.

property.name: GtkGridLayoutChild:column-span
property.description: The number of columns the child spans to.

property.name: GtkGridLayoutChild:row
property.description: The row to place the child in.

property.name: GtkGridLayoutChild:row-span
property.description: The number of rows the child spans to.

signal.name: GtkGridView::activate
signal.description:
Emitted when a cell has been activated by the user, usually via activating the GtkGridView|list.activate-item action.
This allows for a convenient way to handle activation in a gridview. See [property@Gtk.ListItem:activatable] for details on how to use this signal.

property.name: GtkGridView:enable-rubberband
property.description: Allow rubberband selection.

property.name: GtkGridView:factory
property.description:
Factory for populating list items.
The factory must be for configuring [class@Gtk.ListItem] objects.

property.name: GtkGridView:max-columns
property.description:
Maximum number of columns per row.
If this number is smaller than [property@Gtk.GridView:min-columns], that value is used instead.

property.name: GtkGridView:min-columns
property.description: Minimum number of columns per row.

property.name: GtkGridView:model
property.description: Model for the items displayed.

property.name: GtkGridView:single-click-activate
property.description: Activate rows on single click and select them on hover.

property.name: GtkGridView:tab-behavior
property.description:
Behavior of the <kbd>Tab</kbd> key
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkHeaderBar:decoration-layout
property.description:
The decoration layout for buttons.
If this property is not set, the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-decoration-layout] setting is used.

property.name: GtkHeaderBar:show-title-buttons
property.description:
Whether to show title buttons like close, minimize, maximize.
Which buttons are actually shown and where is determined by the [property@Gtk.HeaderBar:decoration-layout] property, and by the state of the window (e.g. a close button will not be shown if the window can't be closed).

property.name: GtkHeaderBar:title-widget
property.description: The title widget to display.

property.name: GtkHeaderBar:use-native-controls
property.description:
Whether to show platform native close/minimize/maximize buttons.
For macOS, the [property@Gtk.HeaderBar:decoration-layout] property can be used to enable/disable controls.
On Linux, this option has no effect.
See also [Using GTK on Apple macOS](osx.html?native-window-controls).
Since: 4.18

signal.name: GtkIMContext::commit
signal.description:
The ::commit signal is emitted when a complete input sequence has been entered by the user.
If the commit comes after a preediting sequence, the ::commit signal is emitted after ::preedit-end.
This can be a single character immediately after a key press or the final result of preediting.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: the completed character(s) entered by the user

signal.name: GtkIMContext::delete-surrounding
signal.description: The ::delete-surrounding signal is emitted when the input method needs to delete all or part of the context surrounding the cursor.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the character offset from the cursor position of the text to be deleted. A negative value indicates a position before the cursor.

parameter.name: n_chars
parameter.parameter_description: the number of characters to be deleted

signal.return: %TRUE if the signal was handled.

signal.name: GtkIMContext::preedit-changed
signal.description:
The ::preedit-changed signal is emitted whenever the preedit sequence currently being entered has changed.
It is also emitted at the end of a preedit sequence, in which case [method@Gtk.IMContext.get_preedit_string] returns the empty string.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkIMContext::preedit-end
signal.description: The ::preedit-end signal is emitted when a preediting sequence has been completed or canceled.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkIMContext::preedit-start
signal.description: The ::preedit-start signal is emitted when a new preediting sequence starts.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkIMContext::retrieve-surrounding
signal.description:
The ::retrieve-surrounding signal is emitted when the input method requires the context surrounding the cursor.
The callback should set the input method surrounding context by calling the [method@Gtk.IMContext.set_surrounding] method.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.return: %TRUE if the signal was handled.

property.name: GtkIMContext:input-hints
property.description: Additional hints that allow input methods to fine-tune their behaviour.

property.name: GtkIMContext:input-purpose
property.description:
The purpose of the text field that the `GtkIMContext is connected to.
This property can be used by on-screen keyboards and other input methods to adjust their behaviour.

enum.name: GtkIconLookupFlags
enum.description: Used to specify options for gtk_icon_theme_lookup_icon().

parameter.name: GTK_ICON_LOOKUP_FORCE_REGULAR
parameter.parameter_description: Try to always load regular icons, even when symbolic icon names are given

parameter.name: GTK_ICON_LOOKUP_FORCE_SYMBOLIC
parameter.parameter_description: Try to always load symbolic icons, even when regular icon names are given

parameter.name: GTK_ICON_LOOKUP_PRELOAD
parameter.parameter_description: Starts loading the texture in the background so it is ready when later needed.

property.name: GtkIconPaintable:file
property.description: The file representing the icon, if any.

property.name: GtkIconPaintable:icon-name
property.description:
The icon name that was chosen during lookup.
Deprecated: 4.20

property.name: GtkIconPaintable:is-symbolic
property.description:
Whether the icon is symbolic or not.
Deprecated: 4.20

enum.name: GtkIconSize
enum.description:
Built-in icon sizes.
Icon sizes default to being inherited. Where they cannot be inherited, text size is the default.
All widgets which use `GtkIconSize` set the normal-icons or large-icons style classes correspondingly, and let themes determine the actual size to be used with the `-gtk-icon-size` CSS property.

parameter.name: GTK_ICON_SIZE_INHERIT
parameter.parameter_description: Keep the size of the parent element

parameter.name: GTK_ICON_SIZE_LARGE
parameter.parameter_description: Large size, for example in an icon view

signal.name: GtkIconTheme::changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the icon theme changes.
This can happen because current icon theme is switched or because GTK detects that a change has occurred in the contents of the current icon theme.

property.name: GtkIconTheme:display
property.description: The display that this icon theme object is attached to.

property.name: GtkIconTheme:icon-names
property.description: The icon names that are supported by the icon theme.

property.name: GtkIconTheme:resource-path
property.description:
Resource paths that will be looked at when looking for icons, similar to search paths.
The resources are considered as part of the hicolor icon theme and must be located in subdirectories that are defined in the hicolor icon theme, such as `@path/16x16/actions/run.png`. Icons that are directly placed in the resource path instead of a subdirectory are also considered as ultimate fallback.

property.name: GtkIconTheme:search-path
property.description:
The search path for this icon theme.
When looking for icons, GTK will search for a subdirectory of one or more of the directories in the search path with the same name as the icon theme containing an index.theme file. (Themes from multiple of the path elements are combined to allow themes to be extended by adding icons in the user’s home directory.)

property.name: GtkIconTheme:theme-name
property.description:
The name of the icon theme that is being used.
Unless set to a different value, this will be the value of the `GtkSettings:gtk-icon-theme-name` property of the `GtkSettings` object associated to the display of the icontheme object.

enum.name: GtkIconThemeError
enum.description: Error codes for `GtkIconTheme` operations.

parameter.name: GTK_ICON_THEME_NOT_FOUND
parameter.parameter_description: The icon specified does not exist in the theme

signal.name: GtkIconView::activate-cursor-item
signal.description:
A [keybinding signal][class@Gtk.SignalAction] which gets emitted when the user activates the currently focused item.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control activation programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal are Space, Return and Enter.

parameter.name: iconview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.return: whether the item was activated

signal.name: GtkIconView::item-activated
signal.description: The ::item-activated signal is emitted when the method gtk_icon_view_item_activated() is called, when the user double clicks an item with the "activate-on-single-click" property set to %FALSE, or when the user single clicks an item when the "activate-on-single-click" property set to %TRUE. It is also emitted when a non-editable item is selected and one of the keys: Space, Return or Enter is pressed.

parameter.name: iconview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkIconView::move-cursor
signal.description:
The ::move-cursor signal is a [keybinding signal][class@Gtk.SignalAction] which gets emitted when the user initiates a cursor movement.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control the cursor programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal include - Arrow keys which move by individual steps - Home/End keys which move to the first/last item - PageUp/PageDown which move by "pages" All of these will extend the selection when combined with the Shift modifier.

parameter.name: iconview
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: the granularity of the move, as a `GtkMovementStep`

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of @step units to move

signal.return: whether the cursor was moved

signal.name: GtkIconView::select-all
signal.description:
A [keybinding signal][class@Gtk.SignalAction] which gets emitted when the user selects all items.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control selection programmatically.
The default binding for this signal is Ctrl-a.

parameter.name: iconview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkIconView::select-cursor-item
signal.description:
A [keybinding signal][class@Gtk.SignalAction] which gets emitted when the user selects the item that is currently focused.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control selection programmatically.
There is no default binding for this signal.

parameter.name: iconview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkIconView::selection-changed
signal.description: The ::selection-changed signal is emitted when the selection (i.e. the set of selected items) changes.

parameter.name: iconview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkIconView::toggle-cursor-item
signal.description:
A [keybinding signal][class@Gtk.SignalAction] which gets emitted when the user toggles whether the currently focused item is selected or not. The exact effect of this depend on the selection mode.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control selection programmatically.
There is no default binding for this signal is Ctrl-Space.

parameter.name: iconview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkIconView::unselect-all
signal.description:
A [keybinding signal][class@Gtk.SignalAction] which gets emitted when the user unselects all items.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control selection programmatically.
The default binding for this signal is Ctrl-Shift-a.

parameter.name: iconview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GtkIconView:activate-on-single-click
property.description: The activate-on-single-click property specifies whether the "item-activated" signal will be emitted after a single click.

property.name: GtkIconView:cell-area
property.description:
The `GtkCellArea` used to layout cell renderers for this view.
If no area is specified when creating the icon view with gtk_icon_view_new_with_area() a `GtkCellAreaBox` will be used.

property.name: GtkIconView:column-spacing
property.description: The column-spacing property specifies the space which is inserted between the columns of the icon view.

property.name: GtkIconView:columns
property.description: The columns property contains the number of the columns in which the items should be displayed. If it is -1, the number of columns will be chosen automatically to fill the available area.

property.name: GtkIconView:item-orientation
property.description: The item-orientation property specifies how the cells (i.e. the icon and the text) of the item are positioned relative to each other.

property.name: GtkIconView:item-padding
property.description: The item-padding property specifies the padding around each of the icon view's item.

property.name: GtkIconView:item-width
property.description: The item-width property specifies the width to use for each item. If it is set to -1, the icon view will automatically determine a suitable item size.

property.name: GtkIconView:margin
property.description: The margin property specifies the space which is inserted at the edges of the icon view.

property.name: GtkIconView:markup-column
property.description: The ::markup-column property contains the number of the model column containing markup information to be displayed. The markup column must be of type `G_TYPE_STRING`. If this property and the :text-column property are both set to column numbers, it overrides the text column. If both are set to -1, no texts are displayed.

property.name: GtkIconView:model
property.description: The model of the icon view.

property.name: GtkIconView:pixbuf-column
property.description: The ::pixbuf-column property contains the number of the model column containing the pixbufs which are displayed. The pixbuf column must be of type `GDK_TYPE_PIXBUF`. Setting this property to -1 turns off the display of pixbufs.

property.name: GtkIconView:reorderable
property.description: The reorderable property specifies if the items can be reordered by DND.

property.name: GtkIconView:row-spacing
property.description: The row-spacing property specifies the space which is inserted between the rows of the icon view.

property.name: GtkIconView:selection-mode
property.description: The ::selection-mode property specifies the selection mode of icon view. If the mode is %GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, rubberband selection is enabled, for the other modes, only keyboard selection is possible.

property.name: GtkIconView:spacing
property.description: The spacing property specifies the space which is inserted between the cells (i.e. the icon and the text) of an item.

property.name: GtkIconView:text-column
property.description: The ::text-column property contains the number of the model column containing the texts which are displayed. The text column must be of type `G_TYPE_STRING`. If this property and the :markup-column property are both set to -1, no texts are displayed.

property.name: GtkIconView:tooltip-column
property.description: The column of the icon view model which is being used for displaying tooltips on it's rows.

enum.name: GtkIconViewDropPosition
enum.description:
An enum for determining where a dropped item goes.
Deprecated: 4.20: There is no replacement.

parameter.name: GTK_ICON_VIEW_DROP_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: dropped item is inserted to the left

parameter.name: GTK_ICON_VIEW_DROP_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: dropped item is inserted to the right

property.name: GtkImage:file
property.description: A path to the file to display.

property.name: GtkImage:gicon
property.description:
The `GIcon` displayed in the GtkImage.
For themed icons, If the icon theme is changed, the image will be updated automatically.

property.name: GtkImage:icon-name
property.description:
The name of the icon in the icon theme.
If the icon theme is changed, the image will be updated automatically.

property.name: GtkImage:icon-size
property.description: The symbolic size to display icons at.

property.name: GtkImage:paintable
property.description: The `GdkPaintable` to display.

property.name: GtkImage:pixel-size
property.description:
The size in pixels to display icons at.
If set to a value != -1, this property overrides the [property@Gtk.Image:icon-size] property for images of type `GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME`.

property.name: GtkImage:resource
property.description: A path to a resource file to display.

property.name: GtkImage:storage-type
property.description: The representation being used for image data.

property.name: GtkImage:use-fallback
property.description:
Whether the icon displayed in the `GtkImage` will use standard icon names fallback.
The value of this property is only relevant for images of type %GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME and %GTK_IMAGE_GICON.

enum.name: GtkImageType
enum.description:
Describes the image data representation used by a [class@Gtk.Image].
If you want to get the image from the widget, you can only get the currently-stored representation; for instance, if the gtk_image_get_storage_type() returns %GTK_IMAGE_PAINTABLE, then you can call gtk_image_get_paintable().
For empty images, you can request any storage type (call any of the "get" functions), but they will all return %NULL values.

parameter.name: GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY
parameter.parameter_description: there is no image displayed by the widget

parameter.name: GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME
parameter.parameter_description: the widget contains a named icon

signal.name: GtkInfoBar::close
signal.description:
Gets emitted when the user uses a keybinding to dismiss the info bar.
The ::close signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is the Escape key.

signal.name: GtkInfoBar::response
signal.description:
Emitted when an action widget is clicked.
The signal is also emitted when the application programmer calls [method@Gtk.InfoBar.response]. The @response_id depends on which action widget was clicked.

parameter.name: info_bar
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GtkInfoBar:message-type
property.description:
The type of the message.
The type may be used to determine the appearance of the info bar.

property.name: GtkInfoBar:revealed
property.description: Whether the info bar shows its contents.

property.name: GtkInfoBar:show-close-button
property.description: Whether to include a standard close button.

enum.name: GtkInputHints
enum.description:
Describes hints that might be taken into account by input methods or applications.
Note that input methods may already tailor their behaviour according to the [enum@InputPurpose] of the entry.
Some common sense is expected when using these flags - mixing %GTK_INPUT_HINT_LOWERCASE with any of the uppercase hints makes no sense.
This enumeration may be extended in the future; input methods should ignore unknown values.

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_HINT_LOWERCASE
parameter.parameter_description: Suggest to convert all text to lowercase

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_HINT_UPPERCASE_WORDS
parameter.parameter_description: Suggest to capitalize the first character of each word

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_HINT_UPPERCASE_SENTENCES
parameter.parameter_description: Suggest to capitalize the first word of each sentence

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_HINT_INHIBIT_OSK
parameter.parameter_description: Suggest to not show an onscreen keyboard (e.g for a calculator that already has all the keys).

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_HINT_PRIVATE
parameter.parameter_description: Request that the input method should not update personalized data (like typing history)

enum.name: GtkInputPurpose
enum.description:
Describes primary purpose of the input widget.
This information is useful for on-screen keyboards and similar input methods to decide which keys should be presented to the user.
Note that the purpose is not meant to impose a totally strict rule about allowed characters, and does not replace input validation. It is fine for an on-screen keyboard to let the user override the character set restriction that is expressed by the purpose. The application is expected to validate the entry contents, even if it specified a purpose.
The difference between %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_DIGITS and %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_NUMBER is that the former accepts only digits while the latter also some punctuation (like commas or points, plus, minus) and “e” or “E” as in 3.14E+000.
This enumeration may be extended in the future; input methods should interpret unknown values as “free form”.

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_NAME
parameter.parameter_description: Edited field expects the name of a person

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_TERMINAL
parameter.parameter_description: Allow any character, in addition to control codes

property.name: GtkInscription:attributes
property.description:
A list of style attributes to apply to the text of the inscription.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkInscription:markup
property.description:
Utility property that sets both the [property@Gtk.Inscription:text] and [property@Gtk.Inscription:attributes] properties, mainly intended for use in GtkBuilder ui files to ease translation support and bindings.
This function uses [func@Pango.parse_markup] to parse the markup into text and attributes. The markup must be valid. If you cannot ensure that, consider using [func@Pango.parse_markup] and setting the two properties yourself.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkInscription:min-chars
property.description:
The number of characters that should fit into the inscription at minimum.
This influences the requested width, not the width actually given to the widget, which might turn out to be larger.
Note that this is an approximate character width, so some characters might be wider and some might be thinner, so do not expect the number of characters to exactly match.
If you set this property to 0, the inscription will not request any width at all and its width will be determined entirely by its surroundings.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkInscription:min-lines
property.description:
The number of lines that should fit into the inscription at minimum.
This influences the requested height, not the height actually given to the widget, which might turn out to be larger.
Note that this is an approximate line height, so if the text uses things like fancy Unicode or attribute that influence the height, the text might not fit.
If you set this property to 0, the inscription will not request any height at all and its height will be determined entirely by its surroundings.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkInscription:nat-chars
property.description:
The number of characters that should ideally fit into the inscription.
This influences the requested width, not the width actually given to the widget. The widget might turn out larger as well as smaller.
If this property is set to a value smaller than [property@Gtk.Inscription:min-chars], that value will be used. In particular, for the default value of 0, this will always be the case.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkInscription:nat-lines
property.description:
The number of lines that should ideally fit into the inscription.
This influences the requested height, not the height actually given to the widget. The widget might turn out larger as well as smaller.
If this property is set to a value smaller than [property@Gtk.Inscription:min-lines], that value will be used. In particular, for the default value of 0, this will always be the case.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkInscription:text
property.description:
The displayed text.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkInscription:text-overflow
property.description:
The overflow method to use for the text.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkInscription:wrap-mode
property.description:
Controls how the line wrapping is done.
Note that unlike `GtkLabel`, the default here is %PANGO_WRAP_WORD_CHAR.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkInscription:xalign
property.description:
The horizontal alignment of the text inside the allocated size.
Compare this to [property@Gtk.Widget:halign], which determines how the inscription's size allocation is positioned in the available space.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkInscription:yalign
property.description:
The vertical alignment of the text inside the allocated size.
Compare this to [property@Gtk.Widget:valign], which determines how the inscription's size allocation is positioned in the available space.
Since: 4.8

enum.name: GtkInscriptionOverflow
enum.description:
The different methods to handle text in #GtkInscription when it doesn't fit the available space.
Since: 4.8

parameter.name: GTK_INSCRIPTION_OVERFLOW_ELLIPSIZE_START
parameter.parameter_description: Omit characters at the start of the text

parameter.name: GTK_INSCRIPTION_OVERFLOW_ELLIPSIZE_MIDDLE
parameter.parameter_description: Omit characters at the middle of the text

parameter.name: GTK_INSCRIPTION_OVERFLOW_ELLIPSIZE_END
parameter.parameter_description: Omit characters at the end of the text

enum.name: GtkInterfaceColorScheme
enum.description:
Values for the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-interface-color-scheme] and [property@Gtk.CssProvider:prefers-color-scheme] properties that indicates what color scheme is used.
This information can be used inside CSS via media queries.
More values may be added to this enumeration. Unknown values should be treated the same as `GTK_INTERFACE_COLOR_SCHEME_DEFAULT`.
Since: 4.20

parameter.name: GTK_INTERFACE_COLOR_SCHEME_UNSUPPORTED
parameter.parameter_description: The system doesn't support color schemes

parameter.name: GTK_INTERFACE_COLOR_SCHEME_DEFAULT
parameter.parameter_description: The default color scheme is used

parameter.name: GTK_INTERFACE_COLOR_SCHEME_DARK
parameter.parameter_description: A dark color scheme is used

parameter.name: GTK_INTERFACE_COLOR_SCHEME_LIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: A light color scheme is used

enum.name: GtkInterfaceContrast
enum.description:
Values for the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-interface-contrast] and [property@Gtk.CssProvider:prefers-contrast] properties that indicates the preferred level of contrast.
This information can be used inside CSS via media queries.
More values may be added to this enumeration. Unknown values should be treated the same as `GTK_INTERFACE_CONTRAST_NO_PREFERENCE`.
Since: 4.20

parameter.name: GTK_INTERFACE_CONTRAST_UNSUPPORTED
parameter.parameter_description: The system doesn't support contrast levels

enum.name: GtkJustification
enum.description: Used for justifying the text inside a [class@Label] widget.

parameter.name: GTK_JUSTIFY_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: The text is placed at the left edge of the label.

parameter.name: GTK_JUSTIFY_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: The text is placed at the right edge of the label.

parameter.name: GTK_JUSTIFY_CENTER
parameter.parameter_description: The text is placed in the center of the label.

parameter.name: GTK_JUSTIFY_FILL
parameter.parameter_description: The text is placed is distributed across the label.

property.name: GtkKeyvalTrigger:keyval
property.description: The key value for the trigger.

property.name: GtkKeyvalTrigger:modifiers
property.description: The key modifiers for the trigger.

signal.name: GtkLabel::activate-current-link
signal.description:
Gets emitted when the user activates a link in the label.
The `::activate-current-link` is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
Applications may also emit the signal with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control activation of URIs programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal are all forms of the <kbd>Enter</kbd> key.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the label which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkLabel::activate-link
signal.description:
Gets emitted to activate a URI.
Applications may connect to it to override the default behaviour, which is to call [method@Gtk.FileLauncher.launch].

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the label which emitted the signal

signal.return: true if the link has been activated

signal.name: GtkLabel::copy-clipboard
signal.description:
Gets emitted to copy the selection to the clipboard.
The `::copy-clipboard` signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>c</kbd>.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the label which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkLabel::move-cursor
signal.description:
Gets emitted when the user initiates a cursor movement.
The `::move-cursor` signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html). If the cursor is not visible in @entry, this signal causes the viewport to be moved instead.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with [func@GObject.signal_emit_by_name] if they need to control the cursor programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal come in two variants, the variant with the <kbd>Shift</kbd> modifier extends the selection, the variant without the <kbd>Shift</kbd> modifier does not. There are too many key combinations to list them all here.
- <kbd>←</kbd>, <kbd>→</kbd>, <kbd>↑</kbd>, <kbd>↓</kbd> move by individual characters/lines - <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd>, etc. move by words/paragraphs - <kbd>Home</kbd> and <kbd>End</kbd> move to the ends of the buffer

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the label which emitted the signal

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: the granularity of the move, as a `GtkMovementStep`

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of @step units to move

parameter.name: extend_selection
parameter.parameter_description: true if the move should extend the selection

property.name: GtkLabel:attributes
property.description: A list of style attributes to apply to the text of the label.

property.name: GtkLabel:ellipsize
property.description:
The preferred place to ellipsize the string, if the label does not have enough room to display the entire string.
Note that setting this property to a value other than [enum.Pango.EllipsizeMode.none] has the side-effect that the label requests only enough space to display the ellipsis "...". In particular, this means that ellipsizing labels do not work well in notebook tabs, unless the [property@Gtk.NotebookPage:tab-expand] child property is set to true.
Other ways to set a label's width are [method@Gtk.Widget.set_size_request] and [method@Gtk.Label.set_width_chars].

property.name: GtkLabel:extra-menu
property.description: A menu model whose contents will be appended to the context menu.

property.name: GtkLabel:justify
property.description:
The alignment of the lines in the text of the label, relative to each other.
This does *not* affect the alignment of the label within its allocation. See [property@Gtk.Label:xalign] for that.

property.name: GtkLabel:label
property.description:
The contents of the label.
If the string contains Pango markup (see [func@Pango.parse_markup]), you will have to set the [property@Gtk.Label:use-markup] property to true in order for the label to display the markup attributes. See also [method@Gtk.Label.set_markup] for a convenience function that sets both this property and the [property@Gtk.Label:use-markup] property at the same time.
If the string contains underlines acting as mnemonics, you will have to set the [property@Gtk.Label:use-underline] property to true in order for the label to display them.

property.name: GtkLabel:lines
property.description:
The number of lines to which an ellipsized, wrapping label should display before it gets ellipsized. This both prevents the label from ellipsizing before this many lines are displayed, and limits the height request of the label to this many lines.
::: warning Setting this property has unintuitive and unfortunate consequences for the minimum _width_ of the label. Specifically, if the height of the label is such that it fits a smaller number of lines than the value of this property, the label can not be ellipsized at all, which means it must be wide enough to fit all the text fully.
This property has no effect if the label is not wrapping or ellipsized.
Set this property to -1 if you don't want to limit the number of lines.

property.name: GtkLabel:max-width-chars
property.description:
The desired maximum width of the label, in characters.
If this property is set to -1, the width will be calculated automatically.
See the section on [text layout](class.Label.html#text-layout) for details of how [property@Gtk.Label:width-chars] and [property@Gtk.Label:max-width-chars] determine the width of ellipsized and wrapped labels.

property.name: GtkLabel:mnemonic-keyval
property.description: The mnemonic accelerator key for the label.

property.name: GtkLabel:mnemonic-widget
property.description: The widget to be activated when the labels mnemonic key is pressed.

property.name: GtkLabel:natural-wrap-mode
property.description:
Select the line wrapping for the natural size request.
This only affects the natural size requested. For the actual wrapping used, see the [property@Gtk.Label:wrap-mode] property.
The default is [enum@Gtk.NaturalWrapMode.inherit], which inherits the behavior of the [property@Gtk.Label:wrap-mode] property.
Since: 4.6

property.name: GtkLabel:selectable
property.description: Whether the label text can be selected with the mouse.

property.name: GtkLabel:single-line-mode
property.description:
Whether the label is in single line mode.
In single line mode, the height of the label does not depend on the actual text, it is always set to ascent + descent of the font. This can be an advantage in situations where resizing the label because of text changes would be distracting, e.g. in a statusbar.

property.name: GtkLabel:tabs
property.description:
Custom tabs for this label.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkLabel:use-markup
property.description:
True if the text of the label includes Pango markup.
See [func@Pango.parse_markup].

property.name: GtkLabel:use-underline
property.description: True if the text of the label indicates a mnemonic with an `_` before the mnemonic character.

property.name: GtkLabel:width-chars
property.description:
The desired width of the label, in characters.
If this property is set to -1, the width will be calculated automatically.
See the section on [text layout](class.Label.html#text-layout) for details of how [property@Gtk.Label:width-chars] and [property@Gtk.Label:max-width-chars] determine the width of ellipsized and wrapped labels.

property.name: GtkLabel:wrap
property.description: True if the label text will wrap if it gets too wide.

property.name: GtkLabel:wrap-mode
property.description:
Controls how the line wrapping is done.
This only affects the formatting if line wrapping is on (see the [property@Gtk.Label:wrap] property). The default is [enum@Pango.WrapMode.word], which means wrap on word boundaries.
For sizing behavior, also consider the [property@Gtk.Label:natural-wrap-mode] property.

property.name: GtkLabel:xalign
property.description:
The horizontal alignment of the label text inside its size allocation.
Compare this to [property@Gtk.Widget:halign], which determines how the labels size allocation is positioned in the space available for the label.

property.name: GtkLabel:yalign
property.description:
The vertical alignment of the label text inside its size allocation.
Compare this to [property@Gtk.Widget:valign], which determines how the labels size allocation is positioned in the space available for the label.

property.name: GtkLayoutChild:child-widget
property.description: The widget that is associated to the `GtkLayoutChild` instance.

property.name: GtkLayoutChild:layout-manager
property.description: The layout manager that created the `GtkLayoutChild` instance.

signal.name: GtkLayoutManagerClass::create_layout_child
signal.description: Create a `GtkLayoutChild` instance for the given @for_child widget.
signal.return: a `GtkLayoutChild`

signal.name: GtkLevelBar::offset-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when an offset specified on the bar changes value.
This typically is the result of a [method@Gtk.LevelBar.add_offset_value] call.
The signal supports detailed connections; you can connect to the detailed signal "changed::x" in order to only receive callbacks when the value of offset "x" changes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the offset that changed value

property.name: GtkLevelBar:inverted
property.description:
Whether the `GtkLeveBar` is inverted.
Level bars normally grow from top to bottom or left to right. Inverted level bars grow in the opposite direction.

property.name: GtkLevelBar:max-value
property.description: Determines the maximum value of the interval that can be displayed by the bar.

property.name: GtkLevelBar:min-value
property.description: Determines the minimum value of the interval that can be displayed by the bar.
