property.name: GtkLevelBar:mode
property.description:
Determines the way `GtkLevelBar` interprets the value properties to draw the level fill area.
Specifically, when the value is %GTK_LEVEL_BAR_MODE_CONTINUOUS, `GtkLevelBar` will draw a single block representing the current value in that area; when the value is %GTK_LEVEL_BAR_MODE_DISCRETE, the widget will draw a succession of separate blocks filling the draw area, with the number of blocks being equal to the units separating the integral roundings of [property@Gtk.LevelBar:min-value] and [property@Gtk.LevelBar:max-value].

property.name: GtkLevelBar:value
property.description: Determines the currently filled value of the level bar.

enum.name: GtkLevelBarMode
enum.description:
Describes how [class@LevelBar] contents should be rendered.
Note that this enumeration could be extended with additional modes in the future.

parameter.name: GTK_LEVEL_BAR_MODE_CONTINUOUS
parameter.parameter_description: the bar has a continuous mode

parameter.name: GTK_LEVEL_BAR_MODE_DISCRETE
parameter.parameter_description: the bar has a discrete mode

enum.name: GtkLicense
enum.description:
The type of license for an application.
This enumeration can be expanded at later date.

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM
parameter.parameter_description: A license text is going to be specified by the developer

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_GPL_2_0
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU General Public License, version 2.0 or later

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_GPL_3_0
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU General Public License, version 3.0 or later

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_LGPL_2_1
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Lesser General Public License, version 2.1 or later

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_LGPL_3_0
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Lesser General Public License, version 3.0 or later

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_GPL_2_0_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU General Public License, version 2.0 only

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_GPL_3_0_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU General Public License, version 3.0 only

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_LGPL_2_1_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Lesser General Public License, version 2.1 only

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_LGPL_3_0_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Lesser General Public License, version 3.0 only

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_AGPL_3_0
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Affero General Public License, version 3.0 or later

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_AGPL_3_0_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Affero General Public License, version 3.0 only

signal.name: GtkLinkButton::activate-link
signal.description:
Emitted each time the `GtkLinkButton` is clicked.
The default handler will call [method@Gtk.FileLauncher.launch] with the URI stored inside the [property@Gtk.LinkButton:uri] property.
To override the default behavior, you can connect to the ::activate-link signal and stop the propagation of the signal by returning %TRUE from your handler.
signal.return: %TRUE if the signal has been handled

property.name: GtkLinkButton:uri
property.description: The URI bound to this button.

property.name: GtkLinkButton:visited
property.description:
The 'visited' state of this button.
A visited link is drawn in a different color.

property.name: GtkListBase:orientation
property.description: The orientation of the list. See GtkOrientable:orientation for details.

signal.name: GtkListBox::activate-cursor-row
signal.description: Emitted when the cursor row is activated.

signal.name: GtkListBox::move-cursor
signal.description:
Emitted when the user initiates a cursor movement.
The default bindings for this signal come in two variants, the variant with the Shift modifier extends the selection, the variant without the Shift modifier does not. There are too many key combinations to list them all here.
- <kbd>←</kbd>, <kbd>→</kbd>, <kbd>↑</kbd>, <kbd>↓</kbd> move by individual children - <kbd>Home</kbd>, <kbd>End</kbd> move to the ends of the box - <kbd>PgUp</kbd>, <kbd>PgDn</kbd> move vertically by pages

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the list box on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: the granularity of the move, as a `GtkMovementStep`

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of @step units to move

signal.name: GtkListBox::row-activated
signal.description: Emitted when a row has been activated by the user.

signal.name: GtkListBox::row-selected
signal.description:
Emitted when a new row is selected, or (with a %NULL @row) when the selection is cleared.
When the @box is using %GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, this signal will not give you the full picture of selection changes, and you should use the [signal@Gtk.ListBox::selected-rows-changed] signal instead.

signal.name: GtkListBox::select-all
signal.description:
Emitted to select all children of the box, if the selection mode permits it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>a</kbd>.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkListBox` on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkListBox::selected-rows-changed
signal.description: Emitted when the set of selected rows changes.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkListBox` on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkListBox::toggle-cursor-row
signal.description:
Emitted when the cursor row is toggled.
The default bindings for this signal is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>␣</kbd>.

signal.name: GtkListBox::unselect-all
signal.description:
Emitted to unselect all children of the box, if the selection mode permits it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>Shift</kbd>-<kbd>a</kbd>.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkListBox` on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GtkListBox:accept-unpaired-release
property.description: Whether to accept unpaired release events.

property.name: GtkListBox:activate-on-single-click
property.description: Determines whether children can be activated with a single click, or require a double-click.

property.name: GtkListBox:selection-mode
property.description: The selection mode used by the list box.

property.name: GtkListBox:show-separators
property.description: Whether to show separators between rows.

property.name: GtkListBox:tab-behavior
property.description:
Behavior of the <kbd>Tab</kbd> key
Since: 4.18

signal.name: GtkListBoxRow::activate
signal.description:
This is a keybinding signal, which will cause this row to be activated.
If you want to be notified when the user activates a row (by key or not), use the [signal@Gtk.ListBox::row-activated] signal on the row’s parent `GtkListBox`.

property.name: GtkListBoxRow:activatable
property.description: Determines whether the ::row-activated signal will be emitted for this row.

property.name: GtkListBoxRow:child
property.description: The child widget.

property.name: GtkListBoxRow:selectable
property.description: Determines whether this row can be selected.

property.name: GtkListHeader:child
property.description:
Widget used for display.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkListHeader:end
property.description:
The first position no longer part of this section.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkListHeader:item
property.description:
The item at the start of the section.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkListHeader:n-items
property.description:
Number of items in this section.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkListHeader:start
property.description:
First position of items in this section.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkListItem:accessible-description
property.description:
The accessible description to set on the listitem.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkListItem:accessible-label
property.description:
The accessible label to set on the listitem.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkListItem:activatable
property.description: If the item can be activated by the user.

property.name: GtkListItem:child
property.description: Widget used for display.

property.name: GtkListItem:focusable
property.description:
If the item can be focused with the keyboard.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkListItem:item
property.description: Displayed item.

property.name: GtkListItem:position
property.description: Position of the item.

property.name: GtkListItem:selectable
property.description: If the item can be selected by the user.

property.name: GtkListItem:selected
property.description: If the item is currently selected.

enum.name: GtkListScrollFlags
enum.description:
List of actions to perform when scrolling to items in a list widget.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: GTK_LIST_SCROLL_SELECT
parameter.parameter_description: Select the target item and unselect all other items.

enum.name: GtkListTabBehavior
enum.description:
Used to configure the focus behavior in the `GTK_DIR_TAB_FORWARD` and `GTK_DIR_TAB_BACKWARD` direction, like the <kbd>Tab</kbd> key in a [class@Gtk.ListView].
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: GTK_LIST_TAB_ALL
parameter.parameter_description: Cycle through all focusable items of the list

parameter.name: GTK_LIST_TAB_ITEM
parameter.parameter_description: Cycle through a single list element, then move focus out of the list. Moving focus between items needs to be done with the arrow keys.

parameter.name: GTK_LIST_TAB_CELL
parameter.parameter_description: Cycle only through a single cell, then move focus out of the list. Moving focus between cells needs to be done with the arrow keys. This is only relevant for cell-based widgets like #GtkColumnView, otherwise it behaves like `GTK_LIST_TAB_ITEM`.

signal.name: GtkListView::activate
signal.description:
Emitted when a row has been activated by the user.
Activation usually happens via the list.activate-item action of the `GtkListView`.
This allows for a convenient way to handle activation in a listview. See [method@Gtk.ListItem.set_activatable] for details on how to use this signal.

property.name: GtkListView:enable-rubberband
property.description: Allow rubberband selection.

property.name: GtkListView:factory
property.description:
Factory for populating list items.
The factory must be for configuring [class@Gtk.ListItem] objects.

property.name: GtkListView:header-factory
property.description:
Factory for creating header widgets.
The factory must be for configuring [class@Gtk.ListHeader] objects.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkListView:model
property.description: Model for the items displayed.

property.name: GtkListView:show-separators
property.description: Show separators between rows.

property.name: GtkListView:single-click-activate
property.description: Activate rows on single click and select them on hover.

property.name: GtkListView:tab-behavior
property.description:
Behavior of the <kbd>Tab</kbd> key
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkLockButton:permission
property.description:
The `GPermission object controlling this button.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkLockButton:text-lock
property.description:
The text to display when prompting the user to lock.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkLockButton:text-unlock
property.description:
The text to display when prompting the user to unlock.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkLockButton:tooltip-lock
property.description:
The tooltip to display when prompting the user to lock.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkLockButton:tooltip-not-authorized
property.description:
The tooltip to display when the user cannot obtain authorization.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkLockButton:tooltip-unlock
property.description:
The tooltip to display when prompting the user to unlock.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkMapListModel:has-map
property.description: If a map is set for this model

property.name: GtkMapListModel:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkMapListModel:model
property.description: The model being mapped.

property.name: GtkMapListModel:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkMediaControls:media-stream
property.description: The media-stream managed by this object or %NULL if none.

property.name: GtkMediaFile:file
property.description: The file being played back or %NULL if not playing a file.

property.name: GtkMediaFile:input-stream
property.description:
The stream being played back or %NULL if not playing a stream.
This is %NULL when playing a file.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:duration
property.description: The stream's duration in microseconds or 0 if unknown.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:ended
property.description: Set when playback has finished.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:error
property.description: %NULL for a properly working stream or the `GError` that the stream is in.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:has-audio
property.description: Whether the stream contains audio.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:has-video
property.description: Whether the stream contains video.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:loop
property.description: Try to restart the media from the beginning once it ended.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:muted
property.description: Whether the audio stream should be muted.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:playing
property.description: Whether the stream is currently playing.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:prepared
property.description: Whether the stream has finished initializing and existence of audio and video is known.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:seekable
property.description: Set unless the stream is known to not support seeking.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:seeking
property.description: Set while a seek is in progress.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:timestamp
property.description: The current presentation timestamp in microseconds.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:volume
property.description: Volume of the audio stream.

signal.name: GtkMenuButton::activate
signal.description:
Emitted to when the menu button is activated.
The `::activate` signal on `GtkMenuButton` is an action signal and emitting it causes the button to pop up its menu.
Since: 4.4

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

property.name: GtkMenuButton:active
property.description:
Whether the menu button is active.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkMenuButton:always-show-arrow
property.description:
Whether to show a dropdown arrow even when using an icon or a custom child.
Since: 4.4

property.name: GtkMenuButton:can-shrink
property.description:
Whether the size of the button can be made smaller than the natural size of its contents.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkMenuButton:child
property.description:
The child widget.
Since: 4.6

property.name: GtkMenuButton:direction
property.description: The `GtkArrowType` representing the direction in which the menu or popover will be popped out.

property.name: GtkMenuButton:has-frame
property.description: Whether the button has a frame.

property.name: GtkMenuButton:icon-name
property.description: The name of the icon used to automatically populate the button.

property.name: GtkMenuButton:label
property.description: The label for the button.

property.name: GtkMenuButton:menu-model
property.description:
The `GMenuModel` from which the popup will be created.
See [method@Gtk.MenuButton.set_menu_model] for the interaction with the [property@Gtk.MenuButton:popover] property.

property.name: GtkMenuButton:popover
property.description: The `GtkPopover` that will be popped up when the button is clicked.

property.name: GtkMenuButton:primary
property.description:
Whether the menu button acts as a primary menu.
Primary menus can be opened using the <kbd>F10</kbd> key
Since: 4.4

property.name: GtkMenuButton:use-underline
property.description: If set an underscore in the text indicates a mnemonic.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:buttons
property.description: Set of buttons to display on the dialog.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:message-area
property.description:
The `GtkBox` that corresponds to the message area of this dialog.
See [method@Gtk.MessageDialog.get_message_area] for a detailed description of this area.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:message-type
property.description: The type of the message.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:secondary-text
property.description: The secondary text of the message dialog.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:secondary-use-markup
property.description:
%TRUE if the secondary text of the dialog includes Pango markup.
See [func@Pango.parse_markup].

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:text
property.description:
The primary text of the message dialog.
If the dialog has a secondary text, this will appear as the title.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:use-markup
property.description:
%TRUE if the primary text of the dialog includes Pango markup.
See [func@Pango.parse_markup].

enum.name: GtkMessageType
enum.description: The type of message being displayed in a [class@MessageDialog].

property.name: GtkMnemonicTrigger:keyval
property.description: The key value for the trigger.

property.name: GtkModelButton:active
property.description: The state of the button. This is reflecting the state of the associated GAction.

property.name: GtkModelButton:icon
property.description: A GIcon that will be used if iconic appearance for the button is desired.

property.name: GtkModelButton:iconic
property.description: If this property is set, the button will show an icon if one is set. If no icon is set, the text will be used. This is typically used for horizontal sections of linked buttons.

property.name: GtkModelButton:indicator-size-group
property.description: Containers like GtkPopoverMenu can provide a size group in this property to align the checks and radios of all the model buttons in a menu.

property.name: GtkModelButton:menu-name
property.description: The name of a submenu to open when the button is activated. * If this is set, the button should not have an action associated with it.

property.name: GtkModelButton:role
property.description: Specifies whether the button is a plain, check or radio button. When GtkActionable:action-name is set, the role will be determined from the action and does not have to be set explicitly.

property.name: GtkModelButton:text
property.description: The label for the button.

property.name: GtkModelButton:use-markup
property.description: If %TRUE, XML tags in the text of the button are interpreted as by pango_parse_markup() to format the enclosed spans of text. If %FALSE, the text will be displayed verbatim.

property.name: GtkMountOperation:display
property.description: The display where dialogs will be shown.

property.name: GtkMountOperation:is-showing
property.description: Whether a dialog is currently shown.

property.name: GtkMountOperation:parent
property.description: The parent window.

enum.name: GtkMovementStep
enum.description: Passed as argument to various keybinding signals for moving the cursor position.

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_LOGICAL_POSITIONS
parameter.parameter_description: Move forward or back by graphemes

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_VISUAL_POSITIONS
parameter.parameter_description: Move left or right by graphemes

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_WORDS
parameter.parameter_description: Move forward or back by words

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_DISPLAY_LINES
parameter.parameter_description: Move up or down lines (wrapped lines)

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_DISPLAY_LINE_ENDS
parameter.parameter_description: Move to either end of a line

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_PARAGRAPHS
parameter.parameter_description: Move up or down paragraphs (newline-ended lines)

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_PARAGRAPH_ENDS
parameter.parameter_description: Move to either end of a paragraph

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_BUFFER_ENDS
parameter.parameter_description: Move to ends of the buffer

property.name: GtkMultiFilter:item-type
property.description:
The type of items.
See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkMultiFilter:n-items
property.description:
The number of items.
See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkMultiSelection:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkMultiSelection:model
property.description: The list managed by this selection.

property.name: GtkMultiSelection:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkMultiSorter:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkMultiSorter:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkNamedAction:action-name
property.description: The name of the action to activate.

signal.name: GtkNativeDialog::response
signal.description:
Emitted when the user responds to the dialog.
When this is called the dialog has been hidden.
If you call [method@Gtk.NativeDialog.hide] before the user responds to the dialog this signal will not be emitted.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GtkNativeDialog:modal
property.description: Whether the window should be modal with respect to its transient parent.

property.name: GtkNativeDialog:title
property.description: The title of the dialog window

property.name: GtkNativeDialog:transient-for
property.description: The transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL for none.

property.name: GtkNativeDialog:visible
property.description: Whether the window is currently visible.

enum.name: GtkNaturalWrapMode
enum.description:
Options for selecting a different wrap mode for natural size requests.
See for example the [property@Gtk.Label:natural-wrap-mode] property.
Since: 4.6

parameter.name: GTK_NATURAL_WRAP_INHERIT
parameter.parameter_description: Inherit the minimum size request. In particular, this should be used with %PANGO_WRAP_CHAR.

parameter.name: GTK_NATURAL_WRAP_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: Try not to wrap the text. This mode is the closest to GTK3's behavior but can lead to a wide label leaving lots of empty space below the text.

parameter.name: GTK_NATURAL_WRAP_WORD
parameter.parameter_description: Attempt to wrap at word boundaries. This is useful in particular when using %PANGO_WRAP_WORD_CHAR as the wrap mode.

property.name: GtkNoSelection:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkNoSelection:model
property.description: The model being managed.

property.name: GtkNoSelection:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

signal.name: GtkNotebook::change-current-page
signal.description:
Emitted when the current page should be changed.
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>PgUp</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>PgDn</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>PgUp</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>PgDn</kbd>.
signal.return: whether the page was changed

signal.name: GtkNotebook::create-window
signal.description:
The ::create-window signal is emitted when a detachable tab is dropped on the root window.
A handler for this signal can create a window containing a notebook where the tab will be attached. It is also responsible for moving/resizing the window and adding the necessary properties to the notebook (e.g. the `GtkNotebook`:group-name ).

parameter.name: page
parameter.parameter_description: the tab of @notebook that is being detached

signal.return: a `GtkNotebook` that @page should be added to

signal.name: GtkNotebook::focus-tab
signal.description: Emitted when a tab should be focused.
signal.return: whether the tab has been focused

signal.name: GtkNotebook::move-focus-out
signal.description:
Emitted when focus was moved out.
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Tab</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Tab</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>→</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>↑</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>↓</kbd>.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: the direction to move the focus

signal.name: GtkNotebook::page-added
signal.description: the ::page-added signal is emitted in the notebook right after a page is added to the notebook.

signal.name: GtkNotebook::page-removed
signal.description: the ::page-removed signal is emitted in the notebook right after a page is removed from the notebook.

signal.name: GtkNotebook::page-reordered
signal.description: the ::page-reordered signal is emitted in the notebook right after a page has been reordered.

signal.name: GtkNotebook::reorder-tab
signal.description:
Emitted when the tab should be reordered.
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>Home</kbd>, <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>End</kbd>, <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>PgUp</kbd>, <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>PgDn</kbd>, <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd>, <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>→</kbd>, <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>↑</kbd> and <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>↓</kbd>.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: the direction to move the tab

parameter.name: move_to_last
parameter.parameter_description: whether to move to the last position

signal.return: whether the tab was moved.

signal.name: GtkNotebook::select-page
signal.description:
Emitted when a page should be selected.
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>␣</kbd>.
signal.return: whether the page was selected

signal.name: GtkNotebook::switch-page
signal.description: Emitted when the user or a function changes the current page.

parameter.name: notebook
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

property.name: GtkNotebook:enable-popup
property.description: If %TRUE, pressing the right mouse button on the notebook shows a page switching menu.

property.name: GtkNotebook:group-name
property.description: Group name for tab drag and drop.

property.name: GtkNotebook:page
property.description: The index of the current page.

property.name: GtkNotebook:pages
property.description: A selection model with the pages.

property.name: GtkNotebook:scrollable
property.description: If %TRUE, scroll arrows are added if there are too many pages to fit.

property.name: GtkNotebook:show-border
property.description: Whether the border should be shown.

property.name: GtkNotebook:show-tabs
property.description: Whether tabs should be shown.

property.name: GtkNotebook:tab-pos
property.description: Which side of the notebook holds the tabs.

property.name: GtkNotebookPage:child
property.description: The child for this page.

property.name: GtkNotebookPage:detachable
property.description: Whether the tab is detachable.

property.name: GtkNotebookPage:menu
property.description: The label widget displayed in the child's menu entry.

property.name: GtkNotebookPage:menu-label
property.description: The text of the menu widget.

property.name: GtkNotebookPage:position
property.description: The index of the child in the parent.

property.name: GtkNotebookPage:reorderable
property.description: Whether the tab is reorderable by user action.

property.name: GtkNotebookPage:tab
property.description: The tab widget for this page.

property.name: GtkNotebookPage:tab-expand
property.description: Whether to expand the child's tab.

property.name: GtkNotebookPage:tab-fill
property.description: Whether the child's tab should fill the allocated area.

property.name: GtkNotebookPage:tab-label
property.description: The text of the tab widget.

enum.name: GtkNotebookTab
enum.description: The parameter used in the action signals of `GtkNotebook`.

parameter.name: GTK_NOTEBOOK_TAB_FIRST
parameter.parameter_description: the first tab in the notebook

parameter.name: GTK_NOTEBOOK_TAB_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: the last tab in the notebook

enum.name: GtkNumberUpLayout
enum.description: Used to determine the layout of pages on a sheet when printing multiple pages per sheet.

property.name: GtkNumericSorter:expression
property.description: The expression to evaluate on items to get a number to compare with.

property.name: GtkNumericSorter:sort-order
property.description: Whether the sorter will sort smaller numbers first.

enum.name: GtkOrdering
enum.description:
Describes the way two values can be compared.
These values can be used with a [callback@GLib.CompareFunc]. However, a `GCompareFunc` is allowed to return any integer values. For converting such a value to a `GtkOrdering` value, use [func@Gtk.Ordering.from_cmpfunc].

parameter.name: GTK_ORDERING_SMALLER
parameter.parameter_description: the first value is smaller than the second

parameter.name: GTK_ORDERING_LARGER
parameter.parameter_description: the first value is larger than the second

property.name: GtkOrientable:orientation
property.description: The orientation of the orientable.

enum.name: GtkOrientation
enum.description:
Represents the orientation of widgets and other objects.
Typical examples are [class@Box] or [class@GesturePan].

parameter.name: GTK_ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL
parameter.parameter_description: The element is in horizontal orientation.

parameter.name: GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL
parameter.parameter_description: The element is in vertical orientation.

enum.name: GtkOverflow
enum.description:
Defines how content overflowing a given area should be handled.
This is used in [method@Gtk.Widget.set_overflow]. The [property@Gtk.Widget:overflow] property is modeled after the CSS overflow property, but implements it only partially.

parameter.name: GTK_OVERFLOW_VISIBLE
parameter.parameter_description: No change is applied. Content is drawn at the specified position.

parameter.name: GTK_OVERFLOW_HIDDEN
parameter.parameter_description: Content is clipped to the bounds of the area. Content outside the area is not drawn and cannot be interacted with.

signal.name: GtkOverlay::get-child-position
signal.description:
Emitted to determine the position and size of any overlay child widgets.
A handler for this signal should fill @allocation with the desired position and size for @widget, relative to the 'main' child of @overlay.
The default handler for this signal uses the @widget's halign and valign properties to determine the position and gives the widget its natural size (except that an alignment of %GTK_ALIGN_FILL will cause the overlay to be full-width/height). If the main child is a `GtkScrolledWindow`, the overlays are placed relative to its contents.
signal.return: %TRUE if the @allocation has been filled

property.name: GtkOverlay:child
property.description: The main child widget.

property.name: GtkOverlayLayoutChild:clip-overlay
property.description: Whether the child should be clipped to fit the parent's size.

property.name: GtkOverlayLayoutChild:measure
property.description: Whether the child size should contribute to the `GtkOverlayLayout`'s measurement.

enum.name: GtkPackType
enum.description:
Represents the packing location of a children in its parent.
See [class@WindowControls] for example.

parameter.name: GTK_PACK_START
parameter.parameter_description: The child is packed into the start of the widget

parameter.name: GTK_PACK_END
parameter.parameter_description: The child is packed into the end of the widget

enum.name: GtkPadActionType
enum.description: The type of a pad action.

parameter.name: GTK_PAD_ACTION_BUTTON
parameter.parameter_description: Action is triggered by a pad button

parameter.name: GTK_PAD_ACTION_RING
parameter.parameter_description: Action is triggered by a pad ring

parameter.name: GTK_PAD_ACTION_STRIP
parameter.parameter_description: Action is triggered by a pad strip

parameter.name: GTK_PAD_ACTION_DIAL
parameter.parameter_description: Action is triggered by a pad dial

property.name: GtkPadController:action-group
property.description: The action group of the controller.

property.name: GtkPadController:pad
property.description: The pad of the controller.

enum.name: GtkPageOrientation
enum.description: See also gtk_print_settings_set_orientation().

enum.name: GtkPageSet
enum.description: See also gtk_print_job_set_page_set().

enum.name: GtkPanDirection
enum.description: Describes the panning direction of a [class@GesturePan].

signal.name: GtkPaned::accept-position
signal.description:
Emitted to accept the current position of the handle when moving it using key bindings.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Return</kbd> or <kbd>Space</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.return: whether the position was accepted

signal.name: GtkPaned::cancel-position
signal.description:
Emitted to cancel moving the position of the handle using key bindings.
The position of the handle will be reset to the value prior to moving it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Escape</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.return: whether the position was canceled

signal.name: GtkPaned::cycle-child-focus
signal.description:
Emitted to cycle the focus between the children of the paned.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding is <kbd>F6</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.return: whether the behavior was cycled

signal.name: GtkPaned::cycle-handle-focus
signal.description:
Emitted to cycle whether the paned should grab focus to allow the user to change position of the handle by using key bindings.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>F8</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.return: whether the behavior was cycled

signal.name: GtkPaned::move-handle
signal.description:
Emitted to move the handle with key bindings.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd>, <kbd>←</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>→</kbd>, <kbd>→</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>↑</kbd>, <kbd>↑</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>↓</kbd>, <kbd>↓</kbd>, <kbd>PgUp</kbd>, <kbd>PgDn</kbd>, <kbd>Home</kbd>, <kbd>End</kbd>.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.return: whether the handle was moved

signal.name: GtkPaned::toggle-handle-focus
signal.description:
Emitted to accept the current position of the handle and then move focus to the next widget in the focus chain.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding is <kbd>Tab</kbd>.
Return: whether handle focus was toggled

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

property.name: GtkPaned:end-child
property.description: The second child.

property.name: GtkPaned:max-position
property.description:
The largest possible value for the [property@Gtk.Paned:position] property.
This property is derived from the size and shrinkability of the widget's children.

property.name: GtkPaned:min-position
property.description:
The smallest possible value for the [property@Gtk.Paned:position] property.
This property is derived from the size and shrinkability of the widget's children.

property.name: GtkPaned:position
property.description: Position of the separator in pixels, from the left/top.

property.name: GtkPaned:position-set
property.description: Whether the [property@Gtk.Paned:position] property has been set.

property.name: GtkPaned:resize-end-child
property.description: Determines whether the second child expands and shrinks along with the paned widget.

property.name: GtkPaned:resize-start-child
property.description: Determines whether the first child expands and shrinks along with the paned widget.

property.name: GtkPaned:shrink-end-child
property.description: Determines whether the second child can be made smaller than its requisition.

property.name: GtkPaned:shrink-start-child
property.description: Determines whether the first child can be made smaller than its requisition.

property.name: GtkPaned:start-child
property.description: The first child.

property.name: GtkPaned:wide-handle
property.description:
Whether the `GtkPaned` should provide a stronger visual separation.
For example, this could be set when a paned contains two [class@Gtk.Notebook]s, whose tab rows would otherwise merge visually.

signal.name: GtkPasswordEntry::activate
signal.description:
Emitted when the entry is activated.
The keybindings for this signal are all forms of the Enter key.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The widget on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GtkPasswordEntry:activates-default
property.description: Whether to activate the default widget when Enter is pressed.

property.name: GtkPasswordEntry:extra-menu
property.description: A menu model whose contents will be appended to the context menu.

property.name: GtkPasswordEntry:placeholder-text
property.description: The text that will be displayed in the `GtkPasswordEntry` when it is empty and unfocused.

property.name: GtkPasswordEntry:show-peek-icon
property.description: Whether to show an icon for revealing the content.

enum.name: GtkPickFlags
enum.description: Flags that influence the behavior of [method@Widget.pick].

parameter.name: GTK_PICK_DEFAULT
parameter.parameter_description: The default behavior, include widgets that are receiving events

parameter.name: GTK_PICK_NON_TARGETABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Include widgets that are marked as non-targetable. See [property@Widget:can-target]

property.name: GtkPicture:alternative-text
property.description: The alternative textual description for the picture.

property.name: GtkPicture:can-shrink
property.description: If the `GtkPicture` can be made smaller than the natural size of its contents.

property.name: GtkPicture:content-fit
property.description:
How the content should be resized to fit inside the `GtkPicture`.
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkPicture:file
property.description: The `GFile` that is displayed or %NULL if none.

property.name: GtkPicture:keep-aspect-ratio
property.description:
Whether the GtkPicture will render its contents trying to preserve the aspect ratio.
Deprecated: 4.8: Use [property@Gtk.Picture:content-fit] instead.

property.name: GtkPicture:paintable
property.description: The `GdkPaintable` to be displayed by this `GtkPicture`.

enum.name: GtkPolicyType
enum.description: Determines how the size should be computed to achieve the one of the visibility mode for the scrollbars.

parameter.name: GTK_POLICY_ALWAYS
parameter.parameter_description: The scrollbar is always visible. The view size is independent of the content.

parameter.name: GTK_POLICY_AUTOMATIC
parameter.parameter_description: The scrollbar will appear and disappear as necessary. For example, when all of a `GtkTreeView` can not be seen.

parameter.name: GTK_POLICY_NEVER
parameter.parameter_description: The scrollbar should never appear. In this mode the content determines the size.

parameter.name: GTK_POLICY_EXTERNAL
parameter.parameter_description: Don't show a scrollbar, but don't force the size to follow the content. This can be used e.g. to make multiple scrolled windows share a scrollbar.

signal.name: GtkPopover::activate-default
signal.description:
Emitted whend the user activates the default widget.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Enter</kbd>.

signal.name: GtkPopover::closed
signal.description: Emitted when the popover is closed.

property.name: GtkPopover:autohide
property.description: Whether to dismiss the popover on outside clicks.

property.name: GtkPopover:cascade-popdown
property.description:
Whether the popover pops down after a child popover.
This is used to implement the expected behavior of submenus.

property.name: GtkPopover:child
property.description: The child widget.

property.name: GtkPopover:default-widget
property.description: The default widget inside the popover.

property.name: GtkPopover:has-arrow
property.description: Whether to draw an arrow.

property.name: GtkPopover:mnemonics-visible
property.description: Whether mnemonics are currently visible in this popover.

property.name: GtkPopover:pointing-to
property.description: Rectangle in the parent widget that the popover points to.

property.name: GtkPopover:position
property.description: How to place the popover, relative to its parent.

property.name: GtkPopoverMenu:flags
property.description:
The flags that @popover uses to create/display a menu from its model.
If a model is set and the flags change, contents are rebuilt, so if setting properties individually, set flags before model to avoid a redundant rebuild.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkPopoverMenu:menu-model
property.description: The model from which the menu is made.

property.name: GtkPopoverMenu:visible-submenu
property.description: The name of the visible submenu.

property.name: GtkPopoverMenuBar:menu-model
property.description:
The `GMenuModel` from which the menu bar is created.
The model should only contain submenus as toplevel elements.

enum.name: GtkPopoverMenuFlags
enum.description: Flags that affect how [class@Gtk.PopoverMenu] widgets built from a [class@Gio.MenuModel] are created and displayed.

parameter.name: GTK_POPOVER_MENU_NESTED
parameter.parameter_description: Submenus are presented as traditional, nested popovers.

parameter.name: GTK_POPOVER_MENU_SLIDING
parameter.parameter_description:
Submenus are presented as sliding submenus that replace the main menu.
Since: 4.14

enum.name: GtkPositionType
enum.description:
Describes which edge of a widget a certain feature is positioned at.
For examples, see the tabs of a [class@Notebook], or the label of a [class@Scale].

parameter.name: GTK_POS_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: The feature is at the left edge.

parameter.name: GTK_POS_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: The feature is at the right edge.

parameter.name: GTK_POS_TOP
parameter.parameter_description: The feature is at the top edge.

parameter.name: GTK_POS_BOTTOM
parameter.parameter_description: The feature is at the bottom edge.

enum.name: GtkPrintCapabilities
enum.description:
Specifies which features the print dialog should offer.
If neither %GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_GENERATE_PDF nor %GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_GENERATE_PS is specified, GTK assumes that all formats are supported.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_PAGE_SET
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will offer printing even/odd pages.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_COPIES
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will allow to print multiple copies.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_COLLATE
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will allow to collate multiple copies.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_REVERSE
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will allow to print pages in reverse order.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_SCALE
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will allow to scale the output.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_GENERATE_PDF
parameter.parameter_description: The program will send the document to the printer in PDF format

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_GENERATE_PS
parameter.parameter_description: The program will send the document to the printer in Postscript format

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_PREVIEW
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will offer a preview

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_NUMBER_UP
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will offer printing multiple pages per sheet

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_NUMBER_UP_LAYOUT
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will allow to rearrange pages when printing multiple pages per sheet

property.name: GtkPrintDialog:accept-label
property.description:
A label that may be shown on the accept button of a print dialog that is presented by [method@Gtk.PrintDialog.setup].
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkPrintDialog:modal
property.description:
Whether the print dialog is modal.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkPrintDialog:page-setup
property.description:
The page setup to use.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkPrintDialog:print-settings
property.description:
The print settings to use.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkPrintDialog:title
property.description:
A title that may be shown on the print dialog that is presented by [method@Gtk.PrintDialog.setup].
Since: 4.14

enum.name: GtkPrintDuplex
enum.description: See also gtk_print_settings_set_duplex().

enum.name: GtkPrintError
enum.description: Error codes that identify various errors that can occur while using the GTK printing support.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_ERROR_INVALID_FILE
parameter.parameter_description: An error occurred while loading a page setup or paper size from a key file.

signal.name: GtkPrintJob::status-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the status of a job changes.
The signal handler can use [method@Gtk.PrintJob.get_status] to obtain the new status.

parameter.name: job
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintJob` object on which the signal was emitted

property.name: GtkPrintJob:page-setup
property.description: Page setup.

property.name: GtkPrintJob:printer
property.description: The printer to send the job to.

property.name: GtkPrintJob:settings
property.description: Printer settings.

property.name: GtkPrintJob:title
property.description: The title of the print job.

property.name: GtkPrintJob:track-print-status
property.description: %TRUE if the print job will continue to emit status-changed signals after the print data has been setn to the printer.

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::begin-print
signal.description:
Emitted after the user has finished changing print settings in the dialog, before the actual rendering starts.
A typical use for ::begin-print is to use the parameters from the [class@Gtk.PrintContext] and paginate the document accordingly, and then set the number of pages with [method@Gtk.PrintOperation.set_n_pages].

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::create-custom-widget
signal.description:
Emitted when displaying the print dialog.
If you return a widget in a handler for this signal it will be added to a custom tab in the print dialog. You typically return a container widget with multiple widgets in it.
The print dialog owns the returned widget, and its lifetime is not controlled by the application. However, the widget is guaranteed to stay around until the [signal@Gtk.PrintOperation::custom-widget-apply] signal is emitted on the operation. Then you can read out any information you need from the widgets.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

signal.return: A custom widget that gets embedded in the print dialog

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::custom-widget-apply
signal.description:
Emitted right before ::begin-print if you added a custom widget in the ::create-custom-widget handler.
When you get this signal you should read the information from the custom widgets, as the widgets are not guaranteed to be around at a later time.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::done

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: result
parameter.parameter_description: the result of the print operation

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::draw-page

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: page_nr
parameter.parameter_description: the number of the currently printed page (0-based)

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::end-print
signal.description:
Emitted after all pages have been rendered.
A handler for this signal can clean up any resources that have been allocated in the [signal@Gtk.PrintOperation::begin-print] handler.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::paginate
signal.description:
Emitted after the ::begin-print signal, but before the actual rendering starts.
It keeps getting emitted until a connected signal handler returns %TRUE.
The ::paginate signal is intended to be used for paginating a document in small chunks, to avoid blocking the user interface for a long time. The signal handler should update the number of pages using [method@Gtk.PrintOperation.set_n_pages], and return %TRUE if the document has been completely paginated.
If you don't need to do pagination in chunks, you can simply do it all in the ::begin-print handler, and set the number of pages from there.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

signal.return: %TRUE if pagination is complete

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::preview
signal.description:
Gets emitted when a preview is requested from the native dialog.
The default handler for this signal uses an external viewer application to preview.
To implement a custom print preview, an application must return %TRUE from its handler for this signal. In order to use the provided @context for the preview implementation, it must be given a suitable cairo context with [method@Gtk.PrintContext.set_cairo_context].
The custom preview implementation can use [method@Gtk.PrintOperationPreview.is_selected] and [method@Gtk.PrintOperationPreview.render_page] to find pages which are selected for print and render them. The preview must be finished by calling [method@Gtk.PrintOperationPreview.end_preview] (typically in response to the user clicking a close button).

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkWindow` to use as window parent

signal.return: %TRUE if the listener wants to take over control of the preview

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::request-page-setup
signal.description:
Emitted once for every page that is printed.
This gives the application a chance to modify the page setup. Any changes done to @setup will be in force only for printing this page.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: page_nr
parameter.parameter_description: the number of the currently printed page (0-based)

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::status-changed
signal.description:
Emitted at between the various phases of the print operation.
See [enum@Gtk.PrintStatus] for the phases that are being discriminated. Use [method@Gtk.PrintOperation.get_status] to find out the current status.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::update-custom-widget
signal.description:
Emitted after change of selected printer.
The actual page setup and print settings are passed to the custom widget, which can actualize itself according to this change.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrintOperation` on which the signal was emitted

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:allow-async
property.description:
Determines whether the print operation may run asynchronously or not.
Some systems don't support asynchronous printing, but those that do will return %GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS as the status, and emit the [signal@Gtk.PrintOperation::done] signal when the operation is actually done.
The Windows port does not support asynchronous operation at all (this is unlikely to change). On other platforms, all actions except for %GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_ACTION_EXPORT support asynchronous operation.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:current-page
property.description:
The current page in the document.
If this is set before [method@Gtk.PrintOperation.run], the user will be able to select to print only the current page.
Note that this only makes sense for pre-paginated documents.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:custom-tab-label
property.description:
Used as the label of the tab containing custom widgets.
Note that this property may be ignored on some platforms.
If this is %NULL, GTK uses a default label.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:default-page-setup
property.description:
The `GtkPageSetup` used by default.
This page setup will be used by [method@Gtk.PrintOperation.run], but it can be overridden on a per-page basis by connecting to the [signal@Gtk.PrintOperation::request-page-setup] signal.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:embed-page-setup
property.description: If %TRUE, page size combo box and orientation combo box are embedded into page setup page.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:export-filename
property.description:
The name of a file to generate instead of showing the print dialog.
Currently, PDF is the only supported format.
The intended use of this property is for implementing “Export to PDF” actions.
“Print to PDF” support is independent of this and is done by letting the user pick the “Print to PDF” item from the list of printers in the print dialog.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:has-selection
property.description:
Determines whether there is a selection in your application.
This can allow your application to print the selection. This is typically used to make a "Selection" button sensitive.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:job-name
property.description:
A string used to identify the job (e.g. in monitoring applications like eggcups).
If you don't set a job name, GTK picks a default one by numbering successive print jobs.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:n-pages
property.description:
The number of pages in the document.
This must be set to a positive number before the rendering starts. It may be set in a [signal@Gtk.PrintOperation::begin-print] signal handler.
Note that the page numbers passed to the [signal@Gtk.PrintOperation::request-page-setup] and [signal@Gtk.PrintOperation::draw-page] signals are 0-based, i.e. if the user chooses to print all pages, the last ::draw-page signal will be for page @n_pages - 1.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:n-pages-to-print
property.description:
The number of pages that will be printed.
Note that this value is set during print preparation phase (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PREPARING), so this value should never be get before the data generation phase (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_GENERATING_DATA). You can connect to the [signal@Gtk.PrintOperation::status-changed] signal and call [method@Gtk.PrintOperation.get_n_pages_to_print] when print status is %GTK_PRINT_STATUS_GENERATING_DATA.
This is typically used to track the progress of print operation.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:print-settings
property.description:
The `GtkPrintSettings` used for initializing the dialog.
Setting this property is typically used to re-establish print settings from a previous print operation, see [method@Gtk.PrintOperation.run].

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:show-progress
property.description: Determines whether to show a progress dialog during the print operation.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:status
property.description: The status of the print operation.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:status-string
property.description:
A string representation of the status of the print operation.
The string is translated and suitable for displaying the print status e.g. in a `GtkStatusbar`.
See the [property@Gtk.PrintOperation:status] property for a status value that is suitable for programmatic use.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:support-selection
property.description:
If %TRUE, the print operation will support print of selection.
This allows the print dialog to show a "Selection" button.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:track-print-status
property.description:
If %TRUE, the print operation will try to continue report on the status of the print job in the printer queues and printer.
This can allow your application to show things like “out of paper” issues, and when the print job actually reaches the printer. However, this is often implemented using polling, and should not be enabled unless needed.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:unit
property.description: The transformation for the cairo context obtained from `GtkPrintContext` is set up in such a way that distances are measured in units of @unit.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:use-full-page
property.description:
If %TRUE, the transformation for the cairo context obtained from `GtkPrintContext` puts the origin at the top left corner of the page.
This may not be the top left corner of the sheet, depending on page orientation and the number of pages per sheet. Otherwise, the origin is at the top left corner of the imageable area (i.e. inside the margins).

enum.name: GtkPrintOperationAction
enum.description:
Determines what action the print operation should perform.
A parameter of this typs is passed to [method@Gtk.PrintOperation.run].

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_ACTION_PRINT
parameter.parameter_description: Start to print without showing the print dialog, based on the current print settings, if possible. Depending on the platform, a print dialog might appear anyway.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_ACTION_EXPORT
parameter.parameter_description: Export to a file. This requires the export-filename property to be set.

signal.name: GtkPrintOperationPreview::got-page-size
signal.description:
Emitted once for each page that gets rendered to the preview.
A handler for this signal should update the @context according to @page_setup and set up a suitable cairo context, using [method@Gtk.PrintContext.set_cairo_context].

parameter.name: preview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkPrintOperationPreview::ready
signal.description:
The ::ready signal gets emitted once per preview operation, before the first page is rendered.
A handler for this signal can be used for setup tasks.

parameter.name: preview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

enum.name: GtkPrintOperationResult
enum.description:
The result of a print operation.
A value of this type is returned by [method@Gtk.PrintOperation.run].

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_APPLY
parameter.parameter_description: The print settings should be stored.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_CANCEL
parameter.parameter_description: The print operation has been canceled, the print settings should not be stored.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS
parameter.parameter_description: The print operation is not complete yet. This value will only be returned when running asynchronously.

enum.name: GtkPrintPages
enum.description: See also gtk_print_job_set_pages()

enum.name: GtkPrintQuality
enum.description: See also gtk_print_settings_set_quality().

enum.name: GtkPrintStatus
enum.description: The status gives a rough indication of the completion of a running print operation.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_INITIAL
parameter.parameter_description: The printing has not started yet; this status is set initially, and while the print dialog is shown.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PREPARING
parameter.parameter_description: This status is set while the begin-print signal is emitted and during pagination.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_GENERATING_DATA
parameter.parameter_description: This status is set while the pages are being rendered.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_SENDING_DATA
parameter.parameter_description: The print job is being sent off to the printer.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PENDING
parameter.parameter_description: The print job has been sent to the printer, but is not printed for some reason, e.g. the printer may be stopped.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PENDING_ISSUE
parameter.parameter_description: Some problem has occurred during printing, e.g. a paper jam.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PRINTING
parameter.parameter_description: The printer is processing the print job.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_FINISHED
parameter.parameter_description: The printing has been completed successfully.

property.name: GtkPrintUnixDialog:current-page
property.description: The current page in the document.

property.name: GtkPrintUnixDialog:embed-page-setup
property.description: %TRUE if the page setup controls are embedded.

property.name: GtkPrintUnixDialog:has-selection
property.description: Whether the application has a selection.

property.name: GtkPrintUnixDialog:manual-capabilities
property.description: Capabilities the application can handle.

property.name: GtkPrintUnixDialog:page-setup
property.description: The `GtkPageSetup` object to use.

property.name: GtkPrintUnixDialog:print-settings
property.description: The `GtkPrintSettings` object used for this dialog.

property.name: GtkPrintUnixDialog:selected-printer
property.description: The `GtkPrinter` which is selected.

property.name: GtkPrintUnixDialog:support-selection
property.description: Whether the dialog supports selection.

signal.name: GtkPrinter::details-acquired
signal.description:
Emitted in response to a request for detailed information about a printer from the print backend.
The @success parameter indicates if the information was actually obtained.

parameter.name: printer
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkPrinter` on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: success
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the details were successfully acquired

property.name: GtkPrinter:accepting-jobs
property.description: %TRUE if the printer is accepting jobs.

property.name: GtkPrinter:accepts-pdf
property.description: %TRUE if this printer can accept PDF.

property.name: GtkPrinter:accepts-ps
property.description: %TRUE if this printer can accept PostScript.

property.name: GtkPrinter:backend
property.description: The backend for the printer.

property.name: GtkPrinter:icon-name
property.description: Icon name to use for the printer.

property.name: GtkPrinter:is-virtual
property.description: %FALSE if this represents a real hardware device.

property.name: GtkPrinter:job-count
property.description: Number of jobs queued in the printer.

property.name: GtkPrinter:location
property.description: Information about the location of the printer.

property.name: GtkPrinter:name
property.description: The name of the printer.

property.name: GtkPrinter:paused
property.description:
%TRUE if this printer is paused.
A paused printer still accepts jobs, but it does not print them.

property.name: GtkPrinter:state-message
property.description: String giving the current status of the printer.

property.name: GtkProgressBar:ellipsize
property.description:
The preferred place to ellipsize the string.
The text will be ellipsized if the progress bar does not have enough room to display the entire string, specified as a `PangoEllipsizeMode`.
Note that setting this property to a value other than %PANGO_ELLIPSIZE_NONE has the side-effect that the progress bar requests only enough space to display the ellipsis ("..."). Another means to set a progress bar's width is [method@Gtk.Widget.set_size_request].

property.name: GtkProgressBar:fraction
property.description: The fraction of total work that has been completed.

property.name: GtkProgressBar:inverted
property.description: Invert the direction in which the progress bar grows.

property.name: GtkProgressBar:pulse-step
property.description: The fraction of total progress to move the bounding block when pulsed.

property.name: GtkProgressBar:show-text
property.description:
Sets whether the progress bar will show a text in addition to the bar itself.
The shown text is either the value of the [property@Gtk.ProgressBar:text] property or, if that is %NULL, the [property@Gtk.ProgressBar:fraction] value, as a percentage.
To make a progress bar that is styled and sized suitably for showing text (even if the actual text is blank), set [property@Gtk.ProgressBar:show-text] to %TRUE and [property@Gtk.ProgressBar:text] to the empty string (not %NULL).

property.name: GtkProgressBar:text
property.description: Text to be displayed in the progress bar.

enum.name: GtkPropagationLimit
enum.description: Describes limits of a [class@EventController] for handling events targeting other widgets.

parameter.name: GTK_LIMIT_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: Events are handled regardless of what their target is.

parameter.name: GTK_LIMIT_SAME_NATIVE
parameter.parameter_description: Events are only handled if their target is in the same [iface@Native] (or widget with [property@Gtk.Widget:limit-events] set) as the event controllers widget. Note that some event types have two targets (origin and destination).

enum.name: GtkPropagationPhase
enum.description: Describes the stage at which events are fed into a [class@EventController].

parameter.name: GTK_PHASE_CAPTURE
parameter.parameter_description: Events are delivered in the capture phase. The capture phase happens before the bubble phase, runs from the toplevel down to the event widget. This option should only be used on containers that might possibly handle events before their children do.

parameter.name: GTK_PHASE_BUBBLE
parameter.parameter_description: Events are delivered in the bubble phase. The bubble phase happens after the capture phase, and before the default handlers are run. This phase runs from the event widget, up to the toplevel.

parameter.name: GTK_PHASE_TARGET
parameter.parameter_description: Events are delivered in the default widget event handlers, note that widget implementations must chain up on button, motion, touch and grab broken handlers for controllers in this phase to be run.

property.name: GtkPropertyLookupListModel:item-type
property.description: The `GType` for elements of this object. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].

property.name: GtkPropertyLookupListModel:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkPropertyLookupListModel:object
property.description: The root object

property.name: GtkPropertyLookupListModel:property
property.description: Name of the property used for lookups

signal.name: GtkRange::adjust-bounds
signal.description: Emitted before clamping a value, to give the application a chance to adjust the bounds.

signal.name: GtkRange::change-value
signal.description:
Emitted when a scroll action is performed on a range.
It allows an application to determine the type of scroll event that occurred and the resultant new value. The application can handle the event itself and return %TRUE to prevent further processing. Or, by returning %FALSE, it can pass the event to other handlers until the default GTK handler is reached.
The value parameter is unrounded. An application that overrides the ::change-value signal is responsible for clamping the value to the desired number of decimal digits; the default GTK handler clamps the value based on [property@Gtk.Range:round-digits].

parameter.name: scroll
parameter.parameter_description: the type of scroll action that was performed

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the new value resulting from the scroll action

signal.return: %TRUE to prevent other handlers from being invoked for the signal, %FALSE to propagate the signal further

signal.name: GtkRange::move-slider
signal.description:
Virtual function that moves the slider.
Used for keybindings.

signal.name: GtkRange::value-changed
signal.description: Emitted when the range value changes.

property.name: GtkRange:adjustment
property.description: The adjustment that is controlled by the range.

property.name: GtkRange:fill-level
property.description: The fill level (e.g. prebuffering of a network stream).

property.name: GtkRange:inverted
property.description: If %TRUE, the direction in which the slider moves is inverted.

property.name: GtkRange:restrict-to-fill-level
property.description: Controls whether slider movement is restricted to an upper boundary set by the fill level.

property.name: GtkRange:round-digits
property.description:
The number of digits to round the value to when it changes.
See [signal@Gtk.Range::change-value].

property.name: GtkRange:show-fill-level
property.description: Controls whether fill level indicator graphics are displayed on the trough.

signal.name: GtkRecentManager::changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the current recently used resources manager changes its contents.
This can happen either by calling [method@Gtk.RecentManager.add_item] or by another application.

property.name: GtkRecentManager:filename
property.description: The full path to the file to be used to store and read the recently used resources list

property.name: GtkRecentManager:size
property.description: The size of the recently used resources list.

enum.name: GtkRecentManagerError
enum.description: Error codes for `GtkRecentManager` operations

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_NOT_FOUND
parameter.parameter_description: the URI specified does not exists in the recently used resources list.

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_INVALID_URI
parameter.parameter_description: the URI specified is not valid.

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_INVALID_ENCODING
parameter.parameter_description: the supplied string is not UTF-8 encoded.

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_NOT_REGISTERED
parameter.parameter_description: no application has registered the specified item.

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_READ
parameter.parameter_description: failure while reading the recently used resources file.

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_WRITE
parameter.parameter_description: failure while writing the recently used resources file.

enum.name: GtkResponseType
enum.description:
Predefined values for use as response ids in gtk_dialog_add_button().
All predefined values are negative; GTK leaves values of 0 or greater for application-defined response ids.
Deprecated: 4.20: There is no replacement.

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: Returned if an action widget has no response id, or if the dialog gets programmatically hidden or destroyed

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_REJECT
parameter.parameter_description: Generic response id, not used by GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT
parameter.parameter_description: Generic response id, not used by GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_DELETE_EVENT
parameter.parameter_description: Returned if the dialog is deleted

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_OK
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by OK buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_CANCEL
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by Cancel buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_CLOSE
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by Close buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_YES
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by Yes buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_NO
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by No buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_APPLY
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by Apply buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_HELP
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by Help buttons in GTK dialogs

property.name: GtkRevealer:child
property.description: The child widget.

property.name: GtkRevealer:child-revealed
property.description: Whether the child is revealed and the animation target reached.

property.name: GtkRevealer:reveal-child
property.description: Whether the revealer should reveal the child.

property.name: GtkRevealer:transition-duration
property.description: The animation duration, in milliseconds.

property.name: GtkRevealer:transition-type
property.description: The type of animation used to transition.

enum.name: GtkRevealerTransitionType
enum.description: These enumeration values describe the possible transitions when the child of a `GtkRevealer` widget is shown or hidden.

property.name: GtkScale:digits
property.description: The number of decimal places that are displayed in the value.

property.name: GtkScale:draw-value
property.description: Whether the current value is displayed as a string next to the slider.

property.name: GtkScale:has-origin
property.description: Whether the scale has an origin.

property.name: GtkScale:value-pos
property.description: The position in which the current value is displayed.

signal.name: GtkScaleButton::popdown
signal.description:
Emitted to dismiss the popup.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Escape</kbd>.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkScaleButton::popup
signal.description:
Emitted to popup the scale widget.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Space</kbd>, <kbd>Enter</kbd> and <kbd>Return</kbd>.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkScaleButton::value-changed
signal.description: Emitted when the value field has changed.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

property.name: GtkScaleButton:active
property.description:
If the scale button should be pressed in.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkScaleButton:adjustment
property.description: The `GtkAdjustment` that is used as the model.

property.name: GtkScaleButton:has-frame
property.description:
If the scale button has a frame.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkScaleButton:icons
property.description:
The names of the icons to be used by the scale button.
The first item in the array will be used in the button when the current value is the lowest value, the second item for the highest value. All the subsequent icons will be used for all the other values, spread evenly over the range of values.
If there's only one icon name in the @icons array, it will be used for all the values. If only two icon names are in the @icons array, the first one will be used for the bottom 50% of the scale, and the second one for the top 50%.
It is recommended to use at least 3 icons so that the `GtkScaleButton` reflects the current value of the scale better for the users.

property.name: GtkScaleButton:value
property.description: The value of the scale.

enum.name: GtkScrollStep
enum.description: Passed as argument to various keybinding signals.

enum.name: GtkScrollType
enum.description: Scrolling types.

property.name: GtkScrollable:hadjustment
property.description:
Horizontal `GtkAdjustment` of the scrollable widget.
This adjustment is shared between the scrollable widget and its parent.

property.name: GtkScrollable:hscroll-policy
property.description: Determines when horizontal scrolling should start.

property.name: GtkScrollable:vadjustment
property.description:
Vertical `GtkAdjustment` of the scrollable widget.
This adjustment is shared between the scrollable widget and its parent.

property.name: GtkScrollable:vscroll-policy
property.description: Determines when vertical scrolling should start.

enum.name: GtkScrollablePolicy
enum.description: Defines the policy to be used in a scrollable widget when updating the scrolled window adjustments in a given orientation.

parameter.name: GTK_SCROLL_MINIMUM
parameter.parameter_description: Scrollable adjustments are based on the minimum size

parameter.name: GTK_SCROLL_NATURAL
parameter.parameter_description: Scrollable adjustments are based on the natural size

property.name: GtkScrollbar:adjustment
property.description: The `GtkAdjustment` controlled by this scrollbar.

signal.name: GtkScrolledWindow::edge-overshot
signal.description:
Emitted whenever user initiated scrolling makes the scrolled window firmly surpass the limits defined by the adjustment in that orientation.
A similar behavior without edge resistance is provided by the [signal@Gtk.ScrolledWindow::edge-reached] signal.
Note: The @pos argument is LTR/RTL aware, so callers should be aware too if intending to provide behavior on horizontal edges.

signal.name: GtkScrolledWindow::edge-reached
signal.description:
Emitted whenever user-initiated scrolling makes the scrolled window exactly reach the lower or upper limits defined by the adjustment in that orientation.
A similar behavior with edge resistance is provided by the [signal@Gtk.ScrolledWindow::edge-overshot] signal.
Note: The @pos argument is LTR/RTL aware, so callers should be aware too if intending to provide behavior on horizontal edges.

signal.name: GtkScrolledWindow::move-focus-out
signal.description:
Emitted when focus is moved away from the scrolled window by a keybinding.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Tab</kbd> to move forward and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Tab</kbd>` to move backward.

signal.name: GtkScrolledWindow::scroll-child
signal.description:
Emitted when a keybinding that scrolls is pressed.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The horizontal or vertical adjustment is updated which triggers a signal that the scrolled window’s child may listen to and scroll itself.

parameter.name: scroll
parameter.parameter_description: a `GtkScrollType` describing how much to scroll

parameter.name: horizontal
parameter.parameter_description: whether the keybinding scrolls the child horizontally or not

signal.return: whether the scroll happened

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:child
property.description:
The child widget.
When setting this property, if the child widget does not implement [iface@Gtk.Scrollable], the scrolled window will add the child to a [class@Gtk.Viewport] and then set the viewport as the child.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:hadjustment
property.description: The `GtkAdjustment` for the horizontal position.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:has-frame
property.description: Whether to draw a frame around the contents.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:hscrollbar-policy
property.description:
When the horizontal scrollbar is displayed.
Use [method@Gtk.ScrolledWindow.set_policy] to set this property.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:kinetic-scrolling
property.description:
Whether kinetic scrolling is enabled or not.
Kinetic scrolling only applies to devices with source %GDK_SOURCE_TOUCHSCREEN.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:max-content-height
property.description: The maximum content height of @scrolled_window.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:max-content-width
property.description: The maximum content width of @scrolled_window.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:min-content-height
property.description: The minimum content height of @scrolled_window.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:min-content-width
property.description: The minimum content width of @scrolled_window.
