property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:overlay-scrolling
property.description:
Whether overlay scrolling is enabled or not.
If it is, the scrollbars are only added as traditional widgets when a mouse is present. Otherwise, they are overlaid on top of the content, as narrow indicators.
Note that overlay scrolling can also be globally disabled, with the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-overlay-scrolling] setting.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:propagate-natural-height
property.description:
Whether the natural height of the child should be calculated and propagated through the scrolled window’s requested natural height.
This is useful in cases where an attempt should be made to allocate exactly enough space for the natural size of the child.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:propagate-natural-width
property.description:
Whether the natural width of the child should be calculated and propagated through the scrolled window’s requested natural width.
This is useful in cases where an attempt should be made to allocate exactly enough space for the natural size of the child.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:vadjustment
property.description: The `GtkAdjustment` for the vertical position.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:vscrollbar-policy
property.description:
When the vertical scrollbar is displayed.
Use [method@Gtk.ScrolledWindow.set_policy] to set this property.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:window-placement
property.description: Where the contents are located with respect to the scrollbars.

property.name: GtkSearchBar:child
property.description: The child widget.

property.name: GtkSearchBar:key-capture-widget
property.description: The key capture widget.

property.name: GtkSearchBar:search-mode-enabled
property.description: Whether the search mode is on and the search bar shown.

property.name: GtkSearchBar:show-close-button
property.description: Whether to show the close button in the search bar.

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::activate
signal.description:
Emitted when the entry is activated.
The keybindings for this signal are all forms of the <kbd>Enter</kbd> key.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The widget on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::next-match
signal.description:
Emitted when the user initiates a move to the next match for the current search string.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
Applications should connect to it, to implement moving between matches.
The default bindings for this signal is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>g</kbd>.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::previous-match
signal.description:
Emitted when the user initiates a move to the previous match for the current search string.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
Applications should connect to it, to implement moving between matches.
The default bindings for this signal is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>g</kbd>.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::search-changed
signal.description: Emitted with a delay. The length of the delay can be changed with the [property@Gtk.SearchEntry:search-delay] property.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::search-started
signal.description: Emitted when the user initiated a search on the entry.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::stop-search
signal.description:
Emitted when the user stops a search via keyboard input.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
Applications should connect to it, to implement hiding the search entry in this case.
The default bindings for this signal is <kbd>Escape</kbd>.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry on which the signal was emitted

property.name: GtkSearchEntry:activates-default
property.description: Whether to activate the default widget when Enter is pressed.

property.name: GtkSearchEntry:input-hints
property.description:
The hints about input for the `GtkSearchEntry` used to alter the behaviour of input methods.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkSearchEntry:input-purpose
property.description:
The purpose for the `GtkSearchEntry` input used to alter the behaviour of input methods.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkSearchEntry:placeholder-text
property.description: The text that will be displayed in the `GtkSearchEntry` when it is empty and unfocused.

property.name: GtkSearchEntry:search-delay
property.description:
The delay in milliseconds from last keypress to the search changed signal.
Since: 4.8

signal.name: GtkSectionModel::sections-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the start-of-section state of some of the items in @model changes.
Note that this signal does not specify the new section state of the items, they need to be queried manually. It is also not necessary for a model to change the section state of any of the items in the section model, though it would be rather useless to emit such a signal.
The [signal@Gio.ListModel::items-changed] implies the effect of the [signal@Gtk.SectionModel::sections-changed] signal for all the items it covers.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: The first item that may have changed

property.name: GtkSelectionFilterModel:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkSelectionFilterModel:model
property.description: The model being filtered.

property.name: GtkSelectionFilterModel:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

enum.name: GtkSelectionMode
enum.description: Used to control what selections users are allowed to make.

parameter.name: GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE
parameter.parameter_description: Zero or one element may be selected.

parameter.name: GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE
parameter.parameter_description: Exactly one element is selected. In some circumstances, such as initially or during a search operation, it’s possible for no element to be selected with %GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE. What is really enforced is that the user can’t deselect a currently selected element except by selecting another element.

parameter.name: GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE
parameter.parameter_description: Any number of elements may be selected. The Ctrl key may be used to enlarge the selection, and Shift key to select between the focus and the child pointed to. Some widgets may also allow Click-drag to select a range of elements.

signal.name: GtkSelectionModel::selection-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the selection state of some of the items in @model changes.
Note that this signal does not specify the new selection state of the items, they need to be queried manually. It is also not necessary for a model to change the selection state of any of the items in the selection model, though it would be rather useless to emit such a signal.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: The first item that may have changed

enum.name: GtkSensitivityType
enum.description: Determines how GTK handles the sensitivity of various controls, such as combo box buttons.

parameter.name: GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO
parameter.parameter_description: The control is made insensitive if no action can be triggered

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-alternative-button-order
property.description: Whether buttons in dialogs should use the alternative button order.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-alternative-sort-arrows
property.description:
Controls the direction of the sort indicators in sorted list and tree views.
By default an arrow pointing down means the column is sorted in ascending order. When set to %TRUE, this order will be inverted.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-application-prefer-dark-theme
property.description:
Whether the application prefers to use a dark theme.
If a GTK theme includes a dark variant, it will be used instead of the configured theme.
Some applications benefit from minimizing the amount of light pollution that interferes with the content. Good candidates for dark themes are photo and video editors that make the actual content get all the attention and minimize the distraction of the chrome.
Dark themes should not be used for documents, where large spaces are white/light and the dark chrome creates too much contrast (web browser, text editor...).
Deprecated: 4.20: Use `GtkCssProvider` properties instead

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-cursor-aspect-ratio
property.description: The aspect ratio of the text caret.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-cursor-blink
property.description:
Whether the cursor should blink.
Also see the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-cursor-blink-timeout] setting, which allows more flexible control over cursor blinking.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-cursor-blink-time
property.description: Length of the cursor blink cycle, in milliseconds.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-cursor-blink-timeout
property.description:
Time after which the cursor stops blinking, in seconds.
The timer is reset after each user interaction.
Setting this to zero has the same effect as setting [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-cursor-blink] to %FALSE.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-cursor-theme-name
property.description:
Name of the cursor theme to use.
Use %NULL to use the default theme.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-cursor-theme-size
property.description:
The size to use for cursors.
0 means to use the default size.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-decoration-layout
property.description:
Determines which buttons should be put in the titlebar of client-side decorated windows, and whether they should be placed on the left or right.
The format of the string is button names, separated by commas. A colon separates the buttons that should appear on the left from those on the right. Recognized button names are minimize, maximize, close, icon (the window icon) and menu (a menu button for the fallback app menu).
For example, "menu:minimize,maximize,close" specifies a menu on the left, and minimize, maximize and close buttons on the right.
Note that buttons will only be shown when they are meaningful. E.g. a menu button only appears when the desktop shell does not show the app menu, and a close button only appears on a window that can be closed.
Also note that the setting can be overridden with the [property@Gtk.HeaderBar:decoration-layout] property.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-dialogs-use-header
property.description:
Whether builtin GTK dialogs such as the file chooser, the color chooser or the font chooser will use a header bar at the top to show action widgets, or an action area at the bottom.
This setting does not affect custom dialogs using `GtkDialog` directly, or message dialogs.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-dnd-drag-threshold
property.description: The number of pixels the cursor can move before dragging.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-double-click-distance
property.description: The maximum distance allowed between two clicks for them to be considered a double click, in pixels.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-double-click-time
property.description: The maximum time to allow between two clicks for them to be considered a double click, in milliseconds.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-enable-accels
property.description: Whether menu items should have visible accelerators which can be activated.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-enable-animations
property.description: Whether to enable toolkit-wide animations.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-enable-event-sounds
property.description:
Whether to play any event sounds at all.
See the [Sound Theme Specifications](http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/sound-theme-spec) for more information on event sounds and sound themes.
GTK itself does not support event sounds, you have to use a loadable module like the one that comes with libcanberra.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-enable-input-feedback-sounds
property.description:
Whether to play event sounds as feedback to user input.
See the [Sound Theme Specifications](http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/sound-theme-spec) for more information on event sounds and sound themes.
GTK itself does not support event sounds, you have to use a loadable module like the one that comes with libcanberra.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-enable-primary-paste
property.description: Whether a middle click on a mouse should paste the 'PRIMARY' clipboard content at the cursor location.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-entry-password-hint-timeout
property.description:
How long to show the last input character in hidden entries.
This value is in milliseconds. 0 disables showing the last char. 600 is a good value for enabling it.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-entry-select-on-focus
property.description: Whether to select the contents of an entry when it is focused.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-error-bell
property.description:
When %TRUE, keyboard navigation and other input-related errors will cause a beep.
Since the error bell is implemented using gdk_surface_beep(), the windowing system may offer ways to configure the error bell in many ways, such as flashing the window or similar visual effects.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-font-name
property.description:
The default font to use.
GTK uses the family name and size from this string.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-font-rendering
property.description:
How GTK font rendering is set up.
When set to [enum@Gtk.FontRendering.MANUAL], GTK respects the low-level font-related settings ([property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-hint-font-metrics], [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-xft-antialias], [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-xft-hinting], [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-xft-hintstyle] and [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-xft-rgba]) as much as practical.
When set to [enum@Gtk.FontRendering.AUTOMATIC], GTK will consider factors such as screen resolution and scale in deciding how to render fonts.
Since: 4.16

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-fontconfig-timestamp
property.description: Timestamp of the current fontconfig configuration.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-hint-font-metrics
property.description:
Whether hinting should be applied to font metrics.
Note that this also turns off subpixel positioning of glyphs, since it conflicts with metrics hinting.
Since: 4.6

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-icon-theme-name
property.description:
Name of the icon theme to use.
See [class@Gtk.IconTheme] for details about how GTK handles icon themes.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-im-module
property.description:
Which IM (input method) module should be used by default.
This is the input method that will be used if the user has not explicitly chosen another input method from the IM context menu. This also can be a colon-separated list of input methods, which GTK will try in turn until it finds one available on the system.
See [class@Gtk.IMContext].

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-interface-color-scheme
property.description:
The color scheme used for rendering the user interface.
This setting communicates the system-wide preference. The color scheme that is actually used when applying CSS styles can be set with the [property@Gtk.CssProvider:prefers-color-scheme] property.
Since: 4.20

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-interface-contrast
property.description:
The level of contrast to use for the user interface.
This setting communicates the system-wide preference. The contrast level that is actually used when applying CSS styles can be set with the [property@Gtk.CssProvider:prefers-contrast] property.
Since: 4.20

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-keynav-use-caret
property.description:
Whether GTK should make sure that text can be navigated with a caret, even if it is not editable.
This is useful when using a screen reader.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-label-select-on-focus
property.description: Whether to select the contents of a selectable label when it is focused.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-long-press-time
property.description:
The time for a button or touch press to be considered a “long press”.
See [class@Gtk.GestureLongPress].

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-overlay-scrolling
property.description:
Whether scrolled windows may use overlaid scrolling indicators.
If this is set to %FALSE, scrolled windows will have permanent scrollbars.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-primary-button-warps-slider
property.description:
If the value of this setting is %TRUE, clicking the primary button in a `GtkRange` trough will move the slider, and hence set the range’s value, to the point that you clicked.
If it is %FALSE, a primary click will cause the slider/value to move by the range’s page-size towards the point clicked.
Whichever action you choose for the primary button, the other action will be available by holding Shift and primary-clicking, or clicking the middle mouse button.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-print-backends
property.description:
A comma-separated list of print backends to use in the print dialog.
Available print backends depend on the GTK installation, and may include "file", "cups", "lpr" or "papi".

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-print-preview-command
property.description:
A command to run for displaying the print preview.
The command should contain a `%f` placeholder, which will get replaced by the path to the pdf file. The command may also contain a `%s` placeholder, which will get replaced by the path to a file containing the print settings in the format produced by [method@Gtk.PrintSettings.to_file].
The preview application is responsible for removing the pdf file and the print settings file when it is done.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-recent-files-enabled
property.description:
Whether GTK should keep track of items inside the recently used resources list.
If set to %FALSE, the list will always be empty.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-recent-files-max-age
property.description:
The maximum age, in days, of the items inside the recently used resources list.
Items older than this setting will be excised from the list. If set to 0, the list will always be empty; if set to -1, no item will be removed.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-shell-shows-app-menu
property.description:
Set to %TRUE if the desktop environment is displaying the app menu, %FALSE if the app should display it itself.
Deprecated: 4.20: This setting is not relevant anymore

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-shell-shows-desktop
property.description:
Set to %TRUE if the desktop environment is displaying the desktop folder, %FALSE if not.
Deprecated: 4.20: This setting is not relevant anymore

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-shell-shows-menubar
property.description:
Set to %TRUE if the desktop environment is displaying the menubar, %FALSE if the app should display it itself.
Deprecated: 4.20: This setting is not relevant anymore

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-show-status-shapes
property.description:
When %TRUE, widgets like switches include shapes to indicate their on/off state.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-sound-theme-name
property.description:
The XDG sound theme to use for event sounds.
See the [Sound Theme Specifications](http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/sound-theme-spec) for more information on event sounds and sound themes.
GTK itself does not support event sounds, you have to use a loadable module like the one that comes with libcanberra.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-split-cursor
property.description: Whether two cursors should be displayed for mixed left-to-right and right-to-left text.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-theme-name
property.description:
Name of the theme to load.
See [class@Gtk.CssProvider] for details about how GTK finds the CSS stylesheet for a theme.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-titlebar-double-click
property.description:
Determines the action to take when a double-click occurs on the titlebar of client-side decorated windows.
Recognized actions are minimize, toggle-maximize, menu, lower or none.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-titlebar-middle-click
property.description:
Determines the action to take when a middle-click occurs on the titlebar of client-side decorated windows.
Recognized actions are minimize, toggle-maximize, menu, lower or none.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-titlebar-right-click
property.description:
Determines the action to take when a right-click occurs on the titlebar of client-side decorated windows.
Recognized actions are minimize, toggle-maximize, menu, lower or none.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-xft-antialias
property.description:
Whether to antialias fonts.
The values are 0 for no, 1 for yes, or -1 for the system default.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-xft-dpi
property.description:
The font resolution, in 1024 * dots/inch.
-1 to use the default value.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-xft-hinting
property.description:
Whether to enable font hinting.
The values are 0 for no, 1 for yes, or -1 for the system default.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-xft-hintstyle
property.description:
What degree of font hinting to use.
The possible vaues are hintnone, hintslight, hintmedium, hintfull.

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-xft-rgba
property.description:
The type of subpixel antialiasing to use.
The possible values are none, rgb, bgr, vrgb, vbgr.
Note that GSK does not support subpixel antialiasing, and this setting has no effect on font rendering in GTK.

property.name: GtkShortcut:action
property.description: The action that gets activated by this shortcut.

property.name: GtkShortcut:arguments
property.description: Arguments passed to activation.

property.name: GtkShortcut:trigger
property.description: The trigger that triggers this shortcut.

enum.name: GtkShortcutActionFlags
enum.description:
Flags that can be passed to action activation.
More flags may be added in the future.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_ACTION_EXCLUSIVE
parameter.parameter_description: The action is the only action that can be activated. If this flag is not set, a future activation may select a different action.

property.name: GtkShortcutController:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkShortcutController:mnemonic-modifiers
property.description: The modifiers that need to be pressed to allow mnemonics activation.

property.name: GtkShortcutController:model
property.description: A list model to take shortcuts from.

property.name: GtkShortcutController:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkShortcutController:scope
property.description: What scope the shortcuts will be handled in.

property.name: GtkShortcutLabel:accelerator
property.description:
The accelerator that @self displays.
See [property@Gtk.ShortcutsShortcut:accelerator] for the accepted syntax.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutLabel:disabled-text
property.description:
The text that is displayed when no accelerator is set.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

enum.name: GtkShortcutScope
enum.description: Describes where [class@Shortcut]s added to a [class@ShortcutController] get handled.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_SCOPE_LOCAL
parameter.parameter_description: Shortcuts are handled inside the widget the controller belongs to.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_SCOPE_MANAGED
parameter.parameter_description: Shortcuts are handled by the first ancestor that is a [iface@ShortcutManager]

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_SCOPE_GLOBAL
parameter.parameter_description: Shortcuts are handled by the root widget.

enum.name: GtkShortcutType
enum.description:
GtkShortcutType specifies the kind of shortcut that is being described.
More values may be added to this enumeration over time.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_ACCELERATOR
parameter.parameter_description: The shortcut is a keyboard accelerator. The GtkShortcutsShortcut:accelerator property will be used.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_GESTURE_PINCH
parameter.parameter_description: The shortcut is a pinch gesture. GTK provides an icon and subtitle.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_GESTURE_STRETCH
parameter.parameter_description: The shortcut is a stretch gesture. GTK provides an icon and subtitle.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_GESTURE_ROTATE_CLOCKWISE
parameter.parameter_description: The shortcut is a clockwise rotation gesture. GTK provides an icon and subtitle.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_GESTURE_ROTATE_COUNTERCLOCKWISE
parameter.parameter_description: The shortcut is a counterclockwise rotation gesture. GTK provides an icon and subtitle.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_GESTURE_TWO_FINGER_SWIPE_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: The shortcut is a two-finger swipe gesture. GTK provides an icon and subtitle.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_GESTURE_TWO_FINGER_SWIPE_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: The shortcut is a two-finger swipe gesture. GTK provides an icon and subtitle.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_GESTURE
parameter.parameter_description: The shortcut is a gesture. The GtkShortcutsShortcut:icon property will be used.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_GESTURE_SWIPE_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: The shortcut is a swipe gesture. GTK provides an icon and subtitle.

parameter.name: GTK_SHORTCUT_GESTURE_SWIPE_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: The shortcut is a swipe gesture. GTK provides an icon and subtitle.

property.name: GtkShortcutsGroup:accel-size-group
property.description:
The size group for the accelerator portion of shortcuts in this group.
This is used internally by GTK, and must not be modified by applications.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsGroup:height
property.description:
A rough measure for the number of lines in this group.
This is used internally by GTK, and is not useful for applications.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsGroup:title
property.description:
The title for this group of shortcuts.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsGroup:title-size-group
property.description:
The size group for the textual portion of shortcuts in this group.
This is used internally by GTK, and must not be modified by applications.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsGroup:view
property.description:
An optional view that the shortcuts in this group are relevant for.
The group will be hidden if the [property@Gtk.ShortcutsWindow:view-name] property does not match the view of this group.
Set this to %NULL to make the group always visible.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

signal.name: GtkShortcutsSection::change-current-page
signal.description:
Emitted when we change the current page.
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>PgUp</kbd>, <kbd>PgUp</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>PgDn</kbd>, <kbd>PgDn</kbd>.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5
signal.return: whether the page was changed

property.name: GtkShortcutsSection:max-height
property.description:
The maximum number of lines to allow per column.
This property can be used to influence how the groups in this section are distributed across pages and columns. The default value of 15 should work in most cases.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsSection:section-name
property.description:
A unique name to identify this section among the sections added to the `GtkShortcutsWindow`.
Setting the [property@Gtk.ShortcutsWindow:section-name] property to this string will make this section shown in the `GtkShortcutsWindow`.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsSection:title
property.description:
The string to show in the section selector of the `GtkShortcutsWindow` for this section.
If there is only one section, you don't need to set a title, since the section selector will not be shown in this case.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsSection:view-name
property.description:
A view name to filter the groups in this section by.
See [property@Gtk.ShortcutsGroup:view].
Applications are expected to use the [property@Gtk.ShortcutsWindow:view-name] property for this purpose.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:accel-size-group
property.description:
The size group for the accelerator portion of this shortcut.
This is used internally by GTK, and must not be modified by applications.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:accelerator
property.description:
The accelerator(s) represented by this object.
This property is used if [property@Gtk.ShortcutsShortcut:shortcut-type] is set to %GTK_SHORTCUT_ACCELERATOR.
The syntax of this property is (an extension of) the syntax understood by [func@Gtk.accelerator_parse]. Multiple accelerators can be specified by separating them with a space, but keep in mind that the available width is limited.
It is also possible to specify ranges of shortcuts, using `...` between the keys. Sequences of keys can be specified using a `+` or `&` between the keys.
Examples:
- A single shortcut: `<ctl><alt>delete` - Two alternative shortcuts: `<shift>a Home` - A range of shortcuts: `<alt>1...<alt>9` - Several keys pressed together: `Control_L&Control_R` - A sequence of shortcuts or keys: `<ctl>c+<ctl>x`
Use "+" instead of "&" when the keys may (or have to be) pressed sequentially (e.g use "t+t" for 'press the t key twice').
Note that `<`, `>` and `&` need to be escaped as `<`, `&gt`; and `&amp`; when used in .ui files.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:action-name
property.description:
A detailed action name.
If this is set for a shortcut of type %GTK_SHORTCUT_ACCELERATOR, then GTK will use the accelerators that are associated with the action via [method@Gtk.Application.set_accels_for_action], and setting [property@Gtk.ShortcutsShortcut:accelerator] is not necessary.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:direction
property.description:
The text direction for which this shortcut is active.
If the shortcut is used regardless of the text direction, set this property to %GTK_TEXT_DIR_NONE.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:icon
property.description:
An icon to represent the shortcut or gesture.
This property is used if [property@Gtk.ShortcutsShortcut:shortcut-type] is set to %GTK_SHORTCUT_GESTURE.
For the other predefined gesture types, GTK provides an icon on its own.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:icon-set
property.description:
%TRUE if an icon has been set.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:shortcut-type
property.description:
The type of shortcut that is represented.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:subtitle
property.description:
The subtitle for the shortcut or gesture.
This is typically used for gestures and should be a short, one-line text that describes the gesture itself. For the predefined gesture types, GTK provides a subtitle on its own.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:subtitle-set
property.description:
%TRUE if a subtitle has been set.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:title
property.description:
The textual description for the shortcut or gesture represented by this object.
This should be a short string that can fit in a single line.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsShortcut:title-size-group
property.description:
The size group for the textual portion of this shortcut.
This is used internally by GTK, and must not be modified by applications.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

signal.name: GtkShortcutsWindow::close
signal.description:
Emitted when the user uses a keybinding to close the window.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is the <kbd>Escape</kbd> key.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

signal.name: GtkShortcutsWindow::search
signal.description:
Emitted when the user uses a keybinding to start a search.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Control</kbd>+<kbd>F</kbd>.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsWindow:section-name
property.description:
The name of the section to show.
This should be the section-name of one of the `GtkShortcutsSection` objects that are in this shortcuts window.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkShortcutsWindow:view-name
property.description:
The view name by which to filter the contents.
This should correspond to the [property@Gtk.ShortcutsGroup:view] property of some of the [class@Gtk.ShortcutsGroup] objects that are inside this shortcuts window.
Set this to %NULL to show all groups.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

property.name: GtkSignalAction:signal-name
property.description: The name of the signal to emit.

signal.name: GtkSignalListItemFactory::bind
signal.description:
Emitted when an object has been bound to an item.
The handler for this signal must set to populate the listitem with widgets.
After this signal was emitted, the object might be shown in a [class@Gtk.ListView] or other widget.
The [signal@Gtk.SignalListItemFactory::unbind] signal is the opposite of this signal and can be used to undo everything done in this signal.

signal.name: GtkSignalListItemFactory::setup
signal.description:
Emitted when a newly created listitem needs to be prepared for use.
It is the first signal emitted for every listitem.
The handler for this signal must call [method@Gtk.ListItem.set_child] to populate the listitem with widgets.
The [signal@Gtk.SignalListItemFactory::teardown] signal is the opposite of this signal and can be used to undo everything done in this signal.

signal.name: GtkSignalListItemFactory::teardown
signal.description:
Emitted when an object is about to be destroyed.
It is the last signal ever emitted for this @object.
This signal is the opposite of the [signal@Gtk.SignalListItemFactory::setup] signal and should be used to undo everything done in that signal.

signal.name: GtkSignalListItemFactory::unbind
signal.description:
Emitted when an object has been unbound from its item.
This happens for example when a listitem was removed from use in a list widget and its [property@Gtk.ListItem:item] is about to be unset.
This signal is the opposite of the [signal@Gtk.SignalListItemFactory::bind] signal and should be used to undo everything done in that signal.

property.name: GtkSingleSelection:autoselect
property.description: If the selection will always select an item.

property.name: GtkSingleSelection:can-unselect
property.description: If unselecting the selected item is allowed.

property.name: GtkSingleSelection:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkSingleSelection:model
property.description: The model being managed.

property.name: GtkSingleSelection:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkSingleSelection:selected
property.description: Position of the selected item.

property.name: GtkSingleSelection:selected-item
property.description: The selected item.

property.name: GtkSizeGroup:mode
property.description: The direction in which the size group affects requested sizes.

enum.name: GtkSizeGroupMode
enum.description: The mode of the size group determines the directions in which the size group affects the requested sizes of its component widgets.

parameter.name: GTK_SIZE_GROUP_BOTH
parameter.parameter_description: group affects both horizontal and vertical requisition

enum.name: GtkSizeRequestMode
enum.description: Specifies a preference for height-for-width or width-for-height geometry management.

property.name: GtkSliceListModel:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkSliceListModel:model
property.description: Child model to take slice from.

property.name: GtkSliceListModel:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkSliceListModel:offset
property.description: Offset of slice.

property.name: GtkSliceListModel:size
property.description: Maximum size of slice.

property.name: GtkSortListModel:incremental
property.description: If the model should sort items incrementally.

property.name: GtkSortListModel:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkSortListModel:model
property.description: The model being sorted.

property.name: GtkSortListModel:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkSortListModel:pending
property.description: Estimate of unsorted items remaining.

property.name: GtkSortListModel:section-sorter
property.description:
The section sorter for this model, if one is set.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkSortListModel:sorter
property.description: The sorter for this model.

enum.name: GtkSortType
enum.description: Determines the direction of a sort.

signal.name: GtkSorter::changed
signal.description:
Emitted whenever the sorter changed.
Users of the sorter should then update the sort order again via gtk_sorter_compare().
[class@Gtk.SortListModel] handles this signal automatically.
Depending on the @change parameter, it may be possible to update the sort order without a full resorting. Refer to the [enum@Gtk.SorterChange] documentation for details.

enum.name: GtkSorterChange
enum.description: Describes changes in a sorter in more detail and allows users to optimize resorting.

parameter.name: GTK_SORTER_CHANGE_DIFFERENT
parameter.parameter_description: The sorter change cannot be described by any of the other enumeration values

parameter.name: GTK_SORTER_CHANGE_INVERTED
parameter.parameter_description: The sort order was inverted. Comparisons that returned %GTK_ORDERING_SMALLER now return %GTK_ORDERING_LARGER and vice versa. Other comparisons return the same values as before.

parameter.name: GTK_SORTER_CHANGE_LESS_STRICT
parameter.parameter_description: The sorter is less strict: Comparisons may now return %GTK_ORDERING_EQUAL that did not do so before.

parameter.name: GTK_SORTER_CHANGE_MORE_STRICT
parameter.parameter_description: The sorter is more strict: Comparisons that did return %GTK_ORDERING_EQUAL may not do so anymore.

enum.name: GtkSorterOrder
enum.description: Describes the type of order that a `GtkSorter` may produce.

parameter.name: GTK_SORTER_ORDER_PARTIAL
parameter.parameter_description: A partial order. Any `GtkOrdering` is possible.

parameter.name: GTK_SORTER_ORDER_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: No order, all elements are considered equal. gtk_sorter_compare() will only return %GTK_ORDERING_EQUAL.

parameter.name: GTK_SORTER_ORDER_TOTAL
parameter.parameter_description: A total order. gtk_sorter_compare() will only return %GTK_ORDERING_EQUAL if an item is compared with itself. Two different items will never cause this value to be returned.

signal.name: GtkSpinButton::activate
signal.description:
Emitted when the spin button is activated.
The keybindings for this signal are all forms of the <kbd>Enter</kbd> key.
If the <kbd>Enter</kbd> key results in the value being committed to the spin button, then activation does not occur until <kbd>Enter</kbd> is pressed again.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The widget on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkSpinButton::change-value
signal.description:
Emitted when the user initiates a value change.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control the cursor programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal are Up/Down and PageUp/PageDown.

parameter.name: spin_button
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: scroll
parameter.parameter_description: a `GtkScrollType` to specify the speed and amount of change

signal.name: GtkSpinButton::input
signal.description:
Emitted to convert the users input into a double value.
The signal handler is expected to use [method@Gtk.Editable.get_text] to retrieve the text of the spinbutton and set @new_value to the new value.
The default conversion uses g_strtod().

parameter.name: spin_button
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: new_value
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the new value

signal.return: %TRUE for a successful conversion, %FALSE if the input was not handled, and %GTK_INPUT_ERROR if the conversion failed.

signal.name: GtkSpinButton::output

parameter.name: spin_button
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

signal.return: %TRUE if the value has been displayed

signal.name: GtkSpinButton::value-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the value is changed.
Also see the [signal@Gtk.SpinButton::output] signal.

parameter.name: spin_button
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkSpinButton::wrapped
signal.description: Emitted right after the spinbutton wraps from its maximum to its minimum value or vice-versa.

parameter.name: spin_button
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

property.name: GtkSpinButton:activates-default
property.description:
Whether to activate the default widget when the spin button is activated.
See [signal@Gtk.SpinButton::activate] for what counts as activation.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkSpinButton:adjustment
property.description: The adjustment that holds the value of the spin button.

property.name: GtkSpinButton:climb-rate
property.description: The acceleration rate when you hold down a button or key.

property.name: GtkSpinButton:digits
property.description: The number of decimal places to display.

property.name: GtkSpinButton:numeric
property.description: Whether non-numeric characters should be ignored.

property.name: GtkSpinButton:snap-to-ticks
property.description: Whether erroneous values are automatically changed to the spin buttons nearest step increment.

property.name: GtkSpinButton:update-policy
property.description: Whether the spin button should update always, or only when the value is acceptable.

property.name: GtkSpinButton:value
property.description: The current value.

property.name: GtkSpinButton:wrap
property.description: Whether a spin button should wrap upon reaching its limits.

enum.name: GtkSpinButtonUpdatePolicy
enum.description:
Determines whether the spin button displays values outside the adjustment bounds.
See [method@Gtk.SpinButton.set_update_policy].

parameter.name: GTK_UPDATE_ALWAYS
parameter.parameter_description: When refreshing your `GtkSpinButton`, the value is always displayed

parameter.name: GTK_UPDATE_IF_VALID
parameter.parameter_description: When refreshing your `GtkSpinButton`, the value is only displayed if it is valid within the bounds of the spin button's adjustment

enum.name: GtkSpinType
enum.description: The values of the GtkSpinType enumeration are used to specify the change to make in gtk_spin_button_spin().

parameter.name: GTK_SPIN_STEP_FORWARD
parameter.parameter_description: Increment by the adjustments step increment.

parameter.name: GTK_SPIN_STEP_BACKWARD
parameter.parameter_description: Decrement by the adjustments step increment.

parameter.name: GTK_SPIN_PAGE_FORWARD
parameter.parameter_description: Increment by the adjustments page increment.

parameter.name: GTK_SPIN_PAGE_BACKWARD
parameter.parameter_description: Decrement by the adjustments page increment.

parameter.name: GTK_SPIN_HOME
parameter.parameter_description: Go to the adjustments lower bound.

parameter.name: GTK_SPIN_END
parameter.parameter_description: Go to the adjustments upper bound.

property.name: GtkSpinner:spinning
property.description: Whether the spinner is spinning

property.name: GtkStack:hhomogeneous
property.description: %TRUE if the stack allocates the same width for all children.

property.name: GtkStack:interpolate-size
property.description: Whether or not the size should smoothly change during the transition.

property.name: GtkStack:pages
property.description: A selection model with the stack pages.

property.name: GtkStack:transition-duration
property.description: The animation duration, in milliseconds.

property.name: GtkStack:transition-running
property.description: Whether or not the transition is currently running.

property.name: GtkStack:transition-type
property.description: The type of animation used to transition.

property.name: GtkStack:vhomogeneous
property.description: %TRUE if the stack allocates the same height for all children.

property.name: GtkStack:visible-child
property.description: The widget currently visible in the stack.

property.name: GtkStack:visible-child-name
property.description: The name of the widget currently visible in the stack.

property.name: GtkStackPage:child
property.description: The child that this page is for.

property.name: GtkStackPage:icon-name
property.description: The icon name of the child page.

property.name: GtkStackPage:name
property.description: The name of the child page.

property.name: GtkStackPage:needs-attention
property.description:
Whether the page requires the user attention.
This is used by the [class@Gtk.StackSwitcher] to change the appearance of the corresponding button when a page needs attention and it is not the current one.

property.name: GtkStackPage:title
property.description: The title of the child page.

property.name: GtkStackPage:use-underline
property.description: If set, an underline in the title indicates a mnemonic.

property.name: GtkStackPage:visible
property.description: Whether this page is visible.

property.name: GtkStackSidebar:stack
property.description: The stack.

property.name: GtkStackSwitcher:stack
property.description: The stack.

enum.name: GtkStackTransitionType
enum.description:
Possible transitions between pages in a `GtkStack` widget.
New values may be added to this enumeration over time.

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_SLIDE_LEFT_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Slide from left or right according to the children order

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_SLIDE_UP_DOWN
parameter.parameter_description: Slide from top down or bottom up according to the order

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER_UP
parameter.parameter_description: Cover the old page by sliding up

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER_DOWN
parameter.parameter_description: Cover the old page by sliding down

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: Cover the old page by sliding to the left

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Cover the old page by sliding to the right

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_UNDER_UP
parameter.parameter_description: Uncover the new page by sliding up

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_UNDER_DOWN
parameter.parameter_description: Uncover the new page by sliding down

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_UNDER_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: Uncover the new page by sliding to the left

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_UNDER_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Uncover the new page by sliding to the right

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER_UP_DOWN
parameter.parameter_description: Cover the old page sliding up or uncover the new page sliding down, according to order

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER_DOWN_UP
parameter.parameter_description: Cover the old page sliding down or uncover the new page sliding up, according to order

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER_LEFT_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Cover the old page sliding left or uncover the new page sliding right, according to order

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER_RIGHT_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: Cover the old page sliding right or uncover the new page sliding left, according to order

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_ROTATE_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: Pretend the pages are sides of a cube and rotate that cube to the left

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_ROTATE_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Pretend the pages are sides of a cube and rotate that cube to the right

parameter.name: GTK_STACK_TRANSITION_TYPE_ROTATE_LEFT_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Pretend the pages are sides of a cube and rotate that cube to the left or right according to the children order

enum.name: GtkStateFlags
enum.description:
Describes a widget state.
Widget states are used to match the widget against CSS pseudo-classes. Note that GTK extends the regular CSS classes and sometimes uses different names.

parameter.name: GTK_STATE_FLAG_PRELIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Widget has a mouse pointer over it

parameter.name: GTK_STATE_FLAG_BACKDROP
parameter.parameter_description: Widget is in a background toplevel window

parameter.name: GTK_STATE_FLAG_DIR_LTR
parameter.parameter_description: Widget is in left-to-right text direction

parameter.name: GTK_STATE_FLAG_DIR_RTL
parameter.parameter_description: Widget is in right-to-left text direction

parameter.name: GTK_STATE_FLAG_VISITED
parameter.parameter_description: The location the widget points to has already been visited

parameter.name: GTK_STATE_FLAG_DROP_ACTIVE
parameter.parameter_description: Widget is highlighted as a drop target for DND

signal.name: GtkStatusbar::text-popped
signal.description:
Emitted whenever a new message is popped off a statusbar's stack.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: statusbar
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: context_id
parameter.parameter_description: the context id of the relevant message/statusbar

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: the message that was just popped

signal.name: GtkStatusbar::text-pushed
signal.description:
Emitted whenever a new message gets pushed onto a statusbar's stack.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: statusbar
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: context_id
parameter.parameter_description: the context id of the relevant message/statusbar

property.name: GtkStringFilter:expression
property.description: The expression to evaluate on each item to get a string to compare with.

property.name: GtkStringFilter:ignore-case
property.description: If matching is case sensitive.

property.name: GtkStringFilter:match-mode
property.description: If exact matches are necessary or if substrings are allowed.

property.name: GtkStringFilter:search
property.description: The search term.

enum.name: GtkStringFilterMatchMode
enum.description: Specifies how search strings are matched inside text.

parameter.name: GTK_STRING_FILTER_MATCH_MODE_EXACT
parameter.parameter_description: The search string and text must match exactly

parameter.name: GTK_STRING_FILTER_MATCH_MODE_SUBSTRING
parameter.parameter_description: The search string must be contained as a substring inside the text

parameter.name: GTK_STRING_FILTER_MATCH_MODE_PREFIX
parameter.parameter_description: The text must begin with the search string

property.name: GtkStringList:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkStringList:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkStringList:strings
property.description:
The strings in the model.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkStringObject:string
property.description: The string.

property.name: GtkStringSorter:collation
property.description:
The collation method to use for sorting.
The `GTK_COLLATION_NONE` value is useful when the expression already returns collation keys, or strings that need to be compared byte-by-byte.
The default value, `GTK_COLLATION_UNICODE`, compares strings according to the [Unicode collation algorithm](https://www.unicode.org/reports/tr10/).
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkStringSorter:expression
property.description: The expression to evaluate on item to get a string to compare with.

property.name: GtkStringSorter:ignore-case
property.description: If sorting is case sensitive.

property.name: GtkStyleContext:display
property.description: The display of the style context.

enum.name: GtkStyleContextPrintFlags
enum.description:
Flags that modify the behavior of gtk_style_context_to_string().
New values may be added to this enumeration.

parameter.name: GTK_STYLE_CONTEXT_PRINT_RECURSE
parameter.parameter_description: Print the entire tree of CSS nodes starting at the style context's node

parameter.name: GTK_STYLE_CONTEXT_PRINT_SHOW_STYLE
parameter.parameter_description: Show the values of the CSS properties for each node

parameter.name: GTK_STYLE_CONTEXT_PRINT_SHOW_CHANGE
parameter.parameter_description: Show information about what changes affect the styles

signal.name: GtkSwitch::activate
signal.description:
Emitted to animate the switch.
Applications should never connect to this signal, but use the [property@Gtk.Switch:active] property.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkSwitch::state-set
signal.description:
Emitted to change the underlying state.
The ::state-set signal is emitted when the user changes the switch position. The default handler calls [method@Gtk.Switch.set_state] with the value of @state.
To implement delayed state change, applications can connect to this signal, initiate the change of the underlying state, and call [method@Gtk.Switch.set_state] when the underlying state change is complete. The signal handler should return %TRUE to prevent the default handler from running.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: the new state of the switch

signal.return: %TRUE to stop the signal emission

property.name: GtkSwitch:active
property.description: Whether the `GtkSwitch` widget is in its on or off state.

property.name: GtkSwitch:state
property.description:
The backend state that is controlled by the switch.
Applications should usually set the [property@Gtk.Switch:active] property, except when indicating a change to the backend state which occurs separately from the user's interaction.
See [signal@Gtk.Switch::state-set] for details.

enum.name: GtkSymbolicColor
enum.description:
The indexes of colors passed to symbolic color rendering, such as [vfunc@Gtk.SymbolicPaintable.snapshot_symbolic].
More values may be added over time.
Since: 4.6

enum.name: GtkSystemSetting
enum.description:
Values that can be passed to the [vfunc@Gtk.Widget.system_setting_changed] vfunc.
The values indicate which system setting has changed. Widgets may need to drop caches, or react otherwise.
Most of the values correspond to [class@Settings] properties.
More values may be added over time.

parameter.name: GTK_SYSTEM_SETTING_FONT_CONFIG
parameter.parameter_description: The font configuration has changed in a way that requires text to be redrawn. This can be any of the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-xft-antialias], [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-xft-hinting], [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-xft-hintstyle], [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-xft-rgba] or [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-fontconfig-timestamp] settings

parameter.name: GTK_SYSTEM_SETTING_ICON_THEME
parameter.parameter_description: The icon theme has changed in a way that requires icons to be looked up again

signal.name: GtkText::activate
signal.description:
Emitted when the user hits the <kbd>Enter</kbd> key.
The default bindings for this signal are all forms of the <kbd>Enter</kbd> key.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkText::backspace
signal.description:
Emitted when the user asks for it.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Backspace</kbd> and <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Backspace</kbd>.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkText::copy-clipboard
signal.description:
Emitted to copy the selection to the clipboard.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>c</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Insert</kbd>.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkText::cut-clipboard
signal.description:
Emitted to cut the selection to the clipboard.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>x</kbd> and <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd>.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkText::delete-from-cursor
signal.description:
Emitted when the user initiates a text deletion.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
If the @type is [enum@Gtk.DeleteType.chars], GTK deletes the selection if there is one, otherwise it deletes the requested number of characters.
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Delete</kbd> for deleting a character and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd> for deleting a word.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of @type units to delete

signal.name: GtkText::insert-at-cursor
signal.description:
Emitted when the user initiates the insertion of a fixed string at the cursor.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This signal has no default bindings.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkText::insert-emoji
signal.description:
Emitted to present the Emoji chooser.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>.</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>;</kbd>

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkText::move-cursor
signal.description:
Emitted when the user initiates a cursor movement.
If the cursor is not visible in @self, this signal causes the viewport to be moved instead.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with [func@GObject.signal_emit_by_name] if they need to control the cursor programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal come in two variants, the variant with the <kbd>Shift</kbd> modifier extends the selection, the variant without it does not. There are too many key combinations to list them all here.
- <kbd>←</kbd>, <kbd>→</kbd>, <kbd>↑</kbd>, <kbd>↓</kbd> move by individual characters/lines - <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd>, etc. move by words/paragraphs - <kbd>Home</kbd> and <kbd>End</kbd> move to the ends of the buffer

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of @step units to move

parameter.name: extend
parameter.parameter_description: true if the move should extend the selection

signal.name: GtkText::paste-clipboard
signal.description:
Emitted to paste the contents of the clipboard.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>v</kbd> and <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Insert</kbd>.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkText::preedit-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the preedit text changes.
If an input method is used, the typed text will not immediately be committed to the buffer. So if you are interested in the text, connect to this signal.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkText::toggle-overwrite
signal.description:
Emitted to toggle the overwrite mode.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal is <kbd>Insert</kbd>.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the text widget which emitted the signal

property.name: GtkText:activates-default
property.description: Whether to activate the default widget when <kbd>Enter</kbd> is pressed.

property.name: GtkText:attributes
property.description:
A list of Pango attributes to apply to the text.
This is mainly useful to change the size or weight of the text.
The `PangoAttribute`'s @start_index and @end_index must refer to the `GtkEntryBuffer` text, i.e. without the preedit string.

property.name: GtkText:buffer
property.description: The `GtkEntryBuffer` object which stores the text.

property.name: GtkText:enable-emoji-completion
property.description: Whether to suggest Emoji replacements.

property.name: GtkText:extra-menu
property.description: A menu model whose contents will be appended to the context menu.

property.name: GtkText:im-module
property.description:
Which input method module should be used.
See [class@Gtk.IMMulticontext].
Setting this to a non-`NULL` value overrides the system-wide input method. See the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-im-module] setting.

property.name: GtkText:input-hints
property.description: Additional hints that allow input methods to fine-tune their behaviour.

property.name: GtkText:input-purpose
property.description:
The purpose of this text field.
This information can be used by on-screen keyboards and other input methods to adjust their behaviour.
Note that setting the purpose to [enum@Gtk.InputPurpose.password] or [enum@Gtk.InputPurpose.pin] is independent from setting [property@Gtk.Text:visibility].

property.name: GtkText:invisible-char
property.description: The character to used when masking contents (in “password mode”).

property.name: GtkText:invisible-char-set
property.description: Whether the invisible char has been set.

property.name: GtkText:max-length
property.description:
Maximum number of characters that are allowed.
Zero indicates no limit.

property.name: GtkText:overwrite-mode
property.description: If text is overwritten when typing.

property.name: GtkText:placeholder-text
property.description: The text that will be displayed in the `GtkText` when it is empty and unfocused.

property.name: GtkText:propagate-text-width
property.description: Whether the widget should grow and shrink with the content.

property.name: GtkText:scroll-offset
property.description: Number of pixels scrolled of the screen to the left.

property.name: GtkText:tabs
property.description: Custom tabs for this text widget.

property.name: GtkText:truncate-multiline
property.description: When true, pasted multi-line text is truncated to the first line.

property.name: GtkText:visibility
property.description: If false, the text is masked with the “invisible char”.

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::apply-tag
signal.description:
Emitted to apply a tag to a range of text in a `GtkTextBuffer`.
Applying actually occurs in the default handler.
Note that if your handler runs before the default handler it must not invalidate the @start and @end iters (or has to revalidate them).
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.apply_tag], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.insert_with_tags], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.insert_range].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: the start of the range the tag is applied to

parameter.name: end
parameter.parameter_description: the end of the range the tag is applied to

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::begin-user-action
signal.description:
Emitted at the beginning of a single user-visible operation on a `GtkTextBuffer`.
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.begin_user_action], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.insert_interactive], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.insert_range_interactive], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.delete_interactive], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.backspace], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.delete_selection].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::changed
signal.description: Emitted when the content of a `GtkTextBuffer` has changed.

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::delete-range
signal.description:
Emitted to delete a range from a `GtkTextBuffer`.
Note that if your handler runs before the default handler it must not invalidate the @start and @end iters (or has to revalidate them). The default signal handler revalidates the @start and @end iters to both point to the location where text was deleted. Handlers which run after the default handler (see g_signal_connect_after()) do not have access to the deleted text.
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.delete].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: the start of the range to be deleted

parameter.name: end
parameter.parameter_description: the end of the range to be deleted

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::end-user-action
signal.description:
Emitted at the end of a single user-visible operation on the `GtkTextBuffer`.
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.end_user_action], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.insert_interactive], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.insert_range_interactive], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.delete_interactive], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.backspace], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.delete_selection], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.backspace].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::insert-child-anchor
signal.description:
Emitted to insert a `GtkTextChildAnchor` in a `GtkTextBuffer`.
Insertion actually occurs in the default handler.
Note that if your handler runs before the default handler it must not invalidate the @location iter (or has to revalidate it). The default signal handler revalidates it to be placed after the inserted @anchor.
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.insert_child_anchor].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::insert-paintable
signal.description:
Emitted to insert a `GdkPaintable` in a `GtkTextBuffer`.
Insertion actually occurs in the default handler.
Note that if your handler runs before the default handler it must not invalidate the @location iter (or has to revalidate it). The default signal handler revalidates it to be placed after the inserted @paintable.
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.insert_paintable].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::insert-text
signal.description:
Emitted to insert text in a `GtkTextBuffer`.
Insertion actually occurs in the default handler.
Note that if your handler runs before the default handler it must not invalidate the @location iter (or has to revalidate it). The default signal handler revalidates it to point to the end of the inserted text.
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.insert], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.insert_range].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: the UTF-8 text to be inserted

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: length of the inserted text in bytes

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::mark-deleted
signal.description:
Emitted as notification after a `GtkTextMark` is deleted.
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.delete_mark].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::mark-set
signal.description:
Emitted as notification after a `GtkTextMark` is set.
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.create_mark], [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.move_mark].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::modified-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the modified bit of a `GtkTextBuffer` flips.
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.set_modified].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::paste-done
signal.description:
Emitted after paste operation has been completed.
This is useful to properly scroll the view to the end of the pasted text. See [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.paste_clipboard] for more details.

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::redo
signal.description: Emitted when a request has been made to redo the previously undone operation.

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::remove-tag
signal.description:
Emitted to remove all occurrences of @tag from a range of text in a `GtkTextBuffer`.
Removal actually occurs in the default handler.
Note that if your handler runs before the default handler it must not invalidate the @start and @end iters (or has to revalidate them).
See also: [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.remove_tag].

parameter.name: textbuffer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: the start of the range the tag is removed from

parameter.name: end
parameter.parameter_description: the end of the range the tag is removed from

signal.name: GtkTextBuffer::undo
signal.description: Emitted when a request has been made to undo the previous operation or set of operations that have been grouped together.

property.name: GtkTextBuffer:can-redo
property.description: Denotes that the buffer can reapply the last undone action.

property.name: GtkTextBuffer:can-undo
property.description: Denotes that the buffer can undo the last applied action.

property.name: GtkTextBuffer:cursor-position
property.description:
The position of the insert mark.
This is an offset from the beginning of the buffer. It is useful for getting notified when the cursor moves.

property.name: GtkTextBuffer:enable-undo
property.description: Denotes if support for undoing and redoing changes to the buffer is allowed.

property.name: GtkTextBuffer:has-selection
property.description: Whether the buffer has some text currently selected.

property.name: GtkTextBuffer:tag-table
property.description: The GtkTextTagTable for the buffer.

property.name: GtkTextBuffer:text
property.description:
The text content of the buffer.
Without child widgets and images, see [method@Gtk.TextBuffer.get_text] for more information.

enum.name: GtkTextBufferNotifyFlags
enum.description:
Values for [callback@Gtk.TextBufferCommitNotify] to denote the point of the notification.
Since: 4.16

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_BUFFER_NOTIFY_BEFORE_INSERT
parameter.parameter_description: Be notified before text is inserted into the underlying buffer.

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_BUFFER_NOTIFY_AFTER_INSERT
parameter.parameter_description: Be notified after text has been inserted into the underlying buffer.

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_BUFFER_NOTIFY_BEFORE_DELETE
parameter.parameter_description: Be notified before text is deleted from the underlying buffer.

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_BUFFER_NOTIFY_AFTER_DELETE
parameter.parameter_description: Be notified after text has been deleted from the underlying buffer.

enum.name: GtkTextDirection
enum.description: Reading directions for text.

enum.name: GtkTextExtendSelection
enum.description: Granularity types that extend the text selection. Use the `GtkTextView::extend-selection` signal to customize the selection.

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_EXTEND_SELECTION_WORD
parameter.parameter_description: Selects the current word. It is triggered by a double-click for example.

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_EXTEND_SELECTION_LINE
parameter.parameter_description: Selects the current line. It is triggered by a triple-click for example.

property.name: GtkTextMark:left-gravity
property.description:
Whether the mark has left gravity.
When text is inserted at the mark’s current location, if the mark has left gravity it will be moved to the left of the newly-inserted text, otherwise to the right.

property.name: GtkTextMark:name
property.description: The name of the mark or %NULL if the mark is anonymous.

enum.name: GtkTextSearchFlags
enum.description:
Flags affecting how a search is done.
If neither `GTK_TEXT_SEARCH_VISIBLE_ONLY` nor `GTK_TEXT_SEARCH_TEXT_ONLY` are enabled, the match must be exact; the special 0xFFFC character will match embedded paintables or child widgets.

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_SEARCH_VISIBLE_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: Search only visible data. A search match may have invisible text interspersed.

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_SEARCH_TEXT_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: Search only text. A match may have paintables or child widgets mixed inside the matched range.

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_SEARCH_CASE_INSENSITIVE
parameter.parameter_description: The text will be matched regardless of what case it is in.

property.name: GtkTextTag:accumulative-margin
property.description:
Whether the margins accumulate or override each other.
When set to %TRUE the margins of this tag are added to the margins of any other non-accumulative margins present. When set to %FALSE the margins override one another (the default).

property.name: GtkTextTag:allow-breaks
property.description: Whether breaks are allowed.

property.name: GtkTextTag:allow-breaks-set
property.description: Whether the `allow-breaks` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:background
property.description: Background color as a string.

property.name: GtkTextTag:background-full-height
property.description: Whether the background color fills the entire line height or only the height of the tagged characters.

property.name: GtkTextTag:background-full-height-set
property.description: Whether the `background-full-height` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:background-rgba
property.description: Background color as a `GdkRGBA`.

property.name: GtkTextTag:background-set
property.description: Whether the `background` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:direction
property.description: Text direction, e.g. right-to-left or left-to-right.

property.name: GtkTextTag:editable
property.description: Whether the text can be modified by the user.

property.name: GtkTextTag:editable-set
property.description: Whether the `editable` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:fallback
property.description:
Whether font fallback is enabled.
When set to %TRUE, other fonts will be substituted where the current font is missing glyphs.

property.name: GtkTextTag:fallback-set
property.description: Whether the `fallback` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:family
property.description: Name of the font family, e.g. Sans, Helvetica, Times, Monospace.

property.name: GtkTextTag:family-set
property.description: Whether the `family` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:font
property.description:
Font description as string, e.g. \"Sans Italic 12\".
Note that the initial value of this property depends on the internals of `PangoFontDescription`.

property.name: GtkTextTag:font-desc
property.description: Font description as a `PangoFontDescription`.

property.name: GtkTextTag:font-features
property.description: OpenType font features, as a string.

property.name: GtkTextTag:font-features-set
property.description: Whether the `font-features` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:foreground
property.description: Foreground color as a string.

property.name: GtkTextTag:foreground-rgba
property.description: Foreground color as a `GdkRGBA`.

property.name: GtkTextTag:foreground-set
property.description: Whether the `foreground` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:indent
property.description:
Amount to indent the paragraph, in pixels.
A negative value of indent will produce a hanging indentation. That is, the first line will have the full width, and subsequent lines will be indented by the absolute value of indent.

property.name: GtkTextTag:indent-set
property.description: Whether the `indent` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:insert-hyphens
property.description: Whether to insert hyphens at breaks.

property.name: GtkTextTag:insert-hyphens-set
property.description: Whether the `insert-hyphens` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:invisible
property.description:
Whether this text is hidden.
Note that there may still be problems with the support for invisible text, in particular when navigating programmatically inside a buffer containing invisible segments.

property.name: GtkTextTag:invisible-set
property.description: Whether the `invisible` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:justification
property.description: Left, right, or center justification.

property.name: GtkTextTag:justification-set
property.description: Whether the `justification` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:language
property.description:
The language this text is in, as an ISO code.
Pango can use this as a hint when rendering the text. If not set, an appropriate default will be used.
Note that the initial value of this property depends on the current locale, see also [func@Gtk.get_default_language].

property.name: GtkTextTag:language-set
property.description: Whether the `language` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:left-margin
property.description: Width of the left margin in pixels.

property.name: GtkTextTag:left-margin-set
property.description: Whether the `left-margin` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:letter-spacing
property.description: Extra spacing between graphemes, in Pango units.

property.name: GtkTextTag:letter-spacing-set
property.description: Whether the `letter-spacing` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:line-height
property.description:
Factor to scale line height by.
Since: 4.6

property.name: GtkTextTag:line-height-set
property.description: Whether the `line-height` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:name
property.description:
The name used to refer to the tag.
%NULL for anonymous tags.

property.name: GtkTextTag:overline
property.description: Style of overline for this text.

property.name: GtkTextTag:overline-rgba
property.description:
This property modifies the color of overlines.
If not set, overlines will use the foreground color.

property.name: GtkTextTag:overline-rgba-set
