property.description: Whether the `overline-rgba` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:overline-set
property.description: Whether the `overline` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:paragraph-background
property.description: The paragraph background color as a string.

property.name: GtkTextTag:paragraph-background-rgba
property.description: The paragraph background color as a `GdkRGBA`.

property.name: GtkTextTag:paragraph-background-set
property.description: Whether the `paragraph-background` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:pixels-above-lines
property.description: Pixels of blank space above paragraphs.

property.name: GtkTextTag:pixels-above-lines-set
property.description: Whether the `pixels-above-lines` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:pixels-below-lines
property.description: Pixels of blank space below paragraphs.

property.name: GtkTextTag:pixels-below-lines-set
property.description: Whether the `pixels-below-lines` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:pixels-inside-wrap
property.description: Pixels of blank space between wrapped lines in a paragraph.

property.name: GtkTextTag:pixels-inside-wrap-set
property.description: Whether the `pixels-inside-wrap` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:right-margin
property.description: Width of the right margin, in pixels.

property.name: GtkTextTag:right-margin-set
property.description: Whether the `right-margin` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:rise
property.description:
Offset of text above the baseline, in Pango units.
Negative values go below the baseline.

property.name: GtkTextTag:rise-set
property.description: Whether the `rise` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:scale
property.description:
Font size as a scale factor relative to the default font size.
This properly adapts to theme changes, etc. so is recommended. Pango predefines some scales such as %PANGO_SCALE_X_LARGE.

property.name: GtkTextTag:scale-set
property.description: Whether the `scale` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:sentence
property.description:
Whether this tag represents a single sentence.
This affects cursor movement.
Since: 4.6

property.name: GtkTextTag:sentence-set
property.description: Whether the `sentence` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:show-spaces
property.description: How to render invisible characters.

property.name: GtkTextTag:show-spaces-set
property.description: Whether the `show-spaces` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:size
property.description: Font size in Pango units.

property.name: GtkTextTag:size-points
property.description: Font size in points.

property.name: GtkTextTag:size-set
property.description: Whether the `size` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:stretch
property.description: Font stretch as a `PangoStretch`, e.g. %PANGO_STRETCH_CONDENSED.

property.name: GtkTextTag:stretch-set
property.description: Whether the `stretch` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:strikethrough
property.description: Whether to strike through the text.

property.name: GtkTextTag:strikethrough-rgba
property.description:
This property modifies the color of strikeouts.
If not set, strikeouts will use the foreground color.

property.name: GtkTextTag:strikethrough-rgba-set
property.description: If the `strikethrough-rgba` property has been set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:strikethrough-set
property.description: Whether the `strikethrough` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:style
property.description: Font style as a `PangoStyle`, e.g. %PANGO_STYLE_ITALIC.

property.name: GtkTextTag:style-set
property.description: Whether the `style` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:tabs
property.description: Custom tabs for this text.

property.name: GtkTextTag:tabs-set
property.description: Whether the `tabs` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:text-transform
property.description:
How to transform the text for display.
Since: 4.6

property.name: GtkTextTag:text-transform-set
property.description: Whether the `text-transform` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:underline
property.description: Style of underline for this text.

property.name: GtkTextTag:underline-rgba
property.description:
This property modifies the color of underlines.
If not set, underlines will use the foreground color.
If [property@Gtk.TextTag:underline] is set to %PANGO_UNDERLINE_ERROR, an alternate color may be applied instead of the foreground. Setting this property will always override those defaults.

property.name: GtkTextTag:underline-rgba-set
property.description: If the `underline-rgba` property has been set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:underline-set
property.description: Whether the `underline` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:variant
property.description: Font variant as a `PangoVariant`, e.g. %PANGO_VARIANT_SMALL_CAPS.

property.name: GtkTextTag:variant-set
property.description: Whether the `variant` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:weight
property.description: Font weight as an integer.

property.name: GtkTextTag:weight-set
property.description: Whether the `weight` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:word
property.description:
Whether this tag represents a single word.
This affects line breaks and cursor movement.
Since: 4.6

property.name: GtkTextTag:word-set
property.description: Whether the `word` property is set.

property.name: GtkTextTag:wrap-mode
property.description: Whether to wrap lines never, at word boundaries, or at character boundaries.

property.name: GtkTextTag:wrap-mode-set
property.description: Whether the `wrap-mode` property is set.

signal.name: GtkTextTagTable::tag-added
signal.description: Emitted every time a new tag is added in the `GtkTextTagTable`.

parameter.name: texttagtable
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkTextTagTable::tag-changed
signal.description: Emitted every time a tag in the `GtkTextTagTable` changes.

parameter.name: texttagtable
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: size_changed
parameter.parameter_description: whether the change affects the `GtkTextView` layout.

signal.name: GtkTextTagTable::tag-removed
signal.description:
Emitted every time a tag is removed from the `GtkTextTagTable`.
The @tag is still valid by the time the signal is emitted, but it is not associated with a tag table any more.

parameter.name: texttagtable
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkTextView::backspace
signal.description:
Gets emitted when the user asks for it.
The ::backspace signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Backspace</kbd> and <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Backspace</kbd>.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextView::copy-clipboard
signal.description:
Gets emitted to copy the selection to the clipboard.
The ::copy-clipboard signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>c</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Insert</kbd>.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextView::cut-clipboard
signal.description:
Gets emitted to cut the selection to the clipboard.
The ::cut-clipboard signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>x</kbd> and <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd>.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextView::delete-from-cursor
signal.description:
Gets emitted when the user initiates a text deletion.
The ::delete-from-cursor signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
If the @type is %GTK_DELETE_CHARS, GTK deletes the selection if there is one, otherwise it deletes the requested number of characters.
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Delete</kbd> for deleting a character, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd> for deleting a word and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Backspace</kbd> for deleting a word backwards.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the granularity of the deletion, as a `GtkDeleteType`

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of @type units to delete

signal.name: GtkTextView::extend-selection
signal.description: Emitted when the selection needs to be extended at @location.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: location
parameter.parameter_description: the location where to extend the selection

signal.return: %GDK_EVENT_STOP to stop other handlers from being invoked for the event. %GDK_EVENT_PROPAGATE to propagate the event further.

signal.name: GtkTextView::insert-at-cursor
signal.description:
Gets emitted when the user initiates the insertion of a fixed string at the cursor.
The ::insert-at-cursor signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
This signal has no default bindings.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextView::insert-emoji
signal.description:
Gets emitted to present the Emoji chooser for the @text_view.
The ::insert-emoji signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>.</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>;</kbd>

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextView::move-cursor
signal.description:
Gets emitted when the user initiates a cursor movement.
The ::move-cursor signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html). If the cursor is not visible in @text_view, this signal causes the viewport to be moved instead.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control the cursor programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal come in two variants, the variant with the <kbd>Shift</kbd> modifier extends the selection, the variant without it does not. There are too many key combinations to list them all here.
- <kbd>←</kbd>, <kbd>→</kbd>, <kbd>↑</kbd>, <kbd>↓</kbd> move by individual characters/lines - <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd>, etc. move by words/paragraphs - <kbd>Home</kbd> and <kbd>End</kbd> move to the ends of the buffer - <kbd>PgUp</kbd> and <kbd>PgDn</kbd> move vertically by pages - <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>PgUp</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>PgDn</kbd> move horizontally by pages

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: the granularity of the move, as a `GtkMovementStep`

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of @step units to move

parameter.name: extend_selection
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the move should extend the selection

signal.name: GtkTextView::move-viewport
signal.description:
Gets emitted to move the viewport.
The ::move-viewport signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html), which can be bound to key combinations to allow the user to move the viewport, i.e. change what part of the text view is visible in a containing scrolled window.
There are no default bindings for this signal.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: the granularity of the movement, as a `GtkScrollStep`

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of @step units to move

signal.name: GtkTextView::paste-clipboard
signal.description:
Gets emitted to paste the contents of the clipboard into the text view.
The ::paste-clipboard signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>v</kbd> and <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Insert</kbd>.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextView::preedit-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when preedit text of the active IM changes.
If an input method is used, the typed text will not immediately be committed to the buffer. So if you are interested in the text, connect to this signal.
This signal is only emitted if the text at the given position is actually editable.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextView::select-all
signal.description:
Gets emitted to select or unselect the complete contents of the text view.
The ::select-all signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>a</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>/</kbd> for selecting and <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>a</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>\</kbd> for unselecting.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextView::set-anchor
signal.description:
Gets emitted when the user initiates settings the "anchor" mark.
The ::set-anchor signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html) which gets emitted when the user initiates setting the "anchor" mark. The "anchor" mark gets placed at the same position as the "insert" mark.
This signal has no default bindings.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextView::toggle-cursor-visible
signal.description:
Gets emitted to toggle the `cursor-visible` property.
The ::toggle-cursor-visible signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>F7</kbd>.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkTextView::toggle-overwrite
signal.description:
Gets emitted to toggle the overwrite mode of the text view.
The ::toggle-overwrite signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>Insert</kbd>.

parameter.name: text_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

property.name: GtkTextView:accepts-tab
property.description: Whether Tab will result in a tab character being entered.

property.name: GtkTextView:bottom-margin
property.description:
The bottom margin for text in the text view.
Note that this property is confusingly named. In CSS terms, the value set here is padding, and it is applied in addition to the padding from the theme.
Don't confuse this property with [property@Gtk.Widget:margin-bottom].

property.name: GtkTextView:buffer
property.description: The buffer which is displayed.

property.name: GtkTextView:cursor-visible
property.description: If the insertion cursor is shown.

property.name: GtkTextView:editable
property.description: Whether the text can be modified by the user.

property.name: GtkTextView:extra-menu
property.description: A menu model whose contents will be appended to the context menu.

property.name: GtkTextView:im-module
property.description:
Which IM (input method) module should be used for this text_view.
See [class@Gtk.IMMulticontext].
Setting this to a non-%NULL value overrides the system-wide IM module setting. See the GtkSettings [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-im-module] property.

property.name: GtkTextView:indent
property.description:
Amount to indent the paragraph, in pixels.
A negative value of indent will produce a hanging indentation. That is, the first line will have the full width, and subsequent lines will be indented by the absolute value of indent.

property.name: GtkTextView:input-hints
property.description: Additional hints (beyond [property@Gtk.TextView:input-purpose]) that allow input methods to fine-tune their behaviour.

property.name: GtkTextView:input-purpose
property.description:
The purpose of this text field.
This property can be used by on-screen keyboards and other input methods to adjust their behaviour.

property.name: GtkTextView:justification
property.description: Left, right, or center justification.

property.name: GtkTextView:left-margin
property.description:
The default left margin for text in the text view.
Tags in the buffer may override the default.
Note that this property is confusingly named. In CSS terms, the value set here is padding, and it is applied in addition to the padding from the theme.

property.name: GtkTextView:monospace
property.description:
Whether text should be displayed in a monospace font.
If %TRUE, set the .monospace style class on the text view to indicate that a monospace font is desired.

property.name: GtkTextView:overwrite
property.description: Whether entered text overwrites existing contents.

property.name: GtkTextView:pixels-above-lines
property.description: Pixels of blank space above paragraphs.

property.name: GtkTextView:pixels-below-lines
property.description: Pixels of blank space below paragraphs.

property.name: GtkTextView:pixels-inside-wrap
property.description: Pixels of blank space between wrapped lines in a paragraph.

property.name: GtkTextView:right-margin
property.description:
The default right margin for text in the text view.
Tags in the buffer may override the default.
Note that this property is confusingly named. In CSS terms, the value set here is padding, and it is applied in addition to the padding from the theme.

property.name: GtkTextView:tabs
property.description: Custom tabs for this text.

property.name: GtkTextView:top-margin
property.description:
The top margin for text in the text view.
Note that this property is confusingly named. In CSS terms, the value set here is padding, and it is applied in addition to the padding from the theme.
Don't confuse this property with [property@Gtk.Widget:margin-top].

property.name: GtkTextView:wrap-mode
property.description: Whether to wrap lines never, at word boundaries, or at character boundaries.

property.name: GtkTextViewChild:window-type
property.description: The "window-type" property is the `GtkTextWindowType` of the `GtkTextView` that the child is attached.

enum.name: GtkTextViewLayer
enum.description: Used to reference the layers of `GtkTextView` for the purpose of customized drawing with the ::snapshot_layer vfunc.

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_VIEW_LAYER_BELOW_TEXT
parameter.parameter_description: The layer rendered below the text (but above the background).

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_VIEW_LAYER_ABOVE_TEXT
parameter.parameter_description: The layer rendered above the text.

enum.name: GtkTextWindowType
enum.description: Used to reference the parts of `GtkTextView`.

parameter.name: GTK_TEXT_WINDOW_WIDGET
parameter.parameter_description: Window that floats over scrolling areas.

signal.name: GtkToggleButton::toggled
signal.description: Emitted whenever the `GtkToggleButton`'s state is changed.

parameter.name: togglebutton
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

property.name: GtkToggleButton:active
property.description: If the toggle button should be pressed in.

property.name: GtkToggleButton:group
property.description: The toggle button whose group this widget belongs to.

property.name: GtkTreeExpander:child
property.description: The child widget with the actual contents.

property.name: GtkTreeExpander:hide-expander
property.description:
Whether the expander icon should be hidden in a GtkTreeListRow. Note that this property simply hides the icon. The actions and keybinding (i.e. collapse and expand) are not affected by this property.
A common use for this property would be to bind to the number of children in a GtkTreeListRow's model in order to hide the expander when a row has no children.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkTreeExpander:indent-for-depth
property.description:
TreeExpander indents the child according to its depth.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkTreeExpander:indent-for-icon
property.description:
TreeExpander indents the child by the width of an expander-icon if it is not expandable.
Since: 4.6

property.name: GtkTreeExpander:item
property.description: The item held by this expander's row.

property.name: GtkTreeExpander:list-row
property.description: The list row to track for expander state.

property.name: GtkTreeListModel:autoexpand
property.description: If all rows should be expanded by default.

property.name: GtkTreeListModel:item-type
property.description:
The type of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_item_type].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkTreeListModel:model
property.description: The root model displayed.

property.name: GtkTreeListModel:n-items
property.description:
The number of items. See [method@Gio.ListModel.get_n_items].
Since: 4.8

property.name: GtkTreeListModel:passthrough
property.description:
Gets whether the model is in passthrough mode.
If %FALSE, the `GListModel` functions for this object return custom [class@Gtk.TreeListRow] objects. If %TRUE, the values of the child models are pass through unmodified.

property.name: GtkTreeListRow:children
property.description: The model holding the row's children.

property.name: GtkTreeListRow:depth
property.description: The depth in the tree of this row.

property.name: GtkTreeListRow:expandable
property.description: If this row can ever be expanded.

property.name: GtkTreeListRow:expanded
property.description: If this row is currently expanded.

property.name: GtkTreeListRow:item
property.description: The item held in this row.

property.name: GtkTreeListRowSorter:sorter
property.description: The underlying sorter

signal.name: GtkTreeModel::row-changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when a row in the model has changed.

parameter.name: tree_model
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkTreeModel` on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid `GtkTreeIter` pointing to the changed row

signal.name: GtkTreeModel::row-deleted
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when a row has been deleted.
Note that no iterator is passed to the signal handler, since the row is already deleted.
This should be called by models after a row has been removed. The location pointed to by @path should be the location that the row previously was at. It may not be a valid location anymore.

parameter.name: tree_model
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkTreeModel` on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkTreeModel::row-has-child-toggled
signal.description: This signal is emitted when a row has gotten the first child row or lost its last child row.

parameter.name: tree_model
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkTreeModel` on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid `GtkTreeIter` pointing to the row

signal.name: GtkTreeModel::row-inserted
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when a new row has been inserted in the model.
Note that the row may still be empty at this point, since it is a common pattern to first insert an empty row, and then fill it with the desired values.

parameter.name: tree_model
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkTreeModel` on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid `GtkTreeIter` pointing to the new row

signal.name: GtkTreeModel::rows-reordered
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when the children of a node in the `GtkTreeModel` have been reordered.
Note that this signal is not emitted when rows are reordered by DND, since this is implemented by removing and then reinserting the row.

parameter.name: tree_model
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkTreeModel` on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a `GtkTreePath` identifying the tree node whose children have been reordered

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid `GtkTreeIter` pointing to the node whose children have been reordered, or %NULL if the depth of @path is 0

parameter.name: new_order
parameter.parameter_description: an array of integers mapping the current position of each child to its old position before the re-ordering, i.e. @new_order`[newpos] = oldpos`

property.name: GtkTreeModelFilter:child-model
property.description: The child model of the tree model filter.

property.name: GtkTreeModelFilter:virtual-root
property.description: The virtual root of the tree model filter.

enum.name: GtkTreeModelFlags
enum.description:
These flags indicate various properties of a `GtkTreeModel`.
They are returned by [method@Gtk.TreeModel.get_flags], and must be static for the lifetime of the object. A more complete description of %GTK_TREE_MODEL_ITERS_PERSIST can be found in the overview of this section.
Deprecated: 4.10: There is no replacement

parameter.name: GTK_TREE_MODEL_ITERS_PERSIST
parameter.parameter_description: iterators survive all signals emitted by the tree

parameter.name: GTK_TREE_MODEL_LIST_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: the model is a list only, and never has children

property.name: GtkTreeModelSort:model
property.description: The model of the tree model sort.

signal.name: GtkTreeSelection::changed
signal.description: Emitted whenever the selection has (possibly) changed. Please note that this signal is mostly a hint. It may only be emitted once when a range of rows are selected, and it may occasionally be emitted when nothing has happened.

parameter.name: treeselection
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

property.name: GtkTreeSelection:mode
property.description: Selection mode. See gtk_tree_selection_set_mode() for more information on this property.

signal.name: GtkTreeSortable::sort-column-changed
signal.description: The ::sort-column-changed signal is emitted when the sort column or sort order of @sortable is changed. The signal is emitted before the contents of @sortable are resorted.

parameter.name: sortable
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkTreeView::columns-changed
signal.description: The number of columns of the treeview has changed.

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkTreeView::cursor-changed
signal.description: The position of the cursor (focused cell) has changed.

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkTreeView::move-cursor
signal.description:
The `GtkTreeView`::move-cursor signal is a [keybinding signal][class@Gtk.SignalAction] which gets emitted when the user presses one of the cursor keys.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control the cursor programmatically. In contrast to gtk_tree_view_set_cursor() and gtk_tree_view_set_cursor_on_cell() when moving horizontally `GtkTreeView`::move-cursor does not reset the current selection.

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted.

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: the granularity of the move, as a `GtkMovementStep`. %GTK_MOVEMENT_LOGICAL_POSITIONS, %GTK_MOVEMENT_VISUAL_POSITIONS, %GTK_MOVEMENT_DISPLAY_LINES, %GTK_MOVEMENT_PAGES and %GTK_MOVEMENT_BUFFER_ENDS are supported. %GTK_MOVEMENT_LOGICAL_POSITIONS and %GTK_MOVEMENT_VISUAL_POSITIONS are treated identically.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: the direction to move: +1 to move forwards; -1 to move backwards. The resulting movement is undefined for all other values.

signal.return: %TRUE if @step is supported, %FALSE otherwise.

signal.name: GtkTreeView::row-activated
signal.description:
The "row-activated" signal is emitted when the method [method@Gtk.TreeView.row_activated] is called.
This signal is emitted when the user double-clicks a treeview row with the [property@Gtk.TreeView:activate-on-single-click] property set to %FALSE, or when the user single-clicks a row when that property set to %TRUE.
This signal is also emitted when a non-editable row is selected and one of the keys: <kbd>Space</kbd>, <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Space</kbd>, <kbd>Return</kbd> or <kbd>Enter</kbd> is pressed.
For selection handling refer to the [tree widget conceptual overview](section-tree-widget.html) as well as `GtkTreeSelection`.

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkTreeViewColumn` in which the activation occurred

signal.name: GtkTreeView::row-collapsed
signal.description: The given row has been collapsed (child nodes are hidden).

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the tree iter of the collapsed row

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a tree path that points to the row

signal.name: GtkTreeView::row-expanded
signal.description: The given row has been expanded (child nodes are shown).

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the tree iter of the expanded row

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a tree path that points to the row

signal.name: GtkTreeView::test-collapse-row
signal.description: The given row is about to be collapsed (hide its children nodes). Use this signal if you need to control the collapsibility of individual rows.

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the tree iter of the row to collapse

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a tree path that points to the row

signal.return: %FALSE to allow collapsing, %TRUE to reject

signal.name: GtkTreeView::test-expand-row
signal.description: The given row is about to be expanded (show its children nodes). Use this signal if you need to control the expandability of individual rows.

parameter.name: tree_view
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the tree iter of the row to expand

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a tree path that points to the row

signal.return: %FALSE to allow expansion, %TRUE to reject

property.name: GtkTreeView:activate-on-single-click
property.description: The activate-on-single-click property specifies whether the "row-activated" signal will be emitted after a single click.

property.name: GtkTreeView:fixed-height-mode
property.description: Setting the ::fixed-height-mode property to %TRUE speeds up `GtkTreeView` by assuming that all rows have the same height. Only enable this option if all rows are the same height. Please see gtk_tree_view_set_fixed_height_mode() for more information on this option.

property.name: GtkTreeView:hover-expand
property.description:
Enables or disables the hover expansion mode of @tree_view. Hover expansion makes rows expand or collapse if the pointer moves over them.
This mode is primarily intended for treeviews in popups, e.g. in `GtkComboBox` or `GtkEntryCompletion`.

property.name: GtkTreeView:hover-selection
property.description:
Enables or disables the hover selection mode of @tree_view. Hover selection makes the selected row follow the pointer. Currently, this works only for the selection modes %GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE and %GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE.
This mode is primarily intended for treeviews in popups, e.g. in `GtkComboBox` or `GtkEntryCompletion`.

property.name: GtkTreeView:level-indentation
property.description: Extra indentation for each level.

property.name: GtkTreeView:show-expanders
property.description: %TRUE if the view has expanders.

signal.name: GtkTreeViewColumn::clicked
signal.description: Emitted when the column's header has been clicked.

property.name: GtkTreeViewColumn:cell-area
property.description:
The `GtkCellArea` used to layout cell renderers for this column.
If no area is specified when creating the tree view column with gtk_tree_view_column_new_with_area() a horizontally oriented `GtkCellAreaBox` will be used.

property.name: GtkTreeViewColumn:sort-column-id
property.description: Logical sort column ID this column sorts on when selected for sorting. Setting the sort column ID makes the column header clickable. Set to -1 to make the column unsortable.

enum.name: GtkTreeViewColumnSizing
enum.description:
The sizing method the column uses to determine its width. Please note that %GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_AUTOSIZE are inefficient for large views, and can make columns appear choppy.
Deprecated: 4.20: There is no replacement.

parameter.name: GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_GROW_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: Columns only get bigger in reaction to changes in the model

parameter.name: GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_AUTOSIZE
parameter.parameter_description: Columns resize to be the optimal size every time the model changes.

parameter.name: GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED
parameter.parameter_description: Columns are a fixed numbers of pixels wide.

enum.name: GtkTreeViewDropPosition
enum.description:
An enum for determining where a dropped row goes.
Deprecated: 4.20: There is no replacement.

parameter.name: GTK_TREE_VIEW_DROP_INTO_OR_BEFORE
parameter.parameter_description: dropped row becomes a child or is inserted before

parameter.name: GTK_TREE_VIEW_DROP_INTO_OR_AFTER
parameter.parameter_description: dropped row becomes a child or is inserted after

enum.name: GtkTreeViewGridLines
enum.description:
Used to indicate which grid lines to draw in a tree view.
Deprecated: 4.20: There is no replacement

enum.name: GtkUnit
enum.description: See also gtk_print_settings_set_paper_width().

property.name: GtkUriLauncher:uri
property.description:
The uri to launch.
Since: 4.10

property.name: GtkVideo:autoplay
property.description: If the video should automatically begin playing.

property.name: GtkVideo:file
property.description: The file played by this video if the video is playing a file.

property.name: GtkVideo:graphics-offload
property.description:
Whether to enable graphics offload.
Since: 4.14

property.name: GtkVideo:loop
property.description: If new media files should be set to loop.

property.name: GtkVideo:media-stream
property.description: The media-stream played

property.name: GtkViewport:child
property.description: The child widget.

property.name: GtkViewport:scroll-to-focus
property.description:
Whether to scroll when the focus changes.
Before 4.6.2, this property was mistakenly defaulting to FALSE, so if your code needs to work with older versions, consider setting it explicitly to TRUE.

property.name: GtkVolumeButton:use-symbolic
property.description:
Whether to use symbolic icons as the icons.
Note that if the symbolic icons are not available in your installed theme, then the normal (potentially colorful) icons will be used.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

signal.name: GtkWidget::destroy
signal.description:
Signals that all holders of a reference to the widget should release the reference that they hold.
May result in finalization of the widget if all references are released.
This signal is not suitable for saving widget state.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWidget::direction-changed
signal.description: Emitted when the text direction of a widget changes.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWidget::hide
signal.description: Emitted when @widget is hidden.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWidget::keynav-failed
signal.description:
Emitted if keyboard navigation fails.
See [method@Gtk.Widget.keynav_failed] for details.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

signal.return: true if stopping keyboard navigation is fine, false if the emitting widget should try to handle the keyboard navigation attempt in its parent widget

signal.name: GtkWidget::map
signal.description:
Emitted when @widget is going to be mapped.
A widget is mapped when the widget is visible (which is controlled with [property@Gtk.Widget:visible]) and all its parents up to the toplevel widget are also visible.
The `::map` signal can be used to determine whether a widget will be drawn, for instance it can resume an animation that was stopped during the emission of [signal@Gtk.Widget::unmap].

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWidget::mnemonic-activate
signal.description:
Emitted when a widget is activated via a mnemonic.
The default handler for this signal activates @widget if @group_cycling is false, or just makes @widget grab focus if @group_cycling is true.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

parameter.name: group_cycling
parameter.parameter_description: true if there are other widgets with the same mnemonic

signal.return: true to stop other handlers from being invoked for the event, false to propagate the event further

signal.name: GtkWidget::move-focus
signal.description:
Emitted when the focus is moved.
The `::move-focus` signal is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Tab</kbd> to move forward, and <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Tab</kbd> to move backward.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: the direction of the focus move

signal.name: GtkWidget::query-tooltip
signal.description:
Emitted when the widget’s tooltip is about to be shown.
This happens when the [property@Gtk.Widget:has-tooltip] property is true and the hover timeout has expired with the cursor hovering above @widget; or emitted when @widget got focus in keyboard mode.
Using the given coordinates, the signal handler should determine whether a tooltip should be shown for @widget. If this is the case true should be returned, false otherwise. Note that if @keyboard_mode is true, the values of @x and @y are undefined and should not be used.
The signal handler is free to manipulate @tooltip with the therefore destined function calls.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the x coordinate of the cursor position in widget coordinates

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the y coordinate of the cursor position in widget coordinates

parameter.name: keyboard_mode
parameter.parameter_description: true if the tooltip was triggered using the keyboard

signal.return: true if @tooltip should be shown right now, false otherwise

signal.name: GtkWidget::realize
signal.description:
Emitted when @widget is associated with a `GdkSurface`.
This means that [method@Gtk.Widget.realize] has been called or the widget has been mapped (that is, it is going to be drawn).

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWidget::show
signal.description: Emitted when @widget is shown.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWidget::state-flags-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the widget state changes.
See [method@Gtk.Widget.get_state_flags].

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWidget::unmap
signal.description:
Emitted when @widget is going to be unmapped.
A widget is unmapped when either it or any of its parents up to the toplevel widget have been set as hidden.
As `::unmap` indicates that a widget will not be shown any longer, it can be used to, for example, stop an animation on the widget.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWidget::unrealize
signal.description:
Emitted when the `GdkSurface` associated with @widget is destroyed.
This means that [method@Gtk.Widget.unrealize] has been called or the widget has been unmapped (that is, it is going to be hidden).

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget which emitted the signal

property.name: GtkWidget:can-focus
property.description:
Whether the widget or any of its descendents can accept the input focus.
This property is meant to be set by widget implementations, typically in their instance init function.

property.name: GtkWidget:can-target
property.description: Whether the widget can receive pointer events.

property.name: GtkWidget:css-classes
property.description: A list of css classes applied to this widget.

property.name: GtkWidget:css-name
property.description:
The name of this widget in the CSS tree.
This property is meant to be set by widget implementations, typically in their instance init function.

property.name: GtkWidget:cursor
property.description: The cursor used by @widget.

property.name: GtkWidget:focus-on-click
property.description:
Whether the widget should grab focus when it is clicked with the mouse.
This property is only relevant for widgets that can take focus.

property.name: GtkWidget:focusable
property.description: Whether this widget itself will accept the input focus.

property.name: GtkWidget:halign
property.description: How to distribute horizontal space if widget gets extra space.

property.name: GtkWidget:has-default
property.description: Whether the widget is the default widget.

property.name: GtkWidget:has-focus
property.description: Whether the widget has the input focus.

property.name: GtkWidget:has-tooltip
property.description:
Enables or disables the emission of the [signal@Gtk.Widget::query-tooltip] signal on @widget.
A true value indicates that @widget can have a tooltip, in this case the widget will be queried using [signal@Gtk.Widget::query-tooltip] to determine whether it will provide a tooltip or not.

property.name: GtkWidget:height-request
property.description:
Overrides for height request of the widget.
If this is -1, the natural request will be used.

property.name: GtkWidget:hexpand
property.description: Whether to expand horizontally.

property.name: GtkWidget:hexpand-set
property.description: Whether to use the `hexpand` property.

property.name: GtkWidget:layout-manager
property.description:
The [class@Gtk.LayoutManager] instance to use to compute the preferred size of the widget, and allocate its children.
This property is meant to be set by widget implementations, typically in their instance init function.

property.name: GtkWidget:limit-events
property.description:
Makes this widget act like a modal dialog, with respect to event delivery.
Global event controllers will not handle events with targets inside the widget, unless they are set up to ignore propagation limits. See [method@Gtk.EventController.set_propagation_limit].
Since: 4.18

property.name: GtkWidget:margin-bottom
property.description:
Margin on bottom side of widget.
This property adds margin outside of the widget's normal size request, the margin will be added in addition to the size from [method@Gtk.Widget.set_size_request] for example.

property.name: GtkWidget:margin-end
property.description:
Margin on end of widget, horizontally.
This property supports left-to-right and right-to-left text directions.
This property adds margin outside of the widget's normal size request, the margin will be added in addition to the size from [method@Gtk.Widget.set_size_request] for example.

property.name: GtkWidget:margin-start
property.description:
Margin on start of widget, horizontally.
This property supports left-to-right and right-to-left text directions.
This property adds margin outside of the widget's normal size request, the margin will be added in addition to the size from [method@Gtk.Widget.set_size_request] for example.

property.name: GtkWidget:margin-top
property.description:
Margin on top side of widget.
This property adds margin outside of the widget's normal size request, the margin will be added in addition to the size from [method@Gtk.Widget.set_size_request] for example.

property.name: GtkWidget:name
property.description: The name of the widget.

property.name: GtkWidget:opacity
property.description: The requested opacity of the widget.

property.name: GtkWidget:overflow
property.description:
How content outside the widget's content area is treated.
This property is meant to be set by widget implementations, typically in their instance init function.

property.name: GtkWidget:parent
property.description: The parent widget of this widget.

property.name: GtkWidget:receives-default
property.description: Whether the widget will receive the default action when it is focused.

property.name: GtkWidget:root
property.description:
The `GtkRoot` widget of the widget tree containing this widget.
This will be `NULL` if the widget is not contained in a root widget.

property.name: GtkWidget:scale-factor
property.description: The scale factor of the widget.

property.name: GtkWidget:sensitive
property.description: Whether the widget responds to input.

property.name: GtkWidget:tooltip-markup
property.description:
Sets the text of tooltip to be the given string, which is marked up with Pango markup.
Also see [method@Gtk.Tooltip.set_markup].
This is a convenience property which will take care of getting the tooltip shown if the given string is not `NULL`: [property@Gtk.Widget:has-tooltip] will automatically be set to true and there will be taken care of [signal@Gtk.Widget::query-tooltip] in the default signal handler.
Note that if both [property@Gtk.Widget:tooltip-text] and [property@Gtk.Widget:tooltip-markup] are set, the last one wins.

property.name: GtkWidget:tooltip-text
property.description:
Sets the text of tooltip to be the given string.
Also see [method@Gtk.Tooltip.set_text].
This is a convenience property which will take care of getting the tooltip shown if the given string is not `NULL`: [property@Gtk.Widget:has-tooltip] will automatically be set to true and there will be taken care of [signal@Gtk.Widget::query-tooltip] in the default signal handler.
Note that if both [property@Gtk.Widget:tooltip-text] and [property@Gtk.Widget:tooltip-markup] are set, the last one wins.

property.name: GtkWidget:valign
property.description: How to distribute vertical space if widget gets extra space.

property.name: GtkWidget:vexpand
property.description: Whether to expand vertically.

property.name: GtkWidget:vexpand-set
property.description: Whether to use the `vexpand` property.

property.name: GtkWidget:visible
property.description: Whether the widget is visible.

property.name: GtkWidget:width-request
property.description:
Overrides for width request of the widget.
If this is -1, the natural request will be used.

property.name: GtkWidgetPaintable:widget
property.description: The observed widget or %NULL if none.

signal.name: GtkWindow::activate-default
signal.description:
Emitted when the user activates the default widget.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The keybindings for this signal are all forms of the <kbd>Enter</kbd> key.

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the window which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWindow::activate-focus
signal.description:
Emitted when the user activates the currently focused widget of @window.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default binding for this signal is <kbd>␣</kbd>.

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the window which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWindow::close-request
signal.description:
Emitted when the user clicks on the close button of the window.
Return: true to stop other handlers from being invoked for the signal

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the window which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWindow::enable-debugging
signal.description:
Emitted when the user enables or disables interactive debugging.
When @toggle is true, interactive debugging is toggled on or off, when it is false, the debugger will be pointed at the widget under the pointer.
This is a [keybinding signal](class.SignalAction.html).
The default bindings for this signal are <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>I</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>D</kbd>.
Return: true if the key binding was handled

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the window which emitted the signal

signal.name: GtkWindow::keys-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the set of accelerators or mnemonics that are associated with the window changes.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Shortcut] and [class@Gtk.EventController] to implement keyboard shortcuts

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the window which emitted the signal

property.name: GtkWindow:application
property.description:
The `GtkApplication` associated with the window.
The application will be kept alive for at least as long as it has any windows associated with it (see g_application_hold() for a way to keep it alive without windows).
Normally, the connection between the application and the window will remain until the window is destroyed, but you can explicitly remove it by setting the this property to `NULL`.

property.name: GtkWindow:child
property.description: The child widget.

property.name: GtkWindow:decorated
property.description: Whether the window should have a frame (also known as *decorations*).

property.name: GtkWindow:default-height
property.description: The default height of the window.

property.name: GtkWindow:default-widget
property.description: The default widget.

property.name: GtkWindow:default-width
property.description: The default width of the window.

property.name: GtkWindow:deletable
property.description: Whether the window frame should have a close button.

property.name: GtkWindow:destroy-with-parent
property.description: If this window should be destroyed when the parent is destroyed.

property.name: GtkWindow:display
property.description: The display that will display this window.

property.name: GtkWindow:focus-visible
property.description:
Whether 'focus rectangles' are currently visible in this window.
This property is maintained by GTK based on user input and should not be set by applications.

property.name: GtkWindow:focus-widget
property.description: The focus widget.

property.name: GtkWindow:fullscreened
property.description:
Whether the window is fullscreen.
Setting this property is the equivalent of calling [method@Gtk.Window.fullscreen] or [method@Gtk.Window.unfullscreen]; either operation is asynchronous, which means you will need to connect to the ::notify signal in order to know whether the operation was successful.

property.name: GtkWindow:gravity
property.description:
The gravity to use when resizing the window programmatically.
Gravity describes which point of the window we want to keep fixed (meaning that the window will grow in the opposite direction). For example, a gravity of `GTK_WINDOW_GRAVITY_TOP_RIGHT` means that we want the to fix top right corner of the window.
Since: 4.20

property.name: GtkWindow:handle-menubar-accel
property.description:
Whether the window frame should handle <kbd>F10</kbd> for activating menubars.
Since: 4.2

property.name: GtkWindow:hide-on-close
property.description: If this window should be hidden instead of destroyed when the user clicks the close button.

property.name: GtkWindow:icon-name
property.description:
Specifies the name of the themed icon to use as the window icon.
See [class@Gtk.IconTheme] for more details.

property.name: GtkWindow:is-active
property.description: Whether the toplevel is the currently active window.

property.name: GtkWindow:maximized
property.description:
Whether the window is maximized.
Setting this property is the equivalent of calling [method@Gtk.Window.maximize] or [method@Gtk.Window.unmaximize]; either operation is asynchronous, which means you will need to connect to the ::notify signal in order to know whether the operation was successful.

property.name: GtkWindow:mnemonics-visible
property.description:
Whether mnemonics are currently visible in this window.
This property is maintained by GTK based on user input, and should not be set by applications.

property.name: GtkWindow:modal
property.description: If true, the window is modal.

property.name: GtkWindow:resizable
property.description: If true, users can resize the window.

property.name: GtkWindow:startup-id
property.description: A write-only property for setting window's startup notification identifier.

property.name: GtkWindow:suspended
property.description:
Whether the window is suspended.
See [method@Gtk.Window.is_suspended] for details about what suspended means.
Since: 4.12

property.name: GtkWindow:title
property.description: The title of the window.

property.name: GtkWindow:titlebar
property.description:
The titlebar widget.
Since: 4.6

property.name: GtkWindow:transient-for
property.description: The transient parent of the window.

property.name: GtkWindowButtonsQuartz:decoration-layout
property.description:
The decoration layout for window buttons.
If this property is not set, the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-decoration-layout] setting is used.

signal.name: GtkWindowClass::close_request
signal.description: Class handler for the [signal@Window::close-request] signal.
signal.return: Whether the window should be destroyed

property.name: GtkWindowControls:decoration-layout
property.description:
The decoration layout for window buttons.
If this property is not set, the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-decoration-layout] setting is used.

property.name: GtkWindowControls:empty
property.description: Whether the widget has any window buttons.

property.name: GtkWindowControls:side
property.description:
Whether the widget shows start or end side of the decoration layout.
See [property@Gtk.WindowControls:decoration_layout].

property.name: GtkWindowControls:use-native-controls
property.description:
Whether to show platform native close/minimize/maximize buttons.
For macOS, the [property@Gtk.HeaderBar:decoration-layout] property controls the use of native window controls.
On other platforms, this option has no effect.
See also [Using GTK on Apple macOS](osx.html?native-window-controls).
Since: 4.18

enum.name: GtkWindowGravity
enum.description:
Determines which point or edge of a window is meant to remain fixed when a window changes size.
Since: 4.20

parameter.name: GTK_WINDOW_GRAVITY_TOP_START
parameter.parameter_description: The top left or top right corner, depending on the text direction

parameter.name: GTK_WINDOW_GRAVITY_TOP_END
parameter.parameter_description: The top right or top left corner, depending on the text direction

parameter.name: GTK_WINDOW_GRAVITY_START
parameter.parameter_description: The left or right edge, depending on the text direction

parameter.name: GTK_WINDOW_GRAVITY_END
parameter.parameter_description: The right or left edge, depending on the text direction

parameter.name: GTK_WINDOW_GRAVITY_BOTTOM_START
parameter.parameter_description: The bottom left or top right corner, depending on the text direction

parameter.name: GTK_WINDOW_GRAVITY_BOTTOM_END
parameter.parameter_description: The bottom right or top left corner, depending on the text direction

property.name: GtkWindowHandle:child
property.description: The child widget.

enum.name: GtkWrapMode
enum.description: Describes a type of line wrapping.

parameter.name: GTK_WRAP_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: do not wrap lines; just make the text area wider

parameter.name: GTK_WRAP_CHAR
parameter.parameter_description: wrap text, breaking lines anywhere the cursor can appear (between characters, usually - if you want to be technical, between graphemes, see pango_get_log_attrs())

parameter.name: GTK_WRAP_WORD
parameter.parameter_description: wrap text, breaking lines in between words

parameter.name: GTK_WRAP_WORD_CHAR
parameter.parameter_description: wrap text, breaking lines in between words, or if that is not enough, also between graphemes

signal.name: GtkXdpOpenURI::handle-open-directory
signal.description:
Signal emitted when a remote caller is invoking the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenDirectory">OpenDirectory()</link> D-Bus method.
If a signal handler returns %TRUE, it means the signal handler will handle the invocation (e.g. take a reference to @invocation and eventually call gtk_xdp_open_uri_complete_open_directory() or e.g. g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() on it) and no other signal handlers will run. If no signal handler handles the invocation, the %G_DBUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN_METHOD error is returned.
signal.return: %G_DBUS_METHOD_INVOCATION_HANDLED or %TRUE if the invocation was handled, %G_DBUS_METHOD_INVOCATION_UNHANDLED or %FALSE to let other signal handlers run.

signal.name: GtkXdpOpenURI::handle-open-file
signal.description:
Signal emitted when a remote caller is invoking the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenFile">OpenFile()</link> D-Bus method.
If a signal handler returns %TRUE, it means the signal handler will handle the invocation (e.g. take a reference to @invocation and eventually call gtk_xdp_open_uri_complete_open_file() or e.g. g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() on it) and no other signal handlers will run. If no signal handler handles the invocation, the %G_DBUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN_METHOD error is returned.
signal.return: %G_DBUS_METHOD_INVOCATION_HANDLED or %TRUE if the invocation was handled, %G_DBUS_METHOD_INVOCATION_UNHANDLED or %FALSE to let other signal handlers run.

signal.name: GtkXdpOpenURI::handle-open-uri
signal.description:
Signal emitted when a remote caller is invoking the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenURI">OpenURI()</link> D-Bus method.
If a signal handler returns %TRUE, it means the signal handler will handle the invocation (e.g. take a reference to @invocation and eventually call gtk_xdp_open_uri_complete_open_uri() or e.g. g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() on it) and no other signal handlers will run. If no signal handler handles the invocation, the %G_DBUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN_METHOD error is returned.
signal.return: %G_DBUS_METHOD_INVOCATION_HANDLED or %TRUE if the invocation was handled, %G_DBUS_METHOD_INVOCATION_UNHANDLED or %FALSE to let other signal handlers run.

signal.name: GtkXdpOpenURI::handle-scheme-supported
signal.description:
Signal emitted when a remote caller is invoking the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.SchemeSupported">SchemeSupported()</link> D-Bus method.
If a signal handler returns %TRUE, it means the signal handler will handle the invocation (e.g. take a reference to @invocation and eventually call gtk_xdp_open_uri_complete_scheme_supported() or e.g. g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() on it) and no other signal handlers will run. If no signal handler handles the invocation, the %G_DBUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN_METHOD error is returned.
signal.return: %G_DBUS_METHOD_INVOCATION_HANDLED or %TRUE if the invocation was handled, %G_DBUS_METHOD_INVOCATION_UNHANDLED or %FALSE to let other signal handlers run.

property.name: GtkXdpOpenURI:version
property.description:
Represents the D-Bus property <link linkend="gdbus-property-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.version">"version"</link>.
Since the D-Bus property for this #GObject property is readable but not writable, it is meaningful to read from it on both the client- and service-side. It is only meaningful, however, to write to it on the service-side.

signal.name: GtkaccessibleInterface::get_first_accessible_child
signal.description:
Retrieves the first accessible child of an accessible object.
Since: 4.10
signal.return: an accessible object

signal.name: GtkaccessibleInterface::get_next_accessible_sibling
signal.description:
Retrieves the next accessible sibling of an accessible object.
Since: 4.10
signal.return: an accessible object

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_add_credit_section
function.description: Creates a new section in the "Credits" page.

parameter.parameter_description: the people who belong to that section

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_artists
function.description: Returns the names of the artists which are displayed in the credits page.
function.return: A `NULL`-terminated string array containing the artists

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_authors
function.description: Returns the names of the authors which are displayed in the credits page.
function.return: A `NULL`-terminated string array containing the authors

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_comments
function.description: Returns the comments string.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_copyright
function.description: Returns the copyright string.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_documenters
function.description: Returns the name of the documenters which are displayed in the credits page.
function.return: A `NULL`-terminated string array containing the documenters

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_license
function.description: Returns the license information.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_program_name
function.description: Returns the program name displayed in the about dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_system_information
function.description: Returns the system information that is shown in the about dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_translator_credits
function.description: Returns the translator credits string which is displayed in the credits page.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_version
function.description: Returns the version string.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_website
function.description: Returns the website URL.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_website_label
