function.return: The label used for the website link

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_wrap_license
function.description: Returns whether the license text in the about dialog is automatically wrapped.
function.return: `TRUE` if the license text is wrapped

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkAboutDialog`.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_artists
function.description: Sets the names of the artists to be displayed in the "Credits" page.

parameter.name: artists
parameter.parameter_description: the authors of the artwork of the application

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_authors
function.description: Sets the names of the authors which are displayed in the "Credits" page of the about dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_comments
function.description:
Sets the comments string to display in the about dialog.
This should be a short string of one or two lines.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_copyright
function.description:
Sets the copyright string to display in the about dialog.
This should be a short string of one or two lines.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_documenters
function.description: Sets the names of the documenters which are displayed in the "Credits" page.

parameter.name: documenters
parameter.parameter_description: the authors of the documentation of the application

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_license
function.description:
Sets the license information to be displayed in the about dialog.
If `license` is `NULL`, the license page is hidden.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_license_type
function.description:
Sets the license of the application showing the about dialog from a list of known licenses.
This function overrides the license set using [method@Gtk.AboutDialog.set_license].

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_logo
function.description: Sets the logo in the about dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_logo_icon_name
function.description: Sets the icon name to be displayed as logo in the about dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_program_name
function.description:
Sets the name to display in the about dialog.
If `name` is not set, the string returned by `g_get_application_name()` is used.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_system_information
function.description:
Sets the system information to be displayed in the about dialog.
If `system_information` is `NULL`, the system information page is hidden.
See [property@Gtk.AboutDialog:system-information].

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_translator_credits
function.description:
Sets the translator credits string which is displayed in the credits page.
The intended use for this string is to display the translator of the language which is currently used in the user interface. Using `gettext()`, a simple way to achieve that is to mark the string for translation:
```c GtkWidget *about = gtk_about_dialog_new (); gtk_about_dialog_set_translator_credits (GTK_ABOUT_DIALOG (about), _("translator-credits")); ```
It is a good idea to use the customary `msgid` “translator-credits” for this purpose, since translators will already know the purpose of that `msgid`, and since `GtkAboutDialog` will detect if “translator-credits” is untranslated and omit translator credits.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_version
function.description: Sets the version string to display in the about dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_website
function.description: Sets the URL to use for the website link.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_website_label
function.description: Sets the label to be used for the website link.

parameter.name: website_label
parameter.parameter_description: the label used for the website link

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_wrap_license
function.description: Sets whether the license text in the about dialog should be automatically wrapped.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_get_default_mod_mask
function.description:
Gets the modifier mask.
The modifier mask determines which modifiers are considered significant for keyboard accelerators. This includes all keyboard modifiers except for `GDK_LOCK_MASK`.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_get_label
function.description: Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string which can be used to represent the accelerator to the user.
function.return: a newly-allocated string representing the accelerator

function.name: gtk_accelerator_get_label_with_keycode
function.description:
Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string that can be displayed to the user.
The string may be translated.
This function is similar to [func@Gtk.accelerator_get_label], but handling keycodes. This is only useful for system-level components, applications should use [func@Gtk.accelerator_get_label] instead.
function.return: a newly-allocated string representing the accelerator

function.name: gtk_accelerator_name
function.description:
Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string that can be parsed by [func@Gtk.accelerator_parse].
For example, if you pass in `GDK_KEY_q` and `GDK_CONTROL_MASK`, this function returns `<Control>q`.
If you need to display accelerators in the user interface, see [func@Gtk.accelerator_get_label].

function.name: gtk_accelerator_name_with_keycode
function.description:
Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string that can be parsed by [func@Gtk.accelerator_parse_with_keycode].
This is similar to [func@Gtk.accelerator_name] but handling keycodes. This is only useful for system-level components, applications should use [func@Gtk.accelerator_name] instead.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_parse
function.description:
Parses a string representing an accelerator.
The format looks like “`<Control>a`” or “`<Shift><Alt>F1`”.
The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as “`<Ctl>`” and “`<Ctrl>`”.
Key names are parsed using [func@Gdk.keyval_from_name]. For character keys the name is not the symbol, but the lowercase name, e.g. one would use “`<Ctrl>minus`” instead of “`<Ctrl>-`”.
Modifiers are enclosed in angular brackets `<>`, and match the [flags@Gdk.ModifierType] mask:
- `<Shift>` for `GDK_SHIFT_MASK` - `<Ctrl>` for `GDK_CONTROL_MASK` - `<Alt>` for `GDK_ALT_MASK` - `<Meta>` for `GDK_META_MASK` - `<Super>` for `GDK_SUPER_MASK` - `<Hyper>` for `GDK_HYPER_MASK`
If the parse operation fails, @accelerator_key and @accelerator_mods will be set to 0 (zero).

parameter.name: accelerator_mods
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator modifier mask

function.name: gtk_accelerator_parse_with_keycode
function.description:
Parses a string representing an accelerator.
This is similar to [func@Gtk.accelerator_parse] but handles keycodes as well. This is only useful for system-level components, applications should use [func@Gtk.accelerator_parse] instead.
If @accelerator_codes is given and the result stored in it is non-%NULL, the result must be freed with g_free().
If a keycode is present in the accelerator and no @accelerator_codes is given, the parse will fail.
If the parse fails, @accelerator_key, @accelerator_mods and @accelerator_codes will be set to 0 (zero).

parameter.name: accelerator_mods
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator modifier mask

function.name: gtk_accelerator_valid
function.description:
Determines whether a given keyval and modifier mask constitute a valid keyboard accelerator.
For example, the `GDK_KEY_a` keyval plus `GDK_CONTROL_MASK` mask is valid, and matches the “Ctrl+a” accelerator. But, you can't, for instance, use the `GDK_KEY_Control_L` keyval as an accelerator.
function.return: true if the accelerator is valid

function.name: gtk_accessible_announce
function.description:
Requests the user's screen reader to announce the given message.
This kind of notification is useful for messages that either have only a visual representation or that are not exposed visually at all, e.g. a notification about a successful operation.
Also, by using this API, you can ensure that the message does not interrupts the user's current screen reader output.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_accessible_get_accessible_parent
function.description:
Retrieves the accessible parent for an accessible object.
This function returns `NULL` for top level widgets.
Since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_accessible_get_accessible_role
function.description: Retrieves the accessible role of an accessible object.

function.name: gtk_accessible_get_at_context
function.description:
Retrieves the implementation for the given accessible object.
Since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_accessible_get_bounds
function.description:
Queries the coordinates and dimensions of this accessible
This functionality can be overridden by `GtkAccessible` implementations, e.g. to get the bounds from an ignored child widget.
Since: 4.10

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the x coordinate of the top left corner of the accessible

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the y coordinate of the top left corner of the widget

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width of the accessible object

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the height of the accessible object

function.return: true if the bounds are valid, and false otherwise

function.name: gtk_accessible_get_first_accessible_child
function.description:
Retrieves the first accessible child of an accessible object.
since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_accessible_get_next_accessible_sibling
function.description:
Retrieves the next accessible sibling of an accessible object
since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_accessible_get_platform_state
function.description:
Queries a platform state, such as focus.
This functionality can be overridden by `GtkAccessible` implementations, e.g. to get platform state from an ignored child widget, as is the case for `GtkText` wrappers.
Since: 4.10
function.return: the value of state for the accessible

function.name: gtk_accessible_list_get_objects
function.description:
Gets the list of objects this boxed type holds.
Since: 4.14
function.return: a shallow copy of the objects

function.name: gtk_accessible_list_new_from_array
function.description:
Allocates a new list of accessible objects.
Since: 4.14
function.return: the newly created list of accessible objects

function.name: gtk_accessible_list_new_from_list
function.description:
Allocates a new `GtkAccessibleList`, doing a shallow copy of the passed list of accessible objects
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_accessible_property_init_value
function.description:
Initializes @value with the appropriate type for the @property.
This function is mostly meant for language bindings, in conjunction with gtk_accessible_update_property_value().

function.name: gtk_accessible_relation_init_value
function.description:
Initializes @value with the appropriate type for the @relation.
This function is mostly meant for language bindings, in conjunction with gtk_accessible_update_relation_value().

function.name: gtk_accessible_reset_property
function.description: Resets the accessible property to its default value.

function.name: gtk_accessible_reset_relation
function.description: Resets the accessible relation to its default value.

function.name: gtk_accessible_reset_state
function.description: Resets the accessible state to its default value.

function.name: gtk_accessible_set_accessible_parent
function.description:
Sets the parent and sibling of an accessible object.
This function is meant to be used by accessible implementations that are not part of the widget hierarchy, and but act as a logical bridge between widgets. For instance, if a widget creates an object that holds metadata for each child, and you want that object to implement the `GtkAccessible` interface, you will use this function to ensure that the parent of each child widget is the metadata object, and the parent of each metadata object is the container widget.
Since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_accessible_state_init_value
function.description:
Initializes @value with the appropriate type for the @state.
This function is mostly meant for language bindings, in conjunction with gtk_accessible_update_relation_state().

function.name: gtk_accessible_text_update_caret_position
function.description:
Updates the position of the caret.
Implementations of the `GtkAccessibleText` interface should call this function every time the caret has moved, in order to notify assistive technologies.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_accessible_text_update_contents
function.description:
Notifies assistive technologies of a change in contents.
Implementations of the `GtkAccessibleText` interface should call this function every time their contents change as the result of an operation, like an insertion or a removal.
Note: If the change is a deletion, this function must be called *before* removing the contents, if it is an insertion, it must be called *after* inserting the new contents.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: change
parameter.parameter_description: the type of change in the contents

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: the starting offset of the change, in characters

parameter.name: end
parameter.parameter_description: the end offset of the change, in characters

function.name: gtk_accessible_text_update_selection_bound
function.description:
Updates the boundary of the selection.
Implementations of the `GtkAccessibleText` interface should call this function every time the selection has moved, in order to notify assistive technologies.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_next_accessible_sibling
function.description:
Updates the next accessible sibling.
That might be useful when a new child of a custom accessible is created, and it needs to be linked to a previous child.
Since: 4.10

parameter.name: new_sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the new next accessible sibling to set

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_platform_state
function.description:
Informs ATs that the platform state has changed.
This function should be used by `GtkAccessible` implementations that have a platform state but are not widgets. Widgets handle platform states automatically.
Since: 4.18

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_property
function.description:
Updates a list of accessible properties.
See the [enum@Gtk.AccessibleProperty] documentation for the value types of accessible properties.
This function should be called by `GtkWidget` types whenever an accessible property change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
Example: ```c value = gtk_adjustment_get_value (adjustment); gtk_accessible_update_property (GTK_ACCESSIBLE (spin_button), GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_VALUE_NOW, value, -1); ```

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: a list of property and value pairs, terminated by -1

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_property_value
function.description:
Updates an array of accessible properties.
This function should be called by `GtkWidget` types whenever an accessible property change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
This function is meant to be used by language bindings.

parameter.name: n_properties
parameter.parameter_description: the number of accessible properties to set

parameter.name: values
parameter.parameter_description: an array of `GValues`, one for each property

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_relation
function.description:
Updates a list of accessible relations.
This function should be called by `GtkWidget` types whenever an accessible relation change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
If the [enum@Gtk.AccessibleRelation] requires a list of references, you should pass each reference individually, followed by `NULL`, e.g.
```c gtk_accessible_update_relation (accessible, GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_CONTROLS, ref1, NULL, GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_LABELLED_BY, ref1, ref2, ref3, NULL, -1); ```

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: a list of relation and value pairs, terminated by -1

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_relation_value
function.description:
Updates an array of accessible relations.
This function should be called by `GtkWidget` types whenever an accessible relation change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
This function is meant to be used by language bindings.

parameter.name: n_relations
parameter.parameter_description: the number of accessible relations to set

parameter.name: values
parameter.parameter_description: an array of `GValues`, one for each relation

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_state
function.description:
Updates a list of accessible states.
See the [enum@Gtk.AccessibleState] documentation for the value types of accessible states.
This function should be called by `GtkWidget` types whenever an accessible state change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
Example:
```c value = GTK_ACCESSIBLE_TRISTATE_MIXED; gtk_accessible_update_state (GTK_ACCESSIBLE (check_button), GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_CHECKED, value, -1); ```

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: a list of state and value pairs, terminated by -1

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_state_value
function.description:
Updates an array of accessible states.
This function should be called by `GtkWidget` types whenever an accessible state change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
This function is meant to be used by language bindings.

parameter.name: n_states
parameter.parameter_description: the number of accessible states to set

parameter.name: values
parameter.parameter_description: an array of `GValues`, one for each state

function.name: gtk_action_bar_get_center_widget
function.description: Retrieves the center bar widget of the bar.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_get_revealed
function.description: Gets whether the contents of the action bar are revealed.
function.return: the current value of the [property@Gtk.ActionBar:revealed] property

function.name: gtk_action_bar_new
function.description: Creates a new action bar widget.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_pack_end
function.description: Adds a child to the action bar, packed with reference to the end of the action bar.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_pack_start
function.description: Adds a child to the action, packed with reference to the start of the action bar.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_remove
function.description: Removes a child from the action bar.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_set_center_widget
function.description: Sets the center widget for the action bar.

parameter.name: center_widget
parameter.parameter_description: a widget to use for the center

function.name: gtk_action_bar_set_revealed
function.description:
Reveals or conceals the content of the action bar.
Note: this does not show or hide the action bar in the [property@Gtk.Widget:visible] sense, so revealing has no effect if the action bar is hidden.

parameter.name: revealed
parameter.parameter_description: the new value for the property

function.name: gtk_action_observable_register_observer
function.description: Registers @observer as being interested in changes to @action_name on @observable.

parameter.name: observer
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkActionObserver` to which the events will be reported

function.name: gtk_action_observable_unregister_observer
function.description:
Removes the registration of @observer as being interested in changes to @action_name on @observable.
If the observer was registered multiple times, it must be unregistered an equal number of times.

parameter.name: observer
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkActionObserver` to which the events will be reported

function.name: gtk_actionable_get_action_name
function.description: Gets the action name for @actionable.

function.name: gtk_actionable_get_action_target_value
function.description: Gets the current target value of @actionable.

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_action_name
function.description:
Specifies the name of the action with which this widget should be associated.
If @action_name is %NULL then the widget will be unassociated from any previous action.
Usually this function is used when the widget is located (or will be located) within the hierarchy of a `GtkApplicationWindow`.
Names are of the form “win.save” or “app.quit” for actions on the containing [class@ApplicationWindow] or its associated [class@Application], respectively. This is the same form used for actions in the [class@Gio.Menu] associated with the window.

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_action_target
function.description:
Sets the target of an actionable widget.
This is a convenience function that calls [ctor@GLib.Variant.new] for @format_string and uses the result to call [method@Gtk.Actionable.set_action_target_value].
If you are setting a string-valued target and want to set the action name at the same time, you can use [method@Gtk.Actionable.set_detailed_action_name].

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_action_target_value
function.description:
Sets the target value of an actionable widget.
If @target_value is %NULL then the target value is unset.
The target value has two purposes. First, it is used as the parameter to activation of the action associated with the `GtkActionable` widget. Second, it is used to determine if the widget should be rendered as “active” — the widget is active if the state is equal to the given target.
Consider the example of associating a set of buttons with a [iface@Gio.Action] with string state in a typical “radio button” situation. Each button will be associated with the same action, but with a different target value for that action. Clicking on a particular button will activate the action with the target of that button, which will typically cause the action’s state to change to that value. Since the action’s state is now equal to the target value of the button, the button will now be rendered as active (and the other buttons, with different targets, rendered inactive).

parameter.name: target_value
parameter.parameter_description: a [struct@GLib.Variant] to set as the target value

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_detailed_action_name
function.description:
Sets the action-name and associated string target value of an actionable widget.
@detailed_action_name is a string in the format accepted by [func@Gio.Action.parse_detailed_name].

function.name: gtk_activate_action_get
function.description:
Gets the activate action.
This is an action that calls gtk_widget_activate() on the given widget upon activation.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_clamp_page
function.description:
Updates the value of the adjustment to ensure that the given range is contained in the current page.
The current page goes from `value` to `value` + `page-size`. If the range is larger than the page size, then only the start of it will be in the current page.
A [signal@Gtk.Adjustment::value-changed] signal will be emitted if the value is changed.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_configure
function.description:
Sets all properties of the adjustment at once.
Use this function to avoid multiple emissions of the [signal@Gtk.Adjustment::changed] signal. See [method@Gtk.Adjustment.set_lower] for an alternative way of compressing multiple emissions of [signal@Gtk.Adjustment::changed] into one.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_lower
function.description: Retrieves the minimum value of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_minimum_increment
function.description: Gets the smaller of step increment and page increment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_page_increment
function.description: Retrieves the page increment of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_page_size
function.description: Retrieves the page size of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_step_increment
function.description: Retrieves the step increment of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_upper
function.description: Retrieves the maximum value of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_value
function.description: Gets the current value of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkAdjustment`.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_lower
function.description:
Sets the minimum value of the adjustment.
When setting multiple adjustment properties via their individual setters, multiple [signal@Gtk.Adjustment::changed] signals will be emitted. However, since the emission of the [signal@Gtk.Adjustment::changed] signal is tied to the emission of the ::notify signals of the changed properties, it’s possible to compress the [signal@Gtk.Adjustment::changed] signals into one by calling g_object_freeze_notify() and g_object_thaw_notify() around the calls to the individual setters.
Alternatively, using a single g_object_set() for all the properties to change, or using [method@Gtk.Adjustment.configure] has the same effect.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_page_increment
function.description:
Sets the page increment of the adjustment.
See [method@Gtk.Adjustment.set_lower] about how to compress multiple emissions of the [signal@Gtk.Adjustment::changed] signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_page_size
function.description:
Sets the page size of the adjustment.
See [method@Gtk.Adjustment.set_lower] about how to compress multiple emissions of the [signal@Gtk.Adjustment::changed] signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_step_increment
function.description:
Sets the step increment of the adjustment.
See [method@Gtk.Adjustment.set_lower] about how to compress multiple emissions of the [signal@Gtk.Adjustment::changed] signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_upper
function.description:
Sets the maximum value of the adjustment.
Note that values will be restricted by `upper - page-size` if the page-size property is nonzero.
See [method@Gtk.Adjustment.set_lower] about how to compress multiple emissions of the [signal@Gtk.Adjustment::changed] signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_value
function.description:
Sets the `GtkAdjustment` value.
The value is clamped to lie between [property@Gtk.Adjustment:lower] and [property@Gtk.Adjustment:upper].
Note that for adjustments which are used in a `GtkScrollbar`, the effective range of allowed values goes from [property@Gtk.Adjustment:lower] to [property@Gtk.Adjustment:upper] - [property@Gtk.Adjustment:page-size].

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_choose
function.description:
Shows the alert to the user.
It is ok to pass `NULL` for the callback if the alert does not have more than one button. A simpler API for this case is [method@Gtk.AlertDialog.show].
Since: 4.10

parameter.name: cancellable
parameter.parameter_description: a cancellable to cancel the operation

parameter.name: callback

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_choose_finish

Finishes the [method@Gtk.AlertDialog.choose] call.

function.return: the index of the button that was clicked, or -1 if the dialog was cancelled and [property@Gtk.AlertDialog:cancel-button] is not set

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_get_buttons

Returns the button labels for the alert.

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_get_cancel_button
function.description:
Returns the index of the cancel button.
Since: 4.10
function.return: the index of the cancel button, or -1

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_get_default_button
function.description:
Returns the index of the default button.
Since: 4.10
function.return: the index of the default button, or -1

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_get_detail

Returns the detail text that will be shown in the alert.

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_get_message

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_new

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_set_buttons

See [property@Gtk.AlertDialog:cancel-button] for details of how this value is used.

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_set_default_button

Sets the index of the default button.

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_set_detail

Sets the detail text that will be shown in the alert.

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_set_message

Sets the message that will be shown in the alert.
Since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_set_modal

Sets whether the alert blocks interaction with the parent window while it is presented.
Since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_alert_dialog_show
function.description:
Shows the alert to the user.
This function is a simpler version of [method@Gtk.AlertDialog.choose] intended for dialogs with a single button.
If you want to cancel the dialog or if the alert has more than one button, you should use that function instead and provide it with a [class@Gio.Cancellable] and callback respectively.
Since: 4.10
