function.name: gtk_application_add_window
function.description:
Adds a window to the application.
This call can only happen after the application has started; typically, you should add new application windows in response to the emission of the [signal@GIO.Application::activate] signal.
This call is equivalent to setting the [property@Gtk.Window:application] property of the window to @application.
Normally, the connection between the application and the window will remain until the window is destroyed, but you can explicitly remove it with [method@Gtk.Application.remove_window].
GTK will keep the application running as long as it has any windows.

function.name: gtk_application_get_accels_for_action
function.description: Gets the accelerators that are currently associated with the given action.

parameter.name: detailed_action_name
parameter.parameter_description: a detailed action name, specifying an action and target to obtain accelerators for

function.name: gtk_application_get_actions_for_accel
function.description:
Returns the list of actions (possibly empty) that the accelerator maps to.
Each item in the list is a detailed action name in the usual form.
This might be useful to discover if an accel already exists in order to prevent installation of a conflicting accelerator (from an accelerator editor or a plugin system, for example). Note that having more than one action per accelerator may not be a bad thing and might make sense in cases where the actions never appear in the same context.
In case there are no actions for a given accelerator, an empty array is returned. `NULL` is never returned.
It is a programmer error to pass an invalid accelerator string.
If you are unsure, check it with [func@Gtk.accelerator_parse] first.

parameter.name: accel
parameter.parameter_description: an accelerator that can be parsed by [func@Gtk.accelerator_parse]

function.name: gtk_application_get_active_window
function.description:
Gets the “active” window for the application.
The active window is the one that was most recently focused (within the application). This window may not have the focus at the moment if another application has it — this is just the most recently-focused window within this application.

function.name: gtk_application_get_menu_by_id
function.description:
Gets a menu from automatically loaded resources.
See [the section on Automatic resources](class.Application.html#automatic-resources) for more information.

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the menu to look up

function.return: Gets the menu with the given ID from the automatically loaded resources

function.name: gtk_application_get_menubar
function.description: Returns the menu model for the menu bar of the application.
function.return: the menubar for windows of the application

function.name: gtk_application_get_window_by_id
function.description:
Returns the window with the given ID.
The ID of a `GtkApplicationWindow` can be retrieved with [method@Gtk.ApplicationWindow.get_id].
function.return: the window for the given ID

function.name: gtk_application_get_windows
function.description:
Gets a list of the window associated with the application.
The list is sorted by most recently focused window, such that the first element is the currently focused window. (Useful for choosing a parent for a transient window.)
The list that is returned should not be modified in any way. It will only remain valid until the next focus change or window creation or deletion.

function.name: gtk_application_inhibit
function.description:
Informs the session manager that certain types of actions should be inhibited.
This is not guaranteed to work on all platforms and for all types of actions.
Applications should invoke this method when they begin an operation that should not be interrupted, such as creating a CD or DVD. The types of actions that may be blocked are specified by the @flags parameter. When the application completes the operation it should call [method@Gtk.Application.uninhibit] to remove the inhibitor. Note that an application can have multiple inhibitors, and all of them must be individually removed. Inhibitors are also cleared when the application exits.
Applications should not expect that they will always be able to block the action. In most cases, users will be given the option to force the action to take place.
The @reason message should be short and to the point.
If a window is given, the session manager may point the user to this window to find out more about why the action is inhibited.
The cookie that is returned by this function should be used as an argument to [method@Gtk.Application.uninhibit] in order to remove the request.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: what types of actions should be inhibited

parameter.name: reason
parameter.parameter_description: a short, human-readable string that explains why these operations are inhibited

function.return: A non-zero cookie that is used to uniquely identify this, or 0 if the platform does not support inhibiting or the request failed for some reason

function.name: gtk_application_list_action_descriptions
function.description:
Lists the detailed action names which have associated accelerators.
See [method@Gtk.Application.set_accels_for_action].

function.name: gtk_application_new
function.description:
Creates a new application instance.
When using `GtkApplication`, it is not necessary to call [func@Gtk.init] manually. It is called as soon as the application gets registered as the primary instance.
Concretely, [func@Gtk.init] is called in the default handler for the `GApplication::startup` signal. Therefore, `GtkApplication` subclasses should always chain up in their [vfunc@GIO.Application.startup] handler before using any GTK API.
Note that commandline arguments are not passed to [func@Gtk.init].
If `application_id` is not `NULL`, then it must be valid. See [func@Gio.Application.id_is_valid].
If no application ID is given then some features (most notably application uniqueness) will be disabled.

function.name: gtk_application_remove_window
function.description:
Remove a window from the application.
If the window belongs to the application then this call is equivalent to setting the [property@Gtk.Window:application] property of the window to `NULL`.
The application may stop running as a result of a call to this function, if the window was the last window of the application.

function.name: gtk_application_set_accels_for_action
function.description:
Sets zero or more keyboard accelerators that will trigger the given action.
The first item in @accels will be the primary accelerator, which may be displayed in the UI.
To remove all accelerators for an action, use an empty, zero-terminated array for @accels.
For the @detailed_action_name, see [func@Gio.Action.parse_detailed_name] and [Gio.Action.print_detailed_name].

parameter.name: detailed_action_name
parameter.parameter_description: a detailed action name, specifying an action and target to associate accelerators with

parameter.name: accels
parameter.parameter_description: a list of accelerators in the format understood by [func@Gtk.accelerator_parse]

function.name: gtk_application_set_menubar
function.description:
Sets or unsets the menubar for windows of the application.
This is a menubar in the traditional sense.
This can only be done in the primary instance of the application, after it has been registered. [vfunc@GIO.Application.startup] is a good place to call this.
Depending on the desktop environment, this may appear at the top of each window, or at the top of the screen. In some environments, if both the application menu and the menubar are set, the application menu will be presented as if it were the first item of the menubar. Other environments treat the two as completely separate — for example, the application menu may be rendered by the desktop shell while the menubar (if set) remains in each individual window.
Use the base `GActionMap` interface to add actions, to respond to the user selecting these menu items.

function.name: gtk_application_uninhibit
function.description:
Removes an inhibitor that has been previously established.
See [method@Gtk.Application.inhibit].
Inhibitors are also cleared when the application exits.

parameter.name: cookie
parameter.parameter_description: a cookie that was returned by [method@Gtk.Application.inhibit]

function.name: gtk_application_window_get_help_overlay
function.description:
Gets the `GtkShortcutsWindow` that is associated with @window.
See [method@Gtk.ApplicationWindow.set_help_overlay].
Deprecated: 4.18: `GtkShortcutsWindow` will be removed in GTK 5
function.return: the help overlay associated with the window

function.name: gtk_application_window_get_id
function.description:
Returns the unique ID of the window.
If the window has not yet been added to a `GtkApplication`, returns `0`.
function.return: the unique ID for the window, or `0` if the window has not yet been added to an application

function.name: gtk_application_window_get_show_menubar
function.description: Returns whether the window will display a menubar for the app menu and menubar as needed.
function.return: True if the window will display a menubar when needed

function.name: gtk_application_window_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkApplicationWindow`.

function.name: gtk_application_window_set_help_overlay
function.description:
Associates a shortcuts window with the application window.
Additionally, sets up an action with the name `win.show-help-overlay` to present it.
The window takes responsibility for destroying the help overlay.
Deprecated: 4.18: `GtkShortcutsWindow` will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_application_window_set_show_menubar
function.description: Sets whether the window will display a menubar for the app menu and menubar as needed.

parameter.name: show_menubar
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show a menubar when needed

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @self.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_get_obey_child
function.description: Returns whether the child's size request should override the set aspect ratio of the `GtkAspectFrame`.
function.return: whether to obey the child's size request

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_get_ratio
function.description: Returns the desired aspect ratio of the child.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_get_xalign
function.description: Returns the horizontal alignment of the child within the allocation of the `GtkAspectFrame`.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_get_yalign
function.description: Returns the vertical alignment of the child within the allocation of the `GtkAspectFrame`.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_new
function.description: Create a new `GtkAspectFrame`.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: Horizontal alignment of the child within the parent. Ranges from 0.0 (left aligned) to 1.0 (right aligned)

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: Vertical alignment of the child within the parent. Ranges from 0.0 (top aligned) to 1.0 (bottom aligned)

parameter.name: obey_child
parameter.parameter_description: If %TRUE, @ratio is ignored, and the aspect ratio is taken from the requistion of the child.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @self.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_set_obey_child
function.description: Sets whether the aspect ratio of the child's size request should override the set aspect ratio of the `GtkAspectFrame`.

parameter.name: obey_child
parameter.parameter_description: If %TRUE, @ratio is ignored, and the aspect ratio is taken from the requisition of the child.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_set_ratio
function.description: Sets the desired aspect ratio of the child.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_set_xalign
function.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the child within the allocation of the `GtkAspectFrame`.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: horizontal alignment, from 0.0 (left aligned) to 1.0 (right aligned)

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_set_yalign
function.description: Sets the vertical alignment of the child within the allocation of the `GtkAspectFrame`.

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: horizontal alignment, from 0.0 (top aligned) to 1.0 (bottom aligned)

function.name: gtk_assistant_add_action_widget
function.description:
Adds a widget to the action area of a `GtkAssistant`.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_append_page
function.description:
Appends a page to the @assistant.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5
function.return: the index (starting at 0) of the inserted page

function.name: gtk_assistant_commit
function.description:
Erases the visited page history.
GTK will then hide the back button on the current page, and removes the cancel button from subsequent pages.
Use this when the information provided up to the current page is hereafter deemed permanent and cannot be modified or undone. For example, showing a progress page to track a long-running, unreversible operation after the user has clicked apply on a confirmation page.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_current_page
function.description:
Returns the page number of the current page.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5
function.return: The index (starting from 0) of the current page in the @assistant, or -1 if the @assistant has no pages, or no current page

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_n_pages
function.description:
Returns the number of pages in the @assistant
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5
function.return: the number of pages in the @assistant

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_nth_page
function.description:
Returns the child widget contained in page number @page_num.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: page_num
parameter.parameter_description: the index of a page in the @assistant, or -1 to get the last page

function.return: the child widget, or %NULL if @page_num is out of bounds

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_page
function.description:
Returns the `GtkAssistantPage` object for @child.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_page_complete
function.description:
Gets whether @page is complete.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_page_title
function.description:
Gets the title for @page.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_page_type
function.description:
Gets the page type of @page.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_pages
function.description:
Gets a list model of the assistant pages.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5
function.return: A list model of the pages.

function.name: gtk_assistant_insert_page
function.description:
Inserts a page in the @assistant at a given position.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the index (starting at 0) at which to insert the page, or -1 to append the page to the @assistant

function.return: the index (starting from 0) of the inserted page

function.name: gtk_assistant_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkAssistant`.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_next_page
function.description:
Navigate to the next page.
It is a programming error to call this function when there is no next page.
This function is for use when creating pages of the %GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CUSTOM type.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_page_get_child
function.description:
Returns the child to which @page belongs.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_prepend_page
function.description:
Prepends a page to the @assistant.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5
function.return: the index (starting at 0) of the inserted page

function.name: gtk_assistant_previous_page
function.description:
Navigate to the previous visited page.
It is a programming error to call this function when no previous page is available.
This function is for use when creating pages of the %GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CUSTOM type.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_remove_action_widget
function.description:
Removes a widget from the action area of a `GtkAssistant`.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_remove_page
function.description:
Removes the @page_num’s page from @assistant.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: page_num
parameter.parameter_description: the index of a page in the @assistant, or -1 to remove the last page

function.name: gtk_assistant_set_current_page
function.description:
Switches the page to @page_num.
Note that this will only be necessary in custom buttons, as the @assistant flow can be set with gtk_assistant_set_forward_page_func().
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: page_num
parameter.parameter_description: index of the page to switch to, starting from 0. If negative, the last page will be used. If greater than the number of pages in the @assistant, nothing will be done.

function.name: gtk_assistant_set_forward_page_func
function.description:
Sets the page forwarding function to be @page_func.
This function will be used to determine what will be the next page when the user presses the forward button. Setting @page_func to %NULL will make the assistant to use the default forward function, which just goes to the next visible page.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: page_func
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkAssistantPageFunc`, or %NULL to use the default one

function.name: gtk_assistant_set_page_complete
function.description:
Sets whether @page contents are complete.
This will make @assistant update the buttons state to be able to continue the task.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: complete
parameter.parameter_description: the completeness status of the page

function.name: gtk_assistant_set_page_title
function.description:
Sets a title for @page.
The title is displayed in the header area of the assistant when @page is the current page.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_set_page_type
function.description:
Sets the page type for @page.
The page type determines the page behavior in the @assistant.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_assistant_update_buttons_state
function.description:
Forces @assistant to recompute the buttons state.
GTK automatically takes care of this in most situations, e.g. when the user goes to a different page, or when the visibility or completeness of a page changes.
One situation where it can be necessary to call this function is when changing a value on the current page affects the future page flow of the assistant.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_at_context_create
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkATContext` instance for the given accessible role, accessible instance, and display connection.
The `GtkATContext` implementation being instantiated will depend on the platform.

parameter.name: accessible_role
parameter.parameter_description: the accessible role used by the `GtkATContext`

function.name: gtk_at_context_get_accessible
function.description: Retrieves the `GtkAccessible` using this context.

function.name: gtk_at_context_get_accessible_role
function.description: Retrieves the accessible role of this context.

function.name: gtk_bin_layout_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkBinLayout` instance.

function.name: gtk_bitset_add
function.description: Adds @value to @self if it wasn't part of it before.
function.return: %TRUE if @value was not part of @self and @self was changed

function.name: gtk_bitset_add_range
function.description: Adds all values from @start (inclusive) to @start + @n_items (exclusive) in @self.

parameter.name: n_items
parameter.parameter_description: number of consecutive values to add

function.name: gtk_bitset_add_range_closed
function.description: Adds the closed range [@first, @last], so @first, @last and all values in between. @first must be smaller than @last.

function.name: gtk_bitset_add_rectangle
function.description: Interprets the values as a 2-dimensional boolean grid with the given @stride and inside that grid, adds a rectangle with the given @width and @height.

function.name: gtk_bitset_contains
function.description: Checks if the given @value has been added to @self

function.name: gtk_bitset_copy
function.description: Creates a copy of @self.
function.return: A new bitset that contains the same values as @self

function.name: gtk_bitset_difference
function.description:
Sets @self to be the symmetric difference of @self and @other.
The symmetric difference is set @self to contain all values that were either contained in @self or in @other, but not in both. This operation is also called an XOR.
It is allowed for @self and @other to be the same bitset. The bitset will be emptied in that case.

parameter.name: other
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkBitset` to compute the difference from

function.name: gtk_bitset_equals
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @self and @other contain the same values.
function.return: %TRUE if @self and @other contain the same values

function.name: gtk_bitset_get_maximum
function.description:
Returns the largest value in @self.
If @self is empty, 0 is returned.

function.name: gtk_bitset_get_minimum
function.description:
Returns the smallest value in @self.
If @self is empty, `G_MAXUINT` is returned.

function.name: gtk_bitset_get_nth
function.description:
Returns the value of the @nth item in self.
If @nth is >= the size of @self, 0 is returned.

parameter.name: nth
parameter.parameter_description: index of the item to get

function.return: the value of the @nth item in @self

function.name: gtk_bitset_get_size
function.description:
Gets the number of values that were added to the set.
For example, if the set is empty, 0 is returned.
Note that this function returns a `guint64`, because when all values are set, the return value is `G_MAXUINT + 1`. Unless you are sure this cannot happen (it can't with `GListModel`), be sure to use a 64bit type.
function.return: The number of values in the set.

function.name: gtk_bitset_get_size_in_range
function.description:
Gets the number of values that are part of the set from @first to @last (inclusive).
Note that this function returns a `guint64`, because when all values are set, the return value is `G_MAXUINT + 1`. Unless you are sure this cannot happen (it can't with `GListModel`), be sure to use a 64bit type.
function.return: The number of values in the set from @first to @last.

function.name: gtk_bitset_intersect
function.description:
Sets @self to be the intersection of @self and @other.
In other words, remove all values from @self that are not part of @other.
It is allowed for @self and @other to be the same bitset. Nothing will happen in that case.

function.name: gtk_bitset_is_empty
function.description: Check if no value is contained in bitset.

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_get_value
function.description:
Gets the current value that @iter points to.
If @iter is not valid and [method@Gtk.BitsetIter.is_valid] returns %FALSE, this function returns 0.
function.return: The current value pointer to by @iter

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_init_at
function.description:
Initializes @iter to point to @target.
If @target is not found, finds the next value after it. If no value >= @target exists in @set, this function returns %FALSE.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: target value to start iterating at

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Set to the found value in @set

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_init_first
function.description:
Initializes an iterator for @set and points it to the first value in @set.
If @set is empty, %FALSE is returned and @value is set to %G_MAXUINT.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Set to the first value in @set

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_init_last
function.description:
Initializes an iterator for @set and points it to the last value in @set.
If @set is empty, %FALSE is returned.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Set to the last value in @set

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_is_valid
function.description: Checks if @iter points to a valid value.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter points to a valid value

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_next
function.description:
Moves @iter to the next value in the set.
If it was already pointing to the last value in the set, %FALSE is returned and @iter is invalidated.

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_previous
function.description:
Moves @iter to the previous value in the set.
If it was already pointing to the first value in the set, %FALSE is returned and @iter is invalidated.

function.name: gtk_bitset_new_empty
function.description: Creates a new empty bitset.

function.name: gtk_bitset_new_range
function.description: Creates a bitset with the given range set.

parameter.name: n_items
parameter.parameter_description: number of consecutive values to add

function.name: gtk_bitset_ref
function.description: Acquires a reference on the given `GtkBitset`.

function.name: gtk_bitset_remove
function.description: Removes @value from @self if it was part of it before.
function.return: %TRUE if @value was part of @self and @self was changed

function.name: gtk_bitset_remove_all
function.description: Removes all values from the bitset so that it is empty again.

function.name: gtk_bitset_remove_range
function.description: Removes all values from @start (inclusive) to @start + @n_items (exclusive) in @self.

parameter.name: n_items
parameter.parameter_description: number of consecutive values to remove

function.name: gtk_bitset_remove_range_closed
function.description: Removes the closed range [@first, @last], so @first, @last and all values in between. @first must be smaller than @last.

function.name: gtk_bitset_remove_rectangle
function.description: Interprets the values as a 2-dimensional boolean grid with the given @stride and inside that grid, removes a rectangle with the given @width and @height.

function.name: gtk_bitset_shift_left
function.description:
Shifts all values in @self to the left by @amount.
Values smaller than @amount are discarded.

parameter.name: amount
parameter.parameter_description: amount to shift all values to the left

function.name: gtk_bitset_shift_right
function.description:
Shifts all values in @self to the right by @amount.
Values that end up too large to be held in a #guint are discarded.

parameter.name: amount
parameter.parameter_description: amount to shift all values to the right

function.name: gtk_bitset_splice
function.description:
This is a support function for `GListModel` handling, by mirroring the `GlistModel::items-changed` signal.
First, it "cuts" the values from @position to @removed from the bitset. That is, it removes all those values and shifts all larger values to the left by @removed places.
Then, it "pastes" new room into the bitset by shifting all values larger than @position by @added spaces to the right. This frees up space that can then be filled.

function.name: gtk_bitset_subtract
function.description:
Sets @self to be the subtraction of @other from @self.
In other words, remove all values from @self that are part of @other.
It is allowed for @self and @other to be the same bitset. The bitset will be emptied in that case.

function.name: gtk_bitset_union
function.description:
Sets @self to be the union of @self and @other.
That is, add all values from @other into @self that weren't part of it.
It is allowed for @self and @other to be the same bitset. Nothing will happen in that case.

function.name: gtk_bitset_unref
function.description:
Releases a reference on the given `GtkBitset`.
If the reference was the last, the resources associated to the @self are freed.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_get_attributes
function.description: Gets the attributes queried on the children.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_get_filename
function.description: Returns the filename of the bookmark file that this list is loading.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_get_io_priority
function.description: Gets the IO priority to use while loading file.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_is_loading
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if the files are currently being loaded.
Files will be added to @self from time to time while loading is going on. The order in which are added is undefined and may change in between runs.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkBookmarkList` with the given @attributes.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets the @attributes to be enumerated and starts the enumeration.
If @attributes is %NULL, no attributes will be queried, but a list of `GFileInfo`s will still be created.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_set_io_priority
function.description:
Sets the IO priority to use while loading files.
The default IO priority is %G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT.

function.name: gtk_bool_filter_get_expression
function.description: Gets the expression that the filter evaluates for each item.

function.name: gtk_bool_filter_get_invert
function.description: Returns whether the filter inverts the expression.

function.name: gtk_bool_filter_new
function.description: Creates a new bool filter.

function.name: gtk_bool_filter_set_expression
function.description:
Sets the expression that the filter uses to check if items should be filtered.
The expression must have a value type of `G_TYPE_BOOLEAN`.

function.name: gtk_bool_filter_set_invert
function.description: Sets whether the filter should invert the expression.

function.name: gtk_border_copy
function.description: Copies a `GtkBorder`.

function.name: gtk_border_free
function.description: Frees a `GtkBorder`.

function.name: gtk_border_new
function.description: Allocates a new `GtkBorder` struct and initializes its elements to zero.
function.return: a newly allocated `GtkBorder` struct. Free with [method@Gtk.Border.free]

function.name: gtk_box_append
function.description: Adds a child at the end.

function.name: gtk_box_get_baseline_child
function.description:
Gets the value set by [method@Gtk.Box.set_baseline_child].
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_box_get_baseline_position
function.description: Gets the value set by [method@Gtk.Box.set_baseline_position].

function.name: gtk_box_get_homogeneous
function.description:
Returns whether the box is homogeneous.
In a homogeneous box all children are the same size.
function.return: true if the box is homogeneous

function.name: gtk_box_get_spacing
function.description: Gets the value set by [method@Gtk.Box.set_spacing].

function.name: gtk_box_insert_child_after
function.description:
Inserts a child at a specific position.
The child is added after @sibling in the list of @box children.
If @sibling is `NULL`, the @child is placed at the beginning.

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the sibling after which to insert @child

function.name: gtk_box_layout_get_baseline_child
function.description:
Gets the value set by gtk_box_layout_set_baseline_child().
Since: 4.12
function.return: the index of the child that determines the baseline in vertical layout, or -1

function.name: gtk_box_layout_get_baseline_position
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_box_layout_set_baseline_position().

function.name: gtk_box_layout_get_homogeneous
function.description:
Returns whether the layout is set to be homogeneous.
Return: %TRUE if the layout is homogeneous

function.name: gtk_box_layout_get_spacing
function.description: Returns the space that @box_layout puts between children.

function.name: gtk_box_layout_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkBoxLayout`.

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.parameter_description: the orientation for the new layout

function.name: gtk_box_layout_set_baseline_child
function.description:
Sets the index of the child that determines the baseline in vertical layout.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_box_layout_set_baseline_position
function.description:
Sets the baseline position of a box layout.
The baseline position affects only horizontal boxes with at least one baseline aligned child. If there is more vertical space available than requested, and the baseline is not allocated by the parent then the given @position is used to allocate the baseline within the extra space available.

function.name: gtk_box_layout_set_homogeneous
function.description: Sets whether the box layout will allocate the same size to all children.

parameter.name: homogeneous
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to set the box layout as homogeneous

function.name: gtk_box_layout_set_spacing
function.description: Sets how much spacing to put between children.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the spacing to apply between children

function.name: gtk_box_new
function.description: Creates a new box.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pixels to place between children

function.name: gtk_box_prepend
function.description: Adds a child at the beginning.

function.name: gtk_box_remove
function.description:
Removes a child widget from the box.
The child must have been added before with [method@Gtk.Box.append], [method@Gtk.Box.prepend], or [method@Gtk.Box.insert_child_after].

function.name: gtk_box_reorder_child_after
function.description:
Moves a child to a different position.
The child is moved to the position after @sibling in the list of @box children.
If @sibling is `NULL`, the child is placed at the beginning.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to move, must be a child of @box

function.name: gtk_box_set_baseline_child
function.description:
Sets the baseline child of a box.
This affects only vertical boxes.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_box_set_baseline_position
function.description:
Sets the baseline position of a box.
This affects only horizontal boxes with at least one baseline aligned child. If there is more vertical space available than requested, and the baseline is not allocated by the parent then @position is used to allocate the baseline with respect to the extra space available.

function.name: gtk_box_set_homogeneous
function.description: Sets whether or not all children are given equal space in the box.

parameter.name: homogeneous
parameter.parameter_description: true to create equal allotments, false for variable allotments

function.name: gtk_box_set_spacing
function.description: Sets the number of pixels to place between children.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pixels to put between children

function.name: gtk_buildable_get_buildable_id
function.description:
Gets the ID of the @buildable object.
`GtkBuilder` sets the name based on the ID attribute of the `<object>` tag used to construct the @buildable.
function.return: the ID of the buildable object

function.name: gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_element
function.description:
Retrieves the name of the currently open element.
If called from the start_element or end_element handlers this will give the element_name as passed to those functions. For the parent elements, see gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_element_stack().
function.return: the name of the currently open element

function.name: gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_element_stack
function.description:
Retrieves the element stack from the internal state of the parser.
The returned `GPtrArray` is an array of strings where the last item is the currently open tag (as would be returned by gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_element()) and the previous item is its immediate parent.
This function is intended to be used in the start_element and end_element handlers where gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_element() would merely return the name of the element that is being processed.
function.return: the element stack, which must not be modified

function.name: gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_position
function.description: Retrieves the current line number and the number of the character on that line. Intended for use in error messages; there are no strict semantics for what constitutes the "current" line number other than "the best number we could come up with for error messages."

parameter.name: line_number
parameter.parameter_description: return location for a line number

parameter.name: char_number
parameter.parameter_description: return location for a char-on-line number

function.name: gtk_buildable_parse_context_pop
function.description:
Completes the process of a temporary sub-parser redirection.
This function exists to collect the user_data allocated by a matching call to gtk_buildable_parse_context_push(). It must be called in the end_element handler corresponding to the start_element handler during which gtk_buildable_parse_context_push() was called. You must not call this function from the error callback -- the @user_data is provided directly to the callback in that case.
This function is not intended to be directly called by users interested in invoking subparsers. Instead, it is intended to be used by the subparsers themselves to implement a higher-level interface.
function.return: the user data passed to gtk_buildable_parse_context_push()

function.name: gtk_buildable_parse_context_push
function.description:
Temporarily redirects markup data to a sub-parser.
This function may only be called from the start_element handler of a `GtkBuildableParser`. It must be matched with a corresponding call to gtk_buildable_parse_context_pop() in the matching end_element handler (except in the case that the parser aborts due to an error).
All tags, text and other data between the matching tags is redirected to the subparser given by @parser. @user_data is used as the user_data for that parser. @user_data is also passed to the error callback in the event that an error occurs. This includes errors that occur in subparsers of the subparser.
The end tag matching the start tag for which this call was made is handled by the previous parser (which is given its own user_data) which is why gtk_buildable_parse_context_pop() is provided to allow "one last access" to the @user_data provided to this function. In the case of error, the @user_data provided here is passed directly to the error callback of the subparser and gtk_buildable_parse_context_pop() should not be called. In either case, if @user_data was allocated then it ought to be freed from both of these locations.
This function is not intended to be directly called by users interested in invoking subparsers. Instead, it is intended to be used by the subparsers themselves to implement a higher-level interface.
For an example of how to use this, see g_markup_parse_context_push() which has the same kind of API.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to `GtkBuildableParser` functions

function.name: gtk_builder_add_from_file
function.description:
Parses a file containing a UI definition and merges it with the current contents of @builder.
This function is useful if you need to call [method@Gtk.Builder.set_current_object]) to add user data to callbacks before loading GtkBuilder UI. Otherwise, you probably want [ctor@Gtk.Builder.new_from_file] instead.
If an error occurs, 0 will be returned and @error will be assigned a `GError` from the `GTK_BUILDER_ERROR`, `G_MARKUP_ERROR` or `G_FILE_ERROR` domains.
It’s not really reasonable to attempt to handle failures of this call. You should not use this function with untrusted files (ie: files that are not part of your application). Broken `GtkBuilder` files can easily crash your program, and it’s possible that memory was leaked leading up to the reported failure. The only reasonable thing to do when an error is detected is to call `g_error()`.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the file to parse

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_add_from_resource
function.description:
Parses a resource file containing a UI definition and merges it with the current contents of @builder.
This function is useful if you need to call [method@Gtk.Builder.set_current_object] to add user data to callbacks before loading GtkBuilder UI. Otherwise, you probably want [ctor@Gtk.Builder.new_from_resource] instead.
If an error occurs, 0 will be returned and @error will be assigned a `GError` from the %GTK_BUILDER_ERROR, %G_MARKUP_ERROR or %G_RESOURCE_ERROR domain.
It’s not really reasonable to attempt to handle failures of this call. The only reasonable thing to do when an error is detected is to call g_error().

parameter.name: resource_path
parameter.parameter_description: the path of the resource file to parse

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_add_from_string
function.description:
Parses a string containing a UI definition and merges it with the current contents of @builder.
This function is useful if you need to call [method@Gtk.Builder.set_current_object] to add user data to callbacks before loading `GtkBuilder` UI. Otherwise, you probably want [ctor@Gtk.Builder.new_from_string] instead.
Upon errors %FALSE will be returned and @error will be assigned a `GError` from the %GTK_BUILDER_ERROR, %G_MARKUP_ERROR or %G_VARIANT_PARSE_ERROR domain.
It’s not really reasonable to attempt to handle failures of this call. The only reasonable thing to do when an error is detected is to call g_error().

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of @buffer (may be -1 if @buffer is nul-terminated)

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_add_objects_from_file
function.description:
Parses a file containing a UI definition building only the requested objects and merges them with the current contents of @builder.
Upon errors, 0 will be returned and @error will be assigned a `GError` from the %GTK_BUILDER_ERROR, %G_MARKUP_ERROR or %G_FILE_ERROR domain.
If you are adding an object that depends on an object that is not its child (for instance a `GtkTreeView` that depends on its `GtkTreeModel`), you have to explicitly list all of them in @object_ids.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the file to parse

parameter.name: object_ids
parameter.parameter_description: nul-terminated array of objects to build

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_add_objects_from_resource
function.description:
Parses a resource file containing a UI definition, building only the requested objects and merges them with the current contents of @builder.
Upon errors, 0 will be returned and @error will be assigned a `GError` from the %GTK_BUILDER_ERROR, %G_MARKUP_ERROR or %G_RESOURCE_ERROR domain.
If you are adding an object that depends on an object that is not its child (for instance a `GtkTreeView` that depends on its `GtkTreeModel`), you have to explicitly list all of them in @object_ids.

parameter.name: resource_path
parameter.parameter_description: the path of the resource file to parse

parameter.name: object_ids
parameter.parameter_description: nul-terminated array of objects to build

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_add_objects_from_string
function.description:
Parses a string containing a UI definition, building only the requested objects and merges them with the current contents of @builder.
Upon errors %FALSE will be returned and @error will be assigned a `GError` from the %GTK_BUILDER_ERROR or %G_MARKUP_ERROR domain.
If you are adding an object that depends on an object that is not its child (for instance a `GtkTreeView` that depends on its `GtkTreeModel`), you have to explicitly list all of them in @object_ids.

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of @buffer (may be -1 if @buffer is nul-terminated)

parameter.name: object_ids
parameter.parameter_description: nul-terminated array of objects to build

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_create_closure
function.description:
Creates a closure to invoke the function called @function_name.
This is using the create_closure() implementation of @builder's [iface@Gtk.BuilderScope].
If no closure could be created, %NULL will be returned and @error will be set.

parameter.name: function_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the function to look up

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: Object to create the closure with

function.name: gtk_builder_cscope_add_callback
function.description:
Adds the @callback to the scope of @builder under its own name.
This is a convenience wrapper of [method@Gtk.BuilderCScope.add_callback_symbol].
Since: 4.8

function.name: gtk_builder_cscope_add_callback_symbol
function.description:
Adds the @callback_symbol to the scope of @builder under the given @callback_name.
Using this function overrides the behavior of [method@Gtk.Builder.create_closure] for any callback symbols that are added. Using this method allows for better encapsulation as it does not require that callback symbols be declared in the global namespace.

parameter.name: callback_name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the callback, as expected in the XML

function.name: gtk_builder_cscope_add_callback_symbols
function.description:
A convenience function to add many callbacks.
This is equivalent to calling [method@Gtk.BuilderCScope.add_callback_symbol] for each symbol.

parameter.name: first_callback_name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the callback, as expected in the XML

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: A list of callback name and callback symbol pairs terminated with %NULL

function.name: gtk_builder_cscope_lookup_callback_symbol
function.description: Fetches a symbol previously added with gtk_builder_cscope_add_callback_symbol().

function.name: gtk_builder_cscope_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkBuilderCScope` object to use with future `GtkBuilder` instances.
Calling this function is only necessary if you want to add custom callbacks via [method@Gtk.BuilderCScope.add_callback_symbol].

function.name: gtk_builder_error_quark
function.description: Registers an error quark for [class@Gtk.Builder] errors.

function.name: gtk_builder_expose_object
function.description:
Add @object to the @builder object pool so it can be referenced just like any other object built by builder.
Only a single object may be added using @name. However, it is not an error to expose the same object under multiple names. `gtk_builder_get_object()` may be used to determine if an object has already been added with @name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the object exposed to the builder

function.name: gtk_builder_extend_with_template
function.description:
Main private entry point for building composite components from template XML.
Most likely you do not need to call this function in applications as templates are handled by `GtkWidget`.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that is being extended

parameter.name: template_type
parameter.parameter_description: the type that the template is for

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of @buffer (may be -1 if @buffer is nul-terminated)

function.return: A positive value on success, 0 if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_get_current_object
function.description: Gets the current object set via gtk_builder_set_current_object().

function.name: gtk_builder_get_object
function.description:
Gets the object named @name.
Note that this function does not increment the reference count of the returned object.

function.name: gtk_builder_get_objects
function.description:
Gets all objects that have been constructed by @builder.
Note that this function does not increment the reference counts of the returned objects.
function.return: a newly-allocated `GSList` containing all the objects constructed by the `GtkBuilder instance`. It should be freed by g_slist_free()

function.name: gtk_builder_get_scope
function.description: Gets the scope in use that was set via gtk_builder_set_scope().

function.name: gtk_builder_get_translation_domain
function.description: Gets the translation domain of @builder.

function.name: gtk_builder_get_type_from_name
function.description:
Looks up a type by name.
This is using the virtual function that `GtkBuilder` has for that purpose. This is mainly used when implementing the `GtkBuildable` interface on a type.
function.return: the `GType` found for @type_name or %G_TYPE_INVALID if no type was found

function.name: gtk_builder_list_item_factory_get_bytes
function.description: Gets the data used as the `GtkBuilder` UI template for constructing listitems.

function.name: gtk_builder_list_item_factory_get_resource
function.description: If the data references a resource, gets the path of that resource.

function.name: gtk_builder_list_item_factory_get_scope
function.description: Gets the scope used when constructing listitems.
function.return: The scope used when constructing listitems

function.name: gtk_builder_list_item_factory_new_from_bytes
function.description: Creates a new `GtkBuilderListItemFactory` that instantiates widgets using @bytes as the data to pass to `GtkBuilder`.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.parameter_description: A scope to use when instantiating

parameter.name: bytes
parameter.parameter_description: the `GBytes` containing the UI definition to instantiate

function.name: gtk_builder_list_item_factory_new_from_resource
function.description: Creates a new `GtkBuilderListItemFactory` that instantiates widgets using data read from the given @resource_path to pass to `GtkBuilder`.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.parameter_description: A scope to use when instantiating

parameter.name: resource_path
parameter.parameter_description: valid path to a resource that contains the UI definition

function.name: gtk_builder_new
function.description:
Creates a new empty builder object.
This function is only useful if you intend to make multiple calls to [method@Gtk.Builder.add_from_file], [method@Gtk.Builder.add_from_resource] or [method@Gtk.Builder.add_from_string] in order to merge multiple UI descriptions into a single builder.

function.name: gtk_builder_new_from_file
function.description:
Parses the UI definition in the file @filename.
If there is an error opening the file or parsing the description then the program will be aborted. You should only ever attempt to parse user interface descriptions that are shipped as part of your program.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: filename of user interface description file

function.name: gtk_builder_new_from_resource
function.description:
Parses the UI definition at @resource_path.
If there is an error locating the resource or parsing the description, then the program will be aborted.

function.name: gtk_builder_new_from_string
function.description:
Parses the UI definition in @string.
If @string is %NULL-terminated, then @length should be -1. If @length is not -1, then it is the length of @string.
If there is an error parsing @string then the program will be aborted. You should not attempt to parse user interface description from untrusted sources.
function.return: a `GtkBuilder` containing the interface described by @string

function.name: gtk_builder_set_current_object
function.description:
Sets the current object for the @builder.
The current object can be thought of as the `this` object that the builder is working for and will often be used as the default object when an object is optional.
[method@Gtk.Widget.init_template] for example will set the current object to the widget the template is inited for. For functions like [ctor@Gtk.Builder.new_from_resource], the current object will be %NULL.

function.name: gtk_builder_set_scope
function.description:
Sets the scope the builder should operate in.
If @scope is %NULL, a new [class@Gtk.BuilderCScope] will be created.

function.name: gtk_builder_set_translation_domain
function.description: Sets the translation domain of @builder.

function.name: gtk_builder_value_from_string
function.description:
Demarshals a value from a string.
This function calls g_value_init() on the @value argument, so it need not be initialised beforehand.
Can handle char, uchar, boolean, int, uint, long, ulong, enum, flags, float, double, string, `GdkRGBA` and `GtkAdjustment` type values.
Upon errors %FALSE will be returned and @error will be assigned a `GError` from the %GTK_BUILDER_ERROR domain.

parameter.name: string
parameter.parameter_description: the string representation of the value

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the `GValue` to store the result in

function.name: gtk_builder_value_from_string_type
function.description:
Demarshals a value from a string.
Unlike [method@Gtk.Builder.value_from_string], this function takes a `GType` instead of `GParamSpec`.
Calls g_value_init() on the @value argument, so it need not be initialised beforehand.
Upon errors %FALSE will be returned and @error will be assigned a `GError` from the %GTK_BUILDER_ERROR domain.

parameter.name: string
parameter.parameter_description: the string representation of the value

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the `GValue` to store the result in

function.name: gtk_button_get_can_shrink
function.description:
Retrieves whether the button can be smaller than the natural size of its contents.
Since: 4.12
function.return: true if the button can shrink, and false otherwise

function.name: gtk_button_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @button.

function.name: gtk_button_get_has_frame
function.description: Returns whether the button has a frame.
function.return: %TRUE if the button has a frame

function.name: gtk_button_get_icon_name
function.description:
Returns the icon name of the button.
If the icon name has not been set with [method@Gtk.Button.set_icon_name] the return value will be %NULL. This will be the case if you create an empty button with [ctor@Gtk.Button.new] to use as a container.

function.name: gtk_button_get_label
function.description:
Fetches the text from the label of the button.
If the label text has not been set with [method@Gtk.Button.set_label] the return value will be %NULL. This will be the case if you create an empty button with [ctor@Gtk.Button.new] to use as a container.
function.return: The text of the label widget. This string is owned by the widget and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_button_get_use_underline
function.description:
gets whether underlines are interpreted as mnemonics.
See [method@Gtk.Button.set_use_underline].
function.return: %TRUE if an embedded underline in the button label indicates the mnemonic accelerator keys.

function.name: gtk_button_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkButton` widget.
To add a child widget to the button, use [method@Gtk.Button.set_child].

function.name: gtk_button_new_from_icon_name
function.description:
Creates a new button containing an icon from the current icon theme.
If the icon name isn’t known, a “broken image” icon will be displayed instead. If the current icon theme is changed, the icon will be updated appropriately.
function.return: a new `GtkButton` displaying the themed icon

function.name: gtk_button_new_with_label
function.description: Creates a `GtkButton` widget with a `GtkLabel` child.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text you want the `GtkLabel` to hold

function.name: gtk_button_new_with_mnemonic
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkButton` containing a label.
If characters in @label are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use “__” (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic. Pressing <kbd>Alt</kbd> and that key activates the button.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text of the button, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.name: gtk_button_set_can_shrink
function.description:
Sets whether the button size can be smaller than the natural size of its contents.
For text buttons, setting @can_shrink to true will ellipsize the label.
For icons and custom children, this function has no effect.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_button_set_child
function.description:
Sets the child widget of @button.
Note that by using this API, you take full responsibility for setting up the proper accessibility label and description information for @button. Most likely, you'll either set the accessibility label or description for @button explicitly, or you'll set a labelled-by or described-by relations from @child to @button.

function.name: gtk_button_set_has_frame
function.description:
Sets the style of the button.
Buttons can have a flat appearance or have a frame drawn around them.

parameter.name: has_frame
parameter.parameter_description: whether the button should have a visible frame

function.name: gtk_button_set_icon_name
function.description:
Adds a `GtkImage` with the given icon name as a child.
If @button already contains a child widget, that child widget will be removed and replaced with the image.

function.name: gtk_button_set_label
function.description:
Sets the text of the label of the button to @label.
This will also clear any previously set labels.

function.name: gtk_button_set_use_underline
function.description:
Sets whether to use underlines as mnemonics.
If true, an underline in the text of the button label indicates the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.

parameter.name: use_underline
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if underlines in the text indicate mnemonics

function.name: gtk_calendar_clear_marks
function.description: Remove all visual markers.

function.name: gtk_calendar_get_date
function.description:
Returns a `GDateTime` representing the shown year, month and the selected day.
The returned date is in the local time zone.

function.name: gtk_calendar_get_day
function.description:
Gets the day of the selected date.
Since: 4.14
function.return: the day of the selected date.

function.name: gtk_calendar_get_day_is_marked
function.description: Returns if the @day of the @calendar is already marked.

function.name: gtk_calendar_get_month
function.description:
Gets the month of the selected date.
Since: 4.14
function.return: The month of the selected date (as a number between 0 and 11).

function.name: gtk_calendar_get_show_day_names
function.description:
Returns whether @self is currently showing the names of the week days.
This is the value of the [property@Gtk.Calendar:show-day-names] property.
function.return: Whether the calendar shows day names.

function.name: gtk_calendar_get_show_heading
function.description:
Returns whether @self is currently showing the heading.
This is the value of the [property@Gtk.Calendar:show-heading] property.
Return: Whether the calendar is showing a heading.

function.name: gtk_calendar_get_show_week_numbers
function.description:
Returns whether @self is showing week numbers right now.
This is the value of the [property@Gtk.Calendar:show-week-numbers] property.
Return: Whether the calendar is showing week numbers.

function.name: gtk_calendar_get_year
function.description:
Gets the year of the selected date.
Since: 4.14
function.return: the year of the selected date.

function.name: gtk_calendar_mark_day
function.description: Places a visual marker on a particular day of the current month.

parameter.name: day
parameter.parameter_description: the day number to mark between 1 and 31.

function.name: gtk_calendar_new
function.description: Creates a new calendar, with the current date being selected.

function.name: gtk_calendar_select_day
function.description:
Switches to @date's year and month and select its day.
Deprecated: 4.20: Use [method@Calendar.set_date] instead.

parameter.name: date
parameter.parameter_description: a `GDateTime` representing the day to select

function.name: gtk_calendar_set_date
function.description:
Switches to @date's year and month and selects its day.
Since: 4.20

parameter.name: date
parameter.parameter_description: a `GDateTime` representing the day to select

function.name: gtk_calendar_set_day
function.description:
Sets the day for the selected date.
The new date must be valid. For example, setting the day to 31 when the month is February will fail.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: day
parameter.parameter_description: The desired day for the selected date (as a number between 1 and 31).

function.name: gtk_calendar_set_month
function.description:
Sets the month for the selected date.
The new date must be valid. For example, setting the month to 1 (February) when the day is 31 will fail.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: month
parameter.parameter_description: The desired month for the selected date (as a number between 0 and 11).

function.name: gtk_calendar_set_show_day_names
function.description: Sets whether the calendar shows day names.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to show day names above the day numbers

function.name: gtk_calendar_set_show_heading
function.description:
Sets whether the calendar should show a heading.
The heading contains the current year and month as well as buttons for changing both.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to show the heading in the calendar

function.name: gtk_calendar_set_show_week_numbers
function.description: Sets whether week numbers are shown in the calendar.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show week numbers alongside the days

function.name: gtk_calendar_set_year
function.description:
Sets the year for the selected date.
The new date must be valid. For example, setting the year to 2023 when the date is February 29 will fail.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: year
parameter.parameter_description: The desired year for the selected date (within [struct@GLib.DateTime] limits, i.e. from 0001 to 9999).

function.name: gtk_calendar_unmark_day
function.description: Removes the visual marker from a particular day.

parameter.name: day
parameter.parameter_description: the day number to unmark between 1 and 31.

function.name: gtk_callback_action_new
function.description: Create a custom action that calls the given @callback when activated.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: the callback to call when the action is activated

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to be passed to @callback

parameter.name: destroy
parameter.parameter_description: the function to be called when the callback action is finalized

function.name: gtk_cclosure_expression_new
function.description:
Creates a `GtkExpression` that calls `callback_func` when it is evaluated.
This function is a variant of [ctor@Gtk.ClosureExpression.new] that creates a `GClosure` by calling g_cclosure_new() with the given `callback_func`, `user_data` and `user_destroy`.

parameter.name: value_type
parameter.parameter_description: the type of the value that this expression evaluates to

parameter.name: marshal
parameter.parameter_description: marshaller used for creating a closure

parameter.name: n_params
parameter.parameter_description: the number of params needed for evaluating @closure

parameter.name: callback_func
parameter.parameter_description: callback used for creating a closure

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data used for creating a closure

function.name: gtk_cell_area_activate
function.description:
Activates @area, usually by activating the currently focused cell, however some subclasses which embed widgets in the area can also activate a widget if it currently has the focus.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkCellArea`Context in context with the current row data

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: the size and location of @area relative to @widget’s allocation

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkCellRenderer`State flags for @area for this row of data.

parameter.name: edit_only

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_allocate
function.description:
Allocates a width and/or a height for all rows which are to be rendered with @context.
Usually allocation is performed only horizontally or sometimes vertically since a group of rows are usually rendered side by side vertically or horizontally and share either the same width or the same height. Sometimes they are allocated in both horizontal and vertical orientations producing a homogeneous effect of the rows. This is generally the case for `GtkTreeView` when `GtkTreeView:fixed-height-mode` is enabled.
Deprecated: 4.10: This object will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the allocated width for all `GtkTreeModel` rows rendered with @context, or -1

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the allocated height for all `GtkTreeModel` rows rendered with @context, or -1

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_allocation
function.description:
Fetches the current allocation size for @context.
If the context was not allocated in width or height, or if the context was recently reset with gtk_cell_area_context_reset(), the returned value will be -1.
Deprecated: 4.10: This object will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the allocated width

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the allocated height

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_area
function.description:
Fetches the `GtkCellArea` this @context was created by.
This is generally unneeded by layouting widgets; however, it is important for the context implementation itself to fetch information about the area it is being used for.
For instance at `GtkCellAreaContextClass.allocate()` time it’s important to know details about any cell spacing that the `GtkCellArea` is configured with in order to compute a proper allocation.
Deprecated: 4.10: This object will be removed in GTK 5
function.return: the `GtkCellArea` this context was created by.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_height
function.description:
Gets the accumulative preferred height for all rows which have been requested with this context.
After gtk_cell_area_context_reset() is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a `GtkCellArea`, the returned values are 0.
Deprecated: 4.10: This object will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum height

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural height

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_height_for_width
function.description:
Gets the accumulative preferred height for @width for all rows which have been requested for the same said @width with this context.
After gtk_cell_area_context_reset() is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a `GtkCellArea`, the returned values are -1.
Deprecated: 4.10: This object will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum height

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural height

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_width
function.description:
Gets the accumulative preferred width for all rows which have been requested with this context.
After gtk_cell_area_context_reset() is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a `GtkCellArea`, the returned values are 0.
Deprecated: 4.10: This object will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum width

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural width

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_width_for_height
function.description:
Gets the accumulative preferred width for @height for all rows which have been requested for the same said @height with this context.
After gtk_cell_area_context_reset() is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a `GtkCellArea`, the returned values are -1.
Deprecated: 4.10: This object will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum width

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural width

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_push_preferred_height
function.description:
Causes the minimum and/or natural height to grow if the new proposed sizes exceed the current minimum and natural height.
This is used by `GtkCellAreaContext` implementations during the request process over a series of `GtkTreeModel` rows to progressively push the requested height over a series of gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height() requests.
Deprecated: 4.10: This object will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: the proposed new minimum height for @context

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: the proposed new natural height for @context

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_push_preferred_width
function.description:
Causes the minimum and/or natural width to grow if the new proposed sizes exceed the current minimum and natural width.
This is used by `GtkCellAreaContext` implementations during the request process over a series of `GtkTreeModel` rows to progressively push the requested width over a series of gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width() requests.
Deprecated: 4.10: This object will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: the proposed new minimum width for @context

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: the proposed new natural width for @context

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_reset
function.description:
Resets any previously cached request and allocation data.
When underlying `GtkTreeModel` data changes its important to reset the context if the content size is allowed to shrink. If the content size is only allowed to grow (this is usually an option for views rendering large data stores as a measure of optimization), then only the row that changed or was inserted needs to be (re)requested with gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width().
When the new overall size of the context requires that the allocated size changes (or whenever this allocation changes at all), the variable row sizes need to be re-requested for every row.
For instance, if the rows are displayed all with the same width from top to bottom then a change in the allocated width necessitates a recalculation of all the displayed row heights using gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height_for_width().
Deprecated: 4.10: This object will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_cell_area_copy_context
function.description:
This is sometimes needed for cases where rows need to share alignments in one orientation but may be separately grouped in the opposing orientation.
For instance, `GtkIconView` creates all icons (rows) to have the same width and the cells theirin to have the same horizontal alignments. However each row of icons may have a separate collective height. `GtkIconView` uses this to request the heights of each row based on a context which was already used to request all the row widths that are to be displayed.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_area_create_context
function.description:
Creates a `GtkCellArea`Context to be used with @area for all purposes. `GtkCellArea`Context stores geometry information for rows for which it was operated on, it is important to use the same context for the same row of data at all times (i.e. one should render and handle events with the same `GtkCellArea`Context which was used to request the size of those rows of data).
Deprecated: 4.10
function.return: a newly created `GtkCellArea`Context which can be used with @area.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkCellArea`Context to perform this request with

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum height

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural height

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height_for_width
function.description:
Retrieves a cell area’s minimum and natural height if it would be given the specified @width.
@area stores some geometrical information in @context along the way while calling gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width(). It’s important to perform a series of gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width() requests with @context first and then call gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height_for_width() on each cell area individually to get the height for width of each fully requested row.
If at some point, the width of a single row changes, it should be requested with gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width() again and then the full width of the requested rows checked again with gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_width().
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkCellArea`Context which has already been requested for widths.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width for which to check the height of this area

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum height

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural height

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkCellArea`Context to perform this request with

parameter.name: natural_width

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width_for_height
function.description:
Retrieves a cell area’s minimum and natural width if it would be given the specified @height.
@area stores some geometrical information in @context along the way while calling gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height(). It’s important to perform a series of gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height() requests with @context first and then call gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width_for_height() on each cell area individually to get the height for width of each fully requested row.
If at some point, the height of a single row changes, it should be requested with gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height() again and then the full height of the requested rows checked again with gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_height().
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkCellArea`Context which has already been requested for widths.

parameter.parameter_description: the height for which to check the width of this area

parameter.name: minimum_width

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural width

Explicitly stops the editing of the currently edited cell.
If @canceled is %TRUE, the currently edited cell renderer will emit the ::editing-canceled signal, otherwise the the ::editing-done signal will be emitted on the current edit widget.
See gtk_cell_area_get_edited_cell() and gtk_cell_area_get_edit_widget().

function.name: gtk_cell_editable_editing_done

Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_editable_start_editing
function.description:
Begins editing on a @cell_editable.
The `GtkCellRenderer` for the cell creates and returns a `GtkCellEditable` from gtk_cell_renderer_start_editing(), configured for the `GtkCellRenderer` type.
gtk_cell_editable_start_editing() can then set up @cell_editable suitably for editing a cell, e.g. making the Esc key emit `GtkCellEditable::editing-done`.
Note that the @cell_editable is created on-demand for the current edit; its lifetime is temporary and does not persist across other edits and/or cells.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: The `GdkEvent` that began the editing process, or %NULL if editing was initiated programmatically

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_add_attribute
function.description:
Adds an attribute mapping to the list in @cell_layout.
The @column is the column of the model to get a value from, and the @attribute is the property on @cell to be set from that value. So for example if column 2 of the model contains strings, you could have the “text” attribute of a `GtkCellRendererText` get its values from column 2. In this context "attribute" and "property" are used interchangeably.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the column position on the model to get the attribute from
