function.name: gtk_cell_layout_pack_end
function.description:
Adds the @cell to the end of @cell_layout. If @expand is %FALSE, then the @cell is allocated no more space than it needs. Any unused space is divided evenly between cells for which @expand is %TRUE.
Note that reusing the same cell renderer is not supported.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @cell is to be given extra space allocated to @cell_layout

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_pack_start
function.description:
Packs the @cell into the beginning of @cell_layout. If @expand is %FALSE, then the @cell is allocated no more space than it needs. Any unused space is divided evenly between cells for which @expand is %TRUE.
Note that reusing the same cell renderer is not supported.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @cell is to be given extra space allocated to @cell_layout

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_reorder
function.description:
Re-inserts @cell at @position.
Note that @cell has already to be packed into @cell_layout for this to function properly.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets the attributes in the parameter list as the attributes of @cell_layout.
See [method@Gtk.CellLayout.add_attribute] for more details.
The attributes should be in attribute/column order, as in gtk_cell_layout_add_attribute(). All existing attributes are removed, and replaced with the new attributes.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_set_cell_data_func
function.description:
Sets the `GtkCellLayout`DataFunc to use for @cell_layout.
This function is used instead of the standard attributes mapping for setting the column value, and should set the value of @cell_layout’s cell renderer(s) as appropriate.
@func may be %NULL to remove a previously set function.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_accel_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkCellRendererAccel`.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_activate
function.description:
Passes an activate event to the cell renderer for possible processing. Some cell renderers may use events; for example, `GtkCellRendererToggle` toggles when it gets a mouse click.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: widget-dependent string representation of the event location; e.g. for `GtkTreeView`, a string representation of `GtkTreePath`

parameter.name: background_area

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: cell area as passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_combo_new

Creates a new `GtkCellRendererCombo`. Adjust how text is drawn using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with `GtkTreeViewColumn`, you can bind a property to a value in a `GtkTreeModel`. For example, you can bind the “text” property on the cell renderer to a string value in the model, thus rendering a different string in each row of the `GtkTreeView`.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_pixbuf_new

Creates a new `GtkCellRendererPixbuf`. Adjust rendering parameters using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with `GtkTreeViewColumn`, you can bind a property to a value in a `GtkTreeModel`. For example, you can bind the “pixbuf” property on the cell renderer to a pixbuf value in the model, thus rendering a different image in each row of the `GtkTreeView`.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_start_editing
function.description:
Starts editing the contents of this @cell, through a new `GtkCellEditable` widget created by the `GtkCellRenderer`Class.start_editing virtual function.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: widget-dependent string representation of the event location; e.g. for `GtkTreeView`, a string representation of `GtkTreePath`

parameter.name: background_area
parameter.parameter_description: background area as passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: cell area as passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()

function.return: A new `GtkCellEditable` for editing this @cell, or %NULL if editing is not possible

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_stop_editing
function.description:
Informs the cell renderer that the editing is stopped. If @canceled is %TRUE, the cell renderer will emit the `GtkCellRenderer`::editing-canceled signal.
This function should be called by cell renderer implementations in response to the `GtkCellEditable::editing-done` signal of `GtkCellEditable`.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: canceled
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the editing has been canceled

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_text_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkCellRendererText`. Adjust how text is drawn using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with `GtkTreeViewColumn`, you can bind a property to a value in a `GtkTreeModel`. For example, you can bind the “text” property on the cell renderer to a string value in the model, thus rendering a different string in each row of the `GtkTreeView`.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_text_set_fixed_height_from_font
function.description:
Sets the height of a renderer to explicitly be determined by the “font” and “y_pad” property set on it. Further changes in these properties do not affect the height, so they must be accompanied by a subsequent call to this function. Using this function is inflexible, and should really only be used if calculating the size of a cell is too slow (ie, a massive number of cells displayed). If @number_of_rows is -1, then the fixed height is unset, and the height is determined by the properties again.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: number_of_rows
parameter.parameter_description: Number of rows of text each cell renderer is allocated, or -1

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_get_activatable
function.description:
Returns whether the cell renderer is activatable. See gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_activatable().
Deprecated: 4.10
function.return: %TRUE if the cell renderer is activatable.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_get_active
function.description:
Returns whether the cell renderer is active. See gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_active().
Deprecated: 4.10
function.return: %TRUE if the cell renderer is active.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_get_radio
function.description:
Returns whether we’re rendering radio toggles rather than checkboxes.
Deprecated: 4.10
function.return: %TRUE if we’re rendering radio toggles rather than checkboxes

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkCellRendererToggle`. Adjust rendering parameters using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with `GtkTreeViewColumn`, you can bind a property to a value in a `GtkTreeModel`. For example, you can bind the “active” property on the cell renderer to a boolean value in the model, thus causing the check button to reflect the state of the model.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_activatable
function.description:
Makes the cell renderer activatable.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_active
function.description:
Activates or deactivates a cell renderer.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_radio
function.description:
If @radio is %TRUE, the cell renderer renders a radio toggle (i.e. a toggle in a group of mutually-exclusive toggles). If %FALSE, it renders a check toggle (a standalone boolean option). This can be set globally for the cell renderer, or changed just before rendering each cell in the model (for `GtkTreeView`, you set up a per-row setting using `GtkTreeViewColumn` to associate model columns with cell renderer properties).
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: radio
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to make the toggle look like a radio button

function.name: gtk_cell_view_get_displayed_row
function.description:
Returns a `GtkTreePath` referring to the currently displayed row. If no row is currently displayed, %NULL is returned.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_view_get_draw_sensitive
function.description:
Gets whether @cell_view is configured to draw all of its cells in a sensitive state.
Deprecated: 4.10
function.return: whether @cell_view draws all of its cells in a sensitive state

function.name: gtk_cell_view_get_fit_model
function.description:
Gets whether @cell_view is configured to request space to fit the entire `GtkTreeModel`.
Deprecated: 4.10
function.return: whether @cell_view requests space to fit the entire `GtkTreeModel`.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_get_model
function.description:
Returns the model for @cell_view. If no model is used %NULL is returned.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_view_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkCellView` widget.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_view_new_with_context
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkCellView` widget with a specific `GtkCellArea` to layout cells and a specific `GtkCellAreaContext`.
Specifying the same context for a handful of cells lets the underlying area synchronize the geometry for those cells, in this way alignments with cellviews for other rows are possible.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkCellAreaContext` in which to calculate cell geometry

function.name: gtk_cell_view_new_with_markup
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkCellView` widget, adds a `GtkCellRendererText` to it, and makes it show @markup. The text can be marked up with the [Pango text markup language](https://docs.gtk.org/Pango/pango_markup.html).
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: markup
parameter.parameter_description: the text to display in the cell view

function.name: gtk_cell_view_new_with_text
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkCellView` widget, adds a `GtkCellRendererText` to it, and makes it show @text.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: the text to display in the cell view

function.name: gtk_cell_view_new_with_texture
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkCellView` widget, adds a `GtkCellRendererPixbuf` to it, and makes it show @texture.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: texture
parameter.parameter_description: the image to display in the cell view

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_displayed_row
function.description:
Sets the row of the model that is currently displayed by the `GtkCellView`. If the path is unset, then the contents of the cellview “stick” at their last value; this is not normally a desired result, but may be a needed intermediate state if say, the model for the `GtkCellView` becomes temporarily empty.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_draw_sensitive
function.description:
Sets whether @cell_view should draw all of its cells in a sensitive state, this is used by `GtkComboBox` menus to ensure that rows with insensitive cells that contain children appear sensitive in the parent menu item.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: draw_sensitive
parameter.parameter_description: whether to draw all cells in a sensitive state.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_fit_model
function.description:
Sets whether @cell_view should request space to fit the entire `GtkTreeModel`.
This is used by `GtkComboBox` to ensure that the cell view displayed on the combo box’s button always gets enough space and does not resize when selection changes.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: fit_model
parameter.parameter_description: whether @cell_view should request space for the whole model.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model for @cell_view. If @cell_view already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. If @model is %NULL, then it will unset the old model.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_value
function.description:
Sets a property of a cell renderer of @cell_view, and makes sure the display of @cell_view is updated.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property of @renderer to set

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the new value to set the property to

function.description:
Gets the baseline position of the center box.

function.description: Gets the center widget.

function.name: gtk_center_box_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkCenterBox`.

function.name: gtk_center_box_set_baseline_position
function.description:
Sets the baseline position of a center box.
This affects only horizontal boxes with at least one baseline aligned child. If there is more vertical space available than requested, and the baseline is not allocated by the parent then @position is used to allocate the baseline with respect to the extra space available.

function.name: gtk_center_box_set_center_widget
function.description:
Sets the center widget.
To remove the existing center widget, pass `NULL`.

function.name: gtk_center_box_set_end_widget
function.description:
Sets the end widget.
To remove the existing end widget, pass `NULL`.

function.name: gtk_center_box_set_shrink_center_last
function.description:
Sets whether to shrink the center widget after other children.
By default, when there's no space to give all three children their natural widths, the start and end widgets start shrinking and the center child keeps natural width until they reach minimum width.
If @shrink_center_last is false, start and end widgets keep natural width and the center widget starts shrinking instead.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: shrink_center_last
parameter.parameter_description: whether to shrink the center widget after others

function.name: gtk_center_box_set_start_widget
function.description:
Sets the start widget.
To remove the existing start widget, pass `NULL`.

Gets whether @self shrinks the center widget after other children.

To remove the existing center widget, pass %NULL.

function.name: gtk_center_layout_set_shrink_center_last
function.description:
Sets whether to shrink the center widget after other children.
By default, when there's no space to give all three children their natural widths, the start and end widgets start shrinking and the center child keeps natural width until they reach minimum width.
If set to `FALSE`, start and end widgets keep natural width and the center widget starts shrinking instead.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_check_button_get_active
function.description: Returns whether the check button is active.
function.return: whether the check button is active

function.name: gtk_check_button_get_child
function.description:
Gets the child widget of @button or `NULL` if [property@CheckButton:label] is set.
Since: 4.8

function.name: gtk_check_button_get_inconsistent
function.description: Returns whether the check button is in an inconsistent state.
function.return: %TRUE if @check_button is currently in an inconsistent state

function.name: gtk_check_button_get_label
function.description: Returns the label of the check button or `NULL` if [property@CheckButton:child] is set.
function.return: The label @self shows next to the indicator. If no label is shown, %NULL will be returned.

function.name: gtk_check_button_get_use_underline
function.description: Returns whether underlines in the label indicate mnemonics.
function.return: The value of the [property@Gtk.CheckButton:use-underline] property. See [method@Gtk.CheckButton.set_use_underline] for details on how to set a new value.

function.name: gtk_check_button_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkCheckButton`.

function.name: gtk_check_button_new_with_label
function.description: Creates a new `GtkCheckButton` with the given text.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the text for the check button.

function.name: gtk_check_button_new_with_mnemonic
function.description: Creates a new `GtkCheckButton` with the given text and a mnemonic.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text of the button, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_active
function.description: Changes the check buttons active state.

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_child
function.description:
Sets the child widget of @button.
Note that by using this API, you take full responsibility for setting up the proper accessibility label and description information for @button. Most likely, you'll either set the accessibility label or description for @button explicitly, or you'll set a labelled-by or described-by relations from @child to @button.
Since: 4.8

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_group
function.description:
Adds @self to the group of @group.
In a group of multiple check buttons, only one button can be active at a time. The behavior of a checkbutton in a group is also commonly known as a *radio button*.
Setting the group of a check button also changes the css name of the indicator widget's CSS node to 'radio'.
Setting up groups in a cycle leads to undefined behavior.
Note that the same effect can be achieved via the [iface@Gtk.Actionable] API, by using the same action with parameter type and state type 's' for all buttons in the group, and giving each button its own target value.

parameter.name: group
parameter.parameter_description: another `GtkCheckButton` to form a group with

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_inconsistent
function.description:
Sets the `GtkCheckButton` to inconsistent state.
You should turn off the inconsistent state again if the user checks the check button. This has to be done manually.

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_label
function.description:
Sets the text of @self.
If [property@Gtk.CheckButton:use-underline] is %TRUE, an underscore in @label is interpreted as mnemonic indicator, see [method@Gtk.CheckButton.set_use_underline] for details on this behavior.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text shown next to the indicator, or %NULL to show no text

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_use_underline
function.description:
Sets whether underlines in the label indicate mnemonics.
If @setting is %TRUE, an underscore character in @self's label indicates a mnemonic accelerator key. This behavior is similar to [property@Gtk.Label:use-underline].

function.name: gtk_check_version
function.description:
Checks that the GTK library in use is compatible with the given version.
Generally you would pass in the constants %GTK_MAJOR_VERSION, %GTK_MINOR_VERSION, %GTK_MICRO_VERSION as the three arguments to this function; that produces a check that the library in use is compatible with the version of GTK the application or module was compiled against.
Compatibility is defined by two things: first the version of the running library is newer than the version @required_major.required_minor.@required_micro. Second the running library must be binary compatible with the version @required_major.required_minor.@required_micro (same major version.)
This function is primarily for GTK modules; the module can call this function to check that it wasn’t loaded into an incompatible version of GTK. However, such a check isn’t completely reliable, since the module may be linked against an old version of GTK and calling the old version of gtk_check_version(), but still get loaded into an application using a newer version of GTK.
function.return: %NULL if the GTK library is compatible with the given version, or a string describing the version mismatch. The returned string is owned by GTK and should not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_closure_expression_new
function.description:
Creates a `GtkExpression` that calls `closure` when it is evaluated.
`closure` is called with the `this` object and the results of evaluating the `params` expressions.

parameter.name: value_type
parameter.parameter_description: the type of the value that this expression evaluates to

parameter.name: closure
parameter.parameter_description: closure to call when evaluating this expression. If closure is floating, it is adopted

parameter.name: n_params
parameter.parameter_description: the number of params needed for evaluating `closure`

function.name: gtk_color_chooser_add_palette
function.description:
Adds a palette to the color chooser.
If @orientation is horizontal, the colors are grouped in rows, with @colors_per_line colors in each row. If @horizontal is %FALSE, the colors are grouped in columns instead.
The default color palette of [class@Gtk.ColorChooserWidget] has 45 colors, organized in columns of 5 colors (this includes some grays).
The layout of the color chooser widget works best when the palettes have 9-10 columns.
Calling this function for the first time has the side effect of removing the default color palette from the color chooser.
If @colors is %NULL, removes all previously added palettes.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.ColorDialog] instead

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.parameter_description: %GTK_ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL if the palette should be displayed in rows, %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL for columns

parameter.name: colors_per_line
parameter.parameter_description: the number of colors to show in each row/column

parameter.name: n_colors
parameter.parameter_description: the total number of elements in @colors

This function is typically called by applications when setting up a listitem so that the widget can be reused when binding it multiple times.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: The list item's child or %NULL to unset

function.name: gtk_column_view_cell_set_focusable
function.description:
Sets @self to be focusable.
If an item is focusable, it can be focused using the keyboard. This works similar to [method@Gtk.Widget.set_focusable].
Note that if items are not focusable, the keyboard cannot be used to activate them and selecting only works if one of the listitem's children is focusable.
By default, list items are focusable.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: focusable
parameter.parameter_description: if the item should be focusable

function.name: gtk_column_view_column_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkColumnViewColumn` that uses the given @factory for mapping items to widgets.
You most likely want to call [method@Gtk.ColumnView.append_column] next.
The function takes ownership of the argument, so you can write code like:
```c column = gtk_column_view_column_new (_("Name"), gtk_builder_list_item_factory_new_from_resource ("/name.ui")); ```

parameter.name: title
parameter.parameter_description: Title to use for this column

parameter.name: factory
parameter.parameter_description: The factory to populate items with

function.name: gtk_column_view_column_set_expand
function.description:
Sets the column to take available extra space.
The extra space is shared equally amongst all columns that have are set to expand.

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: whether this column should expand to fill available space

function.name: gtk_column_view_column_set_factory
function.description: Sets the `GtkListItemFactory` to use for populating list items for this column.

function.name: gtk_column_view_column_set_fixed_width
function.description:
Sets the fixed width of the column.
If @fixed_width is -1, the fixed width of the column is unset.
Setting a fixed width overrides the automatically calculated width. Interactive resizing also sets the “fixed-width” property.

function.name: gtk_column_view_column_set_header_menu
function.description: Sets the menu model that is used to create the context menu for the column header.

function.name: gtk_column_view_column_set_id
function.description:
Sets the id of this column.
GTK makes no use of this, but applications can use it when storing column view configuration.
It is up to callers to ensure uniqueness of IDs.
Since: 4.10

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: ID to use for this column

function.name: gtk_column_view_column_set_resizable

parameter.name: resizable
parameter.parameter_description: whether this column should be resizable

function.name: gtk_column_view_column_set_sorter
function.description:
Associates a sorter with the column.
If @sorter is unset, the column will not let users change the sorting by clicking on its header.
This sorter can be made active by clicking on the column header, or by calling [method@Gtk.ColumnView.sort_by_column].
See [method@Gtk.ColumnView.get_sorter] for the necessary steps for setting up customizable sorting for [class@Gtk.ColumnView].

function.name: gtk_column_view_column_set_title

Sets the title of this column.
The title is displayed in the header of a `GtkColumnView` for this column and is therefore user-facing text that should be translated.

function.name: gtk_column_view_column_set_visible

function.name: gtk_column_view_get_model

function.name: gtk_column_view_get_reorderable

function.name: gtk_column_view_row_get_accessible_label

function.name: gtk_column_view_row_get_focusable

Checks if a row item has been set to be focusable via gtk_column_view_row_set_focusable().

function.description:
Gets the model item that associated with @self.

function.description:
Gets the position in the model that @self currently displays.
If @self is unbound, %GTK_INVALID_LIST_POSITION is returned.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_column_view_row_get_selectable
function.description:
Checks if the row has been set to be selectable via gtk_column_view_row_set_selectable().
Do not confuse this function with [method@Gtk.ColumnViewRow.get_selected].
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_column_view_row_get_selected
function.description:
Checks if the item is selected that this row corresponds to.
The selected state is maintained by the list widget and its model and cannot be set otherwise.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_column_view_row_set_accessible_description
function.description:
Sets the accessible description for the row, which may be used by e.g. screen readers.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_column_view_row_set_accessible_label
function.description:
Sets the accessible label for the row, which may be used by e.g. screen readers.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_column_view_row_set_activatable
function.description:
Sets @self to be activatable.
If a row is activatable, double-clicking on the row, using the Return key or calling gtk_widget_activate() will activate the row. Activating instructs the containing columnview to emit the [signal@Gtk.ColumnView::activate] signal.
By default, row are activatable.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: activatable
parameter.parameter_description: if the row should be activatable

function.name: gtk_column_view_row_set_focusable
function.description:
Sets @self to be focusable.
If a row is focusable, it can be focused using the keyboard. This works similar to [method@Gtk.Widget.set_focusable].
Note that if row are not focusable, the contents of cells can still be focused if they are focusable.
By default, rows are focusable.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: focusable
parameter.parameter_description: if the row should be focusable

function.name: gtk_column_view_row_set_selectable
function.description:
Sets @self to be selectable.
If a row is selectable, clicking on the row or using the keyboard will try to select or unselect the row. Whether this succeeds is up to the model to determine, as it is managing the selected state.
Note that this means that making a row non-selectable has no influence on the selected state at all. A non-selectable row may still be selected.
By default, rows are selectable.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: selectable
parameter.parameter_description: if the row should be selectable

function.name: gtk_column_view_scroll_to
function.description:
Scroll to the row at the given position - or cell if a column is given - and performs the actions specified in @flags.
This function works no matter if the columnview is shown or focused. If it isn't, then the changes will take effect once that happens.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: position of the item. Must be less than the number of items in the view.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: The column to scroll to or `NULL` to not scroll columns

parameter.name: scroll
parameter.parameter_description: details of how to perform the scroll operation or %NULL to scroll into view

function.name: gtk_column_view_set_enable_rubberband
function.description: Sets whether selections can be changed by dragging with the mouse.

function.name: gtk_column_view_set_header_factory
function.description:
Sets the factory to use for populating the [class@Gtk.ListHeader] objects used in section headers.
If this factory is set to `NULL`, the list will not show section headers.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_column_view_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model to use.
This must be a [iface@Gtk.SelectionModel].

function.name: gtk_column_view_set_reorderable
function.description: Sets whether columns should be reorderable by dragging.

function.name: gtk_column_view_set_row_factory
function.description:
Sets the factory used for configuring rows.
The factory must be for configuring [class@Gtk.ColumnViewRow] objects.
If this factory is not set - which is the default - then the defaults will be used.
This factory is not used to set the widgets displayed in the individual cells. For that see [method@GtkColumnViewColumn.set_factory] and [class@GtkColumnViewCell].
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_column_view_set_show_column_separators
function.description: Sets whether the list should show separators between columns.

function.name: gtk_column_view_set_show_row_separators
function.description: Sets whether the list should show separators between rows.

function.name: gtk_column_view_set_single_click_activate
function.description: Sets whether rows should be activated on single click and selected on hover.

parameter.name: single_click_activate
parameter.parameter_description: whether to activate items on single click

function.name: gtk_column_view_set_tab_behavior
function.description:
Sets the <kbd>Tab</kbd> key behavior.
This influences how the <kbd>Tab</kbd> and <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Tab</kbd> keys move the focus in the columnview.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_column_view_sort_by_column
function.description:
Sets the sorting of the view.
This function should be used to set up the initial sorting. At runtime, users can change the sorting of a column view by clicking on the list headers.
This call only has an effect if the sorter returned by [method@Gtk.ColumnView.get_sorter] is set on a sort model, and [method@Gtk.ColumnViewColumn.set_sorter] has been called on @column to associate a sorter with the column.
If @column is unset, the view will be unsorted.

function.name: gtk_column_view_sorter_get_n_sort_columns
function.description:
Returns the number of columns by which the sorter sorts.
If the sorter of the primary sort column does not determine a total order, then the secondary sorters are consulted to break the ties.
Use the [signal@Gtk.Sorter::changed] signal to get notified when the number of sort columns changes.
Since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_column_view_sorter_get_nth_sort_column
function.description:
Gets the @position'th sort column and its associated sort order.
Use the [signal@Gtk.Sorter::changed] signal to get notified when sort columns change.
Since: 4.10

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the sort column to retrieve (0 for the primary sort column)

parameter.name: sort_order
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the sort order

function.name: gtk_column_view_sorter_get_primary_sort_column
function.description:
Returns the primary sort column.
The primary sort column is the one that displays the triangle in a column view header.
Since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_column_view_sorter_get_primary_sort_order
function.description:
Returns the primary sort order.
The primary sort order determines whether the triangle displayed in the column view header of the primary sort column points upwards or downwards.
If there is no primary sort column, then this function returns `GTK_SORT_ASCENDING`.
Since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_active
function.description:
Returns the index of the currently active item.
If the model is a non-flat treemodel, and the active item is not an immediate child of the root of the tree, this function returns `gtk_tree_path_get_indices (path)[0]`, where `path` is the [struct@Gtk.TreePath] of the active item.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]
function.return: An integer which is the index of the currently active item, or -1 if there’s no active item

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_active_id
function.description:
Returns the ID of the active row of @combo_box.
This value is taken from the active row and the column specified by the [property@Gtk.ComboBox:id-column] property of @combo_box (see [method@Gtk.ComboBox.set_id_column]).
The returned value is an interned string which means that you can compare the pointer by value to other interned strings and that you must not free it.
If the [property@Gtk.ComboBox:id-column] property of @combo_box is not set, or if no row is active, or if the active row has a %NULL ID value, then %NULL is returned.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]
function.return: the ID of the active row

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_active_iter
function.description:
Sets @iter to point to the currently active item.
If no item is active, @iter is left unchanged.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_button_sensitivity
function.description:
Returns whether the combo box sets the dropdown button sensitive or not when there are no items in the model.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]
function.return: %GTK_SENSITIVITY_ON if the dropdown button is sensitive when the model is empty, %GTK_SENSITIVITY_OFF if the button is always insensitive or %GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO if it is only sensitive as long as the model has one item to be selected.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_child
function.description:
Gets the child widget of @combo_box.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_entry_text_column
function.description:
Returns the column which @combo_box is using to get the strings from to display in the internal entry.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]
function.return: A column in the data source model of @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_has_entry
function.description:
Returns whether the combo box has an entry.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]
function.return: whether there is an entry in @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_id_column
function.description:
Returns the column which @combo_box is using to get string IDs for values from.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]
function.return: A column in the data source model of @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_model
function.description:
Returns the `GtkTreeModel` of @combo_box.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]
function.return: A `GtkTreeModel` which was passed during construction.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_popup_fixed_width
function.description:
Gets whether the popup uses a fixed width.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]
function.return: %TRUE if the popup uses a fixed width

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_row_separator_func
function.description:
Returns the current row separator function.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new
function.description:
Creates a new empty `GtkComboBox`.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_entry
function.description:
Creates a new empty `GtkComboBox` with an entry.
In order to use a combo box with entry, you need to tell it which column of the model contains the text for the entry by calling [method@Gtk.ComboBox.set_entry_text_column].
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_model
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkComboBox` with a model.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_model_and_entry
function.description:
Creates a new empty `GtkComboBox` with an entry and a model.
See also [ctor@Gtk.ComboBox.new_with_entry].
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_popdown
function.description:
Hides the menu or dropdown list of @combo_box.
This function is mostly intended for use by accessibility technologies; applications should have little use for it.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_popup
function.description:
Pops up the menu or dropdown list of @combo_box.
This function is mostly intended for use by accessibility technologies; applications should have little use for it.
Before calling this, @combo_box must be mapped, or nothing will happen.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_popup_for_device
function.description:
Pops up the menu of @combo_box.
Note that currently this does not do anything with the device, as it was previously only used for list-mode combo boxes, and those were removed in GTK 4. However, it is retained in case similar functionality is added back later.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_active
function.description:
Sets the active item of @combo_box to be the item at @index.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

parameter.name: index_
parameter.parameter_description: An index in the model passed during construction, or -1 to have no active item

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_active_id
function.description:
Changes the active row of @combo_box to the one that has an ID equal to @active_id.
If @active_id is %NULL, the active row is unset. Rows having a %NULL ID string cannot be made active by this function.
If the [property@Gtk.ComboBox:id-column] property of @combo_box is unset or if no row has the given ID then the function does nothing and returns %FALSE.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

parameter.name: active_id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the row to select

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_active_iter
function.description:
Sets the current active item to be the one referenced by @iter.
If @iter is %NULL, the active item is unset.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_button_sensitivity
function.description:
Sets whether the dropdown button of the combo box should update its sensitivity depending on the model contents.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

parameter.name: sensitivity
parameter.parameter_description: specify the sensitivity of the dropdown button

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_child
function.description:
Sets the child widget of @combo_box.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_entry_text_column
function.description:
Sets the model column which @combo_box should use to get strings from to be @text_column.
For this column no separate [class@Gtk.CellRenderer] is needed.
The column @text_column in the model of @combo_box must be of type %G_TYPE_STRING.
This is only relevant if @combo_box has been created with [property@Gtk.ComboBox:has-entry] as %TRUE.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

parameter.name: text_column
parameter.parameter_description: A column in @model to get the strings from for the internal entry

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_id_column
function.description:
Sets the model column which @combo_box should use to get string IDs for values from.
The column @id_column in the model of @combo_box must be of type %G_TYPE_STRING.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

parameter.name: id_column
parameter.parameter_description: A column in @model to get string IDs for values from

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model used by @combo_box to be @model.
Will unset a previously set model (if applicable). If model is %NULL, then it will unset the model.
Note that this function does not clear the cell renderers, you have to call [method@Gtk.CellLayout.clear] yourself if you need to set up different cell renderers for the new model.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_popup_fixed_width
function.description:
Specifies whether the popup’s width should be a fixed width.
If @fixed is %TRUE, the popup's width is set to match the allocated width of the combo box.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

parameter.name: fixed
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use a fixed popup width

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_row_separator_func
function.description:
Sets the row separator function, which is used to determine whether a row should be drawn as a separator.
If the row separator function is %NULL, no separators are drawn. This is the default value.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_append
function.description:
Appends @text to the list of strings stored in @combo_box.
If @id is non-%NULL then it is used as the ID of the row.
This is the same as calling [method@Gtk.ComboBoxText.insert] with a position of -1.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: a string ID for this value

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_append_text
function.description:
Appends @text to the list of strings stored in @combo_box.
This is the same as calling [method@Gtk.ComboBoxText.insert_text] with a position of -1.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_get_active_text
function.description:
Returns the currently active string in @combo_box.
If no row is currently selected, %NULL is returned. If @combo_box contains an entry, this function will return its contents (which will not necessarily be an item from the list).
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]
function.return: a newly allocated string containing the currently active text. Must be freed with g_free().

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_insert
function.description:
Inserts @text at @position in the list of strings stored in @combo_box.
If @id is non-%NULL then it is used as the ID of the row. See [property@Gtk.ComboBox:id-column].
If @position is negative then @text is appended.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: a string ID for this value

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_insert_text
function.description:
Inserts @text at @position in the list of strings stored in @combo_box.
If @position is negative then @text is appended.
This is the same as calling [method@Gtk.ComboBoxText.insert] with a %NULL ID string.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkComboBoxText`.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_new_with_entry
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkComboBoxText` with an entry.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_prepend
function.description:
Prepends @text to the list of strings stored in @combo_box.
If @id is non-%NULL then it is used as the ID of the row.
This is the same as calling [method@Gtk.ComboBoxText.insert] with a position of 0.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: a string ID for this value

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_prepend_text
function.description:
Prepends @text to the list of strings stored in @combo_box.
This is the same as calling [method@Gtk.ComboBoxText.insert_text] with a position of 0.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_remove
function.description:
Removes the string at @position from @combo_box.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: Index of the item to remove

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_remove_all
function.description:
Removes all the text entries from the combo box.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.DropDown]

function.name: gtk_constant_expression_get_value
function.description: Gets the value that a constant expression evaluates to.

function.name: gtk_constant_expression_new
function.description: Creates a `GtkExpression` that evaluates to the object given by the arguments.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: arguments to create the object from

function.name: gtk_constant_expression_new_for_value
function.description: Creates an expression that always evaluates to the given `value`.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_constant
function.description: Retrieves the constant factor added to the source attributes' value.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_multiplier
function.description: Retrieves the multiplication factor applied to the source attribute's value.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_relation
function.description: The order relation between the terms of the constraint.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_source
function.description:
Retrieves the [iface@Gtk.ConstraintTarget] used as the source for the constraint.
If the source is set to `NULL` at creation, the constraint will use the widget using the [class@Gtk.ConstraintLayout] as the source.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_source_attribute
function.description: Retrieves the attribute of the source to be read by the constraint.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_strength
function.description: Retrieves the strength of the constraint.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_target
function.description:
Retrieves the [iface@Gtk.ConstraintTarget] used as the target for the constraint.
If the targe is set to `NULL` at creation, the constraint will use the widget using the [class@Gtk.ConstraintLayout] as the target.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_target_attribute
function.description: Retrieves the attribute of the target to be set by the constraint.

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_get_max_size
function.description: Gets the maximum size of @guide.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the maximum width

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the maximum height

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_get_min_size
function.description: Gets the minimum size of @guide.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the minimum width

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the minimum height

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_get_name
function.description: Retrieves the name set using gtk_constraint_guide_set_name().

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_get_nat_size
function.description: Gets the natural size of @guide.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the natural width

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the natural height

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_get_strength
function.description: Retrieves the strength set using gtk_constraint_guide_set_strength().
function.return: the strength of the constraint on the natural size

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkConstraintGuide` object.
Return: a new `GtkConstraintGuide` object.

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_set_max_size
function.description:
Sets the maximum size of @guide.
If @guide is attached to a `GtkConstraintLayout`, the constraints will be updated to reflect the new size.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the new maximum width, or -1 to not change it

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the new maximum height, or -1 to not change it

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_set_min_size
function.description:
Sets the minimum size of @guide.
If @guide is attached to a `GtkConstraintLayout`, the constraints will be updated to reflect the new size.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the new minimum width, or -1 to not change it

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the new minimum height, or -1 to not change it

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_set_name
function.description:
Sets a name for the given `GtkConstraintGuide`.
The name is useful for debugging purposes.

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_set_nat_size
function.description:
Sets the natural size of @guide.
If @guide is attached to a `GtkConstraintLayout`, the constraints will be updated to reflect the new size.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the new natural width, or -1 to not change it

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the new natural height, or -1 to not change it

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_set_strength
function.description: Sets the strength of the constraint on the natural size of the given `GtkConstraintGuide`.

function.name: gtk_constraint_is_attached
function.description: Checks whether the constraint is attached to a [class@Gtk.ConstraintLayout], and it is contributing to the layout.

function.name: gtk_constraint_is_constant
function.description: Checks whether the constraint describes a relation between an attribute on the [property@Gtk.Constraint:target] and a constant value.
function.return: `TRUE` if the constraint is a constant relation

function.name: gtk_constraint_is_required
function.description: Checks whether the constraint is a required relation for solving the constraint layout.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_add_constraint
function.description:
Adds a constraint to the layout manager.
The [property@Gtk.Constraint:source] and [property@Gtk.Constraint:target] properties of `constraint` can be:
- set to `NULL` to indicate that the constraint refers to the widget using `layout` - set to the [class@Gtk.Widget] using `layout` - set to a child of the [class@Gtk.Widget] using `layout` - set to a [class@Gtk.ConstraintGuide] that is part of `layout`
The @layout acquires the ownership of @constraint after calling this function.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_add_constraints_from_description
function.description:
Creates a list of constraints from a VFL description.
This function is a convenience wrapper around [method@Gtk.ConstraintLayout.add_constraints_from_descriptionv], using variadic arguments to populate the view/target map.

parameter.name: lines
parameter.parameter_description: an array of Visual Format Language lines defining a set of constraints

parameter.name: hspacing
parameter.parameter_description: default horizontal spacing value, or -1 for the fallback value

parameter.name: vspacing
parameter.parameter_description: default vertical spacing value, or -1 for the fallback value

parameter.name: first_view
parameter.parameter_description: the name of a view in the VFL description, followed by the [iface@Gtk.ConstraintTarget] to which it maps

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: a `NULL`-terminated list of view names and [iface@Gtk.ConstraintTarget]s

function.return: the list of [class@Gtk.Constraint]s that were added to the layout

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_add_constraints_from_descriptionv

parameter.name: lines
parameter.parameter_description: an array of Visual Format Language lines defining a set of constraints

parameter.name: hspacing
parameter.parameter_description: default horizontal spacing value, or -1 for the fallback value

parameter.name: vspacing
parameter.parameter_description: default vertical spacing value, or -1 for the fallback value

parameter.name: views
parameter.parameter_description: a dictionary of `[ name, target ]` pairs; the `name` keys map to the view names in the VFL lines, while the `target` values map to children of the widget using a `GtkConstraintLayout`, or guides

function.return: the list of [class@Gtk.Constraint] instances that were added to the layout

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_add_guide
function.description:
Adds a guide to `layout`.
A guide can be used as the source or target of constraints, like a widget, but it is not visible.
The `layout` acquires the ownership of `guide` after calling this function.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkConstraintLayout` layout manager.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_observe_constraints
function.description:
Returns a `GListModel` to track the constraints that are part of the layout.
Calling this function will enable extra internal bookkeeping to track constraints and emit signals on the returned listmodel. It may slow down operations a lot.
Applications should try hard to avoid calling this function because of the slowdowns.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_observe_guides
function.description:
Returns a `GListModel` to track the guides that are part of the layout.
Calling this function will enable extra internal bookkeeping to track guides and emit signals on the returned listmodel. It may slow down operations a lot.
Applications should try hard to avoid calling this function because of the slowdowns.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_remove_all_constraints
function.description: Removes all constraints from the layout manager.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_remove_constraint
function.description: Removes `constraint` from the layout manager, so that it no longer influences the layout.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_remove_guide
function.description: Removes `guide` from the layout manager, so that it no longer influences the layout.

function.name: gtk_constraint_new
function.description: Creates a new constraint representing a relation between a layout attribute on a source and a layout attribute on a target.

parameter.name: target_attribute
parameter.parameter_description: the attribute of `target` to be set

parameter.name: source_attribute
parameter.parameter_description: the attribute of `source` to be read

parameter.name: multiplier
parameter.parameter_description: a multiplication factor to be applied to `source_attribute`

parameter.name: constant
parameter.parameter_description: a constant factor to be added to `source_attribute`

function.name: gtk_constraint_new_constant
function.description: Creates a new constraint representing a relation between a layout attribute on a target and a constant value.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: a the target of the constraint

parameter.name: target_attribute
parameter.parameter_description: the attribute of `target` to be set

parameter.name: constant
parameter.parameter_description: a constant factor to be set on `target_attribute`

function.name: gtk_constraint_vfl_parser_error_quark
function.description: Registers an error quark for VFL error parsing.

function.name: gtk_css_node_new
function.description: Creates a new CSS node.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_consume_ident
function.description:
If the current token is an identifier, consumes it and returns its name.
If the current token is not an identifier, an error is emitted and %NULL is returned.
function.return: the name of the consumed identifier

function.name: gtk_css_parser_consume_string
function.description:
If the current token is a string, consumes it and return the string.
If the current token is not a string, an error is emitted and %NULL is returned.
function.return: the name of the consumed string

function.name: gtk_css_parser_consume_url
function.description: If the parser matches the `<url>` token from the [CSS specification](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-values-4/#url-value), consumes it, resolves the URL and returns the resulting `GFile`. On failure, an error is emitted and %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_error_quark
function.description: Registers an error quark for CSS parsing errors.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_get_block_location
function.description:
Queries the start location of the token that started the current block that is being parsed.
If no block is currently parsed, the beginning of the document is returned.
function.return: The start location of the current block

function.name: gtk_css_parser_get_end_location
function.description:
Queries the location of the current token.
This function will return the location of the end of the current token. In the case a token has been consumed, but no new token has been queried yet via gtk_css_parser_peek_token() or gtk_css_parser_get_token(), the previous token's end location will be returned.
This function may return the same location as gtk_css_parser_get_start_location() - in particular at the beginning and end of the document.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_get_file
function.description: Gets the file being parsed. If no file is associated with @self - for example when raw data is parsed - %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_get_start_location
function.description:
Queries the location of the current token.
This function will return the location of the start of the current token. In the case a token has been consumed, but no new token has been queried yet via gtk_css_parser_peek_token() or gtk_css_parser_get_token(), the previous token's start location will be returned.
This function may return the same location as gtk_css_parser_get_end_location() - in particular at the beginning and end of the document.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_has_function
function.description: Checks if the next token is a function with the given @name.
function.return: %TRUE if the next token is a function with the given @name

function.name: gtk_css_parser_has_ident
function.description: Checks if the next token is an identifier with the given @name.
function.return: %TRUE if the next token is an identifier with the given @name

function.name: gtk_css_parser_has_token
function.description: Checks if the next token is of @token_type.

parameter.name: token_type
parameter.parameter_description: type of the token to check

function.return: %TRUE if the next token is of @token_type

function.name: gtk_css_parser_resolve_url
function.description: Resolves a given URL against the parser's location.
function.return: a new `GFile` for the resolved URL

function.name: gtk_css_parser_try_at_keyword
function.description: Checks if the current token is an at-keyword token with the given @keyword. If that is the case, the token is consumed and %TRUE is returned.

parameter.name: keyword
parameter.parameter_description: name of keyword to check for

function.return: %TRUE if the token matched and was consumed.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_try_delim
function.description:
Checks if the current token is a delimiter matching the given @codepoint. If that is the case, the token is consumed and %TRUE is returned.
Keep in mind that not every unicode codepoint can be a delim token.
function.return: %TRUE if the token matched and was consumed.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_try_ident
function.return: %TRUE if the token matched and was consumed.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_try_token
gtk_css_parser_warning_quark
function.description: Registers an error quark for CSS parsing warnings.

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_from_bytes
function.description:
Loads @data into @css_provider.
This clears any previously loaded information.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_from_data
function.description:
Loads @data into @css_provider.
This clears any previously loaded information.
Deprecated: 4.12: Use [method@Gtk.CssProvider.load_from_string] or [method@Gtk.CssProvider.load_from_bytes] instead

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of @data in bytes, or -1 for NUL terminated strings

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_from_file
function.description:
Loads the data contained in @file into @css_provider.
This clears any previously loaded information.

parameter.name: file
parameter.parameter_description: `GFile` pointing to a file to load

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_from_path
function.description:
Loads the data contained in @path into @css_provider.
This clears any previously loaded information.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the path of a filename to load, in the GLib filename encoding

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_from_resource
function.description:
Loads the data contained in the resource at @resource_path into the @css_provider.
This clears any previously loaded information.

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_from_string
function.description:
Loads @string into @css_provider.
This clears any previously loaded information.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_named
function.description:
Loads a theme from the usual theme paths.
The actual process of finding the theme might change between releases, but it is guaranteed that this function uses the same mechanism to load the theme that GTK uses for loading its own theme.
Deprecated: 4.20: Using any of the other theme loaders, combine with media queries.

parameter.name: variant
parameter.parameter_description: variant to load, for example, "dark", or %NULL for the default

function.name: gtk_css_provider_new
function.description: Returns a newly created `GtkCssProvider`.

function.name: gtk_css_provider_to_string
function.description:
Converts the @provider into a string representation in CSS format.
Using [method@Gtk.CssProvider.load_from_string] with the return value from this function on a new provider created with [ctor@Gtk.CssProvider.new] will basically create a duplicate of this @provider.

parameter.name: provider
parameter.parameter_description: the provider to write to a string

function.name: gtk_css_section_get_bytes
function.description:
Gets the bytes that @section was parsed from.
Since: 4.16
function.return: the `GBytes` from which the `section` was parsed

function.name: gtk_css_section_get_end_location
function.description: Returns the location in the CSS document where this section ends.
function.return: The end location of this section

function.name: gtk_css_section_get_file
function.description:
Gets the file that @section was parsed from.
If no such file exists, for example because the CSS was loaded via [method@Gtk.CssProvider.load_from_data], then `NULL` is returned.
function.return: the `GFile` from which the `section` was parsed

function.name: gtk_css_section_get_parent
function.description:
Gets the parent section for the given `section`.
The parent section is the section that contains this `section`. A special case are sections of type `GTK_CSS_SECTION_DOCUMENT`. Their parent will either be `NULL` if they are the original CSS document that was loaded by [method@Gtk.CssProvider.load_from_file] or a section of type `GTK_CSS_SECTION_IMPORT` if it was loaded with an `@import` rule from a different file.

function.name: gtk_css_section_get_start_location
function.description: Returns the location in the CSS document where this section starts.
function.return: The start location of this section

function.name: gtk_css_section_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkCssSection` referring to the section in the given `file` from the `start` location to the `end` location.

parameter.name: file
parameter.parameter_description: The file this section refers to

function.name: gtk_css_section_new_with_bytes
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkCssSection` referring to the section in the given `file` or the given `bytes` from the `start` location to the `end` location.
Since: 4.16

parameter.name: file
parameter.parameter_description: The file this section refers to

parameter.name: bytes
parameter.parameter_description: The bytes this sections refers to

function.name: gtk_css_section_print
function.description:
Prints the `section` into `string` in a human-readable form.
This is a form like `gtk.css:32:1-23` to denote line 32, characters 1 to 23 in the file `gtk.css`.

function.name: gtk_css_section_ref
function.description: Increments the reference count on `section`.

function.name: gtk_css_section_to_string
function.description: Prints the section into a human-readable text form using [method@Gtk.CssSection.print].

function.name: gtk_css_section_unref
function.description: Decrements the reference count on `section`, freeing the structure if the reference count reaches 0.

function.name: gtk_css_selector_matches
function.description: Checks if the @selector matches the given @node.

function.name: gtk_css_value_compute
function.description: Converts the specified @value into the computed value for the CSS property given by @property_id using the information in @context. This step is explained in detail in the [CSS Documentation](http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-cascade/#computed).

parameter.name: property_id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the property to compute

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the context containing the style provider, style parent style and variables that might be used during computation

function.name: gtk_css_value_get_dynamic_value
function.description:
Gets the dynamic value for a given timestamp. If @monotonic_time is 0, the default value is returned.
See gtk_css_value_is_dynamic() for details about dynamic values.

parameter.name: monotonic_time
parameter.parameter_description: the timestamp for which to get the dynamic value

function.return: The dynamic value for @value at the given timestamp

function.name: gtk_css_value_is_dynamic
function.description:
A "dynamic" value has a different value at different times. This means that the value needs to be animated when time is progressing.
Examples of dynamic values are animated images, such as videos or dynamic shaders.
Use gtk_css_value_get_dynamic_value() to get the value for a given timestamp.

function.name: gtk_css_value_print
function.description: Prints @value to the given @string in CSS format. The @value must be a valid specified value as parsed using the parse functions or as assigned via _gtk_style_property_assign().

function.name: gtk_css_value_resolve
function.description: Converts the computed @value into the used value, by replacing currentcolor with @current_color.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the context containing the style provider, style parent style and variables that might be used during computation

parameter.name: current_color
parameter.parameter_description: the value to use for currentcolor

function.name: gtk_custom_filter_new
function.description:
Creates a new filter using the given function to filter items.
If @match_func is `NULL`, the filter matches all items.
If the filter func changes its filtering behavior, [method@Gtk.Filter.changed] needs to be called.

function.name: gtk_custom_filter_set_filter_func
function.description:
Sets the function used for filtering items.
If @match_func is `NULL`, the filter matches all items.
If the filter func changes its filtering behavior, [method@Gtk.Filter.changed] needs to be called.
If a previous function was set, its @user_destroy will be called.

function.name: gtk_custom_layout_new
function.description:
Creates a new legacy layout manager.
Legacy layout managers map to the old `GtkWidget` size negotiation virtual functions, and are meant to be used during the transition from layout containers to layout manager delegates.

parameter.name: request_mode
parameter.parameter_description: a function to retrieve the `GtkSizeRequestMode` of the widget using the layout; the default request mode is %GTK_SIZE_REQUEST_CONSTANT_SIZE

parameter.name: measure
parameter.parameter_description: a function to measure the widget using the layout manager

parameter.name: allocate
parameter.parameter_description: a function to allocate the children of the widget using the layout manager

function.name: gtk_custom_paper_unix_dialog_new
function.description: Creates a new custom paper dialog.

function.name: gtk_custom_sorter_new
gtk_custom_sorter_set_sort_func
function.description:
Sets (or unsets) the function used for sorting items.
If @sort_func is %NULL, all items are considered equal.
If the sort func changes its sorting behavior, gtk_sorter_changed() needs to be called.
If a previous function was set, its @user_destroy will be called now.

function.name: gtk_dialog_add_action_widget
function.description:
Adds an activatable widget to the action area of a `GtkDialog`.
GTK connects a signal handler that will emit the [signal@Gtk.Dialog::response] signal on the dialog when the widget is activated. The widget is appended to the end of the dialog’s action area.
If you want to add a non-activatable widget, simply pack it into the @action_area field of the `GtkDialog` struct.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

function.name: gtk_dialog_add_button
function.description:
Adds a button with the given text.
GTK arranges things so that clicking the button will emit the [signal@Gtk.Dialog::response] signal with the given @response_id. The button is appended to the end of the dialog’s action area. The button widget is returned, but usually you don’t need it.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

function.name: gtk_dialog_add_buttons
function.description:
Adds multiple buttons.
This is the same as calling [method@Gtk.Dialog.add_button] repeatedly. The variable argument list should be %NULL-terminated as with [ctor@Gtk.Dialog.new_with_buttons]. Each button must have both text and response ID.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for first button, then more text-response_id pairs

function.name: gtk_dialog_error_quark
function.description: Registers an error quark for an operation that requires a dialog if necessary.

function.name: gtk_dialog_get_content_area
function.description:
Returns the content area of @dialog.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

function.name: gtk_dialog_get_header_bar
function.description:
Returns the header bar of @dialog.
Note that the headerbar is only used by the dialog if the [property@Gtk.Dialog:use-header-bar] property is %TRUE.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

function.name: gtk_dialog_get_response_for_widget
function.description:
Gets the response id of a widget in the action area of a dialog.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a widget in the action area of @dialog

function.return: the response id of @widget, or %GTK_RESPONSE_NONE if @widget doesn’t have a response id set.

function.name: gtk_dialog_get_widget_for_response
function.description:
Gets the widget button that uses the given response ID in the action area of a dialog.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

parameter.name: response_id
parameter.parameter_description: the response ID used by the @dialog widget

function.return: the @widget button that uses the given @response_id

function.name: gtk_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new dialog box.
Widgets should not be packed into the `GtkWindow` directly, but into the @content_area and @action_area, as described above.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

function.name: gtk_dialog_new_with_buttons
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkDialog` with the given title and transient parent.
The @flags argument can be used to make the dialog modal, have it destroyed along with its transient parent, or make it use a headerbar.
Button text/response ID pairs should be listed in pairs, with a %NULL pointer ending the list. Button text can be arbitrary text. A response ID can be any positive number, or one of the values in the [enum@Gtk.ResponseType] enumeration. If the user clicks one of these buttons, `GtkDialog` will emit the [signal@Gtk.Dialog::response] signal with the corresponding response ID.
If a `GtkDialog` receives a delete event, it will emit ::response with a response ID of %GTK_RESPONSE_DELETE_EVENT.
However, destroying a dialog does not emit the ::response signal; so be careful relying on ::response when using the %GTK_DIALOG_DESTROY_WITH_PARENT flag.
Here’s a simple example: ```c GtkWindow *main_app_window; // Window the dialog should show up on GtkWidget *dialog; GtkDialogFlags flags = GTK_DIALOG_MODAL | GTK_DIALOG_DESTROY_WITH_PARENT; dialog = gtk_dialog_new_with_buttons ("My dialog", main_app_window, flags, _("_OK"), GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT, _("_Cancel"), GTK_RESPONSE_REJECT, NULL); ```
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

parameter.name: first_button_text
parameter.parameter_description: text to go in first button

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for first button, then additional buttons, ending with %NULL

function.name: gtk_dialog_response
function.description:
Emits the ::response signal with the given response ID.
Used to indicate that the user has responded to the dialog in some way.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

function.name: gtk_dialog_set_default_response
function.description:
Sets the default widget for the dialog based on the response ID.
Pressing “Enter” normally activates the default widget.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

function.name: gtk_dialog_set_response_sensitive
function.description:
A convenient way to sensitize/desensitize dialog buttons.
Calls `gtk_widget_set_sensitive (widget, @setting)` for each widget in the dialog’s action area with the given @response_id.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.Window] instead

function.name: gtk_directory_list_get_attributes
function.description: Gets the attributes queried on the children.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_get_error
function.description:
Gets the loading error, if any.
If an error occurs during the loading process, the loading process will finish and this property allows querying the error that happened. This error will persist until a file is loaded again.
An error being set does not mean that no files were loaded, and all successfully queried files will remain in the list.
function.return: The loading error or %NULL if loading finished successfully

function.name: gtk_directory_list_get_file
function.description: Gets the file whose children are currently enumerated.
function.return: The file whose children are enumerated

function.name: gtk_directory_list_get_io_priority
function.description: Gets the IO priority set via gtk_directory_list_set_io_priority().

function.name: gtk_directory_list_get_monitored
function.description: Returns whether the directory list is monitoring the directory for changes.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_is_loading
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if the children enumeration is currently in progress.
Files will be added to @self from time to time while loading is going on. The order in which are added is undefined and may change in between runs.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkDirectoryList`.
The `GtkDirectoryList` is querying the given @file with the given @attributes.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets the @attributes to be enumerated and starts the enumeration.
If @attributes is %NULL, the list of file infos will still be created, it will just not contain any extra attributes.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_set_file
function.description:
Sets the @file to be enumerated and starts the enumeration.
If @file is %NULL, the result will be an empty list.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_set_io_priority
function.description:
Sets the IO priority to use while loading directories.
Setting the priority while @self is loading will reprioritize the ongoing load as soon as possible.
The default IO priority is %G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT, which is higher than the GTK redraw priority. If you are loading a lot of directories in parallel, lowering it to something like %G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT_IDLE may increase responsiveness.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_set_monitored
function.description:
Sets whether the directory list will monitor the directory for changes.
If monitoring is enabled, the ::items-changed signal will be emitted when the directory contents change.
When monitoring is turned on after the initial creation of the directory list, the directory is reloaded to avoid missing files that appeared between the initial loading and when monitoring was turned on.

parameter.name: monitored
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to monitor the directory for changes

function.name: gtk_disable_portals
function.description:
Prevents GTK from using portals.
This is equivalent to setting `GDK_DEBUG=no-portals` in the environment.
This should only be used in portal implementations, apps must not call it.
Since: 4.18

function.name: gtk_disable_setlocale
function.description:
Prevents [func@Gtk.init] and [func@Gtk.init_check] from calling `setlocale()`.
You would want to use this function if you wanted to set the locale for your program to something other than the user’s locale, or if you wanted to set different values for different locale categories.
Most programs should not need to call this function.

function.name: gtk_distribute_natural_allocation
function.description:
Distributes @extra_space to child @sizes by bringing smaller children up to natural size first.
The remaining space will be added to the @minimum_size member of the `GtkRequestedSize` struct. If all sizes reach their natural size then the remaining space is returned.

parameter.name: extra_space
parameter.parameter_description: Extra space to redistribute among children after subtracting minimum sizes and any child padding from the overall allocation

parameter.name: n_requested_sizes
parameter.parameter_description: Number of requests to fit into the allocation

parameter.name: sizes
parameter.parameter_description: An array of structs with a client pointer and a minimum/natural size in the orientation of the allocation.

function.return: The remainder of @extra_space after redistributing space to @sizes.

function.name: gtk_drag_check_threshold
function.description: Checks to see if a drag movement has passed the GTK drag threshold.

parameter.name: start_x
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate of start of drag

parameter.name: start_y
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate of start of drag

function.return: true if the drag threshold has been passed

function.name: gtk_drag_icon_create_widget_for_value
function.description:
Creates a widget that can be used as a drag icon for the given @value.
Supported types include strings, `GdkRGBA` and `GtkTextBuffer`. If GTK does not know how to create a widget for a given value, it will return %NULL.
This method is used to set the default drag icon on drag-and-drop operations started by `GtkDragSource`, so you don't need to set a drag icon using this function there.
function.return: A new `GtkWidget` for displaying @value as a drag icon.

function.name: gtk_drag_icon_get_child
function.description: Gets the widget currently used as drag icon.

function.name: gtk_drag_icon_get_for_drag
function.description:
Gets the `GtkDragIcon` in use with @drag.
If no drag icon exists yet, a new one will be created and shown.

function.name: gtk_drag_icon_set_child
function.description: Sets the widget to display as the drag icon.

function.name: gtk_drag_icon_set_from_paintable
function.description:
Creates a `GtkDragIcon` that shows @paintable, and associates it with the drag operation.
The hotspot position on the paintable is aligned with the hotspot of the cursor.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_drag_cancel
function.description: Cancels a currently ongoing drag operation.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_get_actions
