function.description: Gets the actions that are currently set on the `GtkDragSource`.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_get_content
function.description: Gets the current content provider of a `GtkDragSource`.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_get_drag
function.description: Returns the underlying `GdkDrag` object for an ongoing drag.
function.return: the `GdkDrag` of the current drag operation

function.name: gtk_drag_source_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkDragSource` object.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_set_actions
function.description:
Sets the actions on the `GtkDragSource`.
During a DND operation, the actions are offered to potential drop targets. If @actions include %GDK_ACTION_MOVE, you need to listen to the [signal@Gtk.DragSource::drag-end] signal and handle @delete_data being %TRUE.
This function can be called before a drag is started, or in a handler for the [signal@Gtk.DragSource::prepare] signal.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_set_content
function.description:
Sets a content provider on a `GtkDragSource`.
When the data is requested in the cause of a DND operation, it will be obtained from the content provider.
This function can be called before a drag is started, or in a handler for the [signal@Gtk.DragSource::prepare] signal.
You may consider setting the content provider back to %NULL in a [signal@Gtk.DragSource::drag-end] signal handler.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_set_icon
function.description:
Sets a paintable to use as icon during DND operations.
The hotspot coordinates determine the point on the icon that gets aligned with the hotspot of the cursor.
If @paintable is %NULL, a default icon is used.
This function can be called before a drag is started, or in a [signal@Gtk.DragSource::prepare] or [signal@Gtk.DragSource::drag-begin] signal handler.

parameter.name: hot_x
parameter.parameter_description: the hotspot X coordinate on the icon

parameter.name: hot_y
parameter.parameter_description: the hotspot Y coordinate on the icon

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_get_content_height
function.description: Retrieves the content height of the `GtkDrawingArea`.
function.return: The height requested for content of the drawing area

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_get_content_width
function.description: Retrieves the content width of the `GtkDrawingArea`.
function.return: The width requested for content of the drawing area

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_new
function.description: Creates a new drawing area.

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_set_content_height
function.description:
Sets the desired height of the contents of the drawing area.
Note that because widgets may be allocated larger sizes than they requested, it is possible that the actual height passed to your draw function is larger than the height set here. You can use [method@Gtk.Widget.set_valign] to avoid that.
If the height is set to 0 (the default), the drawing area may disappear.

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_set_content_width
function.description:
Sets the desired width of the contents of the drawing area.
Note that because widgets may be allocated larger sizes than they requested, it is possible that the actual width passed to your draw function is larger than the width set here. You can use [method@Gtk.Widget.set_halign] to avoid that.
If the width is set to 0 (the default), the drawing area may disappear.

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_set_draw_func
function.description:
Setting a draw function is the main thing you want to do when using a drawing area.
The draw function is called whenever GTK needs to draw the contents of the drawing area to the screen.
The draw function will be called during the drawing stage of GTK. In the drawing stage it is not allowed to change properties of any GTK widgets or call any functions that would cause any properties to be changed. You should restrict yourself exclusively to drawing your contents in the draw function.
If what you are drawing does change, call [method@Gtk.Widget.queue_draw] on the drawing area. This will cause a redraw and will call @draw_func again.

parameter.name: draw_func
parameter.parameter_description: callback that lets you draw the drawing area's contents

function.name: gtk_drop_controller_motion_contains_pointer
function.description: Returns if a Drag-and-Drop operation is within the widget @self or one of its children.
function.return: %TRUE if a dragging pointer is within @self or one of its children.

function.name: gtk_drop_controller_motion_get_drop
function.description: Returns the `GdkDrop` of a current Drag-and-Drop operation over the widget of @self.

function.name: gtk_drop_controller_motion_is_pointer
function.description: Returns if a Drag-and-Drop operation is within the widget @self, not one of its children.
function.return: %TRUE if a dragging pointer is within @self but not one of its children

function.name: gtk_drop_controller_motion_new
function.description: Creates a new event controller that will handle pointer motion events during drag and drop.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_enable_search
function.description: Returns whether search is enabled.
function.return: %TRUE if the popup includes a search entry

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_expression
function.description:
Gets the expression set that is used to obtain strings from items.
See [method@Gtk.DropDown.set_expression].

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_factory
function.description:
Gets the factory that's currently used to populate list items.
The factory returned by this function is always used for the item in the button. It is also used for items in the popup if [property@Gtk.DropDown:list-factory] is not set.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_header_factory
function.description:
Gets the factory that's currently used to create header widgets for the popup.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_list_factory
function.description: Gets the factory that's currently used to populate list items in the popup.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_model
function.description: Gets the model that provides the displayed items.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_search_match_mode
function.description:
Returns the match mode that the search filter is using.
Since: 4.12
function.return: the match mode of the search filter

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_selected
function.description: Gets the position of the selected item.
function.return: the position of the selected item, or %GTK_INVALID_LIST_POSITION if no item is selected

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_selected_item
function.description: Gets the selected item. If no item is selected, %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_show_arrow
function.description:
Returns whether to show an arrow within the widget.
Since: 4.6
function.return: %TRUE if an arrow will be shown.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkDropDown`.
You may want to call [method@Gtk.DropDown.set_factory] to set up a way to map its items to widgets.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_new_from_strings
function.description: Creates a new `GtkDropDown` that is populated with the strings.

parameter.name: strings
parameter.parameter_description: The strings to put in the dropdown

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_enable_search
function.description:
Sets whether a search entry will be shown in the popup that allows to search for items in the list.
Note that [property@Gtk.DropDown:expression] must be set for search to work.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_expression
function.description:
Sets the expression that gets evaluated to obtain strings from items.
This is used for search in the popup. The expression must have a value type of %G_TYPE_STRING.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_factory
function.description: Sets the `GtkListItemFactory` to use for populating list items.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_header_factory
function.description:
Sets the `GtkListItemFactory` to use for creating header widgets for the popup.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_list_factory
function.description: Sets the `GtkListItemFactory` to use for populating list items in the popup.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_model
function.description: Sets the `GListModel` to use.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_search_match_mode
function.description:
Sets the match mode for the search filter.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_selected
function.description: Selects the item at the given position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the item to select, or %GTK_INVALID_LIST_POSITION

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_show_arrow
function.description:
Sets whether an arrow will be displayed within the widget.
Since: 4.6

parameter.name: show_arrow
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show an arrow within the widget

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_get_actions
function.description: Gets the actions that this drop target supports.
function.return: the actions that this drop target supports

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_get_formats
function.description:
Gets the data formats that this drop target accepts.
If the result is %NULL, all formats are expected to be supported.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkDropTargetAsync` object.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_reject_drop
function.description:
Sets the @drop as not accepted on this drag site.
This function should be used when delaying the decision on whether to accept a drag or not until after reading the data.

parameter.name: drop
parameter.parameter_description: the `GdkDrop` of an ongoing drag operation

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_set_actions
function.description: Sets the actions that this drop target supports.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_set_formats
function.description: Sets the data formats that this drop target will accept.

parameter.name: formats
parameter.parameter_description: the supported data formats or %NULL for any format

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_actions
function.description: Gets the actions that this drop target supports.
function.return: the actions that this drop target supports

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_current_drop
function.description:
Gets the currently handled drop operation.
If no drop operation is going on, %NULL is returned.
Since: 4.4

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_drop
function.description:
Gets the currently handled drop operation.
If no drop operation is going on, %NULL is returned.
Deprecated: 4.4: Use [method@Gtk.DropTarget.get_current_drop] instead

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_formats
function.description:
Gets the data formats that this drop target accepts.
If the result is %NULL, all formats are expected to be supported.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_gtypes
function.description:
Gets the list of supported `GType`s that can be dropped on the target.
If no types have been set, `NULL` will be returned.

parameter.name: n_types
parameter.parameter_description: the number of `GType`s contained in the return value

function.return: the `G_TYPE_INVALID`-terminated array of types included in formats

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_preload
function.description: Gets whether data should be preloaded on hover.
function.return: %TRUE if drop data should be preloaded

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_value
function.description: Gets the current drop data, as a `GValue`.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkDropTarget` object.
If the drop target should support more than 1 type, pass %G_TYPE_INVALID for @type and then call [method@Gtk.DropTarget.set_gtypes].

function.name: gtk_drop_target_reject
function.description:
Rejects the ongoing drop operation.
If no drop operation is ongoing, i.e when [property@Gtk.DropTarget:current-drop] is %NULL, this function does nothing.
This function should be used when delaying the decision on whether to accept a drag or not until after reading the data.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_set_actions
function.description: Sets the actions that this drop target supports.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_set_gtypes
function.description: Sets the supported `GType`s for this drop target.

parameter.name: types
parameter.parameter_description: all supported `GType`s that can be dropped on the target

function.name: gtk_drop_target_set_preload
function.description: Sets whether data should be preloaded on hover.

function.name: gtk_editable_delegate_get_accessible_platform_state
function.description:
Retrieves the accessible platform state from the editable delegate.
This is an helper function to retrieve the accessible state for `GtkEditable` interface implementations using a delegate pattern.
You should call this function in your editable widget implementation of the [vfunc@Gtk.Accessible.get_platform_state] virtual function, for instance:
```c static void accessible_interface_init (GtkAccessibleInterface *iface) { iface->get_platform_state = your_editable_get_accessible_platform_state; }
static gboolean your_editable_get_accessible_platform_state (GtkAccessible *accessible, GtkAccessiblePlatformState state) { return gtk_editable_delegate_get_accessible_platform_state (GTK_EDITABLE (accessible), state); } ```
Note that the widget which is the delegate *must* be a direct child of this widget, otherwise your implementation of [vfunc@Gtk.Accessible.get_platform_state] might not even be called, as the platform change will originate from the parent of the delegate, and, as a result, will not work properly.
So, if you can't ensure the direct child condition, you should give the delegate the %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_TEXT_BOX role, or you can change your tree to allow this function to work.
Since: 4.10

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: what kind of accessible state to retrieve

function.return: the accessible platform state of the delegate

function.name: gtk_editable_delegate_get_property
function.description:
Gets a property of the `GtkEditable` delegate for @object.
This is helper function that should be called in the `get_property` function of your `GtkEditable` implementation, before handling your own properties.

function.name: gtk_editable_delegate_set_property
function.description:
Sets a property on the `GtkEditable` delegate for @object.
This is a helper function that should be called in the `set_property` function of your `GtkEditable` implementation, before handling your own properties.

function.name: gtk_editable_delete_selection
function.description:
Deletes the currently selected text of the editable.
This call doesn’t do anything if there is no selected text.

function.name: gtk_editable_delete_text
function.description:
Deletes a sequence of characters.
The characters that are deleted are those characters at positions from @start_pos up to, but not including @end_pos. If @end_pos is negative, then the characters deleted are those from @start_pos to the end of the text.
Note that the positions are specified in characters, not bytes.

function.name: gtk_editable_finish_delegate
function.description:
Undoes the setup done by [method@Gtk.Editable.init_delegate].
This is a helper function that should be called from dispose, before removing the delegate object.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_alignment
function.description: Gets the alignment of the editable.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_chars
function.description:
Retrieves a sequence of characters.
The characters that are retrieved are those characters at positions from @start_pos up to, but not including @end_pos. If @end_pos is negative, then the characters retrieved are those characters from @start_pos to the end of the text.
Note that positions are specified in characters, not bytes.
function.return: a pointer to the contents of the widget as a string. This string is allocated by the `GtkEditable` implementation and should be freed by the caller.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_delegate
function.description:
Gets the `GtkEditable` that @editable is delegating its implementation to.
Typically, the delegate is a [class@Gtk.Text] widget.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_editable
function.description: Retrieves whether @editable is editable.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_enable_undo
function.description: Gets if undo/redo actions are enabled for @editable

function.name: gtk_editable_get_max_width_chars
function.description: Retrieves the desired maximum width of @editable, in characters.
function.return: the maximum width of the entry, in characters

function.name: gtk_editable_get_position
function.description:
Retrieves the current position of the cursor relative to the start of the content of the editable.
Note that this position is in characters, not in bytes.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_selection_bounds

parameter.name: start_pos
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the starting position

parameter.name: end_pos
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the end position

function.return: %TRUE if there is a non-empty selection, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_editable_get_text
function.description:
Retrieves the contents of @editable.
The returned string is owned by GTK and must not be modified or freed.
function.return: a pointer to the contents of the editable

function.name: gtk_editable_get_width_chars
function.description: Gets the number of characters of space reserved for the contents of the editable.
function.return: number of chars to request space for, or negative if unset

function.name: gtk_editable_init_delegate
function.description:
Sets up a delegate for `GtkEditable`.
This is assuming that the get_delegate vfunc in the `GtkEditable` interface has been set up for the @editable's type.
This is a helper function that should be called in instance init, after creating the delegate object.

function.name: gtk_editable_insert_text
function.description:
Inserts @length bytes of @text into the contents of the widget, at position @position.
Note that the position is in characters, not in bytes. The function updates @position to point after the newly inserted text.

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the text in bytes, or -1

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: location of the position text will be inserted at

function.name: gtk_editable_install_properties
function.description:
Overrides the `GtkEditable` properties for @class.
This is a helper function that should be called in class_init, after installing your own properties.
Note that your class must have "text", "cursor-position", "selection-bound", "editable", "width-chars", "max-width-chars", "xalign" and "enable-undo" properties for this function to work.
To handle the properties in your set_property and get_property functions, you can either use [func@Gtk.Editable.delegate_set_property] and [func@Gtk.Editable.delegate_get_property] (if you are using a delegate), or remember the @first_prop offset and add it to the values in the [enum@Gtk.EditableProperties] enumeration to get the property IDs for these properties.

parameter.name: first_prop
parameter.parameter_description: property ID to use for the first property

function.return: the number of properties that were installed

function.name: gtk_editable_label_get_editing
function.description: Returns whether the label is currently in “editing mode”.
function.return: %TRUE if @self is currently in editing mode

function.name: gtk_editable_label_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkEditableLabel` widget.

function.name: gtk_editable_label_start_editing
function.description: Switches the label into “editing mode”.

function.name: gtk_editable_label_stop_editing
function.description:
Switches the label out of “editing mode”.
If @commit is %TRUE, the resulting text is kept as the [property@Gtk.Editable:text] property value, otherwise the resulting text is discarded and the label will keep its previous [property@Gtk.Editable:text] property value.

parameter.name: commit
parameter.parameter_description: whether to set the edited text on the label

function.name: gtk_editable_select_region
function.description:
Selects a region of text.
The characters that are selected are those characters at positions from @start_pos up to, but not including @end_pos. If @end_pos is negative, then the characters selected are those characters from @start_pos to the end of the text.
Note that positions are specified in characters, not bytes.

function.name: gtk_editable_set_alignment
function.description:
Sets the alignment for the contents of the editable.
This controls the horizontal positioning of the contents when the displayed text is shorter than the width of the editable.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: The horizontal alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reversed for RTL layouts

function.name: gtk_editable_set_editable
function.description: Determines if the user can edit the text in the editable widget.

parameter.name: is_editable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the user is allowed to edit the text in the widget

function.name: gtk_editable_set_enable_undo
function.description:
If enabled, changes to @editable will be saved for undo/redo actions.
This results in an additional copy of text changes and are not stored in secure memory. As such, undo is forcefully disabled when [property@Gtk.Text:visibility] is set to %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_editable_set_max_width_chars
function.description: Sets the desired maximum width in characters of @editable.

parameter.name: n_chars
parameter.parameter_description: the new desired maximum width, in characters

function.name: gtk_editable_set_position
function.description:
Sets the cursor position in the editable to the given value.
The cursor is displayed before the character with the given (base 0) index in the contents of the editable. The value must be less than or equal to the number of characters in the editable. A value of -1 indicates that the position should be set after the last character of the editable. Note that @position is in characters, not in bytes.

function.name: gtk_editable_set_text
function.description:
Sets the text in the editable to the given value.
This is replacing the current contents.

function.name: gtk_editable_set_width_chars
function.description:
Changes the size request of the editable to be about the right size for @n_chars characters.
Note that it changes the size request, the size can still be affected by how you pack the widget into containers. If @n_chars is -1, the size reverts to the default size.

function.name: gtk_emoji_chooser_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkEmojiChooser`.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_delete_text
function.description:
Deletes a sequence of characters from the buffer.
@n_chars characters are deleted starting at @position. If @n_chars is negative, then all characters until the end of the text are deleted.
If @position or @n_chars are out of bounds, then they are coerced to sane values.
Note that the positions are specified in characters, not bytes.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position at which to delete text

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_emit_deleted_text
function.description: Used when subclassing `GtkEntryBuffer`.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position at which text was deleted

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_emit_inserted_text
function.description: Used when subclassing `GtkEntryBuffer`.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position at which text was inserted

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_get_bytes
function.description:
Retrieves the length in bytes of the buffer.
See [method@Gtk.EntryBuffer.get_length].
function.return: The byte length of the buffer.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_get_length
function.description: Retrieves the length in characters of the buffer.
function.return: The number of characters in the buffer.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_get_max_length
function.description: Retrieves the maximum allowed length of the text in @buffer.
function.return: the maximum allowed number of characters in `GtkEntryBuffer`, or 0 if there is no maximum.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_get_text
function.description:
Retrieves the contents of the buffer.
The memory pointer returned by this call will not change unless this object emits a signal, or is finalized.
function.return: a pointer to the contents of the widget as a string. This string points to internally allocated storage in the buffer and must not be freed, modified or stored.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_insert_text
function.description:
Inserts @n_chars characters of @chars into the contents of the buffer, at position @position.
If @n_chars is negative, then characters from chars will be inserted until a null-terminator is found. If @position or @n_chars are out of bounds, or the maximum buffer text length is exceeded, then they are coerced to sane values.
Note that the position and length are in characters, not in bytes.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position at which to insert text.

parameter.name: chars
parameter.parameter_description: the text to insert into the buffer.

parameter.name: n_chars
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the text in characters, or -1

function.return: The number of characters actually inserted.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_new
function.description:
Create a new `GtkEntryBuffer` object.
Optionally, specify initial text to set in the buffer.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_set_max_length
function.description:
Sets the maximum allowed length of the contents of the buffer.
If the current contents are longer than the given length, then they will be truncated to fit.

parameter.name: max_length
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum length of the entry buffer, or 0 for no maximum. (other than the maximum length of entries.) The value passed in will be clamped to the range 0-65536.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_set_text
function.description:
Sets the text in the buffer.
This is roughly equivalent to calling [method@Gtk.EntryBuffer.delete_text] and [method@Gtk.EntryBuffer.insert_text].
Note that @n_chars is in characters, not in bytes.

parameter.name: n_chars
parameter.parameter_description: the number of characters in @text, or -1

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_complete
function.description:
Requests a completion operation, or in other words a refiltering of the current list with completions, using the current key.
The completion list view will be updated accordingly.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_compute_prefix
function.description:
Computes the common prefix that is shared by all rows in @completion that start with @key.
If no row matches @key, %NULL will be returned. Note that a text column must have been set for this function to work, see [method@Gtk.EntryCompletion.set_text_column] for details.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.
function.return: The common prefix all rows starting with @key

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_completion_prefix
function.description:
Get the original text entered by the user that triggered the completion or %NULL if there’s no completion ongoing.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.
function.return: the prefix for the current completion

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_entry
function.description:
Gets the entry @completion has been attached to.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.
function.return: The entry @completion has been attached to

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_inline_completion
function.description:
Returns whether the common prefix of the possible completions should be automatically inserted in the entry.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.
function.return: %TRUE if inline completion is turned on

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_inline_selection
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if inline-selection mode is turned on.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_minimum_key_length
function.description:
Returns the minimum key length as set for @completion.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.
function.return: The currently used minimum key length

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_model
function.description:
Returns the model the `GtkEntryCompletion` is using as data source.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_popup_completion
function.description:
Returns whether the completions should be presented in a popup window.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.
function.return: %TRUE if popup completion is turned on

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_popup_set_width
function.description:
Returns whether the completion popup window will be resized to the width of the entry.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.
function.return: %TRUE if the popup window will be resized to the width of the entry

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_popup_single_match
function.description:
Returns whether the completion popup window will appear even if there is only a single match.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.
function.return: %TRUE if the popup window will appear regardless of the number of matches

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_text_column
function.description:
Returns the column in the model of @completion to get strings from.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_insert_prefix
function.description:
Requests a prefix insertion.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkEntryCompletion` object.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_new_with_area
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkEntryCompletion` object using the specified @area.
The `GtkCellArea` is used to layout cells in the underlying `GtkTreeViewColumn` for the drop-down menu.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_inline_completion
function.description:
Sets whether the common prefix of the possible completions should be automatically inserted in the entry.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_inline_selection
function.description:
Sets whether it is possible to cycle through the possible completions inside the entry.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_match_func
function.description:
Sets the match function for @completion to be @func.
The match function is used to determine if a row should or should not be in the completion list.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_minimum_key_length
function.description:
Requires the length of the search key for @completion to be at least @length.
This is useful for long lists, where completing using a small key takes a lot of time and will come up with meaningless results anyway (ie, a too large dataset).
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the minimum length of the key in order to start completing

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model for a `GtkEntryCompletion`.
If @completion already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. If model is %NULL, then it will unset the model.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_popup_completion
function.description:
Sets whether the completions should be presented in a popup window.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_popup_set_width
function.description:
Sets whether the completion popup window will be resized to be the same width as the entry.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

parameter.name: popup_set_width
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to make the width of the popup the same as the entry

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_popup_single_match
function.description:
Sets whether the completion popup window will appear even if there is only a single match.
You may want to set this to %FALSE if you are using [property@Gtk.EntryCompletion:inline-completion].
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

parameter.name: popup_single_match
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the popup should appear even for a single match

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_text_column
function.description:
Convenience function for setting up the most used case of this code: a completion list with just strings.
This function will set up @completion to have a list displaying all (and just) strings in the completion list, and to get those strings from @column in the model of @completion.
This functions creates and adds a `GtkCellRendererText` for the selected column. If you need to set the text column, but don't want the cell renderer, use g_object_set() to set the [property@Gtk.EntryCompletion:text-column] property directly.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the column in the model of @completion to get strings from

function.name: gtk_entry_get_activates_default
function.description: Retrieves the value set by gtk_entry_set_activates_default().
function.return: %TRUE if the entry will activate the default widget

function.name: gtk_entry_get_alignment
function.description:
Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_alignment().
See also: [property@Gtk.Editable:xalign]

function.name: gtk_entry_get_attributes
function.description:
Gets the attribute list of the `GtkEntry`.
See [method@Gtk.Entry.set_attributes].

function.name: gtk_entry_get_buffer
function.description: Get the `GtkEntryBuffer` object which holds the text for this widget.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_completion
function.description:
Returns the auxiliary completion object currently in use by @entry.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.
function.return: The auxiliary completion object currently in use by @entry

function.name: gtk_entry_get_current_icon_drag_source
function.description: Returns the index of the icon which is the source of the current DND operation, or -1.
function.return: index of the icon which is the source of the current DND operation, or -1.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_extra_menu
function.description: Gets the menu model set with gtk_entry_set_extra_menu().

function.name: gtk_entry_get_has_frame
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_has_frame().
function.return: whether the entry has a beveled frame

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_activatable
function.description: Returns whether the icon is activatable.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_area
function.description:
Gets the area where entry’s icon at @icon_pos is drawn.
This function is useful when drawing something to the entry in a draw callback.
If the entry is not realized or has no icon at the given position, @icon_area is filled with zeros. Otherwise, @icon_area will be filled with the icon's allocation, relative to @entry's allocation.

parameter.name: icon_area
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the icon’s area

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_at_pos
function.description:
Finds the icon at the given position and return its index.
The position’s coordinates are relative to the @entry’s top left corner. If @x, @y doesn’t lie inside an icon, -1 is returned. This function is intended for use in a [signal@Gtk.Widget::query-tooltip] signal handler.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the x coordinate of the position to find, relative to @entry

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the y coordinate of the position to find, relative to @entry

function.return: the index of the icon at the given position, or -1

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_gicon
function.description:
Retrieves the `GIcon` used for the icon.
%NULL will be returned if there is no icon or if the icon was set by some other method (e.g., by `GdkPaintable` or icon name).

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_name
function.description:
Retrieves the icon name used for the icon.
%NULL is returned if there is no icon or if the icon was set by some other method (e.g., by `GdkPaintable` or gicon).

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_paintable
function.description:
Retrieves the `GdkPaintable` used for the icon.
If no `GdkPaintable` was used for the icon, %NULL is returned.
function.return: A `GdkPaintable` if no icon is set for this position or the icon set is not a `GdkPaintable`.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_sensitive
function.description: Returns whether the icon appears sensitive or insensitive.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_storage_type
function.description:
Gets the type of representation being used by the icon to store image data.
If the icon has no image data, the return value will be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_tooltip_markup
function.description: Gets the contents of the tooltip on the icon at the specified position in @entry.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_tooltip_text
function.description: Gets the contents of the tooltip on the icon at the specified position in @entry.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_input_hints
function.description: Gets the input hints of this `GtkEntry`.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_input_purpose
function.description: Gets the input purpose of the `GtkEntry`.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_invisible_char
function.description: Retrieves the character displayed in place of the actual text in “password mode”.
function.return: the current invisible char, or 0, if the entry does not show invisible text at all.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_max_length
function.description:
Retrieves the maximum allowed length of the text in @entry.
See [method@Gtk.Entry.set_max_length].
function.return: the maximum allowed number of characters in `GtkEntry`, or 0 if there is no maximum.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_menu_entry_icon_text
function.description:
Gets the text that will be used in the context menu of the `GtkEntry` when the specified icon is activatable. Selecting this item in the menu results, from all aspects, the same than clicking on the specified icon. This greatly simplifies making accessible applications, because the icons aren't focusable when using keyboard navigation. This is why Gtk recommends to add the same action to the context menu.
Since: 4.20
function.return: the text that will be used in the menu item, or NULL if no menu item is desired.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_overwrite_mode
function.description: Gets whether the `GtkEntry` is in overwrite mode.
function.return: whether the text is overwritten when typing.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_placeholder_text
function.description: Retrieves the text that will be displayed when @entry is empty and unfocused
function.return: a pointer to the placeholder text as a string. This string points to internally allocated storage in the widget and must not be freed, modified or stored. If no placeholder text has been set, %NULL will be returned.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_progress_fraction
function.description:
Returns the current fraction of the task that’s been completed.
See [method@Gtk.Entry.set_progress_fraction].

function.name: gtk_entry_get_progress_pulse_step
function.description: Retrieves the pulse step set with gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step().

function.name: gtk_entry_get_tabs
function.description:
Gets the tabstops of the `GtkEntry`.
See [method@Gtk.Entry.set_tabs].

function.name: gtk_entry_get_text_length
function.description:
Retrieves the current length of the text in @entry.
This is equivalent to getting @entry's `GtkEntryBuffer` and calling [method@Gtk.EntryBuffer.get_length] on it.
function.return: the current number of characters in `GtkEntry`, or 0 if there are none.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_visibility
function.description:
Retrieves whether the text in @entry is visible.
See [method@Gtk.Entry.set_visibility].
function.return: %TRUE if the text is currently visible

function.name: gtk_entry_grab_focus_without_selecting
function.description:
Causes @entry to have keyboard focus.
It behaves like [method@Gtk.Widget.grab_focus], except that it doesn't select the contents of the entry. You only want to call this on some special entries which the user usually doesn't want to replace all text in, such as search-as-you-type entries.

function.name: gtk_entry_new
function.description: Creates a new entry.

function.name: gtk_entry_new_with_buffer
function.description: Creates a new entry with the specified text buffer.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: The buffer to use for the new `GtkEntry`.

function.name: gtk_entry_progress_pulse
function.description:
Indicates that some progress is made, but you don’t know how much.
Causes the entry’s progress indicator to enter “activity mode”, where a block bounces back and forth. Each call to gtk_entry_progress_pulse() causes the block to move by a little bit (the amount of movement per pulse is determined by [method@Gtk.Entry.set_progress_pulse_step]).

function.name: gtk_entry_reset_im_context
function.description:
Reset the input method context of the entry if needed.
This can be necessary in the case where modifying the buffer would confuse on-going input method behavior.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_activates_default
function.description:
Sets whether pressing Enter in the @entry will activate the default widget for the window containing the entry.
This usually means that the dialog containing the entry will be closed, since the default widget is usually one of the dialog buttons.

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to activate window’s default widget on Enter keypress

function.name: gtk_entry_set_alignment
function.description:
Sets the alignment for the contents of the entry.
This controls the horizontal positioning of the contents when the displayed text is shorter than the width of the entry.
See also: [property@Gtk.Editable:xalign]

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: The horizontal alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reversed for RTL layouts

function.name: gtk_entry_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets a `PangoAttrList`.
The attributes in the list are applied to the entry text.
Since the attributes will be applied to text that changes as the user types, it makes most sense to use attributes with unlimited extent.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_buffer
function.description: Set the `GtkEntryBuffer` object which holds the text for this widget.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_completion
function.description:
Sets @completion to be the auxiliary completion object to use with @entry.
All further configuration of the completion mechanism is done on @completion using the `GtkEntryCompletion` API. Completion is disabled if @completion is set to %NULL.
Deprecated: 4.10: GtkEntryCompletion will be removed in GTK 5.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_extra_menu
function.description: Sets a menu model to add when constructing the context menu for @entry.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_has_frame
function.description: Sets whether the entry has a beveled frame around it.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_activatable
function.description: Sets whether the icon is activatable.

parameter.name: activatable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the icon should be activatable

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_drag_source
function.description:
Sets up the icon at the given position as drag source.
This makes it so that GTK will start a drag operation when the user clicks and drags the icon.

parameter.name: actions
parameter.parameter_description: a bitmask of the allowed drag actions

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_gicon
function.description:
Sets the icon shown in the entry at the specified position from the current icon theme.
If the icon isn’t known, a “broken image” icon will be displayed instead.
If @icon is %NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.

parameter.name: icon_pos
parameter.parameter_description: The position at which to set the icon

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_icon_name
function.description:
Sets the icon shown in the entry at the specified position from the current icon theme.
If the icon name isn’t known, a “broken image” icon will be displayed instead.
If @icon_name is %NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.

parameter.name: icon_pos
parameter.parameter_description: The position at which to set the icon

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_paintable
function.description:
Sets the icon shown in the specified position using a `GdkPaintable`.
If @paintable is %NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_sensitive
function.description: Sets the sensitivity for the specified icon.

parameter.name: sensitive
parameter.parameter_description: Specifies whether the icon should appear sensitive or insensitive

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_markup
function.description:
Sets @tooltip as the contents of the tooltip for the icon at the specified position.
@tooltip is assumed to be marked up with Pango Markup.
Use %NULL for @tooltip to remove an existing tooltip.
See also [method@Gtk.Widget.set_tooltip_markup] and [method@Gtk.Entry.set_icon_tooltip_text].

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: the contents of the tooltip for the icon

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_text
function.description:
Sets @tooltip as the contents of the tooltip for the icon at the specified position.
Use %NULL for @tooltip to remove an existing tooltip.
See also [method@Gtk.Widget.set_tooltip_text] and [method@Gtk.Entry.set_icon_tooltip_markup].
If you unset the widget tooltip via [method@Gtk.Widget.set_tooltip_text] or [method@Gtk.Widget.set_tooltip_markup], this sets [property@Gtk.Widget:has-tooltip] to %FALSE, which suppresses icon tooltips too. You can resolve this by then calling [method@Gtk.Widget.set_has_tooltip] to set [property@Gtk.Widget:has-tooltip] back to %TRUE, or setting at least one non-empty tooltip on any icon achieves the same result.

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: the contents of the tooltip for the icon

function.name: gtk_entry_set_input_hints
function.description: Set additional hints which allow input methods to fine-tune their behavior.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_input_purpose
function.description: Sets the input purpose which can be used by input methods to adjust their behavior.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_invisible_char
function.description:
Sets the character to use in place of the actual text in “password mode”.
See [method@Gtk.Entry.set_visibility] for how to enable “password mode”.
By default, GTK picks the best invisible char available in the current font. If you set the invisible char to 0, then the user will get no feedback at all; there will be no text on the screen as they type.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_max_length
function.description:
Sets the maximum allowed length of the contents of the widget.
If the current contents are longer than the given length, then they will be truncated to fit. The length is in characters.
This is equivalent to getting @entry's `GtkEntryBuffer` and calling [method@Gtk.EntryBuffer.set_max_length] on it.

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum length of the entry, or 0 for no maximum. (other than the maximum length of entries.) The value passed in will be clamped to the range 0-65536.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_menu_entry_icon_text
function.description:
Sets the text that will be used in the context menu of the `GtkEntry` when the specified icon is activatable. Selecting this item in the menu results, from all aspects, the same than clicking on the specified icon. This greatly simplifies making accessible applications, because the icons aren't focusable when using keyboard navigation. This is why Gtk recommends to add the same action to the context menu.
Since: 4.20

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: the text used for the menu item in the context menu, or NULL to not add a menu item.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_overwrite_mode
function.description: Sets whether the text is overwritten when typing in the `GtkEntry`.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_placeholder_text
function.description:
Sets text to be displayed in @entry when it is empty.
This can be used to give a visual hint of the expected contents of the `GtkEntry`.

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: a string to be displayed when @entry is empty and unfocused

function.name: gtk_entry_set_progress_fraction
function.description:
Causes the entry’s progress indicator to “fill in” the given fraction of the bar.
The fraction should be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

parameter.name: fraction
parameter.parameter_description: fraction of the task that’s been completed

function.name: gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step
function.description:
Sets the fraction of total entry width to move the progress bouncing block for each pulse.
Use [method@Gtk.Entry.progress_pulse] to pulse the progress.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_tabs
function.description:
Sets a `PangoTabArray`.
The tabstops in the array are applied to the entry text.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_visibility
function.description:
Sets whether the contents of the entry are visible or not.
When visibility is set to %FALSE, characters are displayed as the invisible char, and will also appear that way when the text in the entry widget is copied elsewhere.
By default, GTK picks the best invisible character available in the current font, but it can be changed with [method@Gtk.Entry.set_invisible_char].
Note that you probably want to set [property@Gtk.Entry:input-purpose] to %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_PASSWORD or %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_PIN to inform input methods about the purpose of this entry, in addition to setting visibility to %FALSE.

parameter.name: visible
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the contents of the entry are displayed as plaintext

function.name: gtk_entry_unset_invisible_char
function.description: Unsets the invisible char, so that the default invisible char is used again. See [method@Gtk.Entry.set_invisible_char].

function.name: gtk_enumerate_printers
function.description:
Calls a function for all printers that are known to GTK.
If @func returns true, the enumeration is stopped.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call for each printer

parameter.name: destroy
parameter.parameter_description: function to call if @data is no longer needed

parameter.name: wait
parameter.parameter_description: if true, wait in a recursive mainloop until all printers are enumerated; otherwise return early

function.name: gtk_event_controller_focus_contains_focus
function.description: Returns %TRUE if focus is within @self or one of its children.
function.return: %TRUE if focus is within @self or one of its children

function.name: gtk_event_controller_focus_is_focus
function.description: Returns %TRUE if focus is within @self, but not one of its children.
function.return: %TRUE if focus is within @self, but not one of its children

function.name: gtk_event_controller_focus_new
function.description: Creates a new event controller that will handle focus events.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_current_event
function.description:
Returns the event that is currently being handled by the controller.
At other times, %NULL is returned.
function.return: the event that is currently handled by @controller

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_current_event_device
function.description:
Returns the device of the event that is currently being handled by the controller.
At other times, %NULL is returned.
function.return: device of the event is currently handled by @controller

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_current_event_state
function.description:
Returns the modifier state of the event that is currently being handled by the controller.
At other times, 0 is returned.
function.return: modifier state of the event is currently handled by @controller

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_current_event_time
function.description:
Returns the timestamp of the event that is currently being handled by the controller.
At other times, 0 is returned.
function.return: timestamp of the event is currently handled by @controller

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_name
function.description: Gets the name of @controller.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_propagation_limit
function.description: Gets the propagation limit of the event controller.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_propagation_phase
function.description: Gets the propagation phase at which @controller handles events.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_widget
function.description: Returns the `GtkWidget` this controller relates to.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_key_forward
function.description:
Forwards the current event of this @controller to a @widget.
This function can only be used in handlers for the [signal@Gtk.EventControllerKey::key-pressed], [signal@Gtk.EventControllerKey::key-released] or [signal@Gtk.EventControllerKey::modifiers] signals.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_key_get_group
function.description:
Gets the key group of the current event of this @controller.
See [method@Gdk.KeyEvent.get_layout].

function.name: gtk_event_controller_key_get_im_context
function.description: Gets the input method context of the key @controller.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_key_new
function.description: Creates a new event controller that will handle key events.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_key_set_im_context
function.description: Sets the input method context of the key @controller.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_legacy_new
function.description: Creates a new legacy event controller.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_motion_contains_pointer
function.description: Returns if a pointer is within @self or one of its children.
function.return: %TRUE if a pointer is within @self or one of its children

function.name: gtk_event_controller_motion_is_pointer
function.description: Returns if a pointer is within @self, but not one of its children.
function.return: %TRUE if a pointer is within @self but not one of its children

function.name: gtk_event_controller_motion_new
function.description: Creates a new event controller that will handle motion events.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_reset
function.description: Resets the @controller to a clean state.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_scroll_get_flags
function.description: Gets the flags conditioning the scroll controller behavior.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_scroll_get_unit
function.description:
Gets the scroll unit of the last [signal@Gtk.EventControllerScroll::scroll] signal received.
Always returns %GDK_SCROLL_UNIT_WHEEL if the %GTK_EVENT_CONTROLLER_SCROLL_DISCRETE flag is set.
Since: 4.8

function.name: gtk_event_controller_scroll_new
function.description: Creates a new event controller that will handle scroll events.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_scroll_set_flags
function.description: Sets the flags conditioning scroll controller behavior.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_set_name
function.description: Sets a name on the controller that can be used for debugging.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_set_propagation_limit
function.description:
Sets the event propagation limit on the event controller.
If the limit is set to %GTK_LIMIT_SAME_NATIVE, the controller won't handle events that are targeted at widgets on a different surface, such as popovers.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_set_propagation_phase
function.description:
Sets the propagation phase at which a controller handles events.
If @phase is %GTK_PHASE_NONE, no automatic event handling will be performed, but other additional gesture maintenance will.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_set_static_name
function.description:
Sets a name on the controller that can be used for debugging.
Since: 4.8

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: a name for @controller, must be a static string

function.name: gtk_every_filter_new
function.description:
Creates a new empty "every" filter.
Use [method@Gtk.MultiFilter.append] to add filters to it.
This filter matches an item if each of the filters added to it matches the item. In particular, this means that if no filter has been added to it, the filter matches every item.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @expander.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_expanded
function.description: Queries a `GtkExpander` and returns its current state.
function.return: the current state of the expander

function.name: gtk_expander_get_label
function.description:
Fetches the text from a label widget.
This is including any embedded underlines indicating mnemonics and Pango markup, as set by [method@Gtk.Expander.set_label]. If the label text has not been set the return value will be %NULL. This will be the case if you create an empty button with gtk_button_new() to use as a container.
function.return: The text of the label widget. This string is owned by the widget and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_label_widget
function.description: Retrieves the label widget for the frame.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_resize_toplevel
function.description: Returns whether the expander will resize the toplevel widget containing the expander upon resizing and collapsing.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_use_markup
function.description: Returns whether the label’s text is interpreted as Pango markup.
function.return: %TRUE if the label’s text will be parsed for markup

function.name: gtk_expander_get_use_underline
function.description: Returns whether an underline in the text indicates a mnemonic.
function.return: %TRUE if an embedded underline in the expander label indicates the mnemonic accelerator keys

function.name: gtk_expander_new
function.description: Creates a new expander using @label as the text of the label.

function.name: gtk_expander_new_with_mnemonic
function.description:
Creates a new expander using @label as the text of the label.
If characters in @label are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use “__” (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic.
Pressing Alt and that key activates the button.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the text of the label with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.name: gtk_expander_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @expander.

function.name: gtk_expander_set_expanded
function.description:
Sets the state of the expander.
Set to %TRUE, if you want the child widget to be revealed, and %FALSE if you want the child widget to be hidden.

parameter.name: expanded
parameter.parameter_description: whether the child widget is revealed

function.name: gtk_expander_set_label
function.description:
Sets the text of the label of the expander to @label.
This will also clear any previously set labels.

function.name: gtk_expander_set_label_widget
function.description:
Set the label widget for the expander.
This is the widget that will appear embedded alongside the expander arrow.

function.name: gtk_expander_set_resize_toplevel
function.description: Sets whether the expander will resize the toplevel widget containing the expander upon resizing and collapsing.

function.name: gtk_expander_set_use_markup
function.description: Sets whether the text of the label contains Pango markup.

parameter.name: use_markup
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the label’s text should be parsed for markup

function.name: gtk_expander_set_use_underline
function.description: If true, an underline in the text indicates a mnemonic.

parameter.name: use_underline
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if underlines in the text indicate mnemonics

function.name: gtk_expression_bind
function.description:
Bind `target`'s property named `property` to `self`.
The value that `self` evaluates to is set via `g_object_set()` on `target`. This is repeated whenever `self` changes to ensure that the object's property stays synchronized with `self`.
If `self`'s evaluation fails, `target`'s `property` is not updated. You can ensure that this doesn't happen by using a fallback expression.
Note that this function takes ownership of `self`. If you want to keep it around, you should [method@Gtk.Expression.ref] it beforehand.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: the target object to bind to

parameter.name: property
parameter.parameter_description: name of the property on `target` to bind to

parameter.name: this_
parameter.parameter_description: the this argument for the evaluation of `self`

function.name: gtk_expression_evaluate
function.description:
Evaluates the given expression and on success stores the result in @value.
The `GType` of `value` will be the type given by [method@Gtk.Expression.get_value_type].
It is possible that expressions cannot be evaluated - for example when the expression references objects that have been destroyed or set to `NULL`. In that case `value` will remain empty and `FALSE` will be returned.

parameter.name: this_
parameter.parameter_description: the this argument for the evaluation

function.return: `TRUE` if the expression could be evaluated

function.name: gtk_expression_get_value_type
function.description:
Gets the `GType` that this expression evaluates to.
This type is constant and will not change over the lifetime of this expression.

function.name: gtk_expression_is_static
function.description:
Checks if the expression is static.
A static expression will never change its result when [method@Gtk.Expression.evaluate] is called on it with the same arguments.
That means a call to [method@Gtk.Expression.watch] is not necessary because it will never trigger a notify.

function.name: gtk_expression_ref
function.description: Acquires a reference on the given `GtkExpression`.

function.name: gtk_expression_unref
function.description:
Releases a reference on the given `GtkExpression`.
If the reference was the last, the resources associated to the `self` are freed.

function.name: gtk_expression_watch
function.description:
Watch the given `expression` for changes.
The @notify function will be called whenever the evaluation of `self` may have changed.
GTK cannot guarantee that the evaluation did indeed change when the @notify gets invoked, but it guarantees the opposite: When it did in fact change, the @notify will be invoked.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: callback to invoke when the expression changes

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to the `notify` callback

function.return: The newly installed watch. Note that the only reference held to the watch will be released when the watch is unwatched which can happen automatically, and not just via [method@Gtk.ExpressionWatch.unwatch]. You should call [method@Gtk.ExpressionWatch.ref] if you want to keep the watch around.

function.name: gtk_expression_watch_evaluate
function.description:
Evaluates the watched expression and on success stores the result in `value`.
This is equivalent to calling [method@Gtk.Expression.evaluate] with the expression and this pointer originally used to create `watch`.
function.return: `TRUE` if the expression could be evaluated and `value` was set

function.name: gtk_expression_watch_ref
function.description: Acquires a reference on the given `GtkExpressionWatch`.

function.name: gtk_expression_watch_unref
function.description:
Releases a reference on the given `GtkExpressionWatch`.
If the reference was the last, the resources associated to `self` are freed.

function.name: gtk_expression_watch_unwatch
function.description:
Stops watching an expression.
See [method@Gtk.Expression.watch] for how the watch was established.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_add_choice
function.description:
Adds a 'choice' to the file chooser.
This is typically implemented as a combobox or, for boolean choices, as a checkbutton. You can select a value using [method@Gtk.FileChooser.set_choice] before the dialog is shown, and you can obtain the user-selected value in the [signal@Gtk.Dialog::response] signal handler using [method@Gtk.FileChooser.get_choice].
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: user-visible label for the added choice

parameter.name: options
parameter.parameter_description: ids for the options of the choice, or %NULL for a boolean choice

parameter.name: option_labels
parameter.parameter_description: user-visible labels for the options, must be the same length as @options

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_add_filter
function.description:
Adds @filter to the list of filters that the user can select between.
When a filter is selected, only files that are passed by that filter are displayed.
Note that the @chooser takes ownership of the filter if it is floating, so you have to ref and sink it if you want to keep a reference.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder
function.description:
Adds a folder to be displayed with the shortcut folders in a file chooser.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: folder
parameter.parameter_description: a `GFile` for the folder to add

function.return: %TRUE if the folder could be added successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkFileChooserDialog`.
This function is analogous to [ctor@Gtk.Dialog.new_with_buttons].
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: Open or save mode for the dialog

parameter.name: first_button_text
parameter.parameter_description: text to go in the first button

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for the first button, then additional (button, id) pairs, ending with %NULL

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_error_quark
function.description: Registers an error quark for `GtkFileChooser` errors.
function.return: The error quark used for `GtkFileChooser` errors.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_action
function.description:
Gets the type of operation that the file chooser is performing.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead
function.return: the action that the file selector is performing

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_choice
function.description:
Gets the currently selected option in the 'choice' with the given ID.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the choice to get

function.return: the ID of the currently selected option

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_create_folders
function.description:
Gets whether file chooser will offer to create new folders.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead
function.return: %TRUE if the Create Folder button should be displayed.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_folder
function.description:
Gets the current folder of @chooser as `GFile`.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_name
function.description:
Gets the current name in the file selector, as entered by the user.
This is meant to be used in save dialogs, to get the currently typed filename when the file itself does not exist yet.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead
function.return: The raw text from the file chooser’s “Name” entry. Free with g_free(). Note that this string is not a full pathname or URI; it is whatever the contents of the entry are. Note also that this string is in UTF-8 encoding, which is not necessarily the system’s encoding for filenames.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_file
function.description:
Gets the `GFile` for the currently selected file in the file selector.
If multiple files are selected, one of the files will be returned at random.
If the file chooser is in folder mode, this function returns the selected folder.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead
function.return: a selected `GFile`. You own the returned file; use g_object_unref() to release it.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_files
function.description:
Lists all the selected files and subfolders in the current folder of @chooser as `GFile`.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead
function.return: a list model containing a `GFile` for each selected file and subfolder in the current folder. Free the returned list with g_object_unref().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_filter
function.description:
Gets the current filter.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_filters
function.description:
Gets the current set of user-selectable filters, as a list model.
See [method@Gtk.FileChooser.add_filter] and [method@Gtk.FileChooser.remove_filter] for changing individual filters.
You should not modify the returned list model. Future changes to @chooser may or may not affect the returned model.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead
function.return: a `GListModel` containing the current set of user-selectable filters.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_select_multiple
function.description:
Gets whether multiple files can be selected in the file chooser.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead
function.return: %TRUE if multiple files can be selected.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_shortcut_folders
function.description:
Queries the list of shortcut folders in the file chooser.
You should not modify the returned list model. Future changes to @chooser may or may not affect the returned model.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_native_get_accept_label
function.description:
Retrieves the custom label text for the accept button.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_native_get_cancel_label
function.description:
Retrieves the custom label text for the cancel button.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_native_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkFileChooserNative`.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: Open or save mode for the dialog

parameter.name: accept_label
parameter.parameter_description: text to go in the accept button, or %NULL for the default

parameter.name: cancel_label
parameter.parameter_description: text to go in the cancel button, or %NULL for the default

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_native_set_accept_label
function.description:
Sets the custom label text for the accept button.
If characters in @label are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use “__” (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic.
Pressing Alt and that key should activate the button.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_native_set_cancel_label
function.description:
Sets the custom label text for the cancel button.
If characters in @label are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use “__” (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic.
Pressing Alt and that key should activate the button.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_remove_choice
function.description:
Removes a 'choice' that has been added with gtk_file_chooser_add_choice().
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the choice to remove

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_remove_filter
function.description:
Removes @filter from the list of filters that the user can select between.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_remove_shortcut_folder
function.description:
Removes a folder from the shortcut folders in a file chooser.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: folder
parameter.parameter_description: a `GFile` for the folder to remove

function.return: %TRUE if the folder could be removed successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_action
function.description:
Sets the type of operation that the chooser is performing.
The user interface is adapted to suit the selected action.
For example, an option to create a new folder might be shown if the action is %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SAVE but not if the action is %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: the action that the file selector is performing

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_choice
function.description:
Selects an option in a 'choice' that has been added with gtk_file_chooser_add_choice().
For a boolean choice, the possible options are "true" and "false".
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the choice to set

parameter.name: option
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the option to select

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_create_folders
function.description:
Sets whether file chooser will offer to create new folders.
This is only relevant if the action is not set to be %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: create_folders
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the Create Folder button should be displayed

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder
function.description:
Sets the current folder for @chooser from a `GFile`.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead
function.return: %TRUE if the folder could be changed successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name
function.description:
Sets the current name in the file selector, as if entered by the user.
Note that the name passed in here is a UTF-8 string rather than a filename. This function is meant for such uses as a suggested name in a “Save As...” dialog. You can pass “Untitled.doc” or a similarly suitable suggestion for the @name.
If you want to preselect a particular existing file, you should use [method@Gtk.FileChooser.set_file] instead.
Please see the documentation for those functions for an example of using [method@Gtk.FileChooser.set_current_name] as well.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the filename to use, as a UTF-8 string

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_file
gtk_file_chooser_set_filter
function.description:
Sets the current filter.
Only the files that pass the filter will be displayed. If the user-selectable list of filters is non-empty, then the filter should be one of the filters in that list.
Setting the current filter when the list of filters is empty is useful if you want to restrict the displayed set of files without letting the user change it.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_select_multiple
function.description:
Sets whether multiple files can be selected in the file chooser.
This is only relevant if the action is set to be %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN or %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SELECT_FOLDER.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [class@Gtk.FileDialog] instead

parameter.name: select_multiple
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if multiple files can be selected.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_widget_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkFileChooserWidget`.
This is a file chooser widget that can be embedded in custom windows, and it is the same widget that is used by `GtkFileChooserDialog`.
Deprecated: 4.10: Direct use of `GtkFileChooserWidget` is deprecated

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: Open or save mode for the widget

Gets the filters that will be offered to the user in the file chooser dialog.

function.name: gtk_file_dialog_get_initial_folder

Returns the title that will be shown on the file chooser dialog.
