parameter.name: show_peek_icon
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show the peek icon

function.name: gtk_picture_get_alternative_text
function.description:
Gets the alternative textual description of the picture.
The returned string will be %NULL if the picture cannot be described textually.

function.name: gtk_picture_get_can_shrink
function.description: Returns whether the `GtkPicture` respects its contents size.
function.return: %TRUE if the picture can be made smaller than its contents

function.name: gtk_picture_get_content_fit
function.description:
Returns the fit mode for the content of the `GtkPicture`.
See [enum@Gtk.ContentFit] for details.
Since: 4.8

function.name: gtk_picture_get_file
function.description:
Gets the `GFile` currently displayed if @self is displaying a file.
If @self is not displaying a file, for example when [method@Gtk.Picture.set_paintable] was used, then %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_picture_get_keep_aspect_ratio
function.description:
Returns whether the `GtkPicture` preserves its contents aspect ratio.
Deprecated: 4.8: Use [method@Gtk.Picture.get_content_fit] instead. This will now return `FALSE` only if [property@Gtk.Picture:content-fit] is `GTK_CONTENT_FIT_FILL`. Returns `TRUE` otherwise.
function.return: %TRUE if the self tries to keep the contents' aspect ratio

function.name: gtk_picture_get_paintable
function.description: Gets the `GdkPaintable` being displayed by the `GtkPicture`.

function.name: gtk_picture_new
function.description: Creates a new empty `GtkPicture` widget.

function.name: gtk_picture_new_for_file
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkPicture` displaying the given @file.
If the file isn’t found or can’t be loaded, the resulting `GtkPicture` is empty.
If you need to detect failures to load the file, use an image loading framework such as libglycin to load the file yourself, then create the `GtkPicture` from the texture.

function.name: gtk_picture_new_for_filename
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkPicture` displaying the file @filename.
This is a utility function that calls [ctor@Gtk.Picture.new_for_file]. See that function for details.

function.name: gtk_picture_new_for_paintable
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkPicture` displaying @paintable.
The `GtkPicture` will track changes to the @paintable and update its size and contents in response to it.

function.name: gtk_picture_new_for_pixbuf
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkPicture` displaying @pixbuf.
This is a utility function that calls [ctor@Gtk.Picture.new_for_paintable], See that function for details.
The pixbuf must not be modified after passing it to this function.
Deprecated: 4.12: Use [ctor@Gtk.Picture.new_for_paintable] and [ctor@Gdk.Texture.new_for_pixbuf] instead

function.name: gtk_picture_new_for_resource
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkPicture` displaying the resource at @resource_path.
This is a utility function that calls [ctor@Gtk.Picture.new_for_file]. See that function for details.

function.name: gtk_picture_set_alternative_text
function.description:
Sets an alternative textual description for the picture contents.
It is equivalent to the "alt" attribute for images on websites.
This text will be made available to accessibility tools.
If the picture cannot be described textually, set this property to %NULL.

parameter.name: alternative_text
parameter.parameter_description: a textual description of the contents

function.name: gtk_picture_set_can_shrink
function.description:
If set to %TRUE, the @self can be made smaller than its contents.
The contents will then be scaled down when rendering.
If you want to still force a minimum size manually, consider using [method@Gtk.Widget.set_size_request].
Also of note is that a similar function for growing does not exist because the grow behavior can be controlled via [method@Gtk.Widget.set_halign] and [method@Gtk.Widget.set_valign].

parameter.name: can_shrink
parameter.parameter_description: if @self can be made smaller than its contents

function.name: gtk_picture_set_content_fit
function.description:
Sets how the content should be resized to fit the `GtkPicture`.
See [enum@Gtk.ContentFit] for details.
Since: 4.8

function.name: gtk_picture_set_file
function.description:
Makes @self load and display @file.
See [ctor@Gtk.Picture.new_for_file] for details.
::: warning Note that this function should not be used with untrusted data. Use a proper image loading framework such as libglycin, which can load many image formats into a `GdkTexture`, and then use [method@Gtk.Image.set_from_paintable].

function.name: gtk_picture_set_filename
function.description:
Makes @self load and display the given @filename.
This is a utility function that calls [method@Gtk.Picture.set_file].
::: warning Note that this function should not be used with untrusted data. Use a proper image loading framework such as libglycin, which can load many image formats into a `GdkTexture`, and then use [method@Gtk.Image.set_from_paintable].

function.name: gtk_picture_set_keep_aspect_ratio
function.description:
If set to %TRUE, the @self will render its contents according to their aspect ratio.
That means that empty space may show up at the top/bottom or left/right of @self.
If set to %FALSE or if the contents provide no aspect ratio, the contents will be stretched over the picture's whole area.
Deprecated: 4.8: Use [method@Gtk.Picture.set_content_fit] instead. If still used, this method will always set the [property@Gtk.Picture:content-fit] property to `GTK_CONTENT_FIT_CONTAIN` if @keep_aspect_ratio is true, otherwise it will set it to `GTK_CONTENT_FIT_FILL`.

function.name: gtk_picture_set_paintable
function.description:
Makes @self display the given @paintable.
If @paintable is `NULL`, nothing will be displayed.
See [ctor@Gtk.Picture.new_for_paintable] for details.

function.name: gtk_picture_set_pixbuf
function.description:
Sets a `GtkPicture` to show a `GdkPixbuf`.
See [ctor@Gtk.Picture.new_for_pixbuf] for details.
This is a utility function that calls [method@Gtk.Picture.set_paintable].
Deprecated: 4.12: Use [method@Gtk.Picture.set_paintable] instead

function.name: gtk_picture_set_resource
gtk_popover_get_autohide
function.description:
Returns whether the popover is modal.
See [method@Gtk.Popover.set_autohide] for the implications of this.

function.name: gtk_popover_get_cascade_popdown
function.description: Returns whether the popover will close after a modal child is closed.
function.return: %TRUE if @popover will close after a modal child.

function.name: gtk_popover_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @popover.

function.name: gtk_popover_get_has_arrow
function.description: Gets whether this popover is showing an arrow pointing at the widget that it is relative to.
function.return: whether the popover has an arrow

function.name: gtk_popover_get_mnemonics_visible
function.description: Gets whether mnemonics are visible.
function.return: %TRUE if mnemonics are supposed to be visible in this popover

function.name: gtk_popover_get_offset
function.description: Gets the offset previous set with [method@Gtk.Popover.set_offset].

function.name: gtk_popover_get_pointing_to
function.description:
Gets the rectangle that the popover points to.
If a rectangle to point to has been set, this function will return %TRUE and fill in @rect with such rectangle, otherwise it will return %FALSE and fill in @rect with the parent widget coordinates.
function.return: %TRUE if a rectangle to point to was set.

function.name: gtk_popover_get_position
function.description: Returns the preferred position of @popover.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_add_child
function.description:
Adds a custom widget to a generated menu.
For this to work, the menu model of @popover must have an item with a `custom` attribute that matches @id.
function.return: %TRUE if @id was found and the widget added

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_bar_add_child
function.description:
Adds a custom widget to a generated menubar.
For this to work, the menu model of @bar must have an item with a `custom` attribute that matches @id.
function.return: %TRUE if @id was found and the widget added

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_bar_get_menu_model
function.description: Returns the model from which the contents of @bar are taken.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_bar_new_from_model
function.description: Creates a `GtkPopoverMenuBar` from a `GMenuModel`.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_bar_remove_child
function.description: Removes a widget that has previously been added with gtk_popover_menu_bar_add_child().

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_bar_set_menu_model
function.description: Sets a menu model from which @bar should take its contents.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_get_flags
function.description:
Returns the flags that @popover uses to create/display a menu from its model.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_get_menu_model
function.description: Returns the menu model used to populate the popover.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_new
function.description: Creates a new popover menu.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_new_from_model
function.description:
Creates a `GtkPopoverMenu` and populates it according to @model.
The created buttons are connected to actions found in the `GtkApplicationWindow` to which the popover belongs - typically by means of being attached to a widget that is contained within the `GtkApplicationWindow`s widget hierarchy.
Actions can also be added using [method@Gtk.Widget.insert_action_group] on the menus attach widget or on any of its parent widgets.
This function creates menus with sliding submenus. See [ctor@Gtk.PopoverMenu.new_from_model_full] for a way to control this.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_new_from_model_full
function.description:
Creates a `GtkPopoverMenu` and populates it according to @model.
The created buttons are connected to actions found in the action groups that are accessible from the parent widget. This includes the `GtkApplicationWindow` to which the popover belongs. Actions can also be added using [method@Gtk.Widget.insert_action_group] on the parent widget or on any of its parent widgets.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags that affect how the menu is created

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_remove_child
function.description: Removes a widget that has previously been added with [method@Gtk.PopoverMenu.add_child]

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_set_flags
function.description:
Sets the flags that @popover uses to create/display a menu from its model.
If a model is set and the flags change, contents are rebuilt, so if setting properties individually, set flags before model to avoid a redundant rebuild.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_set_menu_model
function.description:
Sets a new menu model on @popover.
The existing contents of @popover are removed, and the @popover is populated with new contents according to @model.

function.name: gtk_popover_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkPopover`.

function.name: gtk_popover_popdown
function.description:
Pops @popover down.
This may have the side-effect of closing a parent popover as well. See [property@Gtk.Popover:cascade-popdown].

function.name: gtk_popover_popup
function.description: Pops @popover up.

function.name: gtk_popover_present
function.description:
Allocate a size for the `GtkPopover`.
This function needs to be called in size-allocate by widgets who have a `GtkPopover` as child. When using a layout manager, this is happening automatically.
To make a popover appear on screen, use [method@Gtk.Popover.popup].

function.name: gtk_popover_set_autohide
function.description:
Sets whether @popover is modal.
A modal popover will grab the keyboard focus on it when being displayed. Focus will wrap around within the popover. Clicking outside the popover area or pressing Esc will dismiss the popover.
Called this function on an already showing popup with a new autohide value different from the current one, will cause the popup to be hidden.

parameter.name: autohide
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to dismiss the popover on outside clicks

function.name: gtk_popover_set_cascade_popdown
function.description:
If @cascade_popdown is %TRUE, the popover will be closed when a child modal popover is closed.
If %FALSE, @popover will stay visible.

parameter.name: cascade_popdown
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the popover should follow a child closing

function.name: gtk_popover_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @popover.

function.name: gtk_popover_set_default_widget
function.description:
Sets the default widget of a `GtkPopover`.
The default widget is the widget that’s activated when the user presses Enter in a dialog (for example). This function sets or unsets the default widget for a `GtkPopover`.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a child widget of @popover to set as the default, or %NULL to unset the default widget for the popover

function.name: gtk_popover_set_has_arrow
function.description: Sets whether this popover should draw an arrow pointing at the widget it is relative to.

function.name: gtk_popover_set_mnemonics_visible
function.description: Sets whether mnemonics should be visible.

function.name: gtk_popover_set_offset
function.description:
Sets the offset to use when calculating the position of the popover.
These values are used when preparing the [struct@Gdk.PopupLayout] for positioning the popover.

parameter.name: x_offset
parameter.parameter_description: the x offset to adjust the position by

parameter.name: y_offset
parameter.parameter_description: the y offset to adjust the position by

function.name: gtk_popover_set_pointing_to
function.description:
Sets the rectangle that @popover points to.
This is in the coordinate space of the @popover parent.

function.name: gtk_popover_set_position
function.description:
Sets the preferred position for @popover to appear.
If the @popover is currently visible, it will be immediately updated.
This preference will be respected where possible, although on lack of space (eg. if close to the window edges), the `GtkPopover` may choose to appear on the opposite side.

function.name: gtk_print_backend_get_printer_list
function.description: Returns the current list of printers.

function.name: gtk_print_context_create_pango_context
function.description: Creates a new `PangoContext` that can be used with the `GtkPrintContext`.

function.name: gtk_print_context_create_pango_layout
function.description: Creates a new `PangoLayout` that is suitable for use with the `GtkPrintContext`.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_cairo_context
function.description: Obtains the cairo context that is associated with the `GtkPrintContext`.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_dpi_x
function.description: Obtains the horizontal resolution of the `GtkPrintContext`, in dots per inch.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_dpi_y
function.description: Obtains the vertical resolution of the `GtkPrintContext`, in dots per inch.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_hard_margins
function.description: Obtains the hardware printer margins of the `GtkPrintContext`, in units.
function.return: %TRUE if the hard margins were retrieved

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_height
function.description: Obtains the height of the `GtkPrintContext`, in pixels.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_page_setup
function.description: Obtains the `GtkPageSetup` that determines the page dimensions of the `GtkPrintContext`.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_pango_fontmap
function.description: Returns a `PangoFontMap` that is suitable for use with the `GtkPrintContext`.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_width
function.description: Obtains the width of the `GtkPrintContext`, in pixels.

function.name: gtk_print_context_set_cairo_context
function.description:
Sets a new cairo context on a print context.
This function is intended to be used when implementing an internal print preview, it is not needed for printing, since GTK itself creates a suitable cairo context in that case.

parameter.name: dpi_x
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal resolution to use with @cr

parameter.name: dpi_y
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical resolution to use with @cr

function.name: gtk_print_context_set_hard_margins
function.description: Sets the hard margins in pixels.

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_get_accept_label
function.description:
Returns the label that will be shown on the accept button of the print dialog.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_get_modal
function.description:
Returns whether the print dialog blocks interaction with the parent window while it is presented.
Since: 4.14
function.return: whether the print dialog is modal

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_get_page_setup
function.description:
Returns the page setup.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_get_print_settings
function.description:
Returns the print settings for the print dialog.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_get_title
function.description:
Returns the title that will be shown on the print dialog.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkPrintDialog` object.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_print
function.description:
This function prints content from a stream.
If you pass `NULL` as @setup, then this method will present a print dialog. Otherwise, it will attempt to print directly, without user interaction.
The @callback will be called when the printing is done.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a callback to call when the operation is complete

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_print_file
function.description:
This function prints a file.
If you pass `NULL` as @setup, then this method will present a print dialog. Otherwise, it will attempt to print directly, without user interaction.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a callback to call when the operation is complete

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_print_file_finish
function.description:
Finishes the [method@Gtk.PrintDialog.print_file] call and returns the results.
Note that this function returns a [error@Gtk.DialogError.DISMISSED] error if the user cancels the dialog.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_print_finish
function.description:
Finishes the [method@Gtk.PrintDialog.print] call and returns the results.
If the call was successful, the content to be printed should be written to the returned output stream. Otherwise, `NULL` is returned.
The overall results of the print operation will be returned in the [method@Gio.OutputStream.close] call, so if you are interested in the results, you need to explicitly close the output stream (it will be closed automatically if you just unref it). Be aware that the close call may not be instant as it operation will for the printer to finish printing.
Note that this function returns a [error@Gtk.DialogError.DISMISSED] error if the user cancels the dialog.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_set_accept_label
function.description:
Sets the label that will be shown on the accept button of the print dialog shown for [method@Gtk.PrintDialog.setup].
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_set_modal
function.description:
Sets whether the print dialog blocks interaction with the parent window while it is presented.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_set_page_setup
function.description:
Set the page setup for the print dialog.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_set_print_settings
function.description:
Sets the print settings for the print dialog.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_set_title
function.description:
Sets the title that will be shown on the print dialog.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_setup
function.description:
This function presents a print dialog to let the user select a printer, and set up print settings and page setup.
The @callback will be called when the dialog is dismissed. The obtained [struct@Gtk.PrintSetup] can then be passed to [method@Gtk.PrintDialog.print] or [method@Gtk.PrintDialog.print_file].
One possible use for this method is to have the user select a printer, then show a page setup UI in the application (e.g. to arrange images on a page), then call [method@Gtk.PrintDialog.print] on @self to do the printing without further user interaction.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a callback to call when the operation is complete

function.name: gtk_print_dialog_setup_finish
function.description:
Finishes the [method@Gtk.PrintDialog.setup] call.
If the call was successful, it returns a [struct@Gtk.PrintSetup] which contains the print settings and page setup information that will be used to print.
Note that this function returns a [error@Gtk.DialogError.DISMISSED] error if the user cancels the dialog.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_print_error_quark
function.description: Registers an error quark for `GtkPrintOperation` if necessary.
function.return: The error quark used for `GtkPrintOperation` errors.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_pages
function.description: Gets the `GtkPrintPages` setting for this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_printer
function.description: Gets the `GtkPrinter` of the print job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_reverse

function.return: whether the job is printed reversed.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_rotate
