function.description: Creates a new scrollbar with the given orientation.

parameter.name: adjustment

function.name: gtk_scrollbar_set_adjustment
function.description: Makes the scrollbar use the given adjustment.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_child
function.description:
Gets the child widget of @scrolled_window.
If the scrolled window automatically added a [class@Gtk.Viewport], this function will return the viewport widget, and you can retrieve its child using [method@Gtk.Viewport.get_child].

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_hadjustment
function.description:
Returns the horizontal scrollbar’s adjustment.
This is the adjustment used to connect the horizontal scrollbar to the child widget’s horizontal scroll functionality.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_has_frame
function.description: Gets whether the scrolled window draws a frame.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_hscrollbar
function.description: Returns the horizontal scrollbar of @scrolled_window.
function.return: the horizontal scrollbar of the scrolled window.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_kinetic_scrolling
function.description: Returns the specified kinetic scrolling behavior.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_max_content_height
function.description: Returns the maximum content height set.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_max_content_width
function.description: Returns the maximum content width set.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_min_content_height
function.description: Gets the minimal content height of @scrolled_window.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_min_content_width
function.description: Gets the minimum content width of @scrolled_window.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_overlay_scrolling
function.description: Returns whether overlay scrolling is enabled for this scrolled window.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_placement
function.description: Gets the placement of the contents with respect to the scrollbars.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_policy
function.description:
Retrieves the current policy values for the horizontal and vertical scrollbars.
See [method@Gtk.ScrolledWindow.set_policy].

parameter.name: hscrollbar_policy
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the policy for the horizontal scrollbar

parameter.name: vscrollbar_policy
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the policy for the vertical scrollbar

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_propagate_natural_height
function.description: Reports whether the natural height of the child will be calculated and propagated through the scrolled window’s requested natural height.
function.return: whether natural height propagation is enabled.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_propagate_natural_width
function.description: Reports whether the natural width of the child will be calculated and propagated through the scrolled window’s requested natural width.
function.return: whether natural width propagation is enabled.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_vadjustment
function.description:
Returns the vertical scrollbar’s adjustment.
This is the adjustment used to connect the vertical scrollbar to the child widget’s vertical scroll functionality.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_vscrollbar
function.description: Returns the vertical scrollbar of @scrolled_window.
function.return: the vertical scrollbar of the scrolled window.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_new
function.description: Creates a new scrolled window.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_child
function.description:
Sets the child widget of @scrolled_window.
If @child does not implement the [iface@Gtk.Scrollable] interface, the scrolled window will add @child to a [class@Gtk.Viewport] instance and then add the viewport as its child widget.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_hadjustment
function.description: Sets the `GtkAdjustment` for the horizontal scrollbar.

parameter.name: hadjustment
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkAdjustment` to use, or %NULL to create a new one

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_has_frame
function.description: Changes the frame drawn around the contents of @scrolled_window.

parameter.name: has_frame
parameter.parameter_description: whether to draw a frame around scrolled window contents

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_kinetic_scrolling
function.description:
Turns kinetic scrolling on or off.
Kinetic scrolling only applies to devices with source %GDK_SOURCE_TOUCHSCREEN.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_max_content_height
function.description:
Sets the maximum height that @scrolled_window should keep visible.
The @scrolled_window will grow up to this height before it starts scrolling the content.
It is a programming error to set the maximum content height to a value smaller than [property@Gtk.ScrolledWindow:min-content-height].

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_max_content_width
function.description:
Sets the maximum width that @scrolled_window should keep visible.
The @scrolled_window will grow up to this width before it starts scrolling the content.
It is a programming error to set the maximum content width to a value smaller than [property@Gtk.ScrolledWindow:min-content-width].

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_min_content_height
function.description:
Sets the minimum height that @scrolled_window should keep visible.
Note that this can and (usually will) be smaller than the minimum size of the content.
It is a programming error to set the minimum content height to a value greater than [property@Gtk.ScrolledWindow:max-content-height].

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_min_content_width
function.description:
Sets the minimum width that @scrolled_window should keep visible.
Note that this can and (usually will) be smaller than the minimum size of the content.
It is a programming error to set the minimum content width to a value greater than [property@Gtk.ScrolledWindow:max-content-width].

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_overlay_scrolling
function.description: Enables or disables overlay scrolling for this scrolled window.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_placement
function.description:
Sets the placement of the contents with respect to the scrollbars for the scrolled window.
The default is %GTK_CORNER_TOP_LEFT, meaning the child is in the top left, with the scrollbars underneath and to the right. Other values in [enum@Gtk.CornerType] are %GTK_CORNER_TOP_RIGHT, %GTK_CORNER_BOTTOM_LEFT, and %GTK_CORNER_BOTTOM_RIGHT.
See also [method@Gtk.ScrolledWindow.get_placement] and [method@Gtk.ScrolledWindow.unset_placement].

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_policy
function.description:
Sets the scrollbar policy for the horizontal and vertical scrollbars.
The policy determines when the scrollbar should appear; it is a value from the [enum@Gtk.PolicyType] enumeration. If %GTK_POLICY_ALWAYS, the scrollbar is always present; if %GTK_POLICY_NEVER, the scrollbar is never present; if %GTK_POLICY_AUTOMATIC, the scrollbar is present only if needed (that is, if the slider part of the bar would be smaller than the trough — the display is larger than the page size).

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_propagate_natural_height
function.description: Sets whether the natural height of the child should be calculated and propagated through the scrolled window’s requested natural height.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_propagate_natural_width
function.description: Sets whether the natural width of the child should be calculated and propagated through the scrolled window’s requested natural width.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_vadjustment
function.description: Sets the `GtkAdjustment` for the vertical scrollbar.

parameter.name: vadjustment
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkAdjustment` to use, or %NULL to create a new one

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_unset_placement
function.description:
Unsets the placement of the contents with respect to the scrollbars.
If no window placement is set for a scrolled window, it defaults to %GTK_CORNER_TOP_LEFT.

function.name: gtk_search_bar_connect_entry
function.description:
Connects the `GtkEditable` widget passed as the one to be used in this search bar.
The entry should be a descendant of the search bar. Calling this function manually is only required if the entry isn’t the direct child of the search bar (as in our main example).

function.name: gtk_search_bar_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @bar.

function.name: gtk_search_bar_get_key_capture_widget
function.description: Gets the widget that @bar is capturing key events from.

function.name: gtk_search_bar_get_search_mode
function.description: Returns whether the search mode is on or off.
function.return: whether search mode is toggled on

function.name: gtk_search_bar_get_show_close_button
function.description: Returns whether the close button is shown.
function.return: whether the close button is shown

function.name: gtk_search_bar_new
function.description:
Creates a `GtkSearchBar`.
You will need to tell it about which widget is going to be your text entry using [method@Gtk.SearchBar.connect_entry].

function.name: gtk_search_bar_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @bar.

function.name: gtk_search_bar_set_key_capture_widget
function.description:
Sets @widget as the widget that @bar will capture key events from.
If key events are handled by the search bar, the bar will be shown, and the entry populated with the entered text.
Note that despite the name of this function, the events are only 'captured' in the bubble phase, which means that editable child widgets of @widget will receive text input before it gets captured. If that is not desired, you can capture and forward the events yourself with [method@Gtk.EventControllerKey.forward].

function.name: gtk_search_bar_set_search_mode
function.description: Switches the search mode on or off.

parameter.name: search_mode
parameter.parameter_description: the new state of the search mode

function.name: gtk_search_bar_set_show_close_button
function.description:
Shows or hides the close button.
Applications that already have a “search” toggle button should not show a close button in their search bar, as it duplicates the role of the toggle button.

parameter.name: visible
parameter.parameter_description: whether the close button will be shown or not

function.name: gtk_search_entry_get_input_hints
function.description:
Gets the input purpose for @entry.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_search_entry_get_input_purpose
function.description:
Gets the input purpose of @entry.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_search_entry_get_key_capture_widget
function.description: Gets the widget that @entry is capturing key events from.

function.name: gtk_search_entry_get_placeholder_text
function.description:
Gets the placeholder text associated with @entry.
Since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_search_entry_get_search_delay
function.description:
Get the delay to be used between the last keypress and the [signal@Gtk.SearchEntry::search-changed] signal being emitted.
Since: 4.8

function.name: gtk_search_entry_new
function.description: Creates a `GtkSearchEntry`.

function.name: gtk_search_entry_set_input_hints
function.description:
Sets the input hints for @entry.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_search_entry_set_input_purpose
function.description:
Sets the input purpose of @entry.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_search_entry_set_key_capture_widget
function.description:
Sets @widget as the widget that @entry will capture key events from.
Key events are consumed by the search entry to start or continue a search.
If the entry is part of a `GtkSearchBar`, it is preferable to call [method@Gtk.SearchBar.set_key_capture_widget] instead, which will reveal the entry in addition to triggering the search entry.
Note that despite the name of this function, the events are only 'captured' in the bubble phase, which means that editable child widgets of @widget will receive text input before it gets captured. If that is not desired, you can capture and forward the events yourself with [method@Gtk.EventControllerKey.forward].

function.name: gtk_search_entry_set_placeholder_text
function.description:
Sets the placeholder text associated with @entry.
Since: 4.10

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: the text to set as a placeholder

function.name: gtk_search_entry_set_search_delay
function.description:
Set the delay to be used between the last keypress and the [signal@Gtk.SearchEntry::search-changed] signal being emitted.
Since: 4.8

function.name: gtk_section_model_get_section
function.description:
Query the section that covers the given position. The number of items in the section can be computed by `out_end - out_start`.
If the position is larger than the number of items, a single range from n_items to G_MAXUINT will be returned.
Since: 4.12

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the item to query

parameter.name: out_start
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the first item in the section

parameter.name: out_end
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the first item not part of the section anymore.

function.name: gtk_section_model_sections_changed
function.description:
This function emits the [signal@Gtk.SectionModel::sections-changed] signal to notify about changes to sections.
It must cover all positions that used to be a section start or that are now a section start. It does not have to cover all positions for which the section has changed.
The [signal@Gio.ListModel::items-changed] implies the effect of the [signal@Gtk.SectionModel::sections-changed] signal for all the items it covers.
It is recommended that when changes to the items cause section changes in a larger range, that the larger range is included in the emission of the [signal@Gio.ListModel::items-changed] instead of emitting two signals.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_selection_filter_model_get_model
function.description: Gets the model currently filtered or %NULL if none.

function.name: gtk_selection_filter_model_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkSelectionFilterModel` that will include the selected items from the underlying selection model.

function.name: gtk_selection_filter_model_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model to be filtered.
Note that GTK makes no effort to ensure that @model conforms to the item type of @self. It assumes that the caller knows what they are doing and have set up an appropriate filter to ensure that item types match.

function.name: gtk_selection_model_get_selection
function.description:
Gets the set containing all currently selected items in the model.
This function may be slow, so if you are only interested in single item, consider using [method@Gtk.SelectionModel.is_selected] or if you are only interested in a few, consider [method@Gtk.SelectionModel.get_selection_in_range].
function.return: a `GtkBitset` containing all the values currently selected in @model. If no items are selected, the bitset is empty. The bitset must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_selection_model_get_selection_in_range
function.description:
Gets the set of selected items in a range.
This function is an optimization for [method@Gtk.SelectionModel.get_selection] when you are only interested in part of the model's selected state. A common use case is in response to the [signal@Gtk.SelectionModel::selection-changed] signal.

parameter.name: n_items
parameter.parameter_description: number of items in the queried range

function.return: A `GtkBitset` that matches the selection state for the given range with all other values being undefined. The bitset must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_selection_model_is_selected
function.description: Checks if the given item is selected.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the item to query

function.name: gtk_selection_model_select_all
function.description: Requests to select all items in the model.
function.return: %TRUE if this action was supported and no fallback should be tried. This does not mean that all items are now selected.

function.name: gtk_selection_model_select_item
function.description: Requests to select an item in the model.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the item to select

parameter.name: unselect_rest
parameter.parameter_description: whether previously selected items should be unselected

function.return: %TRUE if this action was supported and no fallback should be tried. This does not mean the item was selected.

function.name: gtk_selection_model_select_range
function.description: Requests to select a range of items in the model.

parameter.name: n_items
parameter.parameter_description: the number of items to select

parameter.name: unselect_rest
parameter.parameter_description: whether previously selected items should be unselected

function.return: %TRUE if this action was supported and no fallback should be tried. This does not mean the range was selected.

function.name: gtk_selection_model_selection_changed
function.description:
Helper function for implementations of `GtkSelectionModel`.
Call this when the selection changes to emit the [signal@Gtk.SelectionModel::selection-changed] signal.

function.name: gtk_selection_model_set_selection

parameter.name: selected
parameter.parameter_description: bitmask specifying if items should be selected or unselected

parameter.name: mask
parameter.parameter_description: bitmask specifying which items should be updated

function.return: %TRUE if this action was supported and no fallback should be tried. This does not mean that all items were updated according to the inputs.

function.name: gtk_selection_model_unselect_all
function.description: Requests to unselect all items in the model.
function.return: %TRUE if this action was supported and no fallback should be tried. This does not mean that all items are now unselected.

function.name: gtk_selection_model_unselect_item
function.description: Requests to unselect an item in the model.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the item to unselect

function.return: %TRUE if this action was supported and no fallback should be tried. This does not mean the item was unselected.

function.name: gtk_selection_model_unselect_range
function.description: Requests to unselect a range of items in the model.

parameter.name: n_items
parameter.parameter_description: the number of items to unselect

function.return: %TRUE if this action was supported and no fallback should be tried. This does not mean the range was unselected.

function.name: gtk_separator_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkSeparator` with the given orientation.

function.name: gtk_set_debug_flags
function.description: Sets the GTK debug flags.

function.name: gtk_settings_get_default
function.description:
Gets the `GtkSettings` object for the default display, creating it if necessary.
See [func@Gtk.Settings.get_for_display].
function.return: a `GtkSettings` object. If there is no default display, then returns %NULL.

function.name: gtk_settings_get_for_display
function.description: Gets the `GtkSettings` object for @display, creating it if necessary.

function.name: gtk_settings_reset_property
function.description:
Undoes the effect of calling g_object_set() to install an application-specific value for a setting.
After this call, the setting will again follow the session-wide value for this setting.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the setting to reset

function.name: gtk_shortcut_action_activate
function.description:
Activates the action on the @widget with the given @args.
Note that some actions ignore the passed in @flags, @widget or @args.
Activation of an action can fail for various reasons. If the action is not supported by the @widget, if the @args don't match the action or if the activation otherwise had no effect, %FALSE will be returned.
function.return: %TRUE if this action was activated successfully

function.name: gtk_shortcut_action_parse_string
function.description:
Tries to parse the given string into an action.
On success, the parsed action is returned. When parsing failed, %NULL is returned.
The accepted strings are:
- `nothing`, for `GtkNothingAction` - `activate`, for `GtkActivateAction` - `mnemonic-activate`, for `GtkMnemonicAction` - `action(NAME)`, for a `GtkNamedAction` for the action named `NAME` - `signal(NAME)`, for a `GtkSignalAction` for the signal `NAME`

function.name: gtk_shortcut_action_print
function.description:
Prints the given action into a string for the developer.
This is meant for debugging and logging.
The form of the representation may change at any time and is not guaranteed to stay identical.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_action_to_string
function.description:
Prints the given action into a human-readable string.
This is a small wrapper around [method@Gtk.ShortcutAction.print] to help when debugging.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_controller_add_shortcut
function.description:
Adds @shortcut to the list of shortcuts handled by @self.
If this controller uses an external shortcut list, this function does nothing.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_controller_get_mnemonics_modifiers
function.description: Gets the mnemonics modifiers for when this controller activates its shortcuts.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_controller_get_scope
function.description:
Gets the scope for when this controller activates its shortcuts.
See [method@Gtk.ShortcutController.set_scope] for details.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_controller_new
function.description: Creates a new shortcut controller.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_controller_new_for_model
function.description:
Creates a new shortcut controller that takes its shortcuts from the given list model.
A controller created by this function does not let you add or remove individual shortcuts using the shortcut controller api, but you can change the contents of the model.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_controller_remove_shortcut
function.description:
Removes @shortcut from the list of shortcuts handled by @self.
If @shortcut had not been added to @controller or this controller uses an external shortcut list, this function does nothing.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_controller_set_mnemonics_modifiers
function.description:
Sets the controller to use the given modifier for mnemonics.
The mnemonics modifiers determines which modifiers need to be pressed to allow activation of shortcuts with mnemonics triggers.
GTK normally uses the Alt modifier for mnemonics, except in `GtkPopoverMenu`s, where mnemonics can be triggered without any modifiers. It should be very rarely necessary to change this, and doing so is likely to interfere with other shortcuts.
This value is only relevant for local shortcut controllers. Global and managed shortcut controllers will have their shortcuts activated from other places which have their own modifiers for activating mnemonics.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_controller_set_scope
function.description:
Sets the controller to have the given @scope.
The scope allows shortcuts to be activated outside of the normal event propagation. In particular, it allows installing global keyboard shortcuts that can be activated even when a widget does not have focus.
With %GTK_SHORTCUT_SCOPE_LOCAL, shortcuts will only be activated when the widget has focus.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_get_action
function.description: Gets the action that is activated by this shortcut.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_get_arguments
function.description: Gets the arguments that are passed when activating the shortcut.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_get_trigger
function.description: Gets the trigger used to trigger @self.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_label_get_accelerator
function.description:
Retrieves the current accelerator of @self.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_shortcut_label_get_disabled_text
function.description:
Retrieves the text that is displayed when no accelerator is set.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5
function.return: the current text displayed when no accelerator is set.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_label_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkShortcutLabel` with @accelerator set.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_shortcut_label_set_accelerator
function.description:
Sets the accelerator to be displayed by @self.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_shortcut_label_set_disabled_text
function.description:
Sets the text to be displayed by @self when no accelerator is set.
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: disabled_text
parameter.parameter_description: the text to be displayed when no accelerator is set

function.name: gtk_shortcut_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkShortcut` that is triggered by @trigger and then activates @action.

parameter.name: trigger
parameter.parameter_description: The trigger that will trigger the shortcut

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: The action that will be activated upon triggering

function.name: gtk_shortcut_new_with_arguments
function.description: Creates a new `GtkShortcut` that is triggered by @trigger and then activates @action with arguments given by @format_string.

parameter.name: trigger
parameter.parameter_description: The trigger that will trigger the shortcut

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: The action that will be activated upon triggering

parameter.name: format_string
parameter.parameter_description: GVariant format string for arguments or %NULL for no arguments

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: arguments, as given by format string.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_set_action
function.description: Sets the new action for @self to be @action.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: The new action. If the @action is %NULL, the nothing action will be used.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_set_arguments
function.description: Sets the arguments to pass when activating the shortcut.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_set_trigger
function.description: Sets the new trigger for @self to be @trigger.

parameter.name: trigger
parameter.parameter_description: The new trigger. If the @trigger is %NULL, the never trigger will be used.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_trigger_compare
function.description:
The types of @trigger1 and @trigger2 are `gconstpointer` only to allow use of this function as a `GCompareFunc`.
They must each be a `GtkShortcutTrigger`.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_trigger_equal
function.description:
Checks if @trigger1 and @trigger2 trigger under the same conditions.
The types of @one and @two are `gconstpointer` only to allow use of this function with `GHashTable`. They must each be a `GtkShortcutTrigger`.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_trigger_hash
function.description:
Generates a hash value for a `GtkShortcutTrigger`.
The output of this function is guaranteed to be the same for a given value only per-process. It may change between different processor architectures or even different versions of GTK. Do not use this function as a basis for building protocols or file formats.
The types of @trigger is `gconstpointer` only to allow use of this function with `GHashTable`. They must each be a `GtkShortcutTrigger`.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_trigger_parse_string
function.description:
Tries to parse the given string into a trigger.
On success, the parsed trigger is returned. When parsing failed, %NULL is returned.
The accepted strings are:
- `never`, for `GtkNeverTrigger` - a string parsed by gtk_accelerator_parse(), for a `GtkKeyvalTrigger`, e.g. `<Control>C` - underscore, followed by a single character, for `GtkMnemonicTrigger`, e.g. `_l` - two valid trigger strings, separated by a `|` character, for a `GtkAlternativeTrigger`: `<Control>q|<Control>w`
Note that you will have to escape the `<` and `>` characters when specifying triggers in XML files, such as GtkBuilder ui files. Use `<` instead of `<` and `>` instead of `>`.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_trigger_print
function.description:
Prints the given trigger into a string for the developer. This is meant for debugging and logging.
The form of the representation may change at any time and is not guaranteed to stay identical.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_trigger_print_label
function.description:
Prints the given trigger into a string.
This function is returning a translated string for presentation to end users for example in menu items or in help texts.
The @display in use may influence the resulting string in various forms, such as resolving hardware keycodes or by causing display-specific modifier names.
The form of the representation may change at any time and is not guaranteed to stay identical.
function.return: %TRUE if something was printed or %FALSE if the trigger did not have a textual representation suitable for end users.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_trigger_to_label
function.description:
Gets textual representation for the given trigger.
This function is returning a translated string for presentation to end users for example in menu items or in help texts.
The @display in use may influence the resulting string in various forms, such as resolving hardware keycodes or by causing display-specific modifier names.
The form of the representation may change at any time and is not guaranteed to stay identical.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_trigger_to_string
function.description:
Prints the given trigger into a human-readable string.
This is a small wrapper around [method@Gtk.ShortcutTrigger.print] to help when debugging.

function.name: gtk_shortcut_trigger_trigger
function.description: Checks if the given @event triggers @self.

parameter.name: enable_mnemonics
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if mnemonics should trigger. Usually the value of this property is determined by checking that the passed in @event is a Key event and has the right modifiers set.

function.return: Whether the event triggered the shortcut

function.name: gtk_shortcuts_group_add_shortcut
function.description:
Adds a shortcut to the shortcuts group.
This is the programmatic equivalent to using [class@Gtk.Builder] and a `<child>` tag to add the child. Adding children with other API is not appropriate as `GtkShortcutsGroup` manages its children internally.
Since: 4.14
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_shortcuts_section_add_group
function.description:
Adds a group to the shortcuts section.
This is the programmatic equivalent to using [class@Gtk.Builder] and a `<child>` tag to add the child.
Adding children with the `GtkBox` API is not appropriate, as `GtkShortcutsSection` manages its children internally.
Since: 4.14
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_shortcuts_window_add_section
function.description:
Adds a section to the shortcuts window.
This is the programmatic equivalent to using [class@Gtk.Builder] and a `<child>` tag to add the child.
Using [method@Gtk.Window.set_child] is not appropriate as the shortcuts window manages its children internally.
Since: 4.14
Deprecated: 4.18: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_show_about_dialog
function.description:
A convenience function for showing an application’s about dialog.
The constructed dialog is associated with the parent window and reused for future invocations of this function.

parameter.name: first_property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the first property

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: value of first property, followed by more pairs of property name and value, `NULL`-terminated

function.name: gtk_show_uri
function.description:
This function launches the default application for showing a given uri, or shows an error dialog if that fails.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [method@Gtk.FileLauncher.launch] or [method@Gtk.UriLauncher.launch] instead

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: timestamp from the event that triggered this call, or %GDK_CURRENT_TIME

function.name: gtk_show_uri_full
function.description:
This function launches the default application for showing a given uri.
The @callback will be called when the launch is completed.
This is the recommended call to be used as it passes information necessary for sandbox helpers to parent their dialogs properly.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [method@Gtk.FileLauncher.launch] or [method@Gtk.UriLauncher.launch] instead

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: timestamp from the event that triggered this call, or %GDK_CURRENT_TIME

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a callback to call when the action is complete

function.name: gtk_show_uri_full_finish
function.description:
Finishes the gtk_show_uri() call and returns the result of the operation.
Deprecated: 4.10: Use [method@Gtk.FileLauncher.launch] or [method@Gtk.UriLauncher.launch] instead
function.return: %TRUE if the URI was shown successfully. Otherwise, %FALSE is returned and @error is set

function.name: gtk_signal_action_get_signal_name
function.description: Returns the name of the signal that will be emitted.
function.return: the name of the signal to emit

function.name: gtk_signal_action_new
function.description:
Creates an action that when activated, emits the given action signal on the provided widget.
It will also unpack the args into arguments passed to the signal.

parameter.name: signal_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the signal to emit

function.name: gtk_signal_list_item_factory_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkSignalListItemFactory`.
You need to connect signal handlers before you use it.

function.name: gtk_single_selection_get_autoselect
function.description: Checks if autoselect has been enabled or disabled via gtk_single_selection_set_autoselect().

function.name: gtk_single_selection_get_can_unselect
function.description: If %TRUE, gtk_selection_model_unselect_item() is supported and allows unselecting the selected item.

function.name: gtk_single_selection_get_model
function.description: Gets the model that @self is wrapping.

function.name: gtk_single_selection_get_selected
function.description:
Gets the position of the selected item.
If no item is selected, %GTK_INVALID_LIST_POSITION is returned.
function.return: The position of the selected item

function.name: gtk_single_selection_get_selected_item
function.description:
Gets the selected item.
If no item is selected, %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_single_selection_new
function.description: Creates a new selection to handle @model.

function.name: gtk_single_selection_set_autoselect
function.description:
Enables or disables autoselect.
If @autoselect is %TRUE, @self will enforce that an item is always selected. It will select a new item when the currently selected item is deleted and it will disallow unselecting the current item.

function.name: gtk_single_selection_set_can_unselect
function.description:
If %TRUE, unselecting the current item via gtk_selection_model_unselect_item() is supported.
Note that setting [property@Gtk.SingleSelection:autoselect] will cause unselecting to not work, so it practically makes no sense to set both at the same time.

function.name: gtk_single_selection_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model that @self should wrap.
If @model is %NULL, @self will be empty.

function.name: gtk_single_selection_set_selected
function.description:
Selects the item at the given position.
If the list does not have an item at @position or %GTK_INVALID_LIST_POSITION is given, the behavior depends on the value of the [property@Gtk.SingleSelection:autoselect] property: If it is set, no change will occur and the old item will stay selected. If it is unset, the selection will be unset and no item will be selected. This also applies if [property@Gtk.SingleSelection:can-unselect] is set to %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_size_group_add_widget
function.description:
Adds a widget to a `GtkSizeGroup`.
In the future, the requisition of the widget will be determined as the maximum of its requisition and the requisition of the other widgets in the size group. Whether this applies horizontally, vertically, or in both directions depends on the mode of the size group. See [method@Gtk.SizeGroup.set_mode].
When the widget is destroyed or no longer referenced elsewhere, it will be removed from the size group.

function.name: gtk_size_group_get_mode
function.description: Gets the current mode of the size group.
function.return: the current mode of the size group.

function.name: gtk_size_group_get_widgets
function.description: Returns the list of widgets associated with @size_group.
function.return: a `GSList` of widgets. The list is owned by GTK and should not be modified.

function.name: gtk_size_group_new
function.description: Create a new `GtkSizeGroup`.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.parameter_description: the mode for the new size group.

function.name: gtk_size_group_remove_widget
function.description: Removes a widget from a `GtkSizeGroup`.

function.name: gtk_size_group_set_mode
function.description:
Sets the `GtkSizeGroupMode` of the size group.
The mode of the size group determines whether the widgets in the size group should all have the same horizontal requisition (%GTK_SIZE_GROUP_HORIZONTAL) all have the same vertical requisition (%GTK_SIZE_GROUP_VERTICAL), or should all have the same requisition in both directions (%GTK_SIZE_GROUP_BOTH).

parameter.name: mode
parameter.parameter_description: the mode to set for the size group.

function.name: gtk_slice_list_model_get_model
function.description: Gets the model that is currently being used or %NULL if none.

function.name: gtk_slice_list_model_get_offset
function.description: Gets the offset set via gtk_slice_list_model_set_offset().

function.name: gtk_slice_list_model_get_size
function.description: Gets the size set via gtk_slice_list_model_set_size().

function.name: gtk_slice_list_model_new
function.description:
Creates a new slice model.
It presents the slice from @offset to offset + @size of the given @model.

function.name: gtk_slice_list_model_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model to show a slice of.
The model's item type must conform to @self's item type.

function.name: gtk_slice_list_model_set_offset
gtk_slice_list_model_set_size
function.description:
Sets the maximum size. @self will never have more items than @size.
It can however have fewer items if the offset is too large or the model sliced from doesn't have enough items.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_border
function.description:
Appends a stroked border rectangle inside the given @outline.
The four sides of the border can have different widths and colors.

parameter.name: border_width
parameter.parameter_description: the stroke width of the border on the top, right, bottom and left side respectively.

parameter.name: border_color
parameter.parameter_description: the color used on the top, right, bottom and left side.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_cairo
function.description: Creates a new [class@Gsk.CairoNode] and appends it to the current render node of @snapshot, without changing the current node.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the bounds for the new node

function.return: a `cairo_t` suitable for drawing the contents of the newly created render node

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_color
function.description:
Creates a new render node drawing the @color into the given @bounds and appends it to the current render node of @snapshot.
You should try to avoid calling this function if @color is transparent.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the bounds for the new node

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_conic_gradient
function.description: Appends a conic gradient node with the given stops to @snapshot.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the rectangle to render the gradient into

parameter.name: center
parameter.parameter_description: the center point of the conic gradient

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.parameter_description: the clockwise rotation in degrees of the starting angle. 0 means the starting angle is the top.

parameter.name: stops
parameter.parameter_description: the color stops defining the gradient

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_fill
function.description:
A convenience method to fill a path with a color.
See [method@Gtk.Snapshot.push_fill] if you need to fill a path with more complex content than a color.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The path describing the area to fill

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: the color to fill the path with

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_inset_shadow
function.description: Appends an inset shadow into the box given by @outline.

parameter.name: outline
parameter.parameter_description: outline of the region surrounded by shadow

parameter.name: spread
parameter.parameter_description: how far the shadow spreads towards the inside

parameter.name: blur_radius
parameter.parameter_description: how much blur to apply to the shadow

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_layout
function.description:
Creates render nodes for rendering @layout in the given foregound @color and appends them to the current node of @snapshot without changing the current node. The current theme's foreground color for a widget can be obtained with [method@Gtk.Widget.get_color].
Note that if the layout does not produce any visible output, then nodes may not be added to the @snapshot.

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: the foreground color to render the layout in

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_linear_gradient
function.description: Appends a linear gradient node with the given stops to @snapshot.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the rectangle to render the linear gradient into

parameter.name: start_point
parameter.parameter_description: the point at which the linear gradient will begin

parameter.name: end_point
parameter.parameter_description: the point at which the linear gradient will finish

parameter.name: stops
parameter.parameter_description: the color stops defining the gradient

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_node
function.description:
Appends @node to the current render node of @snapshot, without changing the current node.
If @snapshot does not have a current node yet, @node will become the initial node.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_outset_shadow
function.description: Appends an outset shadow node around the box given by @outline.

parameter.name: outline
parameter.parameter_description: outline of the region surrounded by shadow

parameter.name: spread
parameter.parameter_description: how far the shadow spreads towards the outside

parameter.name: blur_radius
parameter.parameter_description: how much blur to apply to the shadow

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_radial_gradient
function.description: Appends a radial gradient node with the given stops to @snapshot.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the rectangle to render the readial gradient into

parameter.name: center
parameter.parameter_description: the center point for the radial gradient

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: the start position (on the horizontal axis)

parameter.name: end
parameter.parameter_description: the end position (on the horizontal axis)

parameter.name: stops
parameter.parameter_description: the color stops defining the gradient

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_repeating_linear_gradient
function.description: Appends a repeating linear gradient node with the given stops to @snapshot.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the rectangle to render the linear gradient into

parameter.name: start_point
parameter.parameter_description: the point at which the linear gradient will begin

parameter.name: end_point
parameter.parameter_description: the point at which the linear gradient will finish

parameter.name: stops
parameter.parameter_description: the color stops defining the gradient

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_repeating_radial_gradient
function.description: Appends a repeating radial gradient node with the given stops to @snapshot.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the rectangle to render the readial gradient into

parameter.name: center
parameter.parameter_description: the center point for the radial gradient

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: the start position (on the horizontal axis)

parameter.name: end
parameter.parameter_description: the end position (on the horizontal axis)

parameter.name: stops
parameter.parameter_description: the color stops defining the gradient

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_scaled_texture
function.description:
Creates a new render node drawing the @texture into the given @bounds and appends it to the current render node of @snapshot.
In contrast to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.append_texture], this function provides control about how the filter that is used when scaling.
Since: 4.10

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the bounds for the new node

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_stroke
function.description:
A convenience method to stroke a path with a color.
See [method@Gtk.Snapshot.push_stroke] if you need to stroke a path with more complex content than a color.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The path describing the area to fill

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: the color to fill the path with

function.name: gtk_snapshot_append_texture
function.description:
Creates a new render node drawing the @texture into the given @bounds and appends it to the current render node of @snapshot.
If the texture needs to be scaled to fill @bounds, linear filtering is used. See [method@Gtk.Snapshot.append_scaled_texture] if you need other filtering, such as nearest-neighbour.

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the bounds for the new node

function.name: gtk_snapshot_free_to_node
function.description:
Returns the node that was constructed by @snapshot and frees @snapshot.
See also [method@Gtk.Snapshot.to_node].

function.name: gtk_snapshot_free_to_paintable
function.description: Returns a paintable for the node that was constructed by @snapshot and frees @snapshot.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: The size of the resulting paintable or %NULL to use the bounds of the snapshot

function.name: gtk_snapshot_gl_shader_pop_texture
function.description:
Removes the top element from the stack of render nodes and adds it to the nearest [class@Gsk.GLShaderNode] below it.
This must be called the same number of times as the number of textures is needed for the shader in [method@Gtk.Snapshot.push_gl_shader].
Deprecated: 4.16: GTK's new Vulkan-focused rendering does not support this feature. Use [class@Gtk.GLArea] for OpenGL rendering.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkSnapshot`.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_perspective
function.description:
Applies a perspective projection transform.
See [method@Gsk.Transform.perspective] for a discussion on the details.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_pop
function.description: Removes the top element from the stack of render nodes, and appends it to the node underneath it.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_blend
function.description:
Blends together two images with the given blend mode.
Until the first call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop], the bottom image for the blend operation will be recorded. After that call, the top image to be blended will be recorded until the second call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].
Calling this function requires two subsequent calls to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_blur
function.description:
Blurs an image.
The image is recorded until the next call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].

parameter.name: radius
parameter.parameter_description: the blur radius to use. Must be positive

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_clip
function.description:
Clips an image to a rectangle.
The image is recorded until the next call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_collect
function.description:
Private.
Pushes state so a later pop_collect call can collect all nodes appended until that point.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_color_matrix
function.description:
Modifies the colors of an image by applying an affine transformation in RGB space.
In particular, the colors will be transformed by applying
pixel = transpose(color_matrix) * pixel + color_offset
for every pixel. The transformation operates on unpremultiplied colors, with color components ordered R, G, B, A.
The image is recorded until the next call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_component_transfer
function.description:
Modifies the colors of an image by applying a transfer function for each component.
The transfer functions operate on unpremultiplied colors.
The image is recorded until the next call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].
Since: 4.20

parameter.name: red
parameter.parameter_description: the transfer for the red component

parameter.name: green
parameter.parameter_description: the transfer for the green component

parameter.name: blue
parameter.parameter_description: the transfer for the blue component

parameter.name: alpha
parameter.parameter_description: the transfer for the alpha component

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_cross_fade
function.description:
Snapshots a cross-fade operation between two images with the given @progress.
Until the first call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop], the start image will be snapshot. After that call, the end image will be recorded until the second call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].
Calling this function requires two subsequent calls to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_debug
function.description:
Inserts a debug node with a message.
Debug nodes don't affect the rendering at all, but can be helpful in identifying parts of a render node tree dump, for example in the GTK inspector.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_fill
function.description:
Fills the area given by @path and @fill_rule with an image and discards everything outside of it.
The image is recorded until the next call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].
If you want to fill the path with a color, [method@Gtk.Snapshot.append_fill] than rendering new ones, use [method@Gtk.Snapshot.append_fill] may be more convenient.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The path describing the area to fill

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_gl_shader
function.description:
Push a [class@Gsk.GLShaderNode].
The node uses the given [class@Gsk.GLShader] and uniform values Additionally this takes a list of @n_children other nodes which will be passed to the [class@Gsk.GLShaderNode].
The @take_args argument is a block of data to use for uniform arguments, as per types and offsets defined by the @shader. Normally this is generated by [method@Gsk.GLShader.format_args] or [struct@Gsk.ShaderArgsBuilder].
The snapshotter takes ownership of @take_args, so the caller should not free it after this.
If the renderer doesn't support GL shaders, or if there is any problem when compiling the shader, then the node will draw pink. You should use [method@Gsk.GLShader.compile] to ensure the @shader will work for the renderer before using it.
If the shader requires textures (see [method@Gsk.GLShader.get_n_textures]), then it is expected that you call [method@Gtk.Snapshot.gl_shader_pop_texture] the number of times that are required. Each of these calls will generate a node that is added as a child to the `GskGLShaderNode`, which in turn will render these offscreen and pass as a texture to the shader.
Once all textures (if any) are pop:ed, you must call the regular [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].
If you want to use pre-existing textures as input to the shader rather than rendering new ones, use [method@Gtk.Snapshot.append_texture] to push a texture node. These will be used directly rather than being re-rendered.
For details on how to write shaders, see [class@Gsk.GLShader].
Deprecated: 4.16: GTK's new Vulkan-focused rendering does not support this feature. Use [class@Gtk.GLArea] for OpenGL rendering.

parameter.name: take_args
parameter.parameter_description: Data block with arguments for the shader.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_mask
function.description:
Until the first call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop], the mask image for the mask operation will be recorded.
After that call, the source image will be recorded until the second call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].
Calling this function requires 2 subsequent calls to gtk_snapshot_pop().
Since: 4.10

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_opacity
function.description:
Modifies the opacity of an image.
The image is recorded until the next call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_repeat
function.description:
Creates a node that repeats the child node.
The child is recorded until the next call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the bounds within which to repeat

parameter.name: child_bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the bounds of the child or %NULL to use the full size of the collected child node

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_rounded_clip
function.description:
Clips an image to a rounded rectangle.
The image is recorded until the next call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].

parameter.name: bounds
parameter.parameter_description: the rounded rectangle to clip to

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_shadow
function.description:
Applies a shadow to an image.
The image is recorded until the next call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].

function.name: gtk_snapshot_push_stroke
function.description:
Strokes the given @path with the attributes given by @stroke and an image.
The image is recorded until the next call to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.pop].
Note that the strokes are subject to the same transformation as everything else, so uneven scaling will cause horizontal and vertical strokes to have different widths.
If you want to stroke the path with a color, [method@Gtk.Snapshot.append_stroke] may be more convenient.
Since: 4.14

function.name: gtk_snapshot_render_background
function.description:
Creates a render node for the CSS background according to @context, and appends it to the current node of @snapshot, without changing the current node.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the style context that defines the background

function.name: gtk_snapshot_render_focus
function.description:
Creates a render node for the focus outline according to @context, and appends it to the current node of @snapshot, without changing the current node.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the style context that defines the focus ring

function.name: gtk_snapshot_render_frame
function.description:
Creates a render node for the CSS border according to @context, and appends it to the current node of @snapshot, without changing the current node.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the style context that defines the frame

function.name: gtk_snapshot_render_insertion_cursor
function.description:
Draws a text caret using @snapshot at the specified index of @layout.
Deprecated: 4.10

function.name: gtk_snapshot_render_layout
function.description:
Creates a render node for rendering @layout according to the style information in @context, and appends it to the current node of @snapshot, without changing the current node.
Deprecated: 4.10

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the style context that defines the text

function.name: gtk_snapshot_restore
function.description: Restores @snapshot to the state saved by a preceding call to [method@Snapshot.save] and removes that state from the stack of saved states.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_rotate
function.description:
Rotates @@snapshot's coordinate system by @angle degrees in 2D space - or in 3D speak, rotates around the Z axis. The rotation happens around the origin point of (0, 0) in the @snapshot's current coordinate system.
To rotate around axes other than the Z axis, use [method@Gsk.Transform.rotate_3d].

function.name: gtk_snapshot_rotate_3d
function.description:
Rotates @snapshot's coordinate system by @angle degrees around @axis.
For a rotation in 2D space, use [method@Gsk.Transform.rotate].

function.name: gtk_snapshot_save
function.description:
Makes a copy of the current state of @snapshot and saves it on an internal stack.
When [method@Gtk.Snapshot.restore] is called, @snapshot will be restored to the saved state.
Multiple calls to [method@Gtk.Snapshot.save] and [method@Gtk.Snapshot.restore] can be nested; each call to `gtk_snapshot_restore()` restores the state from the matching paired `gtk_snapshot_save()`.
It is necessary to clear all saved states with corresponding calls to `gtk_snapshot_restore()`.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_scale
function.description:
Scales @snapshot's coordinate system in 2-dimensional space by the given factors.
Use [method@Gtk.Snapshot.scale_3d] to scale in all 3 dimensions.

parameter.name: factor_x
parameter.parameter_description: scaling factor on the X axis

parameter.name: factor_y
parameter.parameter_description: scaling factor on the Y axis

function.name: gtk_snapshot_scale_3d
function.description: Scales @snapshot's coordinate system by the given factors.

parameter.name: factor_x
parameter.parameter_description: scaling factor on the X axis

parameter.name: factor_y
parameter.parameter_description: scaling factor on the Y axis

parameter.name: factor_z
parameter.parameter_description: scaling factor on the Z axis

function.name: gtk_snapshot_to_node
function.description:
Returns the render node that was constructed by @snapshot.
Note that this function may return %NULL if nothing has been added to the snapshot or if its content does not produce pixels to be rendered.
After calling this function, it is no longer possible to add more nodes to @snapshot. The only function that should be called after this is [method@GObject.Object.unref].
function.return: the constructed `GskRenderNode` or %NULL if there are no nodes to render.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_to_paintable
function.description:
Returns a paintable encapsulating the render node that was constructed by @snapshot.
After calling this function, it is no longer possible to add more nodes to @snapshot. The only function that should be called after this is [method@GObject.Object.unref].

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: The size of the resulting paintable or %NULL to use the bounds of the snapshot

function.name: gtk_snapshot_transform
function.description: Transforms @snapshot's coordinate system with the given @transform.

function.name: gtk_snapshot_transform_matrix
function.description: Transforms @snapshot's coordinate system with the given @matrix.

parameter.name: matrix
parameter.parameter_description: the matrix to multiply the transform with

function.name: gtk_snapshot_translate
function.description: Translates @snapshot's coordinate system by @point in 2-dimensional space.

parameter.name: point
parameter.parameter_description: the point to translate the snapshot by

function.name: gtk_snapshot_translate_3d
function.description: Translates @snapshot's coordinate system by @point.

parameter.name: point
parameter.parameter_description: the point to translate the snapshot by

function.name: gtk_sort_list_model_get_incremental
function.description:
Returns whether incremental sorting is enabled.
See [method@Gtk.SortListModel.set_incremental].

function.name: gtk_sort_list_model_get_model
function.description: Gets the model currently sorted or %NULL if none.

function.name: gtk_sort_list_model_get_pending
function.description:
Estimates progress of an ongoing sorting operation.
The estimate is the number of items that would still need to be sorted to finish the sorting operation if this was a linear algorithm. So this number is not related to how many items are already correctly sorted.
If you want to estimate the progress, you can use code like this: ```c pending = gtk_sort_list_model_get_pending (self); model = gtk_sort_list_model_get_model (self); progress = 1.0 - pending / (double) MAX (1, g_list_model_get_n_items (model)); ```
If no sort operation is ongoing - in particular when [property@Gtk.SortListModel:incremental] is %FALSE - this function returns 0.
function.return: a progress estimate of remaining items to sort

function.name: gtk_sort_list_model_get_section_sorter
function.description:
Gets the section sorter that is used to sort items of @self into sections.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_sort_list_model_get_sorter
function.description: Gets the sorter that is used to sort @self.

function.name: gtk_sort_list_model_new
function.description: Creates a new sort list model that uses the @sorter to sort @model.

function.name: gtk_sort_list_model_set_incremental
function.description:
Sets the sort model to do an incremental sort.
When incremental sorting is enabled, the `GtkSortListModel` will not do a complete sort immediately, but will instead queue an idle handler that incrementally sorts the items towards their correct position. This of course means that items do not instantly appear in the right place. It also means that the total sorting time is a lot slower.
When your filter blocks the UI while sorting, you might consider turning this on. Depending on your model and sorters, this may become interesting around 10,000 to 100,000 items.
By default, incremental sorting is disabled.
See [method@Gtk.SortListModel.get_pending] for progress information about an ongoing incremental sorting operation.

function.name: gtk_sort_list_model_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model to be sorted.
The @model's item type must conform to the item type of @self.

function.name: gtk_sort_list_model_set_section_sorter
function.description:
Sets a new section sorter on @self.
Since: 4.12

function.name: gtk_sort_list_model_set_sorter
function.description: Sets a new sorter on @self.

function.name: gtk_sorter_changed
function.description:
Notifies all users of the sorter that it has changed.
This emits the [signal@Gtk.Sorter::changed] signal. Users of the sorter should then update the sort order via [method@Gtk.Sorter.compare].
Depending on the @change parameter, it may be possible to update the sort order without a full resorting. Refer to the [enum@Gtk.SorterChange] documentation for details.
This function is intended for implementers of `GtkSorter` subclasses and should not be called from other functions.

function.name: gtk_sorter_compare
function.description:
Compares two given items according to the sort order implemented by the sorter.
Sorters implement a partial order:
* It is reflexive, ie a = a * It is antisymmetric, ie if a < b and b < a, then a = b * It is transitive, ie given any 3 items with a ≤ b and b ≤ c, then a ≤ c
The sorter may signal it conforms to additional constraints via the return value of [method@Gtk.Sorter.get_order].

function.name: gtk_sorter_get_order
function.description:
Gets the order that @self conforms to.
See [enum@Gtk.SorterOrder] for details of the possible return values.
This function is intended to allow optimizations.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_configure
function.description:
Changes the properties of an existing spin button.
The adjustment, climb rate, and number of decimal places are updated accordingly.

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: a `GtkAdjustment` to replace the spin button’s existing adjustment, or %NULL to leave its current adjustment unchanged

parameter.name: digits
parameter.parameter_description: the number of decimal places to display in the spin button

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_activates_default
function.description:
Retrieves the value set by [method@Gtk.SpinButton.set_activates_default].
Since: 4.14
function.return: %TRUE if the spin button will activate the default widget

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_adjustment
function.description: Get the adjustment associated with a `GtkSpinButton`.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_climb_rate
function.description: Returns the acceleration rate for repeated changes.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_digits
function.description: Fetches the precision of @spin_button.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_increments
function.description:
Gets the current step and page the increments used by @spin_button.
See [method@Gtk.SpinButton.set_increments].

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_numeric
function.description: Returns whether non-numeric text can be typed into the spin button.
function.return: %TRUE if only numeric text can be entered

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_range
function.description:
Gets the range allowed for @spin_button.
See [method@Gtk.SpinButton.set_range].

parameter.name: min
parameter.parameter_description: location to store minimum allowed value

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: location to store maximum allowed value

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_snap_to_ticks
function.description: Returns whether the values are corrected to the nearest step.
function.return: %TRUE if values are snapped to the nearest step

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_update_policy
function.description:
Gets the update behavior of a spin button.
See [method@Gtk.SpinButton.set_update_policy].

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_value
function.description: Get the value in the @spin_button.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_value_as_int
function.description: Get the value @spin_button represented as an integer.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_wrap
function.description: Returns whether the spin button’s value wraps around to the opposite limit when the upper or lower limit of the range is exceeded.
function.return: %TRUE if the spin button wraps around

function.name: gtk_spin_button_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkSpinButton`.

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: the `GtkAdjustment` that this spin button should use

parameter.name: climb_rate
parameter.parameter_description: specifies by how much the rate of change in the value will accelerate if you continue to hold down an up/down button or arrow key

parameter.name: digits
parameter.parameter_description: the number of decimal places to display

function.name: gtk_spin_button_new_with_range
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkSpinButton` with the given properties.
This is a convenience constructor that allows creation of a numeric `GtkSpinButton` without manually creating an adjustment. The value is initially set to the minimum value and a page increment of 10 * @step is the default. The precision of the spin button is equivalent to the precision of @step.
Note that the way in which the precision is derived works best if @step is a power of ten. If the resulting precision is not suitable for your needs, use [method@Gtk.SpinButton.set_digits] to correct it.

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: Increment added or subtracted by spinning the widget

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_activates_default
function.description:
Sets whether activating the spin button will activate the default widget for the window containing the spin button.
See [signal@Gtk.SpinButton::activate] for what counts as activation.
Since: 4.14

parameter.name: activates_default
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to activate window’s default widget on activation

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_adjustment
function.description: Replaces the `GtkAdjustment` associated with @spin_button.

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: a `GtkAdjustment` to replace the existing adjustment

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_climb_rate
function.description: Sets the acceleration rate for repeated changes when you hold down a button or key.

parameter.name: climb_rate
parameter.parameter_description: the rate of acceleration, must be >= 0

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_digits
function.description:
Set the precision to be displayed by @spin_button.
Up to 20 digit precision is allowed.

parameter.name: digits
parameter.parameter_description: the number of digits after the decimal point to be displayed for the spin button’s value

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_increments
function.description:
Sets the step and page increments for spin_button.
This affects how quickly the value changes when the spin button’s arrows are activated.

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: increment applied for a button 1 press.

parameter.name: page
parameter.parameter_description: increment applied for a button 2 press.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_numeric
function.description: Sets the flag that determines if non-numeric text can be typed into the spin button.

parameter.name: numeric
parameter.parameter_description: flag indicating if only numeric entry is allowed

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_range
function.description:
Sets the minimum and maximum allowable values for @spin_button.
If the current value is outside this range, it will be adjusted to fit within the range, otherwise it will remain unchanged.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_snap_to_ticks
function.description: Sets the policy as to whether values are corrected to the nearest step increment when a spin button is activated after providing an invalid value.

parameter.name: snap_to_ticks
parameter.parameter_description: a flag indicating if invalid values should be corrected

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_update_policy
function.description:
Sets the update behavior of a spin button.
This determines whether the spin button is always updated or only when a valid value is set.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_value
function.description: Sets the value of @spin_button.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_wrap
function.description: Sets the flag that determines if a spin button value wraps around to the opposite limit when the upper or lower limit of the range is exceeded.

parameter.name: wrap
parameter.parameter_description: a flag indicating if wrapping behavior is performed

function.name: gtk_spin_button_spin
function.description: Increment or decrement a spin button’s value in a specified direction by a specified amount.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: a `GtkSpinType` indicating the direction to spin

parameter.name: increment
parameter.parameter_description: step increment to apply in the specified direction

function.name: gtk_spin_button_update
function.description: Manually force an update of the spin button.

function.name: gtk_spinner_get_spinning
function.description: Returns whether the spinner is spinning.

function.name: gtk_spinner_new
function.description: Returns a new spinner widget. Not yet started.

function.name: gtk_spinner_set_spinning
function.description: Sets the activity of the spinner.

parameter.name: spinning
parameter.parameter_description: whether the spinner should be spinning

function.name: gtk_spinner_start
function.description: Starts the animation of the spinner.

function.name: gtk_spinner_stop
function.description: Stops the animation of the spinner.

function.name: gtk_stack_add_child
function.description: Adds a child to @stack.

function.name: gtk_stack_add_named
function.description:
Adds a child to @stack.
The child is identified by the @name.

function.name: gtk_stack_add_titled
function.description:
Adds a child to @stack.
The child is identified by the @name. The @title will be used by `GtkStackSwitcher` to represent @child in a tab bar, so it should be short.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_child_by_name
function.description: Finds the child with the name given as the argument.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the child to find

function.name: gtk_stack_get_hhomogeneous
function.description: Gets whether @stack is horizontally homogeneous.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_interpolate_size
function.description: Returns whether the `GtkStack` is set up to interpolate between the sizes of children on page switch.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_page
function.description: Returns the `GtkStackPage` object for @child.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_pages
function.description:
Returns a `GListModel` that contains the pages of the stack.
This can be used to keep an up-to-date view. The model also implements [iface@Gtk.SelectionModel] and can be used to track and modify the visible page.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_transition_duration
function.description: Returns the amount of time (in milliseconds) that transitions between pages in @stack will take.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_transition_running
function.description: Returns whether the @stack is currently in a transition from one page to another.
function.return: %TRUE if the transition is currently running, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_transition_type
function.description: Gets the type of animation that will be used for transitions between pages in @stack.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_vhomogeneous
function.description: Gets whether @stack is vertically homogeneous.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_visible_child
function.description: Gets the currently visible child of @stack.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_visible_child_name
function.description: Returns the name of the currently visible child of @stack.
function.return: the name of the visible child of the `GtkStack`

function.name: gtk_stack_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkStack`.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_get_child
function.description: Returns the stack child to which @self belongs.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_get_icon_name
function.description: Returns the icon name of the page.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_get_name
function.description: Returns the name of the page.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_get_needs_attention
function.description: Returns whether the page is marked as “needs attention”.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_get_title
function.description: Gets the page title.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_get_use_underline
function.description: Gets whether underlines in the page title indicate mnemonics.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_get_visible
function.description:
Returns whether @page is visible in its `GtkStack`.
This is independent from the [property@Gtk.Widget:visible] property of its widget.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_set_icon_name
function.description: Sets the icon name of the page.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_set_name
function.description: Sets the name of the page.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_set_needs_attention
function.description: Sets whether the page is marked as “needs attention”.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_set_title
function.description: Sets the page title.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_set_use_underline
function.description: Sets whether underlines in the page title indicate mnemonics.

function.name: gtk_stack_page_set_visible
function.description: Sets whether @page is visible in its `GtkStack`.

function.name: gtk_stack_remove
function.description: Removes a child widget from @stack.

function.name: gtk_stack_set_hhomogeneous
function.description:
Sets the `GtkStack` to be horizontally homogeneous or not.
If it is homogeneous, the `GtkStack` will request the same width for all its children. If it isn't, the stack may change width when a different child becomes visible.

function.name: gtk_stack_set_interpolate_size
function.description:
Sets whether or not @stack will interpolate its size when changing the visible child.
If the [property@Gtk.Stack:interpolate-size] property is set to %TRUE, @stack will interpolate its size between the current one and the one it'll take after changing the visible child, according to the set transition duration.

function.name: gtk_stack_set_transition_duration
function.description: Sets the duration that transitions between pages in @stack will take.

function.name: gtk_stack_set_transition_type
function.description:
Sets the type of animation that will be used for transitions between pages in @stack.
Available types include various kinds of fades and slides.
The transition type can be changed without problems at runtime, so it is possible to change the animation based on the page that is about to become current.

function.name: gtk_stack_set_vhomogeneous
function.description:
Sets the `GtkStack` to be vertically homogeneous or not.
If it is homogeneous, the `GtkStack` will request the same height for all its children. If it isn't, the stack may change height when a different child becomes visible.

function.name: gtk_stack_set_visible_child
function.description:
Makes @child the visible child of @stack.
If @child is different from the currently visible child, the transition between the two will be animated with the current transition type of @stack.
Note that the @child widget has to be visible itself (see [method@Gtk.Widget.show]) in order to become the visible child of @stack.

function.name: gtk_stack_set_visible_child_full
function.description:
Makes the child with the given name visible.
Note that the child widget has to be visible itself (see [method@Gtk.Widget.show]) in order to become the visible child of @stack.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the child to make visible

function.name: gtk_stack_set_visible_child_name
function.description:
Makes the child with the given name visible.
If @child is different from the currently visible child, the transition between the two will be animated with the current transition type of @stack.
Note that the child widget has to be visible itself (see [method@Gtk.Widget.show]) in order to become the visible child of @stack.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the child to make visible

function.name: gtk_stack_sidebar_get_stack
function.description: Retrieves the stack.
function.return: the associated `GtkStack` or %NULL if none has been set explicitly

function.name: gtk_stack_sidebar_new
function.description: Creates a new `GtkStackSidebar`.

function.name: gtk_stack_sidebar_set_stack
function.description:
Set the `GtkStack` associated with this `GtkStackSidebar`.
The sidebar widget will automatically update according to the order and items within the given `GtkStack`.

function.name: gtk_stack_switcher_get_stack
function.description: Retrieves the stack.

function.name: gtk_stack_switcher_new
function.description: Create a new `GtkStackSwitcher`.

function.name: gtk_stack_switcher_set_stack
function.description: Sets the stack to control.

function.name: gtk_statusbar_get_context_id
function.description:
Returns a new context identifier, given a description of the actual context.
Note that the description is not shown in the UI.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

parameter.name: context_description
parameter.parameter_description: textual description of what context the new message is being used in

function.name: gtk_statusbar_get_message
function.description:
Retrieves the contents of the label in `GtkStatusbar`.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5

function.name: gtk_statusbar_new
function.description:
Creates a new `GtkStatusbar` ready for messages.
Deprecated: 4.10: This widget will be removed in GTK 5
