This function is only useful on Wayland or X11, not with other GDK backends.

function.name: gtk_window_set_title
function.description:
Sets the title of the window.
The title of a window will be displayed in its title bar; on the X Window System, the title bar is rendered by the window manager so exactly how the title appears to users may vary according to a user’s exact configuration. The title should help a user distinguish this window from other windows they may have open. A good title might include the application name and current document filename, for example.
Passing `NULL` does the same as setting the title to an empty string.

function.name: gtk_window_set_titlebar
function.description:
Sets a custom titlebar for the window.
A typical widget used here is [class@Gtk.HeaderBar], as it provides various features expected of a titlebar while allowing the addition of child widgets to it.
If you set a custom titlebar, GTK will do its best to convince the window manager not to put its own titlebar on the window. Depending on the system, this function may not work for a window that is already visible, so you set the titlebar before calling [method@Gtk.Widget.show].

parameter.name: titlebar
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as titlebar

function.name: gtk_window_set_transient_for
function.description:
Sets a transient parent for the window.
Dialog windows should be set transient for the main application window they were spawned from. This allows window managers to e.g. keep the dialog on top of the main window, or center the dialog over the main window. [ctor@Gtk.Dialog.new_with_buttons] and other convenience functions in GTK will sometimes call this function on your behalf.
Passing `NULL` for @parent unsets the current transient window.
On Windows, this function puts the child window on top of the parent, much as the window manager would have done on X.

function.name: gtk_window_unfullscreen
function.description:
Asks to remove the fullscreen state for the window, and return to its previous state.
Note that you shouldn’t assume the window is definitely not fullscreen afterward, because other entities (e.g. the user or window manager) could fullscreen it again, and not all window managers honor requests to unfullscreen windows; normally the window will end up restored to its normal state. Just don’t write code that crashes if not.
If a window is not explicitly fullscreened or unfullscreened before it is shown, the initial state is at the window managers discretion.
You can track the result of this operation via the [property@Gdk.Toplevel:state] property, or by listening to notifications of the [property@Gtk.Window:fullscreened] property.

function.name: gtk_window_unmaximize
function.description:
Asks to unmaximize the window.
Note that you shouldn’t assume the window is definitely unmaximized afterward, because other entities (e.g. the user or window manager) maximize it again, and not all window managers honor requests to unmaximize.
If a window is not explicitly maximized or unmaximized before it is shown, the initial state is at the window managers discretion. For example, it might decide to maximize a window that almost fills the screen.
You can track the result of this operation via the [property@Gdk.Toplevel:state] property, or by listening to notifications on the [property@Gtk.Window:maximized] property.

function.name: gtk_window_unminimize
function.description:
Asks to unminimize the window.
Note that you shouldn’t assume the window is definitely unminimized afterward, because the windowing system might not support this functionality; other entities (e.g. the user or the window manager) could minimize it again, or there may not be a window manager in which case minimization isn’t possible, etc.
You can track result of this operation via the [property@Gdk.Toplevel:state] property.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_directory
function.description:
Asynchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenDirectory">OpenDirectory()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the thread-default main loop of the thread you are calling this method from (see g_main_context_push_thread_default()). You can then call gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_directory_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_directory_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this method.

parameter.name: arg_parent_window
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_fd
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_options
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_directory_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_directory().

parameter.name: out_handle
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: out_fd_list
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for a #GUnixFDList or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_directory().

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_directory_sync
function.description:
Synchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenDirectory">OpenDirectory()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_directory() for the asynchronous version of this method.

parameter.name: arg_parent_window
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_fd
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_options
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: out_handle
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_file
function.description:
Asynchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenFile">OpenFile()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the thread-default main loop of the thread you are calling this method from (see g_main_context_push_thread_default()). You can then call gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_file_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_file_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this method.

parameter.name: arg_parent_window
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_fd
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_options
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_file_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_file().

parameter.name: out_handle
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: out_fd_list
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for a #GUnixFDList or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_file().

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.description:
Synchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenFile">OpenFile()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_file() for the asynchronous version of this method.

parameter.name: arg_parent_window
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_fd
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_options
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: out_handle
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

Asynchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenURI">OpenURI()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the thread-default main loop of the thread you are calling this method from (see g_main_context_push_thread_default()). You can then call gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_uri_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_uri_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this method.

parameter.name: arg_parent_window
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_uri
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_options
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_uri_finish

parameter.name: out_handle
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_uri().

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

Synchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenURI">OpenURI()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_open_uri() for the asynchronous version of this method.

parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_uri
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_options

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_scheme_supported
function.description:
Asynchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.SchemeSupported">SchemeSupported()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the thread-default main loop of the thread you are calling this method from (see g_main_context_push_thread_default()). You can then call gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_scheme_supported_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_scheme_supported_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this method.

parameter.name: arg_scheme
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_options
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_scheme_supported_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_scheme_supported().

parameter.name: out_supported
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_scheme_supported().

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_scheme_supported_sync
function.description:
Synchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.SchemeSupported">SchemeSupported()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_call_scheme_supported() for the asynchronous version of this method.

parameter.name: arg_scheme
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_options
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: out_supported
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_complete_open_directory
function.description:
Helper function used in service implementations to finish handling invocations of the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenDirectory">OpenDirectory()</link> D-Bus method. If you instead want to finish handling an invocation by returning an error, use g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() or similar.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_complete_open_file
function.description:
Helper function used in service implementations to finish handling invocations of the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.OpenFile">OpenFile()</link> D-Bus method. If you instead want to finish handling an invocation by returning an error, use g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() or similar.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.

If you instead want to finish handling an invocation by returning an error, use g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() or similar.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_get_version
function.description:
Gets the value of the <link linkend="gdbus-property-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.version">"version"</link> D-Bus property.
Since this D-Bus property is readable, it is meaningful to use this function on both the client- and service-side.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_interface_info
function.description: Gets a machine-readable description of the <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.top_of_page">org.freedesktop.portal.OpenURI</link> D-Bus interface.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_override_properties
function.description: Overrides all #GObject properties in the #GtkXdpOpenURI interface for a concrete class. The properties are overridden in the order they are defined.

parameter.name: klass
parameter.parameter_description: The class structure for a #GObject derived class.

parameter.name: property_id_begin
parameter.parameter_description: The property id to assign to the first overridden property.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new
function.description:
Asynchronously creates a proxy for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.top_of_page">org.freedesktop.portal.OpenURI</link>. See g_dbus_proxy_new() for more details.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the thread-default main loop of the thread you are calling this method from (see g_main_context_push_thread_default()). You can then call gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this constructor.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A bus name (well-known or unique) or %NULL if @connection is not a message bus connection.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new().

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new().

function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_for_bus
function.description:
Like gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new() but takes a #GBusType instead of a #GDBusConnection.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the thread-default main loop of the thread you are calling this method from (see g_main_context_push_thread_default()). You can then call gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_for_bus_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_for_bus_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this constructor.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_for_bus_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_for_bus().

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_for_bus().

function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_for_bus_sync
function.description:
Like gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_sync() but takes a #GBusType instead of a #GDBusConnection.
The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_for_bus() for the asynchronous version of this constructor.
function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new_sync
function.description:
Synchronously creates a proxy for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.top_of_page">org.freedesktop.portal.OpenURI</link>. See g_dbus_proxy_new_sync() for more details.
The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See gtk_xdp_open_uri_proxy_new() for the asynchronous version of this constructor.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A bus name (well-known or unique) or %NULL if @connection is not a message bus connection.

function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_set_version
function.description:
Sets the <link linkend="gdbus-property-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.version">"version"</link> D-Bus property to @value.
Since this D-Bus property is not writable, it is only meaningful to use this function on the service-side.

function.name: gtk_xdp_open_uri_skeleton_new
function.description: Creates a skeleton object for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-freedesktop-portal-OpenURI.top_of_page">org.freedesktop.portal.OpenURI</link>.
